data.anv: सर्वभूतानाम् for all beings, नमस्कार्याम् worthy of adoration, यशस्विनीम् illustrious lady, वृद्धाम्  aged, सदा always, अक्रोधनाम् free from anger, ताम् to such a woman, इमाम् this Anasuya, वैदेही Sita, अभिगच्छतु let her approach, या who, कर्मभिः with deeds, आनसूयेति as Anasuya, ख्यातिम्  renown, आगता has acquired.
data.md: Let Vaidehī always resort to this aged ascetic devoid of anger, who is worthy of being bowed down to by all creatures.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं तमृषिं तथेत्युक्त्वा स राघवः । सीतामुवाच धर्मज्ञामिदं वचनमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Hearing those words of the sage, Rama said be it so and said to righteous Sita these choice words.
data.anv: सः राघवः that Rama, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवाणम् speaking,  तम् ऋषिम् that sage, तथेति be it so, उक्त्वा having said, धर्मज्ञाम् wise in the ways of righteousness, सीताम् Sita, उत्तमम् excellent, इदं वचनम् these words, उवाच said.
data.md: When the saint had spoken thus, Rāghava saying, “So be it," turned his eyes to Sītā, and thus spoke to that one knowing morality.

data.v: राजपुत्रि श्रुतं त्वेतन्मुनेरस्य समीरितम् । श्रेयोऽर्थमात्मनः शीघ्रमभिगच्छ तपस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: O princess, you have heard the message of the sage. Without delay approach the ascetic (Anasuya) for your welfare.
data.anv: राजपुत्रि O princess (Sita), अस्य मुनेः of this sage, इदं समीरितम् this saying, श्रुतम् has been heard, आत्मनः for your, श्रेयोऽर्थम् for your welfare, शीघ्रम् without delay, तपस्विनीम् ascetic, अभिगच्छ you may approach.
data.md: O princess, you have heard what has been uttered by the ascetic. For the sake of your own welfare, do you speedily resort to the female anchoret. Do you without delay resort to the ascetic Anasuya, who is worthy of being associated with, and who has by virtue of her acts attained renown among men.f

data.v: अनसूयेति या लोके कर्मभिः क्यातिमागता । तां शीघ्रमभिगच्छ त्वमभिगम्यां तपस्विनीम् ।।
सीता त्वेतद्वचः श्रुत्वा राघवस्य हितैषिणी । तामत्रिपत्नीं धर्मज्ञामभिचक्राम मैथिली ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of Rama, intended for her welfare, Sita, daughter of the king of Mithila, approached the consort of Atri (Devi Anasuya), knower of righteousness, and reverently circumambulated her.
data.anv: मैथिली daughter of the king of Mithila, सीता तु Sita, हितैषिणः  wishing her welfare, राघवस्य Rama's, एतद्वचः words, शृत्वा hearing, धर्मज्ञाम् knower of righteousness, ताम् to that,          अत्रिपत्नीम् wife of Atri (Devi Anasuya), अभिचक्राम circumamabulated in reverence.
data.md: Hearing these words of Rāghava Mithila's daughter, the illustrious Sītā, drew near the righteous wife of Atri.

data.v: शिथिलां वलितां वृद्धां जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम् । सततं वेपमानाङ्गीं प्रवाते कदली यथा ।।
data.es: Highly chaste and fortunate Anasuya was very old and feeble. Her skin was wrinkled and her hair turned grey due to old age. Her body was constantly trembling like a plantain tree in a stormy wind. Pronouncing her name to such Anasuya, Sita made obeisance to her with utmost concentration.
data.anv: सीता Sita, शिथिलाम् feeble, वलिताम् with wrinkles, वृद्धाम् old, जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम् hair turned  grey due to old age, प्रवाते in stormy wind, कदलीं यथा like a plantain tree, सततम्  constantly, वेपमानाङ्गीम् her body trembling, महाभागाम् highly fortunate, पतिव्रताम् chaste woman, ताम् अनसूयाम् that Anasuya, अव्यग्रा without haste, अभ्यवादयत् made obeisance, स्वनाम her name, समुदाहरत् pronounced.
data.md: Thereupon Sītā, announcing her name, saluted the pious and chaste Anasuyā old with slackened joints, with folds all over her skin, and her hair hoary from age, whose frame shook perpetually, like a plantain-leaf in the wind.

data.v: तां तु सीता महाभागामनसूयां पतिव्रताम् । अभ्यवादयदव्यग्रा स्वं नाम समुदाहरत् ।।
data.es: Highly chaste and fortunate Anasuya was very old and feeble. Her skin was wrinkled and her hair turned grey due to old age. Her body was constantly trembling like a plantain tree in a stormy wind. Pronouncing her name to such Anasuya, Sita made obeisance to her with utmost concentration.
data.anv: सीता Sita, शिथिलाम् feeble, वलिताम् with wrinkles, वृद्धाम् old, जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम् hair turned  grey due to old age, प्रवाते in stormy wind, कदलीं यथा like a plantain tree, सततम्  constantly, वेपमानाङ्गीम् her body trembling, महाभागाम् highly fortunate, पतिव्रताम् chaste woman, ताम् अनसूयाम् that Anasuya, अव्यग्रा without haste, अभ्यवादयत् made obeisance, स्वनाम her name, समुदाहरत् pronounced.
data.md: Thereupon Sītā, announcing her name, saluted the pious and chaste Anasuyā old with slackened joints, with folds all over her skin, and her hair hoary from age, whose frame shook perpetually, like a plantain-leaf in the wind.

data.v: अभिवाद्य च वैदेही तापसीं तामनिन्दिताम् । बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा हृष्टा पर्यपृच्छदनामयम् ।।
data.es: Sita offered her obeisance to the blameless ascetic, Anasuya, folding her palms and enquired of her wellbeing in delight.
data.anv: वैदेही Sita, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, तां तापसीम् to that asceetic (Anasuya), अभिवाद्य after paying her homage, बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा folding the palms, हृष्टा delighted lady, अनामयम् wellbeing, पर्यपृच्छत् enquired.
data.md: Having paid homage to that ascetic with her senses subdued, Vaidehi glad at heart, with joined hands, enquired after her welfare.

data.v: ततः सीतां महाभागां दृष्ट्वा तां धर्मचारिणीम् । सान्त्वयन्त्यब्रवीद्धृष्टा दिष्ट्या धर्ममवेक्षसे ।।
data.es: Anasuya was delighted to see the glorious Sita who was always engaged in righteous acts and said in kind words, You are fortunate. You are observing your rightful duty.
data.anv: ततः then, महाभागाम् glorious lady, धर्मचारिणीम् engaged in righteous acts, तां सीताम् that Sita, सान्त्वयन्ती consoling, हृष्टा in delight, अब्रवीत् said, दिष्ट्या fortunately, धर्मम् rightful duty, अवेक्षसे you are observing.
data.md: Seeing the virtuous Sītā engaged in righteous acts, the old lady consoling her, said "By luck it is that you regard righteousness."

data.v: त्यक्त्वा ज्ञातिजनं सीते मानमृद्धिं च मानिनि । अवरुद्धं वने रामं दिष्ट्या त्वमनुगच्छसि ।।
data.es: O noble Sita, by the grace of heaven you are following Rama, forsaking your kinsmen and wealth and confining yourself to the forest.
data.anv: भामिनः सीते O noble Sita, त्वम् you, दिष्ट्या by the grace of heaven, ज्ञातिजनम् your kins, मानम् pride, ऋद्धं च wealth, त्यक्त्वा after forsaking, वने in the forest, अवरुद्धम् confined, रामम् Rama, अनुगच्छसि you are following.
data.md: O Sita, having left your kindred, and banishing pride, you have o honoured lady, followed Rāma staying in the woods.

data.v: नगरस्थो वनस्थो वा पापो वा यदि वाशुभः । यासां स्त्रीणां प्रियो भर्ता तासां लोका महोदयाः ।।
data.es: One who is devoted to her husband, whether he be in the city or in the forest, whether he is sinful or virtuous, will attain the most prosperous worlds.
data.anv: यासाम् those, स्त्रीणाम् women, नगरस्थः in the city, वनस्थो वा or in the forest, पापो वा or sinful, यदि वा or, शुभः virtuous, भर्ता husband, प्रियः dear, तासाम् for them, महोदयाः highly promising, लोकः worlds.
data.md: They that love their husbands, whether living in the city or the forest, whether well or ill disposed towards them, attain great state.

data.v: दुःशीलः कामवृत्तो वा धनैर्वा परिवर्जितः । स्त्रीणामार्य स्वभावानां परमं दैवतं पतिः ।।
data.es: For a woman of noble nature her husband, whether he be licentious or of bad character or devoid of riches, is her supreme lord.
data.anv: आर्यस्वभावानाम् of noble nature, स्त्रीणाम् for women, दुश्शीलः a man of bad character, कामवृत्तो वा or licentious, धनैः with riches, परिवर्जितो वा or devoid of, पतिः husband, परमम् is supreme, दैवतम् is deity.
data.md: Wicked, ur libidinous, or indigent, a husband is a supreme deity to a wife of noble character.

data.v: नातो विशिष्टं पश्यामि बान्धवं विमृशन्त्यहम् । सर्वत्र योग्यं वैदेहि तपः कृतमिवाव्ययम् ।।
data.es: O Sita, on reflection I know of none who is a better friend than the husband. He, like an imperishable penance, once acquired is never lost.
data.anv: वैदेहि Sita, अहम् I, सर्वत्र all over, विमृशन्ती reflecting, कृतम् performed, अव्ययम् imperishable,  योग्यम् befitting, तपः इव like austerities, अतः more than husband, विशिष्टम् better, बान्धवम् relation, न पश्यामि I do not see.
data.md: Than the husband a greater friend find I none, O Vaidehī, who is worthy of being served both in this world and the next, and who is like imperishable asceticism.

data.v: न त्वेवमवगच्छन्ति गुण दोषमसत्स्त्रियः । कामवक्तव्यहृदया भर्तृनाथाश्चरन्ति याः ।।
data.es: Those wicked women whose minds are overpowered by carnal desires, ranging at will as lords of their husbands, do not understand about vice and virtue.
data.anv: याः those women, कामवक्तव्यहृदयाः with minds overpowerd by carnal desires, भर्तृनाथाः as lords of their husbands, चरन्ति ranging at will, असत्त्स्रियः such wicked women, एवम् in this way, गुणदोषम् vice and virtue, न अवगच्छन्ति do not understand.
data.md: But bad women whose hearts hunger after carnality, and who lord over their husbands, do not get acquainted with the virtues and demerits (of their husbands); and range at their will.

data.v: प्राप्नुवन्त्ययशश्चैव धर्मभ्रंशं च मैथिलि । अकार्य वशमापन्नाः स्त्रियो याः खलु तद्विधाः ।।
data.es: O Sita, those women under the control of unworthy acts are dislodged from the path of righteousness and get infamy.
data.anv: मैथिलि O Sita, तद्विधाः such, स्त्रियः women, अकार्यवशम् the influence of unworthy acts, आपन्नः having obtained, अयशश्च infamy, पाप्नुवन्ति are obtaining, धर्मभ्रंशं च dislodged from the state of righteousness.
data.md: O Mithilā's daughter, surely women of this sort who are given to doing evil acts, reap infamy and fall off from righteousness.

data.v: त्वद्विधास्तु गुणैर्युक्ता दृष्टलोकपरावराः । स्त्रियः स्वर्गे चरिष्यन्ति यथा पुण्यकृतस्तथा ।।
data.es: Women like you who are endowed with virtues and can distinguish between good and bad in this world, like those who perform virtuous deeds, will move about in heaven.
data.anv: गुणैः with virtues, युक्ताः endowed with, दृष्टलोकपरावरा who can distinguish between good and bad in the world, त्वद्विधाः like you, स्त्रियस्तु women, धर्मकृतः doing virtuous deeds, यथा as to how, तथा that way, स्वर्गे in heaven, चरिष्यन्ति will range about.
data.md: But worthy women like you furnished with excellence, see a superior and better world, and range the celestial regions, like pious people.

data.v: सा त्वेवमुक्ता वैदेही अनसूयानसूयया । प्रतिपूज्य वचो मन्दं प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: When Anasuya thus addressed Vaidehi who is free from any malice, she worshipped Anasuya and started speaking in a gentle tone.
data.anv: अनसूया one who is free from malice, सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, अनसूयया by Anasuya, एवम् in this way, उक्ता when  addressed, वचः those words, प्रतिपूज्य having worshipped, मन्दम् in a gentle tone, प्रवक्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे commenced.
data.md: Thus addressed by Anasūyā, Vaidehī devoid of malice, honouring her words, began, “That you should instruct me is no wonder in you."

data.v: नैतदाश्चर्यमार्याया यन्मां त्वमनुभाषसे । विदितं तु ममाप्येतद्यथा नार्याः पतिर्गुरुः ।।
data.es: It is no wonder that a noble lady like you should instruct me this way. It is known to me that a husband is a guru to his wife.
data.anv: त्वम् you, माम् to me, यत् अभिभाषसे you are instructing, एतत् all this, आर्यायाः for a noble lady like you, आश्चर्यम् wonder, न not, नार्या for a woman, पतिः husband, गुरुः the revered one, यथा as, एतत् all this, ममापि to me, विदितं तु also known.
data.md: I know that a woman's spiritual guide is her husband. Even if a husband should be poor and of a disreputable character, he should be ungiudgingly obeyed by the like of me. one

data.v: यद्यप्येष भवेद्भर्ता ममार्ये वृत्तवर्जितः । अद्वैधमुपवर्तव्यस्तथाप्येष मया भवेत् ।।
data.es: O noble lady, even if my husband is devoid of good conduct, he should be obeyed without showing any hesitation.
data.anv: आर्ये O noble lady, एषः मम भर्ता my husband, वृत्तवर्जितः  devoid of good conduct, यद्यपि भवेत् even if it happens, तथापि even then, एषः he, मया by me, अद्वैधम् without hesitation, उपचर्तव्यः should be obeyed.

data.v: किं पुनर्यो गुणश्लाघ्यः सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः । स्थिरानुरागो धर्मात्मा मातृवर्ती पितृ प्रियः ।।
data.es: What to speak of a husband if he is worthy of applause for his virtues, is compassionate, a subduer of the senses, righteous and ever affectionate like a mother and a father?
data.anv: यः such a man, गुणश्लाघ्यः is worthy of applause for his virtues, सानुक्रोश: compassionate, जितेन्द्रियः subdued his senses, स्थिरानुरागः ever affectionate, धर्मात्मा righteous man, मातृवत् like a mother, पितृवत् like a father, प्रियः is dear, किं पुनः where is the need to say.
data.md: And to be said of one that is crowned with qualities, kind, self-controlled, of steady affection, righteous-souled, and who is dear as a father or a mother?

data.v: यां वृत्तिं वर्तते रामः कौसल्यायां महाबलः । तामेव नृपनारीणामन्यासामपि वर्तते ।।
data.es: Mighty Rama shows the same behaviour and treatment towards the other consorts of the king as he does towards his own mother Kausalya.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, रामः Rama, कौसल्यायाम् in Kausalya, यां वृत्तिम् such treatment, वर्तते behaves, अन्यासाम् with others, नृपनारीणामपि consorts of  the king, तामेव the same way, वर्तते behaves.
data.md: The exceedingly strong Rāma bear himself towards the other wives of the monarch as he does towards Kausalyā herself.

data.v: सकृद्दृष्टास्वपि स्त्रीषु नृपेण नृपवत्सलः । मातृवद्वर्तते वीरो मानमुत्सृज्य धर्मवित् ।।
data.es: Heroic Rama is affectionate towards king Dasaratha and is conversant with righteousness. Renouncing the sense of selfrespect he honours all the women on whom his father had cast his glance even once just as his own mother.
data.anv: नृपवत्सलः affectionate towards king Dasaratha, धर्मवित् one who is conversant with righteousness, वीरः heroic Rama, नृपेण by king, सकृत् only once, दृष्टासु seen, स्त्रिष्वपि in any woman, मानम् pride, उत्सृज्य setting aside, मातृवत् like a mother, वर्तते abides.
data.md: Renouncing sense of self-importance that heroic conversant with righteousness, devoted to his king, regards as his mothers those on whom the monarch once cast his eyes.

data.v: आगच्छन्त्याश्च विजनं वनमेवं भयावहम् । समाहितं हि मे श्वश्र्वा हृदये यत्स्थितं मम ।।
data.es: When departing for this frightful and desolate forest, the great (advice) imparted by my motherinlaw is firmly fixed in my mind.
data.anv: एवम् in this way, भयावहम् frightful, विजनम् desolate, वनम् forest, आगच्छन्त्याः when I was coming, मे to me, श्वश्वा by motherinlaw, समाहितम् imparted, तत् that, महत् wise instruction, हृदये in my heart, धृतम् is firmly grasped.
data.md: What my mother-in-law instructed me at the time that I was leaving for the lonely and fearful forest, is constantly present in my mind.

data.v: प्राणिप्रदानकाले च यत्पुरा त्वग्निसंनिधौ । अनुशिष्टा जनन्यास्मि वाक्यं तदपि मे धृतम् ।।
data.es: When I have been taught by my mother earlier, at the time of bestowal of my hand to Rama in the presence of the sacrificial fire (as witness) is etched in my mind.
data.anv: पुरा formerly, पाणिप्रदानकाले च at the time of bestowal of my hand to Rama, अग्नि सन्निधौ in the presence of sacrificial marriage fire, जनन्या by my mother, यत् वाक्यम् that word,  अनुशिष्टा आस्मि I have been taught, तदपि that also, मे to me, धृतम् hold
data.md: And what also my mother taught me in presence of fire on the occasion of the bestowal of my hand, is also remembered by me.

data.v: नवीकृतं तु तत्सर्वं वाक्यैस्ते धर्मचारिणि । पतिशुश्रूषणान्नार्यास्तपो नान्यद्विधीयते ।।
data.es: O righteous one (Anasuya), after listening to your words the instructions given by my motherinlaw and my mother are renewed (remembered again). For a woman, no other penance is laid down (in scriptures) except service to her husband.
data.anv: धर्मचारिणि O follower of righteous duty (Anasuya), ते वाक्यैः your words, तत् सर्वम् all that, नवीकृतम् renewed (reminded afresh), नार्याः for women, पतिशुश्रूषणात् more than obedience to her husband, अन्यत् other, तपः ascetic practice, न विधीयते is not laid down.
data.md: And, O you engaged in acts of righteousness, I have not forgotten the words that my relatives said to me, viz, the asceticism of a woman is ministering to her husband. They did not teach any thing else.

data.v: सावित्री पतिशुश्रूषां कृत्वा स्वर्गे महीयते । तथा वृत्तिश्च याता त्वं पतिशुश्रूषया दिवम् ।।
data.es: Having served her husband (faithfully), Savitri is honoured in heaven. You also, by following the same path of serving your husband, shall reach the heaven.
data.anv: पतिशुश्रूषाम् service to her husband, कृत्वा having rendered, सावित्री Savitri, स्वर्गे in heaven, महीयते is honoured, तथावृत्ति: having followed the same path, त्वं च you also, पतिशुश्रूषया through serving your husband, दिवम् to heaven, याता shall go.
data.md: Having served her lord. Sāvitri is highly honoured in heaven; and you also, following the same course, by virtue of having served your husband, has secured heaven.

data.v: वरिष्ठा सर्वनारीणामेषा च दिवि देवता । रोहिणी च विना चन्द्रं मुहूर्तमपि दृश्यते ।।
data.es: Rohini, the very best among all women and the goddess of heaven, is never seen in the sky separated from the moon even for a moment.
data.anv: सर्वनारीणाम् among  all women, वरिष्ठा the very best, देवता goddess, एषा रोहिणी this Rohini, दिवि in the sky, चन्द्रं विना without the Moon, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, न दृश्यते is not seen.
data.md: And this foremost of females, this goddess of heaven, Rohiņi, is not seen for a moment without the moon.

data.v: एवंविधाश्च प्रवराः स्त्रियो भर्तृदृढव्रताः । देवलोके महीयन्ते पुण्येन स्वेन कर्मणा ।।
data.es: Execellent women such as these, firm in their vows to their husband are highly revered in the world of gods through their own meritorious deeds.
data.anv: एवंविधाः such women, प्रवराः excellent, भर्तृदृढव्रताः firm in their vows to their husbands, स्त्रियः women, पुण्येन by merit, स्वेन by their own, कर्मणा deeds, देवलोके in the world of the gods, महीयन्ते are highly revered.
data.md: And prime women of this sort, firm in their husbands, are highly respected in the celestial regions by virtue of their pious acts.

data.v: ततोऽनसूया संहृष्टा श्रुत्वोक्तं सीतया वचः । शिरस्याघ्राय चोवाच मैथिलीं हर्षयन्त्युत ।।
data.es: Thereafter hearing Sita's words, Anasuya affectionately kissed her forehead and said this in order to make her happy:
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सीतया by Sita, उक्तम् spoken, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अनसूया Anasuya, संहृष्टा highly rejoiced, मैथिलीम् to Sita, शिरसि on her forehead, अघ्राय having kissed, हर्षयन्ती in order to make her happy, उवाच said.
data.md: Hearing Sītā's words, Anasuyā, exceedingly delighted, smelling her head, spoke thus, pleasing Maithili.

data.v: नियमैर्विविधैराप्तं तपो हि महदस्ति मे । तत्संश्रित्य बलं सीते छन्दये त्वां शुचिव्रते ।।
data.es: O Sita of pure conduct, I have great ascetic power obtained through practising various austerities. With its strength I shall give what you want for your enjoyment.
data.anv: शुचिव्रते O woman of pure conduct, सीते O Sita, विविधैः by various, नियमैः by austerities, आप्तम् obtained, महत् great, तपः ascetic power, मे to me, अस्ति हि is there to my credit, तत् बलम् that ascetic power, संश्रित्य having resorted to, त्वाम् you, छन्दये I shall cause your enjoyment.
data.md: By observing restrictions, I have earned great asceticism. By resorting to that energy, I would, O Sīta, confer a boon upon you, O you of pure vows.

data.v: उपपन्नं च युक्तं च वचनं तव मैथिलि । प्रीता चास्म्युचितं किं ते करवाणि ब्रवीहि मे । कृतमित्यब्रवीत्सीता तपोबलसमन्विताम् ।।
data.es: O Sita, I am glad to hear your befitting and pleasing words. Tell me what appropriate thing you desire and I shall give you.
data.anv: मैथिलि O Sita, तव वचनम् your words, उपपन्नम् are befitting, मनोज्ञं च also pleasing, प्रीता आस्मि I am pleased, उचितम् appropriate thing, किं what, ते to you, करवाणि shall I do, मे to me, ब्रवीहि  tell.
data.md: O Maithili, your words are just and proper. I am well pleased (with you). Tell me, O Sītā, what good shall I do you?

data.v: सा त्वेवमुक्ता धर्मज्ञा तया प्रीततराभवत् । सफलं च प्रहर्षं ते हन्त सीते करोम्यहम् ।।
data.es: When Sita said so, Anasuya who knew her righteous duty was immensely pleased. and replied, 'What a joy I shall make the words you have spoken come true'.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञा knower of righteous ways, सा she (Anasuya), तया by Sita, एवम् in this way, उक्ता having been addressed, प्रीततरा अभवत् she was immensely pleased, सीते O Sita, हन्त what a joy, प्रहर्षम् my delight, ते to you, सफलम् fruitful, अहम् I, करोमि shall do.
data.md: Thus accosted, that one cognizant of virtue, was still more pleased, and said, “I am exceedingly pleased (with your words). I will attain a desire of mine."

data.v: इदं दिव्यं वरं माल्यं वस्त्रमाभरणानि च । अङ्गरागं च वैदेहि महार्हमनुलेपनम् ।।
data.es: O princess of Videha, O Sita, I bestow on you this best garland of the gods, raiment, jewellery, fragrant unguents, and precious ointment for anointing your body with. All this will beautify your limbs. It is convenient (to use) and will never fade.
data.anv: वैदेहि O princess of Videha, सीते Sita, दिव्यम् divine, वरम् best, इदं माल्यम् this garland,  वस्त्रम् raiment, आभरणानि च jewellery, अङ्गरागं च fragrant unguents, महार्हम् precious, अनुलेपनं च ointment for anointing the body, मया by me, दत्तम् is bestowed, इदम् all this, तव to your, गात्राणि limbs, शोभयेत् will beautify, नित्यम् always, अनुरूपम् convenient, असंक्लिष्टम् भविष्यति will never impair.
data.md: This noble and grand garland, this apparel, these ornaments, and this precious paste for adorning the person, presented by me, let these, O Sītā, grace your person. These, worthy of you will never be tarnished.

data.v: मया दत्तमिदं सीते तव गात्राणि शोभयेत् । अनुरूपमसंक्लिष्टं नित्यमेव भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O princess of Videha, O Sita, I bestow on you this best garland of the gods, raiment, jewellery, fragrant unguents, and precious ointment for anointing your body with. All this will beautify your limbs. It is convenient (to use) and will never fade.
data.anv: वैदेहि O princess of Videha, सीते Sita, दिव्यम् divine, वरम् best, इदं माल्यम् this garland,  वस्त्रम् raiment, आभरणानि च jewellery, अङ्गरागं च fragrant unguents, महार्हम् precious, अनुलेपनं च ointment for anointing the body, मया by me, दत्तम् is bestowed, इदम् all this, तव to your, गात्राणि limbs, शोभयेत् will beautify, नित्यम् always, अनुरूपम् convenient, असंक्लिष्टम् भविष्यति will never impair.
data.md: This noble and grand garland, this apparel, these ornaments, and this precious paste for adorning the person, presented by me, let these, O Sītā, grace your person. These, worthy of you will never be tarnished.

data.v: अङ्गरागेण दिव्येन लिप्ताङ्गी जनकात्मजे । शोभयिष्यामि भर्तारं यथा श्रीर्विष्णुमव्ययम् ।।
data.es: O daughter of Janaka, you will enhance the glory of your husband by anointing your body with this divine, fragrant unguent to your body like Lakshmi enhancing the glory of eternal Visnu.
data.anv: जनकात्मजे O daughter of Janaka, दिव्ये O divine lady, अङ्गरागेण with fragrant unguent, लिप्ताङ्गी anointing to your body, श्रीः Lakshmi, अव्ययम् imperishable, विष्णुम् Vishnu, यथा how, भर्तारम् your husband, शोभयिष्यसि you will enhance the glory.
data.md: O daughter of Janaka, daubing your person with this excellent paint, you will grace your husband even as Śrī does the undeteriorating Visnu.

data.v: सा वस्त्रमङ्गरागं च भूषणानि स्रजस्तथा । मैथिली प्रतिजग्राह प्रीतिदानमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: That princess from Mithila accepted the incomparable gifts of love, the raiment, fragrant unguents, jewellery and also the garland.
data.anv: सा मैथिली that princess from Mithila, वस्त्रम् raiment, अङ्गरागं च fragrant unguent, भूषणानि jewellery, तथा and, स्रजः garlands, अनुत्तमम् incomparable, प्रीतिदानम् gifts of love, प्रतिजग्राह accepted.
data.md: Thereupon Mithila's daughter accepted those things presented to her out of love, viz., the apparel, the paint, the ornaments and the garland. Having accepted those accepted those presents conferred on her from love, that illustrious one, Sītā, quietly sat beside the female ascetic with joined hands.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तत्सीता प्रीतिदानं यशस्विनी । श्लिष्टाञ्जलिपुटा धीरा समुपास्त तपोधनाम् ।।
data.es: Illustrious Sita accepted the gifts of love and with palms folded in reverence sat beside her, an ascetic.
data.anv: यशस्विनी illustrious lady, सीता Sita, तत् that, प्रीतिदानम् gifts of love, प्रतिगृह्य having accepted, श्लिष्टाञ्जलिपुटा with hands folded like a dish in reverence, तत्र there, तपोधनाम्  ascetic, समुपास्त sat beside her.
data.md: Thereupon Mithila's daughter accepted those things presented to her out of love, viz., the apparel, the paint, the ornaments and the garland. Having accepted those accepted those presents conferred on her from love, that illustrious one, Sītā, quietly sat beside the female ascetic with joined hands.

data.v: तथा सीतामुपासीनामनसूया दृढव्रता । वचनं प्रष्टुमारेभे कथां कांचिदनुप्रियाम् ।।
data.es: Anasuya who was firm in her vows commenced to ask Sita this way about a certain tale (that was close to her heart).
data.anv: दृढव्रता firm in her vows, अनसूया Anasuya, तथा in that way, उपासीनाम् sitting, सीताम् Sita, कांचित् certain, प्रियकथामनु relating to a dear tale (that was close to her heart), प्रष्टुम् to ask, वचनम् these words, आरेभे commenced.
data.md: Then as Sītā was sitting, Anasūyā firm in vow asked her concerning a thing that was near her heart, saying.

data.v: स्वयंवरे किल प्राप्ता त्वमनेन यशस्विना । राघवेणेति मे सीते कथा श्रुतिमुपागता ।।
data.es: O Sita, I have heard that you have been won by the illustrious Rama in the swayamvara. At least that is the story which reached my ears.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, त्वम् you, यशस्विना by the illustrious one, राघवेण by Rama, स्वयंवरे in the swayamvara (the choice of the husband by a princess in the public), प्राप्ता किल are obtained, इति कथा so runs the story, मे my, श्रुतिम् my ear, उपागता reached.
data.md: I have heard, O Sītā, that you were won by the renowned Rāghava on the occasion of a selfchoice.

data.v: तां कथां श्रोतुमिच्छामि विस्तरेण च मैथिलि । यथानुभूतं कार्त्स्न्येन तन्मे त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O daughter of Mithila, I would like to hear the story in detail. You should tell me the whole story as you experienced it.
data.anv: मैथिलि O daughter of the king of Mithila,  ताम् that story,  विस्तरेण in detail, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish, तत् that one, त्वम् you, यथाऽनुभूतम् as you experienced, कात्स्न्येन entirely, वक्तुम् अर्हसि  you should tell me.
data.md: O Maithili, that story I should like to hear, related at length. It therefore, behoves you to relate that to me in detail.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सा सीता तां ततो धर्मचारिणीम् । श्रूयतामिति चोक्त्वा वै कथयामास तां कथाम् ।।
data.es: 'Listen' said Sita, thus addressed, and began relating the story to Anasuya, a performer of austerities.
data.anv: एवम् thus, उक्ता  addressed, सा सीता that Sita, ततः then, श्रूयताम् इति  listen, उक्त्वा having said, ताम् that, धर्मचारिणीम् to one who practiced righteousness, तां कथाम् that story, कथयामास related.
data.md: Thus address, Sītā, saying to the ascetic engaged in pious acts, "Listen!" began to tell the story.

data.v: मिथिलाधिपतिर्वीरो जनको नाम धर्मवित् । क्षत्रधर्मण्यभिरतो न्यायतः शास्ति मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: There is a king in Mithila, Janaka by name. He is heroic and is conversant with righteousness. Engaged in the duties of a kshatriya, he is rules the earth with justice.
data.anv: मिथिलाधिपतिः king of Mithila, वीरः a warrior, धर्मवित् one conversant wtih righteousness, जनको नाम by name Janaka, क्षत्रधर्मे in the duties of kshatriya, अभिरतः engaged, न्यायतः  rightly, मेदिनीम् this earth, शास्ति was ruling.
data.md: Mithila's lord, the heroic Janaka, justly rule the earth, engaged in observing the duties of Ks atriyas.

data.v: तस्य लाङ्गलहस्तस्य कर्षतः क्षेत्रमण्डलम् । अहं किलोत्थिता भित्त्वा जगतीं नृपतेः सुता ।।
data.es: When he was ploughing the circular plot of land for performing a sacrifice, it is said I emerged from the earth by breaking it and therefore I became his dauhghter.
data.anv: तस्य his, लाङ्गलहस्तस्य of a man holding a plough in hand, क्षेत्रमण्डलम् the circular plot of land for performing sacrifice, कर्षतः while ploughing, अहम् I, नृपतेः king's, सुता as daughter, जगतीम् the earth, भित्वा breaking, उत्थिता किल arose, as they say.
data.md: As he was ploughing a plain intended for a sacrifice, I rose from under the earth; and (in this sense) I am the daughter of that king.

data.v: स मां दृष्ट्वा नरपतिर्मुष्टिविक्षेपतत्परः । पांशु गुण्ठित सर्वाङ्गीं विस्मितो जनकोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: Engaged in sowing fistfuls of seeds, king Janaka found me covered with dust and was astonished.
data.anv: मुष्टिविक्षेपतत्परः eager to sow fistfuls of seeds, नरपतिः king, सः जनकः that Janaka, पांसुकुण्ठितसर्वाङ्गीं with my body covered with dust, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा having seen, विस्मितः अभवत् was astonished.
data.md: Tending me, with my body covered with dust, Janaka, engaged in throwing handfuls of dust (to level hollow spots), was struck with amazement.

data.v: अनपत्येन च स्नेहादङ्कमारोप्य च स्वयम् । ममेयं तनयेत्युक्त्वा स्नेहो मयि निपातितः ।।
data.es: As he had no children, he, on his own accord, lifted me up and placing me on his lap, saying, This is my daughter, he began showering (lots of) love on me.
data.anv: अनपत्येन being childless, स्वयम् himself, स्नेहात् out of affection, अङ्कम् in his lap, आरोप्य placing, इयम् this one, मम तनया is my daughter, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, मयि in me,  स्नेहः affection, निपातितः showered
data.md: Being childless, he took me on his lap from affection, and saying, 'This is my daughter', conceived affection for me.

data.v: अन्तरिक्षे च वागुक्ताप्रतिमा मानुषी किल । एवमेतन्नरपते धर्मेण तनया तव ।।
data.es: 'O king, she is an incomparable divine being. By right she is your daughter'. These were the words (Janaka) heard from out of the sky.
data.anv: नरपते O king, एतत् this, एवम् in this way, अप्रतिमा incomparable, अमानुषी not a human being, तव to you, धर्मेण by right, तनया daughter, अन्तरिक्षे from out of the sky, वाक् word, उक्ता  was uttered.
data.md: Then there were uttered words in the welkin, resembling those of a human being,! 'O king, in all righteousness, this is your daughter'.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टो धर्मात्मा पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः । अवाप्तो विपुलामृद्धिं मामवाप्य नराधिपः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, my father and the righteous lord of Mithila was delighted in possessing me when a noble thought struck his mind.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, धर्मात्मा righteous, नराधिप: the king, मिथिलाधिपः the lord of Mithila, मे पिता my father, प्रहृष्टः was delighted, माम् me, अवाप्य having got, विपुलाम् noble, बुद्धिम् thought, अवाप्तः obtained.
data.md: Then well-pleased, my righteous father, the king, lord of Mithilā, receiving me, attained mighty good fortune.

data.v: दत्त्वा चास्मीष्टवद्देव्यै ज्येष्ठायै पुण्यकर्मणा । तया संभाविता चास्मि स्निग्धया मातृसौहृदात् ।।
data.es: Bestowed as the choicest one of meritorious acts on the chief queen, I was brought up by her, by nature affectionate, with the love of a mother.
data.anv: पुण्यकर्मणा by a man of meritorious acts, ज्येष्ठायै to the chief, देव्यैः queen, इष्टवत् as the choicest one, दत्ता अस्मि I was given, स्निग्धया by a lady endowed with affection, तया by her, मातृसौहृदात् with the love of a mother, सम्भाविता अस्मि I was nourished.
data.md: Consigned to the pious eldest noble one (queen), desirous of having offspring, I was brought up by that mild lady, with the tenderness of a mother.

data.v: पतिसंयोगसुलभं वयो दृष्ट्वा तु मे पिता । चिन्तामभ्यगमद्दीनो वित्तनाशादिवाधनः ।।
data.es: When my father saw I had attained the marriageable age, he was immersed in sorrow like an indigent man who had lost all his wealth.
data.anv: मे पिता my father, पतिसंयोगसुलभम् a proper time for uniting with a husband, वयः age,         दृष्ट्वा having observed, दीनः desolate, वित्तनाशात् due to loss of wealth, अधनः इव like an poor man, चिन्ताम् sorrow, अभ्यगमत् obtained.
data.md: (In time) seeing me fit for the company of a husband, my father in distress was plunged in thought, like a poor man that has lost his wealth.

data.v: सदृशाच्चापकृष्टाच्च लोके कन्यापिता जनात् । प्रधर्षणामवाप्नोति शक्रेणापि समो भुवि ।।
data.es: Even though he was an Indra on earth, as a father of an unmarried girl he would be humiliated by men who are his equal or inferior in this world.
data.anv: भुवि on earth, शक्रेण with Indra, समोऽपि though equal, कन्यापिता the father of an unmarried girl, सदृशाः equal, अपकृष्टात् by an inferior, जनात् from men, लोके in this world, प्रधर्षणाम् humiliation, अवाप्नोति will receive.
data.md: Even if the father of a girl be like to ſakra himself on earth he reaps odium at the hands of his equals and inferiors.

data.v: तां धर्षणामदूरस्थां संदृश्यात्मनि पार्थिवः । चिन्न्तार्णवगतः पारं नाससादाप्लवो यथ ।।
data.es: Having perceived that the humiliation is not very far, king Janaka was plunged in a sea of sorrow like one who cannot reach the shore without a float.
data.anv: पार्थिवः the king, तां धर्षणाम् that humiliation, आत्मनि in him, अदूरस्थाम् not very far, दृष्ट्वा having observed, चिन्तार्णवगतः submerged in a sea of sorrow, अप्लवो यथा like one without a float, पारम् the shore, नाससाद did not reach.
data.md: Perceiving this obloquy at a short distance, the king was plunged in a sea of anxiety, but could not cross it, like one that has no raft.

data.v: अयोनिजां हि मां ज्ञात्वा नाध्यगच्छत्स चिन्तयन् । सदृशं चानुरूपं च महीपालः पतिं मम ।।
data.es: The ruler of the earth knew that I was not born from a woman's womb, and could not find a suitable husband for me after deep reflection.
data.anv: महीपालः the ruler of earth, माम् me, अयोनिजाम् not born from the womb, ज्ञात्वा having known, मम for me, सदृशम् equal, अनुरूपं च suitable, पतिम् husband, विचिन्तयन् thinking over, नाध्यगच्छत् did not find.
data.md: Knowing me as unborn from any female vessel, the lord of earth reflecting upon it, could not come upon a suitable and fit husband for me.

data.v: तस्य बुद्धिरियं जाता चिन्तयानस्य संततम् । स्वयं वरं तनूजायाः करिष्यामीति धीमतः ।।
data.es: After constantly pondering over the matter, the wise king arrived at the decision to perform a swayamvara for his daughter.
data.anv: सन्ततम् constantly, चिन्तयानस्य pondering deeply, धीमतः wise, तस्य his, तनूजायाः for the daughter, स्वयंवरम् swayamvara, करिष्यामि I shall perform, इति thus, इयं बुद्धि: this thought, जाता was born.
data.md: Then as he reflected, this thought occurred to him 'I will righteously celebrate the self-choice of my daughters'.

data.v: महायज्ञे तदा तस्य वरुणेन महात्मना । दत्तं धनुर्वरं प्रीत्या तूणी चाक्षय्य सायकौ ।।
data.es: Magnanimous Varuna out of his affection had given him, on the occasion of a great sacrifice, an excellent bow with inexhaustible arrows and a pair of quivers.
data.anv: तदा then, महायज्ञे at a great sacrifice, तस्य to him, महात्मना by the magnanimous, वरुणेन by Varuna, प्रीत्या with affection, धनुर्वरम् an excellent bow, दत्तम् was given, अक्षयसायकौ with two inexhaustible arrows, तूणी च and two quivers.
data.md: In the great sacrifice of Daksa, the highsouled Varuna had well-pleased conferred on Devarata an excellent bow with inexhaustible arrows and a couple of quivers.

data.v: असंचाल्यं मनुष्यैश्च यत्नेनापि च गौरवात् । तन्न शक्ता नमयितुं स्वप्नेष्वपि नराधिपाः ।।
data.es: Because of its weight, no human could move that bow despite great effort nor were the kings capable of bending it even in their dreams.
data.anv: गौरवात् because of weight, मनुष्यैः by a human, यत्नेनापि even with great effort,  असञ्चाल्यम् cannot be moved, तत् that bow, नराधिपाः lords of men, स्वप्नेष्वपि even in their dreams, नमयितुम् to bend, न शक्ताः were not capable.
data.md: Incapable of being moved on account of its weight, the kings could not even dream of bending the bow.

data.v: तद्धनुः प्राप्य मे पित्रा व्याहृतं सत्यवादिना । समवाये नरेन्द्राणां पूर्वमामन्त्र्य पार्थिवान् ।।
data.es: My truthful father, after having acquired the bow, invited all the princes and placed the great bow before them in the assembly where he declared:
data.anv: सत्यवादिना by a truthful man, मे पित्रा by my father, पूर्वम् previously, पार्थिवान् kings, आमन्त्र्य having invited, नरेन्द्राणाम् of kings, समवाये in the assembly, तत् धनुः that bow, प्राप्य having acquired, व्याहृतम् addressed them.
data.md: Having obtained the bow, my truthful father said, 'No fear!' inviting at the same time the kings to an assembly of sovereigns.

data.v: इदं च धनुरुद्यम्य सज्यं यः कुरुते नरः । तस्य मे दुहिता भार्या भविष्यति न संशयः ।।
data.anv: यः नर: any man, इदं धनुः this bow, उद्यम्य having lifted, सज्यं च string the bow, कुरुते who could do, तस्य to him, मे दुहिता my daughter, भार्या wife, भविष्यति shall become, संशयः न no doubt about it.
data.md: He that, raising the bow, shall string it, shall doubtless receive my daughter for his wife.

data.v: तच्च दृष्ट्वा धनुःश्रेष्ठं गौरवाद्गिरिसंनिभम् । अभिवाद्य नृपा जग्मुरशक्तास्तस्य तोलने ।।
data.es: Beholding the mighty bow resembling a mountain in weight, the kings, unable to lift it, paid their homage and left.
data.anv: नृपाः the kings, गौरवात् due to heavy weight, गिरिसन्निभम् resembling a mountain, तत् धनुः श्रेष्ठम् that mighty bow, दृष्ट्वा beholding, तस्य its, तोलने in lifting, अशक्ताः were unable, अभिवाद्य paying obeisance, जग्मुः went away.
data.md: Seeing that best of bows in weight resembling a hill, the kings saluting it, go away, unable to move it.

data.v: सुदीर्घस्य तु कालस्य राघवोऽयं महाद्युतिः । विश्वामित्रेण सहितो यज्ञं द्रष्टुं समागतः ।।
data.es: After a long time, resplendent Rama whose prowess was truth, arrived along with his brother Lakshman and sage Viswamitra in order to witness the sacrifice.
data.anv: सुदीर्घस्य कालस्य after a long time, राघवः Rama, महाद्युतिः resplendent, सत्यपराक्रमः whose prowess was truth, अयं रामः this Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, विश्वामित्रेण सहितः together with Viswamitra, यज्ञम् the sacrifice, द्रष्टुम् to observe, समागतः arrived.
data.md: It came to pass that after a long time, this highly effulgent Rāghava came to witness the sacrifice in company with Viśvāmitra. And Rāma having truth for his prowess, and the righteous Viśvāmitra were respectfully received by my sire.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा मम पित्रा सुपूजितः ।।
data.md: It came to pass that after a long time, this highly effulgent Rāghava came to witness the sacrifice in company with Viśvāmitra. And Rāma having truth for his prowess, and the righteous Viśvāmitra were respectfully received by my sire.

data.v: प्रोवाच पितरं तत्र राघवो रामलक्ष्मणौ । सुतौ दशरथस्येमौ धनुर्दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणौ । इत्युक्तस्तेन विप्रेण तद्धनुः समुपानयत् ।।
data.md: Then Viśvāmitra said to my father, 'The descendants of Raghu, sons of Daśaratha, Rāma and Lakşmaņa are anxious to behold the bow.'

data.v: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण तदानम्य स वीर्यवान् । ज्यां समारोप्य झटिति पूरयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: At the words of that ascetic, my father brought out the bow. Mighty and valiant Rama bent it and strung it and drew it in the twinkling of an eye.
data.anv: तेन विप्रेण by that ascetic, इति thus, उक्तः uttered, ततो then, धनुः bow, उपानयत् brought,  महाबलः mighty one, वीर्यवान् valiant man, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in the twinkling of an eye, तत् that one, आनम्य having bent, झडिति instantly, ज्याम् the string, समारोप्य pulling it, पूरयामास drew it.

data.v: तेन पूरयता वेगान्मध्ये भग्नं द्विधा धनुः । तस्य शब्दोऽभवद्भीमः पतितस्याशनेरिव ।।
data.es: When Rama was stringing the bow with force, it was broken into two in the middle and fell down with a dreadful sound like that of thunder.
data.anv: पूरयता while stringing, तेन by Rama, वेगात् with force, धनुः bow, मध्ये in the middle, द्विधा into two, भग्नम् was broken, तस्य its, भीमः dreadful, शब्दः sound, पतितस्य fallen, अशनेरिव like that of a thunder, अभवत् arose.
data.md: And as he drew it vehemently, it broke in the middle in twain. And the sound of it was dreadful like to the bursting of a thunder-bolt.

data.v: ततोऽहं तत्र रामाय पित्रा सत्याभिसंधिना । उद्यता दातुमुद्यम्य जलभाजनमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Then, my father steadfast in truth, held a vessel of pure water and declared his decision to offer me to Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, तत्र there, सत्याभिसन्धिना by one steadfast in truth, पित्रा by my father, उत्तमम् pure, जलभाजनम् watervessel, उद्यम्य having raised, अहम् I, रामाय to Rama , दातुम् to give, निश्चिता decided.
data.md: Then raising an excellent vessel of water, my truthful father prepared to bestow me on Rāghava.

data.v: दीयमानां न तु तदा प्रतिजग्राह राघवः । अविज्ञाय पितुश्छन्दमयोध्याधिपतेः प्रभोः ।।
data.es: Then Rama did not accept the offer of my father straightaway before he knew the opinion of his father Dasaratha, king of Ayodhya.
data.anv: तदा then, राघवः Rama, अयोध्याऽधिपतेः of the king of Ayodhya, प्रभोः lord, पितुः his father's, छन्दम् opinion, अविज्ञाय without knowing, दीयमानाम् being offered by father, न तु प्रतिजग्राह did not accept.
data.md: And bestowed on Rāghava, I was accepted of him, after he had consulted the wish of his father, that lord, the master of Ayodhyā.

data.v: ततः श्वशुरमामन्त्र्य वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम् । मम पित्रा अहं दत्ता रामाय विदितात्मने ।।
data.es: Thereafter, my fatherinlaw, the aged king Dasaratha was invited and my father offered me to Rama known for his sagacity.
data.anv: ततः then, मम पित्रा by my father, श्वशुरम् fatherinlaw, वृद्धम् aged, दशरथं नृपम् king Dasaratha, आमन्त्र्य having invited, अहम् I, विदितात्मन: of a man who is known for his sagacity, रामाय to Rama, दत्ता I was given.
data.md: And inviting my father-in-law, the old king Dasaratha, my father bestowed me on Rāma having knowledge of self.

data.v: मम चैवानुजा साध्वी ऊर्मिला प्रियदर्शना । भार्यार्थे लक्ष्मणस्यापि दत्ता पित्रा मम स्वयम् ।।
data.es: My father, on his own accord, bestowed Urmila, my younger sister of chaste and of pleasing appearance as wife to Lakshmana.
data.anv: मम my, अनुजा younger sister, साध्वी chaste, प्रियदर्शना pleasing appearance, ऊर्मिला Urmila, भार्यार्थे as wife, मम पित्रा by my father, स्वयम् of his own accord, लक्ष्मणस्यापि for Lakshman, दत्ता was given.
data.md: And my father bestowed on Lakşmaņa for his wife, my younger sister, the beauteous and chaste Urmila.

data.v: एवं दत्तास्मि रामाय तदा तस्मिन्स्वयं वरे । अनुरक्ता च धर्मेण पतिं वीर्यवतां वरम् ।।
data.es: In this way my father bestowed me on Rama in that swayamvara and I remain devoted to my husband who is the foremost among the valiant in treading the path of righteousness.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टादशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the one hundredeighteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तदा then, तस्मिन् स्वयंवरे in that swayamvara, रामाय for Rama, एवम् in this way, दत्ता अस्मि was bestowed, वीर्यवताम् among valiant, वरम् foremost, पतिम् husband, धर्मेण in accordance with righteousness, अनुरक्ता अस्मि I remain devoted.
data.md: Thus was I bestowed on Rāma on the occasion of that self-choice. And ever since I have been devoted to my husband, the foremost of those possessing prowess.

data.v: अनसूया तु धर्मज्ञा श्रुत्वा तां महतीं कथाम् । पर्यष्वजत बाहुभ्यां शिरस्याघ्राय मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: Then righteous Anasuya, having heard the great story of Sita, kissed her on the forehead and embraced her with both the arms.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञा knower of righteousness, अनसूया तु Anasuya on her part, ताम् all that, महतीं कथाम्  great narrative, श्रुत्वा having heard, मैथिलीम् Sita, शिरसि on head, आघ्राय having smelt, बाहुभ्याम् with arms, पर्यष्वजत embraced.
data.md: Having heard this grand story, Anasāyā cognizant of righteousness, smelling the head of Mithilā's daughter, embraced Sītā with her arms.

data.v: व्यक्ताक्षरपदं चित्रं भाषितं मधुरं त्वया । यथा स्वयंवरं वृत्तं तत्सर्वं हि श्रुतं मया ।।
data.es: You have related wonderfully and sweetly your Swayamvara with each word and each syllable uttered clearly. I have heard everything as it happened. O sweetspeaking Sita, I have greatly enjoyed your story.
data.anv: त्वया by you, व्यक्ताक्षरपदम् with each word and each syllable uttered clearly, चित्रम्   wonderful, मधुरम् sweet, भाषितम् spoken, स्वयंवरम् the ceremony in which the bride chooses the groom of her own accord, यथा as, वृत्तम् it happened, तत्सर्वं all that, मया by me, श्रुतं हि has been heard, मधुरभाषिणि O sweetspeaking, Sita, ते your, कथया in the story, अहम् I, दृढम् रमे I enjoy  greatly.
data.md: I have heard all that you, describing the selfchoice, have spoken sweetly and beautifully in articulated letters and feet.

data.v: रमेऽहं कथया ते तु दृढं मधुरभाषिणि । रविरस्तं गतः श्रीमानुपोह्य रजनीं शिवाम् ।।
दिवसं प्रति कीर्णानामाहारार्थं पतत्रिणाम् । संध्याकाले निलीनानां निद्रार्थं श्रूयते ध्वनिः ।।
data.es: The resplendent Sun has set. The auspcious night is drawing near. The birds who forage far and wide for food during the day return to their nests to rest for the night. You can hear them twittering.
data.anv: श्रीमान् resplendent, रविः Sun, शिवाम् auspicious, रजनीम् night, उपोह्य after drawing near, अस्तगतः has set, दिवसम् during day, आहारार्थम् for the sake of food, प्रतिकीर्णानाम् forage far and wide, सन्ध्याकाले in the twilight, निद्रार्थम् for the sake of sleep, निलीनानाम् resting, पतत्रिणाम् of birds, ध्वनिः sound, श्रूयते is heard.
data.md: O sweet-speeched one, I have been delighted with your narration. But ushering in the auspicious night, the graceful Sun has set. And there are heard the notes of feathered ones, which, after having gone about in search of food, are resting now for the purpose of sleeping.

data.v: एते चाप्यभिषेकार्द्रा मुनयः फलशोधनाः । सहिता उपवर्तन्ते सलिलाप्लुतवल्कलाः ।।
data.es: The sages also are returning in groups with waterpitchers filled with water and their bark robes soaked with water after their ceremonial bath.
data.anv: एते मुनयः च these sages, अभिषेकार्द्राः wet through ablution, कलशोद्यताः carrying waterpitchers, सलिलाप्लुतवल्कलाः their bark robes soaked with water, सहिता: in groups, उपवर्तन्ते are returning.
data.md: And these ascetics having bathed, are wending their way in a body, carrying waterpitchers, their barks drenched with water.

data.v: ऋषीणामग्निहोत्रेषु हुतेषु विधिपुर्वकम् । कपोताङ्गारुणो धूमो दृश्यते पवनोद्धतः ।।
data.es: The ascetics have duly offered oblations to the fire in Agnihotra sacrifices and the smoke, tawny like the pigeon's body, emanates wafted by the wind.
data.anv: ऋषीणाम् of the ascetics, अग्निहोत्रेषु  in Agnihotra sacrifices, विधिपूर्वकम् duly, हुतेषु oblations offered, कपोताङ्गारुणः tawny like the pigeon's body, धूमः smoke, पवनोद्धतः raised by the wind, दृश्यते is seen.
data.md: The smoke arising from the fire-sacrifice duly performed by the ascetics, reddish like the hue of the pigeon's neck, is seen, wafted by the wind.

data.v: अल्पपर्णा हि तरवो घनीभूताः समन्ततः । विप्रकृष्टेऽपि ये देशे न प्रकाशन्ति वै दिशः ।।
data.es: The trees with sparse leaves all over have grown dense, the quarters in the distant region are no longer discernible by the senses.
data.anv: समन्ततः on all sides, अल्पपर्णाः with sparse leaves, तरवः trees, घनीभूताः have grown dense, विप्रकृष्टेन्द्रिये with disturbed senses, अस्मिन् देशे in this region, दिशः the four quarters, न प्रकाशन्ति वै no longer look bright.
data.md: And trees of spare foliage appear dense (on all sides); and distance is no longer perceptible.

data.v: रजनी रससत्त्वानि प्रचरन्ति समन्ततः । तपोवनमृगा ह्येते वेदितीर्थेषु शेरते ।।
data.es: The night rangers have started moving everywhere and the deer in the penance grove are beginning to sleep around the sacred altars.
data.anv: रजनीचरसत्वानि the beings that range by night, समन्ततः everywhere, प्रचरन्ति are wandering, एते तपोवनमृगाः these deer of the penance grove, वेदितीर्थेषु around sacred altars, शेरते are sleeping.
data.md: And animals ranging in the night are going about all round; and those deer of the asylum are reposing on the daises.

data.v: संप्रवृत्ता निशा सीते नक्षत्रसमलंकृता । ज्योत्स्ना प्रावरणश्चन्द्रो दृश्यतेऽभ्युदितोऽम्बरे ।।
data.es: O Sita, adorned with stars, the night has commenced. You can see the moon rising in the sky spreading his mantle of light.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, नक्षत्रसमलङ्कृता adorned with stars, निशा night, सम्प्रवृत्ता has commenced, ज्योत्स्नाप्रावरणः spread with the mantle of moonlight, चन्द्रः moon, अम्बरे in the sky, अभ्युदितः is rising, दृश्यते is appearing.
data.md: O Sītā, the night crested by the stars has arrived; and, veiled in moonlight, appears the moon in the heavens.

data.v: गम्यतामनुजानामि रामस्यानुचरी भव । कथयन्त्या हि मधुरं त्वयाहं परितोषिता ।।
data.es: With my permission you may go now and be a companion of Rama. I am thoroughly contented with your story told so sweetly.
data.anv: गम्यताम् you may go now, अनुजानामि I give you my consent, रामस्य to Rama, अनुचरी भव be his companion, मधुरम् sweetly, कथयन्त्या storytelling, त्वया by you, अहम् I, परितोषिता  thoroughly contented.
data.md: Go you; I permit you. Do you seek the society of Rāma. I have been pleased with your sweet converse.

data.v: अलंकुरु च तावत्त्वं प्रत्यक्षं मम मैथिलि । प्रीतिं जनय मे वत्स दिव्यालंकारशोभिनी ।।
data.es: O Sita, adorn yourself in my presence. Dear child, permit me the pleasure of adorning you with these divine ornaments.
data.anv: मैथिलि O Sita, त्वम् you, मम my, प्रत्यक्षं तावत् in my presence, अलङ्कुरु adorn yourself, वत्से dear child, दिव्यालङ्कारशोभिता adorned with divine ornaments, मे to me, प्रीतिम् delight, जनय cause me.
data.md: O daughter of Mithilā, do you deck yourself before me. Do you thus please me, my child, you that look beautiful with excellent ornaments.

data.v: सा तदा समलंकृत्य सीता सुरसुतोपमा । प्रणम्य शिरसा तस्यै रामं त्वभिमुखी ययौ ।।
data.es: Sita, adorned, looked like the daughter of a god. She bowed at the feet of Anasuya in reverence and set out to meet Rama.
data.anv: सुरसुतोपमा resembling the daughter of a god, सा सीता that Sita, तथा in that way, समलङ्कुत्य having adorned, तस्यै to her, शिरसा with her head, प्रणम्य saluting with reverence, रामम् to Rama, अभिमुखी towards, ययौ went.
data.md: Thereat, having adorned herself, Sītā, resembling the daughter of a celestial, bowing down to the feet (of the female ascetic), directed her steps towards Rāma.

data.v: तथा तु भूषितां सीतां ददर्श वदतां वरः । राघवः प्रीतिदानेन तपस्विन्या जहर्ष च ।।
data.es: Rama, the most eloquent among men, saw Sita adorned, and rejoiced at the gifts of love given by the ascetic Anasuya.
data.anv: वदताम् among those eloquent one, वरः excellent, राघवः Rama, तथा in that way, भूषिताम्  adorned, सीताम् Sita, ददर्श beheld, तपस्विन्याः of the female ascetic, प्रीतिदानेन with gifts of love, जहर्ष च rejoiced.
data.md: And that best of speakers, Raghava, saw Sita, decked with the ornaments affectionately presented by the ascetic; and he rejoiced thereat.

data.v: न्यवेदयत्ततः सर्वं सीता रामाय मैथिली । प्रीतिदानं तपस्विन्या वसनाभरणस्रजाम् ।।
data.es: Sita the princess of Mithila related everything to Rama and showed him the gifts of love given by ascetic Anasuya -- raiment, jewellery and garlands.
data.anv: मैथिली the princess of Mithila, सीता Sita, ततः there after, तपस्विन्याः of ascetic Anasuya, प्रीतिदानम् gifts of love, वसनाभरणस्रजम् raiment, jewellery and garlands, सर्वम् everything, रामाय to Rama, न्यवेदयत् related.
data.md: Then Mithila's daughter, Sita, related to Rama all about her having been affectionately presented by the ascetic with attire, ornaments and the garland.

data.v: प्रहृष्टस्त्वभवद्रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महारथः । मैथिल्याः सत्क्रियां दृष्ट्वा मानुषेषु सुदुर्लभाम् ।।
data.es: Rama the great charioteer and Lakshmana were exceedingly gratified to see the honour conferred on Sita, rare among mortals.
data.anv: रामः Rama, महारथः great charioteer, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, मानुषेषु among mortals, सुदुर्लभाम् very difficult to obtain, मैथिल्याः to Sita, सत्क्रियाम् the honour, दृष्ट्वा having seen, प्रहृष्टः अभवत् was gratified.
data.md: Thereupon, witnessing the honour that had been accorded to Maithili, rare among men, Rāma became well pleased, as also that mighty car-warrior, Laksmana.

data.v: ततस्तां सर्वरीं प्रीतः पुण्यां शशिनिभाननः । अर्चितस्तापसैः सिद्धैरुवास रघुनन्दनः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, the descendant of Raghu, whose countenance resembled the Moon, having received the hospitality of the accomplished ascetics, passed that holy night in delight.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, शशिनिभाननः face like the Moon, रघुनन्दनः the descendant of Raghu, सिद्धैः by the acomplished, तापसैः by ascetics, अर्चितः hospitality having been extended, प्रीतः in delight, पुण्याम् holy, तां शर्वरीम् that night, उवास passed.
data.md: Then Raghu's son, ministered to by the ascetic, happily spent the delightful night there, with her face resembling the moon.

data.v: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामभिषिच्य हुताग्निकान् । आपृच्छेतां नरव्याघ्रौ तापसान्वनगोचरान् ।।
data.es: Night over, the two best men, Rama and Lakshmana, after their ablution took leave of the ascetics inhabiting the forest who offered morning oblations to the fire .
data.anv: तस्याम् that, रात्र्याम् night, व्यतीतायाम् had passed away, नरव्याघ्रौ the two great men, अभिषिच्य having bathed, हुताग्निकान् who performed their fireofferings, वनगोचरान् inhabiting the  forest, तापसान् ascetics, अपृच्छेताम् took leave of.
data.md: On the night having passed away, those foremost of men, after performing their ablutions, enquired of the ascetics performing fire sacrifices, who lived in the forest.

data.v: तावूचुस्ते वनचरास्तापसा धर्मचारिणः । वनस्य तस्य संचारं राक्षसैः समभिप्लुतम् ।।
data.es: The righteous ascetics dwelling in the forest informed both Rama and Lakshmana that part of the forest infested by demons.
data.anv: वनचराः dwellers in the forest, धर्मचारिणः following the righteousness, ते तापसाः those ascetics, तस्य वनस्य of that forest, सञ्चारम् movement, राक्षसैः with demons, समभिप्लुतम्   inundated, तौ addressing both of them, ऊचुः said.
data.md: Thereat the righteous ascetics ranging the forest said that all the sides of the forest were infested by Rākşasas. “Ferocious beasts feasting on blood, and Rākşasas, O Rāghava, living on human beings, wearing various shapes, abide in this mighty forest."

data.v: एष पन्था महर्षीणां फलान्याहरतां वने । अनेन तु वनं दुर्गं गन्तुं राघव ते क्षमम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, this is the one path in the forest used by the ascetics to gather fruits. You can safely cross the otherwise impassable forest through this path.
data.anv: राघव Rama, एषः वने in the forest, फलानि fruits, आहरताम् of those gathering, महर्षीणाम् ascetics, एष पन्थाः this path, अनेन through this path, दुर्गम् impassable, वनम् the forest, गन्तुम् to go, ते to you, क्षमम् is safe.
data.md: This is the path of the Maharșis, who procure fruits in the forest. By this way you will be able to enter the impracticable wild, O Rāghava.

data.v: इतीव तैः प्राञ्जलिभिस्तपस्विभि;र्द्विजैः कृतस्वस्त्ययनः परंतपः । वनं सभार्यः प्रविवेश राघवः; सलक्ष्मणः सूर्य इवाभ्रमण्डलम् ।।
data.es: The ascetics offered their blessings to Rama the tormentor of enemies. Thereafter, accompanied by his wife and Lakshmana, he entered the great forest like the Sun entering the mass of clouds. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे श्रीमद्वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये चतुर्विंशत्सहस्रिकायां संहितयां श्रीमदयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनविंशत्युत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the hundrednineteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्राञ्जलिभिः (paying obeisance) with folded hands, तपस्विभिः by ascetics, तैः द्विजैः by those brahmins, इतीव thus, कृतस्वस्त्ययनः obtaining their blessings, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, राघवः Rama, सभार्यः with his wife, सलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, सूर्यः Sun, अभ्रमण्डलम् इव like entering the mass of clouds, वनम् forest, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Thus addressed by the ascetic twice-born ones, and having been blessed by them, that repressor of foes, Rāghava, entered the forest in company with his wife and Lakşmaņa, like the sun entering a mass of clouds.

data.v: प्रविश्य तु महारण्यं दण्डकारण्यमात्मवान् । ददर्श रामो दुर्धर्षस्तापसाश्रममण्डलम् ।।
data.es: The invincible and selfpossessed Rama entered the great forest of Dandaka and saw there a multitude of hermitages of the ascetics.
data.anv: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, दुर्धर्षः invincible रामः Rama, महारण्यम् great forest, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, प्रविश्य having entered, तापसाश्रममण्डलम् multitude of hermitages of the ascetics, ददर्श saw.

data.v: कुशचीरपरिक्षिप्तं ब्राह्म्या लक्ष्म्या समावृतम् । यथा प्रदीप्तं दुर्धर्शं गगने सूर्यमण्डलम् ।।
data.es: They (the hermitages) were strewn all over with kusa grass and robes by bark with auspicious sacrificial materials around and hence dazzling like the orb of the sun in the sky difficult to gaze.
data.anv: कुशचीरपरिक्षिप्तम्  ceremonial robes(made) of kusa grass spread all over ब्राह्म्या of the brahmanas, लक्ष्म्या of auspicious appearance, समावृतम् surrounded, गगने in the sky, प्रदीप्तम् glowing, सूर्यमण्डलं यथा like the orb of the Sun, दुर्दर्शम् difficult to gaze.

data.v: शरण्यं सर्वभूतानां सुसमृष्टाजिरं सदा । पूजितं चोपनृत्तं च नित्यमप्सरसां गणैः ।।
data.es: The courtyards (of the hermitages) were cleanswept, sprinkled with water and decorated. They provided shelter to all kinds of creatures and were filled all over with flocks of birds and antelopes.

data.v: विशालैरग्निशरणैः स्रुग्भाण्डैरजिनैः कुशैः । समिद्भिस्तोयकलशैः फलमूलैश्च शोभितम् ।।
data.es: The hermitages looked glorified with dances by celestial damsels. They were adorned with vast fire sanctuaries, ladles for sacrificial ceremonies, deerskins and kusa grass faggots for pots of water, roots and fruits. They looked delightful with huge sacred trees of the forest laden with sweet fruits.
data.anv: अप्सरसाम्  by celestial damsels, गणैः by groups, पूजितं च glorified, प्रनृत्तं च and offered dances as service, विशालैः with vast, अग्निशरणैः with fire sanctuaries स्रुग्भाण्डैः with wooden ladles for offering ghee अजिनैः with deerskins, कुशैः with kusa grass, समिद्भि: with faggots (specially offered to fire in sacrificial ceremonies), तोयकलशैः pots filled with water, फलमूलैश्च with fruits and roots, शोभितम् adorned, आरण्यैः produced in forests, पुण्यैः sacred ones, स्वादुफलैः by sweet fruits, महावृक्षैः with huge trees, उपशोभितम् looking delightful all over.

data.v: आरण्यैश्च महावृक्षैः पुण्यैः स्वादुफलैर्वृतम् । बलिहोमार्चितं पुण्यं ब्रह्मघोषनिनादितम् ।।
पुष्पैर्वन्यैः परिक्षिप्तं पद्मिन्या च सपद्मया । फलमूलाशनैर्दान्तैश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरैः ।।
data.es: The hermitages where various sacrificial offerings were made reverberated with Vedic chantings. Flowers were scattered all over. There was a lotuspond with lotuses. There were aged, selfrestrained sages glowing like the Sun or the fire, living on fruits and roots, clothed in bark and dark deerskin.
data.anv: बलिहोमार्चितम् worshipped with various offerings and sacrifices, पुण्यम् sacred, ब्रह्मघोषनिनादितम् reverberating with chanting of the Vedas,अन्यैः पुष्पैः by other flowers, परिक्षिप्तम् scattered here and there, पद्मिन्या by a lotuspond, सपद्मया filled with lotuses, फलमूलाशनैः by those living on fruits and roots, दान्तै: selfrestrained ones, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरैः wearing bark garments and skins of black antelopes, सूर्यवैश्वानराभैश्च glowing like the Sun or the fire, पुराणैः by the aged, मुनिभिः by the sages, वृतम् surrounded by.

data.v: सूर्यवैश्वानराभैश्च पुराणैर्मुनिभिर्वृतम् । पुण्यैश नियताहारैः शोभितं परमर्षिभिः ।।
तद्ब्रह्मभवनप्रख्यं ब्रह्मघोषनिनादितम् । ब्रह्मविद्भिर्महाभागैर्ब्राह्मणैरुपशोभितम् ।।
तद्दृष्ट्वा राघवः श्रीमांस्तापसाश्रममण्डलम् । अभ्यगच्छन्महातेजा विज्यं कृत्वा महद्धनुः ।।
data.es: The illustrious, effulgent Rama saw groups of hermitages adorned with venerable brahmins, with knowledge of the Supreme Spirit. On seeing them he loosened the string of his great bow and went forward.
data.anv: ब्रह्मविद्भि: by those knowing the Supreme Spirit, महाभागैः by the venerable ones, बाह्मणैः by brahmins, उपशोभितम् was adorned, तत् that, तापसाश्रममण्डलम् groups of hermitages of the sages, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, श्रीमान्  illustrious, महातेजाः a man of great lustre, राघवः Rama, महत् great, धनुः bow, विज्यम् with loosened string, कृत्वा doing, अभ्यगच्छत् went forward.

data.v: दिव्यज्ञानोपपन्नास्ते रामं दृष्ट्वा महर्षयः । अभ्यगच्छंस्तदा प्रीता वैदेहीं च यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: On seeing Rama with illustrious Sita, the great sages, richly endowed with divine knowledge, went forward to greet him.
data.anv: दिव्यज्ञानोपपन्नाः richly endowed with divine knowledge, ते महर्षयः those great sages, रामं Rama, यशस्विनीम् highly reputed, वैदेहीं च Sita too, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, प्रीताः pleased, तदा then, अभ्यगच्छन् went towards.

data.v: ते तं सोममिवोद्यन्तं दृष्ट्वा वै धर्मचारिणः । मङ्गलानि प्रयुञ्जानाः प्रत्यगृह्णन्दृढव्रताः ।।
data.es: The sages, steadfast in their vows, saw Rama who was shining like the rising Moon, Lakshmana and the famed Sita went forward and received them with words of benediction.
data.anv: दृढव्रताः steadfast in vows, ते they, उद्यन्तम् rising, सोममिव like the Moon, धर्मचारिणम् follower of  righteous path, दृष्ट्वा तु on seeing, लक्ष्मणं चैव Lakshmana too, यशस्विनीम् famed, वैदेहीं च Sita also, दृष्ट्वा तु seeing, मङ्गलानि words of benediction, प्रयुञ्जानाः uttering, प्रत्यगृह्णन् went towards and received them.

data.v: रूपसंहननं लक्ष्मीं सौकुमार्यं सुवेषताम् । ददृशुर्विस्मिताकारा रामस्य वनवासिनः ।।
data.es: Those sages living in the forest were wonderstruck to see the handsome, graceful, delicate and welldressed Rama.
data.anv: वनवासिनः (sages) living in the woods, रामस्य Rama's, रूपसंहननम् beauty of the body, लक्ष्मीम् splendour, सौकुमार्यम् tenderness, सुवेषताम् will attired, विस्मिताकाराः wonderstruck sages, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: And those dwellers of the wood, struck with wonder, beheld Rāma's tender grace and loveliness and elegance of dress.

data.v: वैदेहीं लक्ष्मणं रामं नेत्रैरनिमिषैरिव । आश्चर्यभूतान्ददृशुः सर्वे ते वनचारिणः ।।
data.es: All the foresters looked at the wonderful figures of Rama, Sita and Lakshmana with unblinking eyes.
data.anv: सर्वे all, ते वनचारिण: those forestrangers, आश्चर्यभूतान् creating wonder, वैदेहीम् Sita, लक्ष्मणं Lakshmana, चैव too, रामं Rama, अनिमिषैरिव unblinking, नेत्रै: with eyes, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: And struck with astonishment, those inhabitants of the woods of pre-eminent piety saw Vaidehī, Lakşmaņa and Rāma, with winkless eyes.

data.v: अत्रैनं हि महाभागाः सर्वभूतहिते रताः । अतिथिं पर्णशालायां राघवं संन्यवेशयन् ।।
data.es: Ever engaged in the welfare of all beings, the sages made Rama, their guest, sit in their leafy hut.
data.anv: सर्वभूतहिते in the welfare of all beings, रताः engaged, महाभागाः glorious, अत्र here, पर्णशालायाम् in a leafy hut, अतिथिम् guest, एनम् राघवम् this Rama, संन्यवेशयन् made him sit and rest.
data.md: And those persons of exalted virtue, engaged in the welfare of all creatures, made Rāghava, their guest, sit down in their thatched cottage.

data.v: ततो रामस्य सत्कृत्य विधिना पावकोपमाः । आजह्रुस्ते महाभागाः सलिलं धर्मचारिणः ।।
data.es: The great sages comparable to the firegod and followers of righteousness honoured Rama according to tradition by offering water.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, पावकोपमाः comparable to fire, महाभागाः great ones, ते they, धर्मचारिणः followers of righteousness, विधिना as per tradition, सत्कृत्य after rendering due hospitality, रामस्य to Rama, सलिलम् water, आजह्रुः offered.
data.md: Then, having received Rāma respectfully according to scriptural prescription, those virtuous ones of eminent piety, resembling fire, procured water (for Rāma).

data.v: मूलं पुष्पं फलं वन्यमाश्रमं च महात्मनः । निवेदयीत्वा धर्मज्ञास्ततः प्राञ्जलयोऽब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: The sages who were knowers of dharma saluted the noble Rama, offered fruits, roots and flowers available at the hermitage and with folded palms said thus:
data.anv: धर्मज्ञाः knowers of dharma, ते they, तत: then, पुष्पम् flower, फलम् fruit, मूलं root, सर्वम् all, आश्रमं च and the hermitage, महात्मनः to the great self, निवेदयित्वा having offered, प्राञ्जलयः with folded palms, अब्रुवन् said.

data.v: धर्मपालो जनस्यास्य शरण्यश्च महायशाः । पूजनीयश्च मान्यश्च राजा दण्डधरो गुरुः ।।
data.es: O king of great reputation, you are the refuge of the people, a protector of dharma, a chastiser of wrongdoers, a worshipful and respectable preceptor.
data.anv: राजा king, महायशा: of great fame, जनस्यास्य of the people, धर्मपालः protector of dharma, शरण्यश्च  refuge, पूजनीयश्च worthy of worship, मान्यश्च respectable, दण्डधरः chastiser of evildoers, गुरुः a respectable one.

data.v: इन्द्रस्यैव चतुर्भागः प्रजा रक्षति राघव । राजा तस्माद्वनान्भोगान्भुङ्क्ते लोकनमस्कृतः ।।
data.es: O Rama, in this world a king is considered the fourth part of Indra as he protects the people. Therefore, he is respected and he enjoys the choicest pleasures of life.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, इह here, चतुर्भागः fourth part, प्रजाः people, रक्षति protects, तस्मात् therefore, राजा king, नमस्कृतः obeyed, वरान् best, भोगान् pleasures, भुङक्ते enjoys.

data.v: ते वयं भवता रक्ष्या भवद्विषयवासिनः । नगरस्थो वनस्थो वा त्वं नो राजा जनेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Since we are the residents of your territory we deserve to be protected by you. Whether you live in the city or in the forest, you are the lord of the people and our king.
data.anv: भवद्विषयवासि residents of your domain, ते to you, वयम् we, भवता by you, रक्ष्याः deserve to be protected, नगरस्थः residing in a city, वनस्थः वा or staying in the forest, जनेश्वर: Lord of the people, त्वम् you, राजा king.
data.md: And we, being in your dominions, ought to be protected by you. Whether living in the city or in the woods, you, lord of men, are our sovereign.

data.v: न्यस्तदण्डा वयं राजञ्जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः । रक्षितव्यास्त्वया शश्वद्गर्भभूतास्तपोधनाः ।।
data.es: O king, we have conquered our anger and have controlled our senses. We ascetics have cast aside all our authority. We are like your children and need to be protected by you forever
data.anv: राजन् O king, जितक्रोधाः men who have conquered anger, जितेन्द्रियाः selfcontrolled, तपोधनाः  asceties, वयम् we, न्यस्तदण्डाः cast aside the symbol of authority, गर्भभूताः like your children, त्वया by you, शश्वत् forever, रक्षणीयाः to be protected.
data.md: We have renounced chastising others; and, O monarch, we have conquered our anger, and subdued our passions. Therefore, even as a child in its mother's womb (should be protected by her), should we be protected by you."

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा फलैर्मूलैः पुष्पैर्वन्यैश्च राघवम् । अन्यैश्च विविधाहारैः सलक्ष्मणमपूजयन् ।।
data.es: Having said so, the ascetics offered with reverence fruits, roots, flowers and other forest products to Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: एवम् in that manner, उक्त्वा having said, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, फलैः with fruits, मूलैः with roots, पुष्पैः with flowers, अन्यैश्च and by other, वन्यैः by forest produce, विविधाहारैः different kinds of food, अपूजयन् offered with reverence.
data.md: Having said this, they entertained Rāghava, along with Laksmana, with fruits and roots and flowers and diverse other edibles procurable in the woods.

data.v: तथान्ये तापसाः सिद्धा रामं वैश्वानरोपमाः । न्यायवृत्ता यथान्यायं तर्पयामासुरीश्वरम् ।।
data.md: In the same way, other ascetics of accomplished purposes, living lives of integrity, duly pleased that lord, Rāma, resembling Vaisvānara.

data.v: कृतातिथ्योऽथ रामस्तु सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति । आमन्त्र्य स मुनीन्सर्वान्वनमेवान्वगाहत ।।
data.es: After receiving hospitality from the sages, Rama took of all of them at sunrise and entered deep into the forest.
data.anv: अथ then, कृतातिथ्यः on receiving hospitality, सः रामस्तु that Rama also, सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति at the time of sunrise, सर्वान् all, मुनीन् sages, आम्नत्ऱ्य  took leave, वनमेव into the forest, अन्वगाहत entered deep.
data.md: Having received the homage of the ascetics, Rāma about sun-rise, having greeted them all, entered into the forest.

data.v: नानामृगगणाकीर्णं शार्दूलवृकसेवितम् । ध्वस्तवृक्षलतागुल्मं दुर्दर्श सलिलाशयम् ।।
data.es: With Lakshmana following, Rama went through the forest, filled with herds of animals and inhabited by bears and tigers. It was a place where trees, creepers and bushes were crushed (by frequent visits of demons). It was difficult to locate a water source. And it resounded with the chirping of various birds and insects (crickets).
data.anv: लक्ष्मणानुगतः followed by Lakshmana, रामः Rama, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् filled with different kinds of animals, ऋक्षशार्दूलसेवितम् inhabited by bears and tigers, ध्वस्तवृक्षलतागुल्मम् a place where trees, creepers and bushes were crushed (due to frequent visit by demons), दुर्दश difficult to see, सलिलाशयम् waterreservoirs like wells, निष्कूजनानाशकुनि with the twitter of various birds, झिल्लिकागणनादितम् resounding with the chirping of crickets. वनमध्यम् midst of the forest, ददर्श ह witnessed.
data.md: And Rāma, followed by Lakṣmaṇa, saw the heart of the forest abounding in various kinds of beasts, ranged by bears and tigers, with its trees and shrubs torn and trampled, its pools turbid, and its birds crying.

data.v: निष्कूजनानाशकुनि झिल्लिका गणनादितम् । लक्ष्मणानुगतो रामो वनमध्यं ददर्श ह ।।
data.es: With Lakshmana following, Rama went through the forest, filled with herds of animals and inhabited by bears and tigers. It was a place where trees, creepers and bushes were crushed (by frequent visits of demons). It was difficult to locate a water source. And it resounded with the chirping of various birds and insects (crickets).
data.anv: लक्ष्मणानुगतः followed by Lakshmana, रामः Rama, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् filled with different kinds of animals, ऋक्षशार्दूलसेवितम् inhabited by bears and tigers, ध्वस्तवृक्षलतागुल्मम् a place where trees, creepers and bushes were crushed (due to frequent visit by demons), दुर्दश difficult to see, सलिलाशयम् waterreservoirs like wells, निष्कूजनानाशकुनि with the twitter of various birds, झिल्लिकागणनादितम् resounding with the chirping of crickets. वनमध्यम् midst of the forest, ददर्श ह witnessed.

data.v: वनमध्ये तु काकुत्स्थस्तस्मिन्घोरमृगायुते । ददर्श गिरिशृङ्गाभं पुरुषादं महास्वनम् ।।
data.es: While Rama along with Sita was wandering in the forest infested with dreadful animals, he saw a roaring cannibal resembling the peak of a mountain.
data.anv: सीतया सह along with Sita, काकुत्स्थः Rama of the Kakutstha family, घोरमृगायुते infested with dreadful animals, तस्मिन् in that place, गिरिशृङ्गाभम् comparable to the peak of a mountain, महास्वनम्  heavy sound, पुरुषादम् a cannibal, ददर्श saw.

data.v: गभीराक्षं महावक्त्रं विकटं विषमोदरम् । बीभत्सं विषमं दीर्घं विकृतं घोरदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: He was of dreadful appearance with deep eyes, a huge face and a big belly. He looked tall, ugly and frightening.
data.anv: गम्भीराक्षम् deepeyed, महावक्त्रम् with a large face, विकटम् of dreadful appearance, विषमोदरम् with a huge belly, बीभत्सम् loathsome, विषमम् crude, दीर्घम् tall, विकृतम् ugly, घोरदर्शनम् of frightful appearance.

data.v: वसानं चर्मवैयाघ्रं वसार्द्रं रुधिरोक्षितम् । त्रासनं सर्वभूतानां व्यादितास्यमिवान्तकम् ।।
data.es: Wearing a tigerskin, he resembled the god of death. With a wide, open mouth, wet with marrow and drenched with blood, he struck terror into all beings.
data.anv: वैयाघ्रम् tiger's, चर्म skin, वसानम्  wore, वसार्द्रम्  wet with marrow, रुधिरोक्षितम् drenched with  blood, सर्वभूतानाम् of all beings, त्रासनम् causing terror, व्यादितास्यम् with wide open mouth, अन्तकम् इव like the god of death.

data.v: त्रीन्सिंहांश्चतुरो व्याघ्रान्द्वौ वृकौ पृषतान्दश । सविषाणं वसादिग्धं गजस्य च शिरो महत् ।।
data.es: Roaring loudly, he carried an iron spit in which were pierced three lions, four tigers, two wolves, ten deer and the huge head of an elephant with its tusks smeared with the fat of flesh.
data.anv: त्रीन् three, सिंहान् lions, चतुरः four, व्याघ्रान् tigers, द्वौ two, वृकौ wolves, दश ten, पृषतान् deer, सविषाणम् along with the tusk of an elephant, वसादिग्धम् wet with the fat of flesh, महत् great, गजस्य शिरः elephant's head, आयसे on an iron, शूले spoke, अवसज्य having pierced, महास्वनम् shouting loudly, विनदन्तम् while he  produced.

data.v: अवसज्यायसे शूले विनदन्तं महास्वनम् । स रामं लक्ष्मणं चैव सीतां दृष्ट्वा च मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: Looking extremely furious, he ran towards Rama, Lakshmana and Sita like the god of death rushes towards the (dying) people.
data.anv: सः that, रामम् Rama, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, मैथिलीम् princess of Mithila, सीतां च and to Sita, दृष्ट्वा seeing सुसङ्कृद्धः he was with anger, अन्तकः god of death, कालः Yama, प्रजाः इव like the people, अभ्यधावत् ran towards.

data.v: अभ्यधावत्सुसंक्रुद्धः प्रजाः काल इवान्तकः । स कृत्वा भैरवं नादं चालयन्निव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.md: Having seen Rāma and Laksmana as well as Sītā the daughter of Mithilā, he growing angry, rushed (against them), like the Destroyer himself rushing against creatures at the universal dissolution.

data.v: अङ्गेनादाय वैदेहीमपक्रम्य ततोऽब्रवीत् । युवां जटाचीरधरौ सभार्यौ क्षीणजीवितौ ।।
data.md: Uttering a dreadful yell, and, as if making the earth tremble, he took Vaidehi on his waist, and, going a little distance, said, “O you wearing bark and matted locks, O you of feeble strength, that accompanied by your (common) wife, have entered the forest of Dandaka, bearing bows and arrows and scimitars, why, being ascetics, do you wish to associate with a (single) woman?

data.v: प्रविष्टौ दण्डकारण्यं शरचापासिधारिणौ । कथं तापसयोर्वां च वासः प्रमदया सह ।।
अधर्मचारिणौ पापौ कौ युवां मुनिदूषकौ । अहं वनमिदं दुर्गं विराघो नाम राक्षसः ।।
चरामि सायुधो नित्यमृषिमांसानि भक्षयन् । इयं नारी वरारोहा मम भर्या भविष्यति । युवयोः पापयोश्चाहं पास्यामि रुधिरं मृधे ।।
data.es: This woman of fine hips shall be my wife. You sinners I shall drink the blood of both of you in the fight.
data.anv: वरारोहा a beautiful woman (with fine hips), इयं नारी this woman, मम my, भार्या wife, भविष्यति will be, अहम् I, मृधे in the fight, पापयोः of both of you sinners, युवयोः of you both, रुधिरम् blood, पास्यामि I shall drink.

data.v: तस्यैवं ब्रुवतो धृष्टं विराधस्य दुरात्मनः । श्रुत्वा सगर्वितं वाक्यं संभ्रान्ता जनकात्मजा । सीता प्रावेपतोद्वेगात्प्रवाते कदली यथा ।।
data.es: Sita, daughter of Janaka was bewildered out of fear when she heard the cruel and boastful words of that wicked Viradha.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, ब्रुवतः while he spoke, दुरात्मनः of that wicked, तस्य विराधस्य that Viradha's, सगर्वितम् boastful, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, दुष्टम् cruel, वाक्यम् statements, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सम्भ्रान्ता  bewildered out of fear.
data.md: Hearing the wicked and vaunting speech of the impious Virādha, as he said this, Janaka's daughter, Sītā, began to tremble from fear, like a plantain tree shaken by the wind.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा राघवः सीतां विराधाङ्कगतां शुभाम् । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणं वाक्यं मुखेन परिशुष्यता ।।
data.es: Seeing the auspicious Sita in the lap of Viradha shaken out of anxiety, like a plantain tree in a strong wind, Rama with his throat parched said to Lakshmana:
data.anv: सीता Sita, उद्वेगात् due to anxiety, प्रवाते in strong wind, कदली यथा like a plantain tree, प्रवेपिता was shaken, राघवः Rama, विराधाङ्कगताम् in the lap of Viradha, शुभाम् Sita, the auspicious, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, परिशुष्यता with a parched(pale), मुखेन with face, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Seeing the graceful Sītā on the waist of Virādha, Rāghava with a blank countenance said to Laksmana,

data.v: पश्य सौम्य नरेन्द्रस्य जनकस्यात्मसंभवाम् । मम भार्यां शुभाचारां विराधाङ्के प्रवेशिताम् । अत्यन्त सुखसंवृद्धां राजपुत्रीं यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: Gentle Lakshmana, see the illustrious daughter ofJanaka, a lady of good conduct, brought up in utmost comfort caught in the lap of Viradha
data.anv: सौम्य O gentle one, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, जनकस्य Janaka's, आत्मसम्भवाम् daughter, born of his own self, मम भार्याम् my wife, शुभाचाराम् of good conduct, अत्यन्तसुखसंवृद्धाम् brought up in utmost comfort, यशस्विनीम् an illustrious one, विराधाङ्के  in the lap of Viradha, प्रवेशिताम् entered, राजपुत्रीम्  princess, पश्य  see.
data.md: O amiable one, behold the daughter of king Janaka, my wife of pure ways, an illustrious princess brought up in luxury, on Virādha's waist.

data.v: यदभिप्रेतमस्मासु प्रियं वर वृतं च यत् । कैकेय्यास्तु सुसंवृत्तं क्षिप्रमद्यैव लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana whatever Kaikeyi desired through her boons has now come true so soon.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अस्मासु for us, यत् whatever, अभिप्रेतम् desired, यत् that, वरवृतं च  those boons desired, कैकेय्याः by Kaikeyi's, प्रियम् joy, अद्यैव to day itself, क्षिप्रम् now itself, सुसंवृतम् attained well.

data.v: या न तुष्यति राज्येन पुत्रार्थे दीर्घदर्शिनी । ययाहं सर्वभूतानां हितः प्रस्थापितो वनम् । अद्येदानीं सकामा सा या माता मम मध्यमा ।।
data.es: Kaikeyi, my middle mother is farsighted indeed Not content with the kingdom alone see sent me, beloved of all beings, away to the forest. Let her cherished desire be fulfilled.
data.anv: दीर्घदर्शिनी farsighted lady, या such a lady as she is, पुत्रार्थे for her son, राज्येन with kingdom, न तुष्यति not being contended, यया by whomsoever, सर्वभूतानाम् of all beings, प्रियः dear, अहम् I, वनम् forest, प्रस्थापितः is sent, या whoever, मम my, मध्यमा माता middle mother, सा she, अद्य today, सकामा has her desire fulfilled.

data.v: परस्पर्शात्तु वैदेह्या न दुःखतरमस्ति मे । पितुर्विनाशात्सौमित्रे स्वराज्यहरणात्तथा ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana nothing is more sorrowful to me than the touch of Vaidehi by another. It is more painful to me than the death of my father or loss of my kingdom.
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, वैदेह्याः Sita's, परस्पर्शात् the touch of a man other man, पितुः father's, विनाशात् more than demise, तथा in the same way, स्वराज्यहरणात् more than the the loss of my kingdom, मे to me, दुःखतरम् more painful, नास्ति is not.
data.md: O Sumitra's son, nothing can impart to me greater anguish than the touching of Vaidehi by another, which surpasses my father's demise and my having been deprived of the kingdom.”'

data.v: इति ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे बाष्पशोकपरिप्लुते । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणः क्रुद्धो रुद्धो नाग इव श्वसन् ।।
data.es: As Rama was thus full of tears of sorrow, Lakshmana sighed heavily in anger like a hissing serpant in confinement. And said:
data.anv: काकुत्स्थे when Rama of the Kakutstha family, इति this way, ब्रुवति while he spoke, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, बाष्पशोकपरिप्लुते full of tears of sorrow, क्रुद्धः angry, रुद्धः tied up, नागः इव like a serpent, श्वसन् hissing, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: As Kākutstha with his eyes flooded with tears was speaking thus, Lakşmaņa flying into a rage, spoke like to a confined elephant:

data.v: अनाथ इव भूतानां नाथस्त्वं वासवोपमः । मया प्रेष्येण काकुत्स्थ किमर्थं परितप्स्यसे ।।
data.es: O Rama, you are, like Indra, lord of all beings. What makes you feel sad like an orphan when I am at your service like a servant?
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, भूतानाम् of all beings, नाथः lord, वासवोपमः comparable to Indra, त्वम् you, अनाथः an orphan, इव like, प्रेष्येण by a servant (at your service), मया by myself, किमर्थम् for what reason, परितप्यसे feeling sad.
data.md: Why do you, O Kākutstha, being the lord of all creatures and resembling Väsava himself, and also backed by myself, your servant, grieve like one forlorn ?

data.v: शरेण निहतस्याद्य मया क्रुद्धेन रक्षसः । विराधस्य गतासोर्हि मही पास्यति शोणितम् ।।
data.es: The earth will drink the blood of Viradha with his life gone, slain by my angry arrow.
data.anv: क्रुद्धेन by an angry one, मया by me, अद्य now, शरेण by the arrow, निहतस्य killed, गतासोः of one who loses life, रक्षसः of this demon, विराधस्य Viradha's, शोणितम् blood, मही the earth, पास्यति will drink.
data.md: The earth shall drink the gore of this Rākşasa, Virādha, when deprived of life, after he has been slain with a shaft by my angry self.

data.v: राज्यकामे मम क्रोधो भरते यो बभूव ह । तं विराधे विमोक्ष्यामि वज्री वज्रमिवाचले ।।
data.es: Like Indra who hits the mountain with his thunderbolt, I shall release on Viradha the anger I felt against Bharata for his passion for the kingdom.
