One prominent evil is falsehood, and both the others' are of weightier significance, association with others; wives, and vindictiveness without any (basis of) hostility. Falsehood, O Rāghava, has never been yours nor can it ever be yours (in the future).

data.v: मिथ्यावाक्यं न ते भूतं न भविष्यति राघव । कुतोऽभिलषणं स्त्रीणां परेषां धर्मनाशनम् ।।
data.es: O Rama you never spoke untruth in the past nor will you speak in future. How can there be any desire in you to destroy the virtue of others' wives ?
data.anv: राघव Rama, मिथ्यावाक्यम्  lie, ते to  you, न भूतम् never practised, न भविष्यति nor in future, धर्मनाशनम् destroying the character, परेषाम् other's, स्त्रीणाम् women, अभिलषणम् such desire, कुतः how can it come to you.

data.v: तच्च सर्वं महाबाहो शक्यं वोढुं जितेन्द्रियैः । तव वश्येन्द्रियत्वं च जानामि शुभदर्शन ।।
data.es: O longarmed one, to contain all this is only possible for those who have conquered the senses. O handsome one, I know your ability to control the senses.
data.anv: महाबाहो longarmed, तत् that, सर्वम् all, जितेन्द्रियैः having conquered the senses, धर्तुम् to hold, शक्यम् possible, शुभदर्शन pleasing to look at, तव वश्येन्द्रियत्वम् your ability to control the senses, जानामि I know.
data.md: O you of a gracious presence, yours is control over sense. The third evil that leads men through ignorance to bear hostility towards others without any (cause of) hostility, is now present (to you).

data.v: तृतीयं यदिदं रौद्रं परप्राणाभिहिंसनम् । निर्वैरं क्रियते मोहात्तच्च ते समुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: (But) you are a victim to the third (vice born of lust) i.e. showing violence without cause for enmity
data.anv: निर्वैरम् without enmity, यत् as such, इदम् this, रौद्रम् wrath, परप्राणाभिहिंसनम् showing violence on other beings, मोहात् out of delusion, क्रियते is carried out, तत् that, तृतीयम् third, ते you, समुपस्थितम्  befallen.
data.md: O you of a gracious presence, yours is control over sense. The third evil that leads men through ignorance to bear hostility towards others without any (cause of) hostility, is now present (to you).

data.v: प्रतिज्ञातस्त्वया वीर दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम् । ऋषीणां रक्षणार्थाय वधः संयति रक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: O valiant one, you have promised to kill the demons in the battle, in order to protect the sages residing in the Dandaka forest.
data.anv: वीर O valiant one , दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम् those residing in Dandaka forest, ऋषीणाम् of sages, रक्षणार्थाय to protect them, संयति in battle, रक्षसाम् with demons, वधः killing, त्वया by you, प्रतिज्ञात: is promised.
data.md: You have, O hero, for the protection of the saints dwelling in the forest of Dandaka, Promised the slaughter of Rākṣasas in battle.

data.v: एतन्निमित्तं च वनं दण्डका इति विश्रुतम् । प्रस्थितस्त्वं सह भ्रात्रा धृतबाणशरासनः ।।
data.es: It is only on account of this that you entered the wellknown Dandaka forest with your brother wielding bow and arrows.
data.anv: एतन्निमित्तम् for this reason, त्वम् you, धृतबाणशरासनः wielding bow and arrows, भ्रात्रा सह with brother, दण्डकाः Dandaka forest, इति by name, विश्रुतम् wellknown, वनम् forest, प्रस्थितः entered.
data.md: And it is for this reason that equipped with bows and arrows, you have along with your brother set out for the forest known as Dandaka.

data.v: ततस्त्वां प्रस्थितं दृष्ट्वा मम चिन्ताकुलं मनः । त्वद्वृत्तं चिन्तयन्त्या वै भवेन्निःश्रेयसं हितम् ।।
data.es: I am, therefore, worried in my mind when I see you here and think of your wellbeing. I wish your ultimate good. [The next two lines appear, more or less, a repetition. So omitted : Editor]
data.anv: ततः therefore, प्रस्थितम् present, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, मम to me, मनः mind, चिन्ताकुलम् is worried, त्वद्वृत्तम् your stand, चिन्तयन्त्याः while I reflect, हितम् salutary, निश्रेयसम् final benefit, भवेत् वै it is wished.
data.md: Seeing you set out, my mind reflecting on your truthfulness as well as your happiness in this world and welfare in the next, is wrought up with anxiety.

data.v: न हि मे रोचते वीर गमनं दण्डकान्प्रति । कारणं तत्र वक्ष्यामि वदन्त्याः श्रूयतां मम ।।
data.es: O brave Rama, I do not like your going to Dandaka forest. I shall tell you the reason. Do listen.
data.anv: वीर O brave Rama, दण्डकान् प्रति to Dandakaranyam, गमनम् going, मे to me, न रोचते not to my liking, तत्र there, कारणम् reason, वक्ष्यामि I shall tell, मम वदन्त्याः my saying so, श्रूयताम् please listen.
data.md: O hero, I do not relish this journey to Dandaka. Thereof I will tell you the reason. Do you listen to me as I tell you.

data.v: त्वं हि बाणधनुष्पाणिर्भ्रात्रा सह वनं गतः । दृष्ट्वा वनचरान्सर्वान्कच्चित्कुर्याः शरव्ययम् ।।
data.es: Of course, you will go to the forest with your brother, holding the bow and arrows. Release the arrows when you see the forestrangers.
data.anv: बाणधनुष्पाणिः holding bow and arrows, त्वम् you, भ्रात्रा सह with your brother, वनम् to the forest, गतः you are gone, सर्वान् all, वनचरान् forestrangers दृष्ट्वा seeing, शरव्ययम् release of arrows, कच्चित् कुर्यात् you may resort to.
data.md: Bearing bows and arrows in your hands, you have come to the wood along with your brother; and it may well happen) that seeing grim rangers of the forest, you may discharge your shafts.

data.v: क्षत्रियाणामिह धनुर्हुताशस्येन्धनानि च । समीपतः स्थितं तेजोबलमुच्छ्रयते भृशम् ।।
data.es: A bow in the hand of a kshatriya is like fuel to fire. It surely swells his strength and his brilliance.
data.anv: क्षत्रियाणाम् for Kshatriyas, समीपतः nearby, स्थितम् available, धनुः bow, हुताशस्य for a fire, इन्धनानि च is fuel also, भृशम् surely, तेजः lustre, बलम् strength, उच्छ्रयते increases.
data.md: Even as the vicinity of faggots increases the energy of fire, the proximity of (the bow) enhances the strength and energy of the Ksatriya.

data.v: पुरा किल महाबाहो तपस्वी सत्यवाक्शुचिः । कस्मिंश्चिदभवत्पुण्ये वने रतमृगद्विजे ।।
data.es: O mightyarmed one, there dwelt in the past an ascetic, noble and truthful in a sacred forest where animals and birds lived merrily together.
data.anv: महाबाहो mightyarmed, पुरा in the past, पुण्ये in a sacred, रतमृगद्विजे where animals and birds roamed, कस्मिंश्चित्  some, वने in a forest, सत्यवाक् one who speaks the truth, शुचिः pure, तपस्स्वी ascetic, अभवत् किल lived.
data.md: Formerly, O long-armed one, in a sacred wood haunted by beasts and birds, there lived a truthful ascetic of a pure person.

data.v: तस्यैव तपसो विघ्नं कर्तुमिन्द्रः शचीपतिः । खड्गपाणिरथागच्छदाश्रमं भट रूपधृक् ।।
data.es: Once Indra, husband of Sachi, came to his hermitage in the guise of an attendant, sword in hand, in order to hinder his penance.
data.anv: अथ then, शचीपतिः husband of Sachi, इन्द्रः Indra, तस्यैव his only, तपसः penance, विघ्नम् obstruction, कर्तुम् to do, भटरूपधृत् in the guise of an attendant, खङ्गपाणिः sword in hand, आश्रमम् to the hermitage, आगच्छत् came.
data.md: Intending to disturb his austerities, Saci's lord, Indra, bearing a sword in his hand, came to the asylum in the guise of a warrior.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तदाश्रमपदे निहितः खड्ग उत्तमः । स न्यासविधिना दत्तः पुण्ये तपसि तिष्ठतः ।।
data.es: Then while the sage was practising penance at the hermitage, he gave him that excellent sword to be kept in trust.
data.anv: तदा then, तस्मिन् in that, आश्रमपदे at the hermitage, पुण्ये holy, तपसि in penance, तिष्ठतः practising, निशितः a sharp, उत्तमः best, सः खङ्ग: that sword, न्यासविधिना as a trust, दत्तः was deposited.
data.md: And in that asylum, that excellent scimitar was deposited as a trust with that righteous person practising asceticisin.

data.v: स तच्छस्त्रमनुप्राप्य न्यासरक्षणतत्परः । वने तु विचरत्येव रक्षन्प्रत्ययमात्मनः ।।
data.es: Having received the weapon as a trust, the sage went wandering in the forest, always attentive in safeguarding the weapon.
data.anv: सः तु that sage, तत् that, शस्त्रम् weapon, अनुप्राप्य having received, आत्मनः his own, प्रत्ययम् trust, रक्षन् while keeping, न्यासरक्षणतत्परः always attentive in protecting that deposit, वने in the forest, विचरत्येव  went wandering.
data.md: Receiving that weapon, that ascetic intent upon preserving his trust, range the forest, maintaining his faith.

data.v: यत्र गच्छत्युपादातुं मूलानि च फलानि च । न विना याति तं खड्गं न्यासरक्षणतत्परः ।।
data.es: Vigilant about protecting the sword deposited with him, the sage never moved without it even when he went gathering roots and fruits.
data.anv: न्यासरक्षणतत्परः ever alert in protecting the trust, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, यत्र wherever, गच्छति he goes, तं खङ्गं विना without that sword, न याति does not go,
data.md: And intent upon preserving his trust, he goes nowhere for procuring fruits and roots without that sword deposited with him as a trust.

data.v: नित्यं शस्त्रं परिवहन्क्रमेण स तपोधनः । चकार रौद्रीं स्वां बुद्धिं त्यक्त्वा तपसि निश्चयम् ।।
data.es: While the sage moved about holding the weapon, he gave up the practice of penance gradually and developed a violent mindset.
data.anv: नित्यम् always, शस्त्रम् weapon, परिवहन् while carrying, सः तपोधनः that sage, तपसि in penance, निश्चयम् his resolve, त्यक्त्वा after giving up, क्रमेण gradually, स्वाम् his, बुद्धिं intellect, रौद्रीम् fierce, चकार developed.
data.md: Constantly carrying the sword, by degrees, the ascetic, foregoing all thoughts about asceticism, had his mind involved in fierce sentiments.

data.v: ततः स रौद्राभिरतः प्रमत्तोऽधर्मकर्षितः । तस्य शस्त्रस्य संवासाज्जगाम नरकं मुनिः ।।
data.es: By association with the sword, he developed a violent attitude. And in that habitual state of excitement he was dragged into unrighteous ways which (ultimately) took him to hell.
data.anv: ततः then, तस्य of that, शस्त्रस्य संवासात् in association with the weapon, रौद्रे in a violent mood, अभिरतः always involved, सः that, मुनिः sage, प्रमत्तः in excitement अधर्मकर्शितः dragged in unrighteous ways, नरकम् to hell, जगाम went.
data.md: Thus in consequence of bearing that weapon, that ascetic taken up with fierce thoughts, losing his sobriety and led astray from righteousness, went to hell.

data.v: स्नेहाच्च बहुमानाच्च स्मारये त्वां न शिक्षये । न कथंचन सा कार्या हृहीतधनुषा त्वया ।।
data.md: From affection and the high honour in which I hold you, I merely remind you of this matter. I do not teach you. Equipped with bows as you are, you should renounce all thoughts of slaying without hostility the Rākṣasas residing in Dandaka. Without offence none should be slain.

data.v: बुद्धिर्वैरं विना हन्तुं राक्षसान्दण्डकाश्रितान् । अपराधं विना हन्तुं लोकान्वीर न कामये ।।
data.es: While holding a bow, you should not have the intention to kill demons residing in Dandaka with no animosity against you. O valiant one I do not desire that any one should be killed without incurring any offence.
data.anv: गृहीतधनुषा by one holding a bow, त्वया by you, वैरं विना without animosity, दण्डकाश्रितान् those taking shelter in Dandaka, राक्षसान् demons, हन्तुम् to kill, सा बुद्धि: that thinking, कथञ्चन on any account, न कार्या should not be done, अपराधं विना without any offence, लोकान् the people, हन्तुम् to kill, न कामये not desirable.
data.md: From affection and the high honour in which I hold you, I merely remind you of this matter. I do not teach you. Equipped with bows as you are, you should renounce all thoughts of slaying without hostility the Rākṣasas residing in Dandaka. Without offence none should be slain.

data.v: क्षत्रियाणां तु वीराणां वनेषु नियतात्मनाम् । धनुषा कार्यमेतावदार्तानामभिरक्षणम् ।।
data.es: It is the duty of a kshatriya, a warrior to protect with his bow those who practise selfcontrol (penance) in the forest in a state of panic.
data.anv: वनेषु in the forests, निरतात्मनाम् those practising selfcontrol, वीराणाम् for warriors, क्षत्रियाणाम् for kshatriyas, आर्तानाम् of the panicked, अभिरक्षणम् protection, एतावत् this much, धनुषा with a bow, कार्यम्  duty.
data.md: It is the duty of Kșatriya heroes by means of their bows to protect persons of subdued souls, come by any calamity.

data.v: क्व च शस्त्रं क्व च वनं क्व च क्षात्रं तपः क्व च । व्याविद्धमिदमस्माभिर्देशधर्मस्तु पूज्यताम् ।।
data.es: Where is the question of wielding a weapon and living in the forest, where is the life of a kshatriya and the life of penance? For us, this is an encroachment. Let the law of the land be honoured.
data.anv: क्वच शस्त्रं where is a weapon, क्व च वनं and where is a forest, क्व च क्षात्रं where is the duty of a kshatriya, तपः क्वच and where is penance, अस्माभि by us, इदं this, व्याविद्धम् is encroached, देशधर्मस्तु law of the locality पूज्यताम् may be honoured.
data.md: Where are arms? And where is the forest? Where is Kaştriya virtue? And where is asceticism? These are opposed to each other, let us, therefore, honour the morality that pertains to this place.

data.v: तदार्यकलुषा बुद्धिर्जायते शस्त्रसेवनात् । पुनर्गत्वा त्वयोध्यायां क्षत्रधर्मं चरिष्यसि ।।
data.es: Lord, when we handle the weapon, the mind gets vitiated. (Only) after returning to Ayodhya can you perform the duty of a kshatriya.
data.anv: आर्य Lord  तत् thus, शस्त्रसेवनात् serving the weapons बुद्धि: mind, कलुषा impure, जायते will be, पुनः again, गत्वा after going to, अयोध्यायाम् to Ayodhya, क्षत्रधर्मम् duty of a Kshatriya, चरिष्यसि you can practise.
data.md: From following arms, one's sense gets befouled and deformed. Again going to Ayodhyā, You will observe the duties of Kastriyas.

data.v: अक्षया तु भवेत्प्रीतिः श्वश्रू श्वशुरयोर्मम । यदि राज्यं हि संन्यस्य भवेस्त्वं निरतो मुनिः ।।
data.es: You would have been on unlimited source of joy to my fatherinlaw and motherinlaw had you permanently renounced the kingdom for the life of an ascetic.
data.anv: त्वम् you, राज्यम् kingdom, परित्यज्य having given up, निरतः permanent, मुनिः an ascetic, भवेः you, यदि if, मम to me, श्वश्रूश्वशुरयोः to motherinlaw and fatherinlaw, अक्षया unlimited, प्रीतिः joy, भवेत् will be.
data.md: Then my mother-in-law and father-in-law shall experience enduring delight, if having renounced the kingdom, you lead the life of an ascetic.

data.v: धर्मादर्थः प्रभवति धर्मात्प्रभवते सुखम् । धर्मेण लभते सर्वं धर्मसारमिदं जगत् ।।
data.es: Righteousness brings wealth. Wealth brings happiness. Righteousness brings everything. In fact, the essence of the world is righteousness.
data.anv: धर्मात् from righteous duty, अर्थः wealth, प्रभवति will arise, धर्मात् from righteousness, सुखम् happiness, प्रभवते will result, धर्मेण by righteous ways, सर्वम् everything, लभते is attained, इदं जगत् this world, धर्मसारम् the essence is dharma.
data.md: Interest springs from righteousness; and happiness also results therefrom. One attains everything through righteousness, in this world the only substantial thing.

data.v: आत्मानं नियमैस्तैस्तैः कर्षयित्वा प्रयत्नतः । प्राप्यते निपुणैर्धर्मो न सुखाल्लभ्यते सुखम् ।।
data.es: The wise earn dharma through getting their bodies emaciated by carefully adopting different means of discipline (selftorture). Happiness does not beget happiness.
data.anv: निपुणैः by wisemen, आत्मानम् themselves, तैस्तै: by their various means, नियमैः by their discipline, प्रयत्नतः with effort, कर्शयित्वा after crushing, धर्मः righteousness, प्राप्यते is  attained, सुखात् from happiness, सुखम् joy, न लभ्यते will not be attained.
data.md: Repressing self by diverse restrictions, intelligent people attain righteousness; but virtue crowned with felicity, is incapable of being attained by following pleasure.

data.v: नित्यं शुचिमतिः सौम्य चर धर्मं तपोवने । सर्वं हि विदितं तुभ्यं त्रैलोक्यमपि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: O gentle one you may move in this forest of ascetics with a pure mind. The true meaning behind everything in these three worlds is known to you, indeed.
data.anv: सौम्य O gentle one, नित्यम् always, शुचिमतिः with a pure mind (free from thoughts of punishing the innocent), तपोवने in this forest of ascetics, धर्मम् dharma, चर follow, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, सर्वम् अपि all put together, तुभ्यम् to you, तत्त्वतः in true spirit, विदितं हि is known indeed.
data.md: O mild one! ever cherishing your heart in purity, do you practise piety in the wood of asceticism Everything the three worlds are truly known to you.

data.v: स्त्रीचापलादेतदुदाहृतं मे; धर्मं च वक्तुं तव कः समर्थः । विचार्य बुद्ध्या तु सहानुजेन; यद्रोचते तत्कुरु माचिरेण ।।
data.md: I have spoken this through feminine fickleness. Who can speak of righteousness to you? Reflecting on and understanding things, do you along with your younger brother speedily do what you like.

data.v: वाक्यमेतत्तु वैदेह्या व्याहृतं भर्तृभक्तया । श्रुत्वा धर्मे स्थितो रामः प्रत्युवाचाथ मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: Having heard these words spoken by Sita who was devoted to her husband, replied Rama who was firm in righteousness.
data.anv: भर्तृभक्तया out of devotion to her husband, वैदेह्या by Sita, व्याहृतम् spoken, एतत् this, वाक्यम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, धर्मे in righteousness, स्थितः steadfast, रामः Rama, अथ thereafter, मैथिलीम् to Sita, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Hearing Vaidehi's words spoken through high regard (for her husband), Rāma with his energy enhanced, answered Janaka's daughter.

data.v: हितमुक्तं त्वया देवि स्निग्धया सदृशं वचः । कुलं व्यपदिशन्त्या च धर्मज्ञे जनकात्मजे ।।
data.es: O daughter of Janaka, you are conversant with dharma. Whatever you have admonished out of affection for me is befitting your race.
data.anv: देवि O Devi, धर्मज्ञे O one who knows righteousness जनकात्मजे O daughter of Janaka, कुलम् race, व्यपदिशन्त्या by admonishing, स्निग्धया affectionately, त्वया by you, हितम्  good, सदृशम् suitable, वचः words, उक्तम् is stated.
data.md: O noble lady, you have spoken wild words fraught with worth and profit; and, O Janaka's daughter versed in virtue, you have expounded the duties of Kșatriyas.

data.v: किं तु वक्ष्याम्यहं देवि त्वयैवोक्तमिदं वचः । क्षत्रियैर्धार्यते चापो नार्तशब्दो भवेदिति ।।
data.es: But permit me, Devi, you have already stated, when a kshatriya holds a bow there will be no cry of distress. (it means you approve of my holding a bow)
data.anv: देवि O Devi, अहम् I, किन्तु but, वक्ष्यामि I speak, आर्तशब्दः cry of distress न भवेदिति  not  to arise, क्षत्रियैः by kshatriyas, चापः bow, धार्यते is held, इदम् this way, वचः declaration, त्वयैव by yourself, उक्तम् is spoken.
data.md: What, O exalted one, shall I say? You have yourself by your words (furnished an answer to what you had said). Kşatriyas wear bows in order that the word 'distressed' may not exist (on earth).

data.v: ते चार्ता दण्डकारण्ये मुनयः संशितव्रताः । मां सीते स्वयमागम्य शरण्याः शरणं गताः ।।
data.es: O Sita, the sages who perform rigorous penance in Dandaka forest came to me personally, seeking shelter although they can be their own protection.
data.anv: सीते Sita, संशितव्रता: practising rigorous austerities, शरण्या worthy of giving refuge, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, ते मुनयः those sages, आर्ताः in distress, स्वयम् personally, आगम्य after coming to me, माम् myself, शरणं गताः sought refuge.
data.md: O Sītā, those ascetics of severe vows that are beset with perils in Dandaka, having personally come to me, who am their refuge, have sought protection at my hands.

data.v: वसन्तो धर्मनिरता वने मूलफलाशनाः । न लभन्ते सुखं भीता राक्षसैः क्रूरकर्मभिः ।।
data.es: The sages living in the forest, eating roots and fruits and ever engaged in righteous activities are afraid of the depredations of the demons, with their happiness gone.
data.anv: मूलफलाशनाः living on roots and fruits, धर्मनिरताः engaged in righteous activition वने in the forest, वसन्तः residing, क्रूरकर्मभिः by cruel activities, राक्षसैः by demons, भीताः are afraid, सुखम् happiness, न लभन्ते do not get.

data.v: काले काले च निरता नियमैर्विविधैर्वने । भक्ष्यन्ते राक्षसैर्भीमैर्नरमांसोपजीविभिः ।।
data.es: The sages engrossed in various austerities in the forest have been victims to the dreadful demons living on human flesh.
data.anv: काले काले at all times, विविधैः by different, नियमैः traditions, निरताः totally involved, वने in the forest, नरमांसोपजीविभिः living on human flesh (as cannibals), भीमैः by dreadful, राक्षसैः demons, भक्ष्यन्ते are eaten.

data.v: ते भक्ष्यमाणा मुनयो दण्डकारण्यवासिनः । अस्मानभ्यवपद्येति मामूचुर्द्विजसत्तमाः ।।
data.es: The ascetics, the best of brahmins living in Dandaka forest being eaten up like that besought me to come to their rescue.
data.anv: भक्ष्यमाणाः eaten up like that, दण्डकारण्यवासिनः living in the Dandaka forest, द्विजसत्तमाः best of brahmins, ते मुनयः those sages, अस्मान् to us, अभ्यवपद्य you may come to our rescue, इति like this, माम् me, ऊचु: spoke.
data.md: Always dwelling in the forest, subsisting on fruits and roots, they on account of Rākṣasas of cruel deeds do not, O timid attain ease. These ascetics are devoured by terrible Rākṣasas living on human flesh. Being eaten up (by the Rākşasas), the anchorites living in the forest of Dandaka, those best of the twice-born ones, said to us-Be you gracious to us.'

data.v: मया तु वचनं श्रुत्वा तेषामेवं मुखाच्च्युतम् । कृत्वा चरणशुश्रूषां वाक्यमेतदुदाहृतम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words that came from their mouth, I bowed at their feet and said:
data.anv: एवम् in that way, तेषाम् their, मुखात् from their mouth, च्युतम् that came out from, वचनम् statement, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मया by me, चरणशुश्रूषाम् bowing at their feet, कृत्वा having done एतत् this way, वाक्यम् words, उदाहृतम् said so.
data.md: Hearing those words of theirs which fell from their lips, I, resolving to act in accordance with their request, said.

data.v: प्रसीदन्तु भवन्तो मे ह्रीरेषा हि ममातुला । यदीदृशैरहं विप्रैरुपस्थेयैरुपस्थितः । किं करोमीति च मया व्याहृतं द्विजसंनिधौ ।।
data.es: Be pleased That brahmins like you have approached me while I should have come to you has put me to shame immeasurable .
data.anv: भवन्तः you all, मे myself, प्रसीदस्तु be pleased, अहम् I, यत् that, उपस्थेयैः to be approached ईदृशैः by such men, विप्रैः by sages, उपस्थितः is approached, एषा this, मम my, अतुला immeasureable, ह्रीः हि shame in deed.
data.md: 'Be you propitious.' This is surpassing shame to me that such Vipras who themselves are worthy of being sought, seek me. What shall I do? I said this in the presence of those twiceborn ones.

data.v: सर्वैरेव समागम्य वागियं समुदाहृता । राक्षसैर्दण्डकारण्ये बहुभिः कामरूपिभिः । अर्दिताः स्म भृशं राम भवान्नस्त्रातुमर्हति ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, the demons who can assume any form at their will are mercilessly tormenting us in Dandaka forest. Do protect us from them'.
data.anv: राम O Rama, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, बहुभिः by many, कामरूपिभिः assuming forms at will राक्षसैः by demons, दृढम् strongly, (cruelly) अर्दिताः are tormented, स्म we are, भवान् you, तत्र for that reason, नः us, रक्षतु may protect.
data.md: Thereat all those that had come, said, We have been, O Rāma, immensely harassed in the forest of Dandaka by Räkşasas wearing shapes at will. Do you deliver us.

data.v: होमकाले तु संप्राप्ते पर्वकालेषु चानघ । धर्षयन्ति स्म दुर्धर्षा राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः ।।
data.es: 'O sinless one, these cannibals are invincible. They arrive at the time of our sacrificial rituals, on the days of festivities or at the time of lunar conjunctions like no moon or full moon days and attack us.
data.anv: अनघ O sinless one, सुदुर्धर्षाः quite invincible, पिशिताशनाः flesheaters, राक्षसाः demons, होमकालेषु at the time of  sacrifices, पर्वकालेषु at the time of change of lunar conjunction like full moon or no moon days सम्प्राप्ताः are arriving, धर्षयन्ति are attacking.
data.md: O sinless one! These irrepressible Rākṣasas living on human flesh vanquish us at the time of Homa, and on the occasions of Parvas.

data.v: राक्षसैर्धर्षितानां च तापसानां तपस्विनाम् । गतिं मृगयमाणानां भवान्नः परमा गतिः ।।
data.es: 'You are the supreme refuge for us ascetics, tormented by demons, helpless men in search of shelter.
data.anv: राक्षसैः by demons, धर्षितानाम् oppressed, तपस्विनाम् helpless people, तापसानाम् of the sages, गतिम् direction, मृगयमाणानाम् for those who search for, नः for us, भवान् your, परमा supreme, गतिः refuge
data.md: Of the saints and ascetics afflicted by the Rākşasas, who are on the search for their refuge, you are our best refuge. sore

data.v: कामं तपः प्रभावेन शक्ता हन्तुं निशाचरान् । चिरार्जितं तु नेच्छामस्तपः खण्डयितुं वयम् ।।
data.anv: वयम् we, तपःप्रभावेन by the power of penance, निशाचरान् nightrangers (demons), हन्तुम् to kill, कामं शक्ताः have the power, तु however, चिरार्जितम् earned over a long time, तपः penance, खण्डयितुम् to exhaust them, (वयम्) नेच्छामः we are not willing.
data.md: We can by virtue of the energy of our asceticism easily destroy the rangers of the night; but we are loath to lose our asceticism earned in a long time. O Rāghava our austerities are constantly disturbed, and we can hardly perform thein.

data.v: बहुविघ्नं तपोनित्यं दुश्चरं चैव राघव । तेन शापं न मुञ्चामो भक्ष्यमाणाश्च राक्षसैः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama it is difficult to perform penance which is ever full of obstacles. Therefore, we do not pronounce curses even if eaten up by demons'.
data.anv: राघव Rama, तपः penance, नित्यम् always, बहुविघ्नम् is full of obstacles, दुश्चरं चैव but is difficult to pursue, तेन therefore, राक्षसैः by demons, भक्ष्यमाणाः even if  they eat us, शापम् curse, न not, मुञ्चामः we do not pronounce.

data.v: तदर्द्यमानान्रक्षोभिर्दण्डकारण्यवासिभिः । रक्षनस्त्वं सह भ्रात्रा त्वन्नाथा हि वयं वने ।।
data.es: 'The demons, dwelling in the Dandaka forest are tormenting us. You alone are our lord in the forest. Do protect us with your brother.'
data.anv: तत् then, दण्डकारण्यवासिभिः by those who are dwelling in Dandaka forest, रक्षोभिः by demons, अर्ध्यमानान् being tormented by, नः us, सह भ्रात्रा with your brother, त्वम् you,रक्ष protect, वयम् we, वने in the forest, त्वन्नाथाः हि you alone as the Lord.
data.md: Therefore, although afflicted and devoured by the Rākşasas dwelling in the forest of Dandaka, we do not cast our curse on them. You along with your brother are our protector: you are our master in this forest.

data.v: मया चैतद्वचः श्रुत्वा कार्त्स्न्येन परिपालनम् । ऋषीणां दण्डकारण्ये संश्रुतं जनकात्मजे ।।
data.es: O daughter of Janaka, on hearing the words of the sages I promised to undertake the entire protection of sages of the Dandaka forest.
data.anv: जनकात्मजे O daughter of Janaka, Sita, च and, एतत् these, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, दण्डकारण्ये ऋषीणाम् of sages of Dandaka forest, कार्त्स्न्येन in the entire, परिपालनम् protection, संश्रुतम् made a promise.
data.md: Having heard these words, I promised my perfect protection to the saints in the forest of Dandaka, O daughter of Janaka.

data.v: संश्रुत्य च न शक्ष्यामि जीवमानः प्रतिश्रवम् । मुनीनामन्यथा कर्तुं सत्यमिष्टं हि मे सदा ।।
data.es: Having promised the sages, I cannot do otherwise as long as I have life in me. To me truth is always dear.
data.anv: संश्रुत्य having promised, जीवमानः as long as there is life in me, मुनीनाम् of sages, प्रतिश्रवम् promise, अन्यथा otherwise, कर्तुम् to do, न shall not do, शक्ष्यामि I will not be able, सदा always, मे to me, सत्यम् truth, इष्टं हि is dear.
data.md: Having promised, I living cannot violate my vow concerning the ascetics; verily truth is ever dear to me.

data.v: अप्यहं जीवितं जह्यां त्वां वा सीते सलक्ष्मणाम् । न तु प्रतिज्ञां संश्रुत्य ब्राह्मणेभ्यो विशेषतः ।।
data.es: O Sita I may forfeit my life forsake, even Lakshmana and you but will not break the promise made specially to the brahmins৷৷
data.anv: सीते O Sita, अहम् I, जीवितमपि even life, सलक्ष्मणाम् including Lakshmana, त्वां वा or you, जह्याम् I may forsake तु but, प्रतिज्ञाम् the promise, विशेषतः specially, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to the brahmins, संश्रुत्य after promising, न do not (fail to fulfil).
data.md: I had rather renounce my life, or you, O Sītā, along with Lakşmaņa-but by no means my promise made, especially to Brahmanas.

data.v: तदवश्यं मया कार्यमृषीणां परिपालनम् । अनुक्तेनापि वैदेहि प्रतिज्ञाय तु किं पुनः ।।
data.es: Even before the sages requested me I should have protected them. What to speak of the promise I have already made ?
data.anv: वैदेहि O Sita, तत् that, मया by me, अनुक्तेनापि even if they did not request, ऋषीणाम् of the sages, परिपालनम् protection, कार्यम् should have been done, प्रतिज्ञाय even after making the promise किं पुनः what more?
data.md: O Videha's daughter, the protection of the saints is incumbent on me even without any representation, and what (shall I say) when I have promised the same?

data.v: मम स्नेहाच्च सौहार्दादिदमुक्तं त्वया वचः । परितुष्टोऽस्म्यहं सीते न ह्यनिष्टोऽनुशिष्यते । सदृशं चानुरूपं च कुलस्य तव शोभने ।।
data.es: O sinless one all that has been said by you is out of your love and affection for me. I am pleased. What is harmful is never advised.
data.anv: अनघे O sinless, मम my, स्नेहाच्च out of love, सौहार्दात् friendly feeling, त्वया by you, इदम् this, उक्तम् is spoken, सीते O Sita, अहम् I, परितुष्टः pleased, अस्मि I am, अनिष्टः undesirable, न अनुशिष्यते हि is not advised.
data.md: You have spoken this to me through affection and friendship. I have been well pleased with you, O Sītā. One did not instruct another that one did not bear affection to.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनं महात्मा; सीतां प्रियां मैथिल राजपुत्रीम् । रामो धनुष्मान्सहलक्ष्मणेन; जगाम रम्याणि तपोवनानि ।।
data.es: Having said this to Sita, the princess of Mithila, Rama along with Lakshmana, bow in hand, moved about the delightful penancegrove.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the tenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महात्मा great soul, रामः Rama, प्रियाम् to his beloved, मैथिलराजपुत्रीम् to the daughter of king of Mithila, सीताम् to Sita, इत्येवम् in this way, वचनम् statement, उक्त्वा on having said, धनुष्मान् wielding the bow, सह लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, रम्याणि most delightful, तपोवनानि penance groves, जगाम moved about.
data.md: Having said these words to Mithila's princess, the, beloved Sītā, the high-souled Răma, equipped with bows, along with Laksmana, directed his steps towards the inviting woods of asceticism.

data.v: अग्रतः प्रययौ रामः सीता मध्ये सुमध्यमा । पृष्ठतस्तु धनुष्पाणिर्लक्ष्मणोऽनुजगाम ह ।।
data.es: Rama walked in front, Sita with a beautiful waist, in the middle and Lakshmana holding the bow, behind them৷৷
data.anv: रामः Rama, अग्रतः in front, प्रययौ walked, सुमध्यमा a lady with a beautiful waist, सीता Sita, मध्ये in the middle, धनुष्पाणिः one holding the bow, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, पृष्ठतः following behind them, अनुजगाम ह followed.
data.md: Rāma went first; in the middle, Sītā; and bearing a bow in his hand, Laksmana went in their wake.

data.v: तौ पश्यमानौ विविधाञ्शैलप्रस्थान्वनानि च । नदीश्च विविधा रम्या जग्मतुः सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Both Rama and Lakshmana walked on, accompanied by Sita, watching several beautiful mountain ranges, forests and rivers.
data.anv: तौ both (Rama and Lakshmana), विविधान् different, शैलप्रस्थान् chains of hills वनानि च and forests too, विविधाः different, रम्याः delightful, नदीश्च rivers, पश्यमानौ  seeing, सीतया सह along with Sita, जग्मतुः went.

data.v: सारसांश्चक्रवाकांश्च नदीपुलिनचारिणः । सरांसि च सपद्मानि युतानि जलजैः खगैः ।।
data.es: (Watching) the swans and ruddy geese on river banks and lakes full of lotuses, and birds on water and in the sky.
data.anv: नदीपुलिनचारिणः roaming the riverbanks, सारसान् swans, चक्रवाकांश्च ruddy geese, सपद्मानि full of lotuses, जलजैः along with aquatic birds in the sky, खगैः with birds, युक्तानि joined with, सरांसि च lakes also.

data.v: यूथबद्धांश्च पृषतान्मदोन्मत्तान्विषाणिनः । महिषांश्च वराहांश्च गजांश्च द्रुमवैरिणः ।।
data.es: (Watching) herds of deer, intoxicated horned buffaloes, wild boars and elephants who are enemies of trees (elephants uproof trees).
data.anv: यूथबद्धान् in herds, पृषतान् deer, मदोन्मत्तान् intoxicated, विषाणिनः horned animals, महिषांश्च buffaloes, वराहांश्च wild boars, द्रुमवैरिणः enemies of trees, नागांश्च elephants also.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं लम्बमाने दिवाकरे । ददृशुः सहिता रम्यं तटाकं योजनायतम् ।।
data.es: As the Sun was setting, they had covered a long distance, watching a yojanalong tank adorned with lotuses, and crowded with herds of elephants and flocks of cranes, swans and aquatic animals.
data.anv: सहिताः together with, ते they, दूरम् distant, अध्वानाम् path, गत्वा having gone, दिवाकरे Sun, लम्बमाने was setting, पद्मपुष्करसम्बाधम् filled with lotuses, गजयूथैः with herds of elephants, अलङ्कृतम् adorned, जलचारिभिः with aquatic animals, सारसैः by cranes, हंस कादम्बैः with flocks of swans, सङ्कुलम् filled with, योजनायतम् spread over a yojana, रम्यम् delightful, तटाकम् tank, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: Having proceeded a long way, when the sun was aslant, they together saw a delightful tank measuring a Yojana, filled with red and pale Swans lotuses, graced with herds of elephants, and abounding in aquatic cranes, and Kadambas.

data.v: पद्मपुष्करसंबाधं गजयूथैरलंकृतम् । सारसैर्हंसकादम्बैः संकुलं जलचारिभिः ।।
data.es: As the Sun was setting, they had covered a long distance, watching a yojanalong tank adorned with lotuses, and crowded with herds of elephants and flocks of cranes, swans and aquatic animals.
data.anv: सहिताः together with, ते they, दूरम् distant, अध्वानाम् path, गत्वा having gone, दिवाकरे Sun, लम्बमाने was setting, पद्मपुष्करसम्बाधम् filled with lotuses, गजयूथैः with herds of elephants, अलङ्कृतम् adorned, जलचारिभिः with aquatic animals, सारसैः by cranes, हंस कादम्बैः with flocks of swans, सङ्कुलम् filled with, योजनायतम् spread over a yojana, रम्यम् delightful, तटाकम् tank, ददृशुः saw.

data.v: प्रसन्नसलिले रम्यतस्मिन्सरसि शुश्रुवे । गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषो न तु कश्चन दृश्यते ।।
data.es: In that lake of clear waters they heard the sounds of songs and musical instruments, while there were none around.
data.anv: प्रसन्नसलिले in the clear water, रम्ये in a delightful place, तस्मिन् in that, सरसि lake, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषः sounds of songs and musical instruments, शुश्रुवे heard, तु but, कश्चन none, न दृश्यते could be seen.
data.md: And in that tank containing charming and pleasant waters, they heard sounds of song and instrumental music; but no one was seen there.

data.v: ततः कौतूहलाद्रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महारथः । मुनिं धर्मभृतं नाम प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Out of curiosity, mighty Rama, and Lakshmana started enquiring about the matter from sage Dharmabrata by name:
data.anv: ततः thereafter, रामः Rama, महाबलः of great prowess, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, कौतूहलात् out of curiosity, धर्मभृतं नाम Dharmabrata by name, मुनिम् to a sage, प्रष्टुम् to enquire, समुपचक्रमे started.
data.md: There at, from curiosity, Rāma and Lakşmana, mighty car warrior, asked an ascetic named Dharmabhrt.

data.v: इदमत्यद्भुतं श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां नो महामुने । कौतूहलं महज्जातं किमिदं साधु कथ्यताम् ।।
data.es: O great sage, this very wonderful sound, has whetted our great curiosity. If there is no top secret about this, do disclose it.
data.anv: महामुने O great sage, अत्यद्भुतम् very wonderful, इदम् this, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सर्वेषाम् for all, नः us, महत् great, कौतूहलम् curiosity, जातम् created, इदम् this, किम् what is this, साधु well, कथ्यताम् please tell us, प्रभो O lord, विप्र O sage, नातिगुह्यमपि यदि चेत् if there is no great secret about this, वक्तव्यम् let it be revealed.
data.md: Hearing this mighty wonder, we have been worked up with intense curiosity. Do you tell us what this is.

data.v: तेनैवमुक्तो धर्मात्मा राघवेण मुनिस्तदा । प्रभावं सरसः कृत्स्नमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Rama, the righteous sage narrated the entire origin of the lake.
data.anv: तदा then, तेन by that, राघवेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः addressed, धर्मात्मा righteous one, मुनिः sage, सरसः of the lake, कृत्स्नम् entire, प्रभवम् origin, अख्यातुम् to narrate, उपचक्रमे started.
data.md: Thus accosted by Rāghava, the ascetic then at once began to expatiate over the potency of the pool.

data.v: इदं पञ्चाप्सरो नाम तटाकं सार्वकालिकम् । निर्मितं तपसा राम मुनिना माण्डकर्णिना ।।
data.es: O Rama this lake called Panchapsara filled with water at all times has been created through penance by a sage called Mandakarni.
data.anv: राम O Rama, इदम् this, माण्डकर्णिना by Mandakarni, मुनिना by sage, तपसा through penance, निर्मितम् is created, सार्वकालिकम् for all times (to be filled with water), पञ्चाप्सरः नाम by name Panchapsara, तटाकम् lake.
data.md: This tank goes by the name of Pancāpsara, and is always filled with water. It was made, O Rāma, by the ascetic Măndakarni, by virtue of his asceticism.

data.v: स हि तेपे तपस्तीव्रं माण्डकर्णिर्महामुनिः । दशवर्षसहस्राणि वायुभक्षो जलाश्रय ।।
data.es: Great sage Mandakarni standing in water and living on air performed rigorous penance for ten thousand years.
data.anv: महामुनिः the great sage, सः that, माण्डकर्णि: Mandakarni, वायुभक्षः living on air, जलाश्रयः standing in water, दशवर्षसहस्राणि for ten thousand years, तीव्रम् intense, तपः penance, तेपे performed.
data.md: In yonder tank, the mighty ascetic, living on air, performed signal austerities for ten thousand years.

data.v: ततः प्रव्यथिताः सर्वे देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः । अब्रुवन्वचनं सर्वे परस्पर समागताः । अस्मकं कस्यचित्स्थानमेष प्रार्थयते मुनिः ।।
data.es: Thereafter very much perturbed, all the gods led by Agni gathered together at one place and started deliberating among themselves.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, साग्निपुरोगमाः with fire god in the forefront, सर्वे all, देवाः deities, प्रव्यथिताः very much perplexed, सर्वे all, परस्परसमागताः getting together at one place, वचनम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke to one another
data.md: Thereat, exceedingly agitated, all the deities with Agni at their head assembled together, said, This ascetic wishes to have the position of one of us.' Thus all the deities present there were filled with anxiety.

data.v: ततः कर्तुं तपोविघ्नं सर्वैर्देवैर्नियोजिताः । प्रधानाप्सरसः पञ्चविद्युच्चलितवर्चसः ।।
data.es: All the gods then engaged five of the important nymphs, glittering like lightning, to disturb the penance of the sage.
data.anv: सर्वैः by all, देवैः by gods, तत्र there, तपोविघ्नम् to disturb the penance, कर्तुम् to do, विद्युच्चलितवर्चसः glittering like lightning, पञ्च five, प्रधानाप्सरसः important nymphs नियोजिताः  engaged,
data.md: Then with the view of disturbing his austerities, the deities ordered five principal Apsarās, possessed of the splendour of live lighting.

data.v: अप्सरोभिस्ततस्ताभिर्मुनिर्दृष्टपरावरः । नीतो मदनवश्यत्वं सुराणां कार्यसिद्धये ।।
data.es: The sage, a knower of the inner self and the world of plurality, was gripped by passion for the apsaras, who had come to achieve the target of the gods.
data.anv: ततः then, दृष्टपरावरः knower of the inner self and the world of plurality, मुनिः sage, ताभिः all of them, अप्सरोभिः by the apsaras, सुराणाम् of gods, कार्यसिद्धये for the achievement of their target, मदनवश्यत्वम् into the grip of Cupid, नीतः was taken.
data.md: And for compassing the end of the celestials, that ascetic conversant with the morality and otherwise as well of this life as that to come, was brought by those Apsaras (nymphs) under the sway of Madana.

data.v: ताश्चैवाप्सरसः पञ्चमुनेः पत्नीत्वमागताः । तटाके निर्मितं तासामस्मिन्नन्तर्हितं गृहम् ।।
data.es: The five apsaras, got the status of wives to the sage who built them an invisible home inside the lake.
data.anv: ता: those, पञ्च five, अप्सरसः apsaras, मुनेः sage's, पत्नीत्वम् wifehood, आगताः became, तासाम् for them, गृहम् a home, अस्मिन् in that, तटाके lake, अन्तर्हितम् in invisible manner, निर्मितम् built.
data.md: And those five nymphs (ultimately) became the wives of the ascetic; and their hidden residence was reared in the pool.

data.v: तत्रैवाप्सरसः पञ्चनिवसन्त्यो यथासुखम् । रमयन्ति तपोयोगान्मुनिं यौवनमास्थितम् ।।
data.es: The apsaras lived happily with the sage who remained youthful by virtue of his penance.
data.anv: तथैव like that, अप्सरसः the apsaras, यथासुखम् happily निवसन्त्य: while living there, तपोयोगात् by the power of penance, यौवनम् youth, आस्थितम् attaining, मुनिम् sage, रमयन्ति are entertaining.
data.md: And there the five nymphs living happily, pleased the anchorite, established in youth through asceticism and yoga.

data.v: तासां संक्रीडमानानामेष वादित्रनिःस्वनः । श्रूयते भूषणोन्मिश्रो गीतशब्दो मनोहरः ।।
data.es: While the apsaras played their musical instruments, their melodious songs mingled with the sounds of ornaments are heard.
data.anv: सङ्क्रीडमानानाम् while playing तासाम् for them, एषः this, वादित्रनिस्स्वनः the sound of musical instruments, भूषणोन्मिश्रः mingled with that of ornaments, मनोहरः pleasing to the ears, गीतशब्दः sound of songs, श्रूयते is heard.
data.md: As your sport, we hear the sounds of their musical instruments, and the sweet voice of their song mixed with the tinkling of their instruments.

data.v: आश्चर्यमिति तस्यैतद्वचनं भावितात्मनः । राघवः प्रतिजग्राह सह भ्रात्रा महायशाः ।।
data.es: Glorious Rama and his brother heard the wonderful words of the selfrealised sage and exclaimed, 'How strange '
data.anv: महायशाः glorious, राघवः Rama, सह भ्रात्रा with his brother, भावितात्मनः of selfrealised individuals तस्य his, एतत् this, वचनम् word, आश्चर्यमिति as wonderful, प्रतिजग्राह received.
data.md: (Hearing this), the illustrious Rāghava along with his brother declared the story narrated by that one of a pure heart to be wonderful.

data.v: एवं कथयमानस्य ददर्शाश्रममण्डलम् । कुशचीरपरिक्षिप्तं नानावृक्षसमावृतम् ।।
data.es: When the sage Dharmabrata was telling the story, Rama saw a hermitage strewn all over with kusa grass and bark garments, and endowed with pure brahminic grace.
data.anv: एवम् thus, कथयमानस्य narrating, कुशचीरसमाक्षिप्तम् one with kusa grass and bark garments, ब्राह्म्या of brahmin, लक्ष्म्यया with grace, समावृतम् spread all over, आश्रममण्डलम् hermitage, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Thus conversing, Rāma saw the collection of asylums, strewn with Kusa and bark, and be-girt with energy derived from Brahmā lore.

data.v: प्रविश्य सह वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च राघवः । तदा तस्मिन्स काकुत्स्थः श्रीमत्याश्रममण्डले ।।
data.es: Illustrious Rama accompanied by Vaidehi and Lakshmana entered the hermitage and, honoured by all the sages, stayed there.
data.anv: महायशाः renowned, राघवः Rama, वैदेह्या सह accompanied by Vaidehi, लक्ष्मणेन च and also with Lakshmana, प्रविश्य entered, सर्वैः by all, मुनिभिः by sages too, पूज्यमानः were honoured, उवास dwelt.
data.md: Entering (the place) along with Vaidehi and Lakşmaņa, the highly famous Rāghava dwelt there respected by all the ascetics.

data.v: उषित्वा सुसुखं तत्र पूर्ज्यमानो महर्षिभिः । जगाम चाश्रमांस्तेषां पर्यायेण तपस्विनाम् ।।
data.es: Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race, wielder of great weapons, stayed in that beautiful hermitage, accepting the hospitality of the sages extended with due honour, He visited in turn their penancegroves where he repeated his stay.
data.anv: सः काकुत्थ्सः the scion of the Kakutstha race, तदा then, श्रीमति prosperous तस्मिन् in that, आश्रममण्डले in the hermitage complex, सुखम् comfortably, उषित्वा after living, तत्र there, पूज्यमानः being honoured by the sages, महास्त्रवित् wielder of great weapons, सः he, पूर्वम् earlier, येषाम् whose, सकाशे in the presence, उषितवान् he had resided, तेषाम् their, तपस्विनाम् sages', आश्रमान् hermitages, पर्यायेण in turn, जगाम went round.

data.v: येषामुषितवान्पूर्वं सकाशे स महास्त्रवित् । क्वचित्परिदशान्मासानेकं संवत्सरं क्वचित् ।।
क्वचिच्च चतुरो मासान्पञ्चषट्चापरान्क्वचित् । अपरत्राधिकान्मासानध्यर्धमधिकं क्वचित् ।।
data.es: Rama lived happily here for about ten months, there one year, here four or five or six months and there over one or half a month or three or eight months in another.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, क्वचित् at one place, परिदशान् about ten, मासान् months, क्वचित् at another hermitage, एकम् one only, संवत्सरम् year, क्वचित् at one place, चतुरः four, मासान् months, क्वचित् at one hermitage, पञ्च five, षट् च six, अपरान् other months, अपरत्र and in another hermitage, मासादपि more than a month, अधिकम् more, क्वचित् at one place, अर्धम् half a month, अधिकम् more, त्रीन् three, मासान् months, अष्टमासान् for eight months, सुखम् comfortably, न्यवसत् dwelt.

data.v: त्रीन्मासानष्टमासांश्च राघवो न्यवसत्सुखम् । तथा संवसतस्तस्य मुनीनामाश्रमेषु वै । रमतश्चानुकुल्येन ययुः संवत्सरा दश ।।
data.es: Thus enjoying their stay in the hermitages, Rama, Sita and Lakshmana spent ten favourable years.
data.anv: तथा in that way, तस्य for him, आश्रमेषु in the hermitages, वसतः while he was living, रमतश्च and enjoying, दश ten, संवत्सराः years, आनुकूल्येन favourably, ययुः passed.
data.md: And as Rāma lived in the asylums of the ascetics and amused himself through their good graces, ten years were passed away (in this way).

data.v: परिसृत्य च धर्मज्ञो राघवः सह सीतया । सुतीक्ष्णस्याश्रमं श्रीमान्पुनरेवाजगाम ह ।।
data.es: Rama went round who was full of grace and full of knowledge on dharma went round with Sita and came back to Suthikshna's hermitage.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, श्रीमान् graceful, राघवः Rama, सीतया सह with Sita, परिवृत्य after going round, पुनरेव once again, सुतीक्ष्णस्य Sutikshna's, आश्रमम् hermitage, आजगाम ह returned.
data.md: Having gone round the asylums of all the ascetics, Rāghava cognizant of righteousness returned to the hermitage of Sutīkşna.

data.v: स तमाश्रममागम्य मुनिभिः प्रतिपूजितः । तत्रापि न्यवसद्रामः कंचित्कालमरिंदमः ।।
data.es: On his arrival, Rama, the subduer of enemies, was honoured by the sages at the hermitage where he stayed for a short time.
data.anv: अरिन्दमः subduer of enemies, सः रामः that Rama, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य on reaching, मुनिभिः by sages, प्रतिपूजितः being honoured, तत्रापि there again, कञ्चित्कालम् for some time, न्यवसत् he resided.
data.md: Coming to this asylum, respected by the ascetics, that subduer of enemies, Rāma, stayed there for a time.

data.v: अथाश्रमस्थो विनयात्कदाचित्तं महामुनिम् । उपासीनः स काकुत्स्थः सुतीक्ष्णमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Once while sitting beside sage Sutikshna at the hermitage Rama humbly addressed him:
data.anv: तत् that, आश्रमस्थः staying in the hermitage, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, कदाचित् at one time, महामुनिम् to the great sage, सुतीक्ष्णम् Sutikshna, उपासीनः seated near, विनयात् out of humility, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Once upon a time, as Kākutstha dwelling in that asylum was seated, he humbly observed to that great ascetic.

data.v: अस्मिन्नरण्ये भगवन्नगस्त्यो मुनिसत्तमः । वसतीति मया नित्यं कथाः कथयतां श्रुतम् ।।
data.es: I have heard others saying that lord Agastya, the great sage, lives in this forest.
data.anv: भगवान् Lord, मुनिसत्तमः best among the sages, अगस्त्यः Agastha, अस्मिन् in this, अरण्ये  in the forest, वसतीति is living, नित्यम् always, कथाः incidents, कथयताम् about that, श्रुतम् is heard.
data.md: I have always heard from men speaking on the subject that that foremost of ascetics, the reverend Agastya, lives in this forest. On account of the vastness of this forest, I do not know that place.

data.v: न तु जानामि तं देशं वनस्यास्य महत्तया । कुत्राश्रमपदं पुण्यं महर्षेस्तस्य धीमतः ।।
data.es: I am unable to locate the sacred hermitage of that sagacious sage due to the vastness of this forest.
data.anv: तु you, अस्य this, वनस्य forest, महत्तया due to its vastness, तं देशम् that place, न जानामि I do not know, धीमतः of the wise, तस्य महर्षेः of that sage, पुण्यम् sacred, अश्रमपदम् location of hermitage, कुत्र where.

data.v: प्रसादात्तत्र भवतः सानुजः सह सीतया । अगस्त्यमभिगच्छेयमभिवादयितुं मुनिम् ।।
data.es: By your grace, I wish to go there with Sita and my brother Lakshmana to offer our respectful salutations.
data.anv: भवतः your, प्रसादात् by grace, सानुजः with my brother, सह सीतया and along with Sita, मुनिम् sage, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, अभिवादयितुम् to offer our respectful salutations, तत्र there, अभिगच्छेयम् I wish to go.

data.v: मनोरथो महानेष हृदि संपरिवर्तते । यदहं तं मुनिवरं शुश्रूषेयमपि स्वयम् ।।
data.es: There is a great desire in my heart to serve in person the best of sages, Agastya.
data.anv: तम् to that, मुनिवरम् best of sages, स्वयम् myself, अहम् I, शुश्रूषेयमपि I may serve, यदि that, एषः this, महान् great, मनोरथः desire, मे my, हृदि in the heart, परिवर्तते is being entertained.

data.v: इति रामस्य स मुनिः श्रुत्वा धर्मात्मनो वचः । सुतीक्ष्णः प्रत्युवाचेदं प्रीतो दशरथात्मजम् ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Rama, the righteous son of Dasaratha, sage Sutikshna was pleased to reply:
data.anv: सः that, मुनिः sage, सुतीक्ष्णः Sutikshna, धर्मात्मनः of the righteous one, रामस्य of Rama, इति thus, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रीतः pleased, दशरथात्मजम् to the son of Dasaratha, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: This great desire is burning in my heart, that I should myself minister to that best of anchorets. Hearing these words of the righteous-souled Rama, Sutiksna, well pleased, answered Dasaratha's son.

data.v: अहमप्येतदेव त्वां वक्तुकामः सलक्ष्मणम् । अगस्त्यमभिगच्छेति सीतया सह राघव ।।
data.es: I also wished you, O Raghava, to visit Agastya along with Sita and Lakshmana.
data.anv: राघव  O Rama, अहमपि I also, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, त्वाम् you, सीतया सह with Sita, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya, अभिगच्छ you may approach, इति thus, एतदेव that only, वक्तुकामः wished to tell.
data.md: I also am desirous of telling you this along with Lakşmaņa. Repair to Agastya in company with Sītā, O Rāghava. By luck you have yourself said this to me as to your purpose.

data.v: दिष्ट्या त्विदानीमर्थेऽस्मिन्स्वयमेव ब्रवीषि माम् । अहमाख्यामि ते वत्स यत्रागस्त्यो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: Luckily you have asked me on your own. I will tell you where the great sage Agastya lives.
data.anv: दिष्ट्या luckily, इदानीम् presently, अस्मिन् in this, अर्थे connection, स्वयमेव yourself personally, माम् to me, ब्रवीषि you are speaking, वत्स dear son, महामुनिः the great sage, अगस्त्य: Agastya, यत्र where, अहम् I, ते to you, आख्यामि I will tell you.

data.v: योजनान्याश्रमात्तात याहि चत्वारि वै ततः । दक्षिणेन महाञ्श्रीमानगस्त्यभ्रातुराश्रमः ।।
data.es: Dear Rama, walk from here a distance of four yojanas. There in the southerly direction stands the great, beautiful hermitage of Agastya's brother.
data.anv: तात dear child, आश्रमात् from this hermitage, चत्वारि योजनानि four yojanas, (8 x 4  32 miles) याहि you may go, ततः thereafter, दक्षिणेन in southern direction, अगस्त्यभ्रातुः Agastya of the brother of, महान् great, श्रीमान् beautiful, आश्रमः hermitage.

data.v: स्थलप्राये वनोद्देशे पिप्पलीवनशोभिते । बहुपुष्पफले रम्ये नानाशकुनिनादिते ।।
data.es: This plain land in the beautiful forest tract is adorned with fig trees,filled with flowers, fruits, and delightful sounds of different birds.
data.anv: पिप्पलीवनशोभिते adorned with a fig forest, बहुपुष्पफले with many flowers and fruits, रम्ये in a beautiful, नानाशकुनिनादिते filled with delightful sounds of different birds, स्थलप्राये in mostly  plain land, वनोद्देशे in the forest region.

data.v: पद्मिन्यो विविधास्तत्र प्रसन्नसलिलाः शिवाः । हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाश्चक्रवाकोपशोभिताः ।।
data.es: O Rama, there are lotusponds filled with clear, sacred waters, with different kinds of swans, ducks and ruddy geese. Spend one night there and proceed early in the morning.
data.anv: तत्र there, प्रसन्नसलिलाः clear water, शिवाः sacred, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः filled with swans and ducks, चक्रवाकोपशोभिताः beautiful with ruddy geese, विविधाः many, पद्मिन्यः lakes full of lotuses, राम O Rama, तत्र there, एकाम् one, रजनीम् night, व्युष्य after spending, प्रभाते early in the morning, गम्यताम् you can go.

data.v: तत्रैकां रजनीमुष्य प्रभाते राम गम्यताम् । दक्षिणां दिशमास्थाय वनखण्डस्य पार्श्वतः ।।
data.md: Passing a night there, do you, O Rāma, in the morning, taking a southerly course, go by the skirts of the forest tract. Passing a Yojana, you । shall come upon Agastya's asylum, located at a charming woodland graced with many a tree.

data.v: तत्रागस्त्याश्रमपदं गत्वा योजनमन्तरम् । रमणीये वनोद्देशे बहुपादप संवृते । रंस्यते तत्र वैदेही लक्ष्मणश्च त्वया सह ।।
data.es: Vaidehi will feel happy in your company in that delightful forest region full of many trees.So too will Lakshmana.
data.anv: रमणीये enchanting, बहुपादपसङ्कुले full of many trees, तत्र there, वनोद्देशे in the forest tract, वैदेही Sita, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana too, त्वया सह along with you, रंस्यते will enjoy, बहुपादपसङ्कुलः filled with many trees, सः that, वनोद्देशः forest region, रम्यः delightful, हि will be.

data.v: स हि रम्यो वनोद्देशो बहुपादपसंकुलः । यदि बुद्धिः कृता द्रष्टुमगस्त्यं तं महामुनिम् । अद्यैव गमने बुद्धिं रोचयस्व महायशः ।।
data.es: O glorious one, if you have made up your mind to visit that great sage Agastya, think of starting today itself.
data.anv: महायशः O glorious one, महामुनिम् to the great sage, तम् him, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya, द्रष्टुम् to see, बुद्धि: mind, कृता यदि if arises, अद्यैव today itself, गमने in going, बुद्धिम् thought, रोचयस्व  may entertain.
data.md: O magnanimous one, if you intend to see the mighty ascetic, Agastya, in that charming woodland, containing a great many trees, then do you make up your mind to set out this very day.

data.v: इति रामो मुनेः श्रुत्वा सह भ्रात्राभिवाद्य च । प्रतस्थेऽगस्त्यमुद्दिश्य सानुजः सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Rama heard the words of the sage, offered him reverential salutations and set out along with his brother and Sita.
data.anv: रामः Rama, मुनेः sage's, इति this, श्रुत्वा having heard, भ्रात्रा सह  with brother, अभिवाद्य च reverentially saluted, सानुजः with his brother, सीतया सह with Sita, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, उद्दिश्य intending to move in that direction, प्रतस्थे moved out.
data.md: Hearing these words of the anchorite, Rāma, saluting him, along with his brother, set off for Agastya's (place) with his younger brother and Sītā.

data.v: पश्यन्वनानि चित्राणि पर्वपांश्चाभ्रसंनिभान् । सरांसि सरितश्चैव पथि मार्गवशानुगाः ।।
data.es: Enjoying the sight of delightful forests, cloudlike mountains, lakes and rivers on the way, and following the directions given by Sutikshna, Rama was happy. He said to Lakshmana:
data.anv: रम्याणि delightful, वनानि forests, अभ्रसन्निभान् looking like clouds, पर्वतांश्च mountains also, सरांसि lakes, पथि on his way, मार्गवशानुगाः moved in that direction, सरितश्च rivers also, पश्यन् while seeing, सुतीक्ष्णेन by Sutikshna, उपदिष्टेन as indicated, तेन पथा by that path, सुखम् happily, गत्वा after going, परमसंहृष्टः a very happy man, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And, pleasantly proceeding by the way dire ted by Sutiksna, seeing picturesque woods, hills resembling clouds, watery expanses and streams flowing by their path; Rāma filled with delight said these words to Lakşmana,

data.v: सुतीक्ष्णेनोपदिष्टेन गत्वा तेन पथा सुखम् । इदं परमसंहृष्टो वाक्यं लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Enjoying the sight of delightful forests, cloudlike mountains, lakes and rivers on the way, and following the directions given by Sutikshna, Rama was happy. He said to Lakshmana:
data.anv: रम्याणि delightful, वनानि forests, अभ्रसन्निभान् looking like clouds, पर्वतांश्च mountains also, सरांसि lakes, पथि on his way, मार्गवशानुगाः moved in that direction, सरितश्च rivers also, पश्यन् while seeing, सुतीक्ष्णेन by Sutikshna, उपदिष्टेन as indicated, तेन पथा by that path, सुखम् happily, गत्वा after going, परमसंहृष्टः a very happy man, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And, pleasantly proceeding by the way dire ted by Sutiksna, seeing picturesque woods, hills resembling clouds, watery expanses and streams flowing by their path; Rāma filled with delight said these words to Lakşmana,

data.v: एतदेवाश्रमपदं नूनं तस्य महात्मनः । अगस्त्यस्य मुनेर्भ्रातुर्दृश्यते पुण्यकर्मणः ।।
data.es: Surely this is the hermitage of great Agastya's brother, a man of holy deeds.
data.anv: एतदेव this alone is, महात्मनः of the great one, पुण्यकर्मणः of holy deeds, अगस्त्यस्य मुनेः Sage Agastya's, भ्रातुः brother's, तस्य his, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, दृश्यते is seen, नूनम् surely.
data.md: 'Surely we see the asylumn of that high-souled one, the ascetic, Agastya's brother of pious acts.

data.v: यथा हीमे वनस्यास्य ज्ञाताः पथि सहस्रशः । संनताः फलभरेण पुष्पभारेण च द्रुमाः ।।
data.es: This is the glade we were told about with thousands of trees drooping down with abundant fruits and flowers.
data.anv: पथि on the path, फलभारेण with abundance of fruits, पुष्पभारेण च heavy with flowers, संन्नताः drooping down, सहस्रशः in thousands, अस्य वनस्य of this forest, द्रुमाः trees, यथा हि like that, मे I, ज्ञाताः were informed.
data.md: These trees standing by thousands on the way bending beneath the weight of fruits and flowers, bear the signs that had been mentioned to me as belonging to this wood.

data.v: पिप्पलीनां च पक्वानां वनादस्मादुपागतः । गन्धोऽयं पवनोत्क्षिप्तः सहसा कटुकोदयः ।।
data.es: Feel this sudden astringent smell of ripe figs wafted by the breeze from the forest.
data.anv: सहसा suddenly, पवनोक्षिप्तः wafted by the breeze, कटुकोदयः astringent aroma, पक्वानाम् of the  ripe fruits, पिप्पलीनाम् fig trees, अयं गन्धः this smell, अस्मात् from this, वनात् from the forest, उपागतः coming from.
data.md: And coming from the wood this scent is wafted by the wind the pungent odour of ripe Pippalis.

data.v: तत्र तत्र च दृश्यन्ते संक्षिप्ताः काष्ठसंचयाः । लूनाश्च पथि दृश्यन्ते दर्भा वैदूर्यवर्चसः ।।
data.es: Heaps of firewood are seen here and there on the path. There are blades of grass (used for sacrificial ceremonies) shining like vaidurya (gems).
data.anv: तत्र तत्र here and there, सङ्क्षिप्ताः collected, काष्ठसञ्चयाः heaps of firewood, दृश्यन्ते are seen, लूनाः cut, वैडूर्यवर्चसः shining like vaidurya (gems), दर्भाश्च blades of grass (used for sacrifices), पथि दृश्यन्ते are seen on the path.
data.md: And here and there are found heaps of firewood, and torn Darbha are seen, of the lustre of lapses.

data.v: एतच्च वनमध्यस्थं कृष्णाभ्रशिखरोपमम् । पावकस्याश्रमस्थस्य धूमाग्रं संप्रदृश्यते ।।
data.es: In the middle of the forest can be seen like the tip of the dark clouds columns of smoke coming out of the top of hermitages.
data.anv: आश्रमस्थस्य on the hermitages, पावकस्य of the fire, कृष्णाभ्रशिखरोपमम् looking like the tip of the dark cloud, वनमध्यस्थम् appearing in the middle of the forest, एतत् this way, धूमाग्रम् smoke, सम्प्रदृश्यते are seen.
data.md: And the top of the column of smoke belonging to the fire lit in the asylum in this wood, appears like the peak of a dark mountain.

data.v: विविक्तेषु च तीर्थेषु कृतस्नाना द्विजातयः । पुष्पोपहारं कुर्वन्ति कुसुमैः स्वयमार्जितैः ।।
data.es: Priests are coming out of the solitary sacred spots after their bath and making offerings of flowers they had themselves plucked.
data.anv: विविक्तेषु in solitary places, तीर्थेषु in sacred spots, कृतस्नानाः after taking their bath, द्विजातयः brahmins, स्वयम् by themselves, अर्जितैः collected ones, कुसुमैः flowers, पुष्पोपहारम् offering of flowers, कुर्वन्ति doing.
data.md: And twice-born ones, having performed their ablutions in sacred and retired bathing places, are offering flowers gathered by themselves.

data.v: तत्सुतीक्ष्णस्य वचनं यथा सौम्य मया श्रुतम् । अगस्त्यस्याश्रमो भ्रातुर्नूनमेष भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O handsome one, surely this is the hermitage of Agastya's brother about which I heard from Sutikshna.
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome one, तत् then, सुतीक्ष्णस्य Sutikshna's, वचनम् word, मया by me, यथा as, श्रुतम् was heard, एषः this, नूनम् surely, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, भ्रातुः brother's, आश्रमः hermitage, भविष्यति it will be.
data.md: O placid one, from what I had heard from Sutiksna, this would appear to be the asylum of Agastya's brother.

data.v: निगृह्य तरसा मृत्युं लोकानां हितकाम्यया । यस्य भ्रात्रा कृतेयं दिक्शरण्या पुण्यकर्मणा ।।
data.anv: यस्य whose, भ्रात्रा by the brother, पुण्यकर्मणा of holy deeds, लोकानाम् for the people, हितकाम्यया desirous of their welfare, तपसा with penance, मृत्युम् death, निगृह्य after controlling, इयम् this, दिक् direction, शरण्या worthy of refuge, कृता is rendered.
data.md: The righteous Agastya it is who, wishing for the welfare of the worlds, destroying by virtue of his austerities a Daitya resembling Death, has rendered this quarter habitable.

data.v: इहैकदा किल क्रूरो वातापिरपि चेल्वलः । भ्रातरौ सहितावास्तां ब्राह्मणघ्नौ महासुरौ ।।
data.md: Once on a time here dwelt together two mighty Asuras, brothers, given to slaughtering Brāhmanas, the wily Vātāpi and Ilvala.

data.v: धारयन्ब्राह्मणं रूपमिल्वलः संस्कृतं वदन् । आमन्त्रयति विप्रान्स श्राद्धमुद्दिश्य निर्घृणः ।।
data.es: Assuming the form of a brahmin and using Sanskrit language, Ilvala would invite brahmins for offering shraddha to the dead
data.anv: इल्वलः Ilvala, ब्राह्मणम् a brahmin's, रूपम् form, धारायन् taking, संस्कृतम् Sanskrit, वदन् while speaking, निर्घृणः a cruel one, श्राद्धमुद्दिश्य for offering oblations to the dead on the day of anniversary, विप्रान् brahmins, आमन्त्रयति स्म invited.
data.md: Wearing the form of a Brāhmana, and speaking Sanskrit, the cruel one used to invite Vipras to a Śrāddha. And, cooking his brother wearing the shape of a sheep, he used to feed the twice-born ones according to the rites prescribed for Śrāddhas.

data.v: भ्रातरं संस्कृतं भ्राता ततस्तं मेषरूपिणम् । तान्द्विजान्भोजयामास श्राद्धदृष्टेन कर्मणा ।।
data.es: Ilvala would keep his brother sanctified, so that he is fit for offering, Then he would feed the brahmins with mutton according to the rituals.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, मेषरूपिणम् assuming the form of a sheep, तं भ्रातरम् his brother, संस्कृतम्   sanctified कृत्वा making, ततः then, श्राद्धदृष्टेन suitable for offering oblations to the dead, कर्मणा did, तान् द्विजान् those brahmins, भोजयामास offered them food.
data.md: Wearing the form of a Brāhmana, and speaking Sanskrit, the cruel one used to invite Vipras to a Śrāddha. And, cooking his brother wearing the shape of a sheep, he used to feed the twice-born ones according to the rites prescribed for Śrāddhas.

data.v: ततो भुक्तवतां तेषां विप्राणामिल्वलोऽब्रवीत् । वातापे निष्क्रमस्वेति स्वरेण महता वदन् ।।
data.es: Then when the brahmins finished eating, Ilvala would call aloud, 'O Vatapi come out'.
data.anv: ततः then, तेषां विप्राणाम् when those brahmins, भुक्तवताम् finished eating, इल्वलः Ilvala, महता with a loud, स्वरेण voice, वदन् while shouting, वातापे O Vatapi, निष्क्रमस्व come out, इति thus, अब्रवीत् he spoke.
data.md: Then when the Vipras had fed, Ilvala said'uttering a loud sound, O Vātāpi; come out.'

data.v: ततो भ्रातुर्वचः श्रुत्वा वातापिर्मेषवन्नदन् । भित्त्वा भित्वा शरीराणि ब्राह्मणानां विनिष्पतत् ।।
data.es: Then hearing his brother's voice, Vatapi would bleat like a sheep and jump out, tearing open the bodies of those brahmins.
data.anv: ततः then, वातापिः Vatapi, भ्रातुः brother's, वचः voice, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मेषवत् like a sheep, नदन् while bleating, ब्राह्मणानाम् of brahmins, शरीराणि from the bodies, भित्त्वा भित्त्वा tearing out one by one, विनिष्पतत् came out.
data.md: Hearing his brother's words, Vātāpi, bleating like a sheep, came out, riving their bodies.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां सहस्राणि तैरेवं कामरूपिभिः । विनाशितानि संहत्य नित्यशः पिशिताशनैः ।।
data.es: In this manner, thousands of brahmins used to be killed daily by those carnivorous demons who assumed any form at their free will.
data.anv: परन्तप O subduer of enemies, ताभ्याम् by both, संहत्य after killing, पिशिताशनैः by those carnivorous, ब्राह्मणानाम् brahmins, सहस्राणि in thousands, एवम् in that way, नित्यशः daily, विनाशितानि killed, तैः कामरूपिभिः by them assuming any form at will.
data.md: In this way, thousands of Brāhmaṇas gathered together, were destroyed by flesh eating ones wearing shapes at will.

data.v: अगस्त्येन तदा देवैः प्रार्थितेन महर्षिणा । अनुभूय किल श्राद्धे भक्षितः स महासुरः ।।
data.es: Urged by the gods, Agastya came for the shradda . The mighty demon played the same routine trick and Vatapi, for sure, was eaten by the great sage.
data.anv: तदा then, देवैः by the gods, प्रार्थितेन on being requested, महर्षिणा by the ascetic, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, श्राद्धे in the shraddha, अनुभूय  experienced, सः महासुरः that mighty demon, भक्षितः was eaten, किल certainly.
data.md: (And it came to pass that once upon a time) the Maharși Agastya, having been invited to a Sraddha, fed on the mighty Asura.

data.v: ततः संपन्नमित्युक्त्वा दत्त्वा हस्तावसेचनम् । भ्रातरं निष्क्रमस्वेति इल्वलः सोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Saying, the ritual is complete Ilvala offered water in the palm of Agastya and called his brother to come out.
data.anv: ततः then, सः इल्वलः that Ilvala, सम्पन्नम् the ritual is complete, इति like this, उक्त्वा  having said, दत्त्वा giving, निष्क्रमस्व you may come out, इति thus, भ्रातरम् brother, अभ्यभाषत said, ततः after offering, हस्तोदकं water in hand.
data.md: Thereupon uttering Finished' and offering water to wash hands with, Ilvala said to his brother, 'Come out'!

data.v: तं तथा भाषमाणं तु भ्रातरं विप्रघातिनम् । अब्रवीत्प्रहसन्धीमानगस्त्यो मुनिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Wise Agastya, the best among the ascetics, laughing aloud, said to Ilvala, the destroyer of brahmins:
data.anv: धीमान् wise, मुनिसत्तमः best among the ascetics, अगस्त्यः Agastya, भ्रातरम् to brother, तथा स like that, भाषमाणम् while he spoke, विप्रघातिनम् destroyer of brahmins, तम् him, प्रहसन्  laughing aloud, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And, as that brother of Vātãpi, given to slaughtering Vipras was speaking thus, that foremost of ascetics, the intelligent Agastya, said with a laugh,

data.v: कुतो निष्क्रमितुं शक्तिर्मया जीर्णस्य रक्षसः । भ्रातुस्ते मेष रूपस्य गतस्य यमसादनम् ।।
data.es: I have digested the demon Vatapi your brother, who assumed the form of a sheep. He has reached the abode of Yama, Lord of death. Where does he have the power to come out?
data.anv: मया by me, जीर्णस्य digested, रक्षसः of the demon, मेषरूपस्य of the form of a sheep, यमसादनम् to the abode of Yama (lord of death), गतस्य one who has gone, ते भ्रातुः your brother, निष्क्रमितुम् to come out, शक्तिः power, कुतः where from.
data.md: 'Where is the power of coming out, of the Rākṣasa, your brother wearing the shape of a sheep, who has gone to Yama's abode?'

data.v: अथ तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा भ्रातुर्निधनसंश्रितम् । प्रधर्षयितुमारेभे मुनिं क्रोधान्निशाचरः ।।
data.es: On hearing the news of the death of his brother, the demon Ilvala, out of anger, started attacking the sage.
data.anv: अथ and then, भ्रातुः brothers, निधनसंश्रयम् pertaining to death, तस्य his, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, निशाचरः demon, क्रोधात् angrily, प्रधर्षयितुम् to attack, आरेभे started.
data.md: Hearing his words, from wrath the ranger of the night prepared to assail the ascetic, and he rushed against that foremost of the twice-born ones.

data.v: सोऽभ्यद्रवद्द्विजेन्द्रं तं मुनिना दीप्ततेजसा । चक्षुषानलकल्पेन निर्दग्धो निधनं गतः ।।
data.es: Ilvala who pounced upon Agastya, the best among the sages whose lustre lay consumed by the fire of his eyes which were in flames.
data.anv: सः that (Ilvala), मुनिश्रेष्ठम् best among the sages, अभ्यद्रवत् pounced upon, दीप्ततेजसा by him whose lustre was kindled, मुनिना sage, अनलकल्पेन by firelike, चक्षुषा eyes, निर्दग्धः burnt, निधनं गतः died.
data.md: And, being consumed by that ascetic of flaming energy with his eyes resembling fire, the Rākşasa met his end.

data.v: तस्यायमाश्रमो भ्रातुस्तटाकवनशोभितः । विप्रानुकम्पया येन कर्मेदं दुष्करं कृतम् ।।
data.es: This hermitage surrounded by beautiful lakes and forests belongs to his brother (Sudarsana). Out of sympathy for Agastya, he has accomplished this difficult task.
data.anv: तटाकवनशोभितः adorned with lakes and forests, अयम् this, येन by whom, विप्रानुकम्पया congenial to brahmins, इदम् this, दुष्करम् difficult, कर्म action, कृतम् is done, तस्य his, भ्रातुः brothers, आश्रम: hermitage.
data.md: This asylum graced with pools and groves belongs to the brother of him who has performed this arduous feat from compassion for the Vipras'.

data.v: एवं कथयमानस्य तस्य सौमित्रिणा सह । रामस्यास्तं गतः सूर्यः संध्याकालोऽभ्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: While Rama was thus narrating to Lakshmana (the story of Agastya), the Sun set and evening closed in.
data.anv: तस्य रामस्य of Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, कथयमानस्य     as he was narrating, सूर्यः Sun, अस्तं गतः had set, सन्ध्याकालः evening time, अभ्यवर्तत had set in.
data.md: As Rāma was thus conversing with Sumitra's son, the sun set and evening approached.

data.v: उपास्य पश्चिमां संध्यां सह भ्रात्रा यथाविधि । प्रविवेशाश्रमपदं तमृषिं चाभ्यवादयन् ।।
data.es: Rama with his brother Lakshmana duly offered oblations at twilight, entered the hermitage and greeted the sage (Sudarsana) with folded palms.
data.anv: सः that Rama, सह भ्रात्रा with his brother, यथाविधि as per rule, पश्चिमाम् western, सन्ध्याम् at twilight, उपास्य offered  oblations, आश्रमपदम् to the hermitage, विवेश entered, तम् that, ऋषिम् to the sage, अभ्यवादयत् greeted with folded palms.
data.md: Then, duly performing his afternoon adorations along with his brother, Rāma entered the hermitage, and saluted the ascetic.

data.v: सम्यक्प्रतिगृहीतस्तु मुनिना तेन राघवः । न्यवसत्तां निशामेकां प्राश्य मूलफलानि च ।।
data.es: Warmly received by the sage, Rama shared the roots and fruits and slept the night there.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, तेन मुनिना by that sage, सम्यक् properly, प्रतिगृहीतः was received, मूलफलानि roots and fruits, प्राश्य after eating, ताम् that, एकाम् one, निशाम् night, न्यवसत् spent.
data.md: Well received by the ascetic, Rāghava spent there a night, eating fruits and roots.

data.v: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां विमले सूर्यमण्डले । भ्रातरं तमगस्त्यस्य आमन्त्रयत राघवः ।।
data.es: When the night passed and the Sun became bright, Rama took leave of the brother of Agastya.
data.anv: तस्यां रात्य्राम् when that night, व्यतीतायाम् was spent, सूर्यमण्डले when the Sun's orb, विमले was bright, राघवः Rama, अगस्त्यस्य Agasthya's, भ्रातरम् brother, तम् him, आमन्त्रयत bid him farewell.
data.md: When the night had passed away, and solar disc arose, Rāghava greeted Agastya's brother.

data.v: अभिवादये त्वा भगवन्सुखमध्युषितो निशाम् । आमन्त्रये त्वां गच्छामि गुरुं ते द्रष्टुमग्रजम् ।।
data.es: O Lord, the night has been wellspent. Now we humbly seek leave of you to see your respectable elder brother.
data.anv: भगवन् O lord , निशाम् night, सुखम् comfortably, अध्युषितः wellspent, त्वाम् you, अभिवादये I bow down, त्वाम् you, आमन्त्रये I seek your permission to leave, ते that, गुरुम्  respectable one, अग्रजम् elder brother, द्रष्टुम् to see, गच्छामि I will go.
data.md: O reverend Sir, I salute you. I have pleasantly passed the night. I greet you; I shall go to behold my preceptor, your elder brother.

data.v: गम्यतामिति तेनोक्तो जगाम रघुनन्दनः । यथोद्दिष्टेन मार्गेण वनं तच्चावलोकयन् ।।
data.es: With his permission, Rama, the delight of the Raghu race, proceeded along the path indicated, watching (the beauty of) the forest.
data.anv: गम्यताम् you may go, इति like this तेन by him, उक्तः said, रघुनन्दनः Rama, the delight  of the Raghu dynasty, तत् that, वनम् forest, अवलोकयन् watching, यथोद्दिष्टेन in the indicated direction, मार्गेण path, जगाम went.
data.md: Thereat on the ascetic's saying, 'Go you,' the descendant of Raghu went away by the prescribed route.

data.v: नीवारान्पनसांस्तालांस्तिमिशान्वञ्जुलान्धवान् । चिरिबिल्वान्मधूकांश्च बिल्वानपि च तिन्दुकान् ।।
data.es: They passed by wild rice fields, jackfruit trees, palmyra and various other trees like Ashoka, trees with white flowers, old trees that existed for a long time, mahva trees, bilva trees and tindukas.
data.anv: नीवारान् unvcultivated ricefields, पनसान् jackfruit trees, तालान् palmyra trees, तिमिशान् timishas, वञ्जुलान् ashoka, धवान् trees with white flowers, चिरिबिल्वान् trees existing for a long time, मधूकांश्च mahva trees, बिल्वानपि च and bilva trees, तिन्दुकान् tindukas.

data.v: पुष्पितान्पुष्पिताग्राभिर्लताभिरनुवेष्टितान् । ददर्श रामः शतशस्तत्र कान्तारपादपान् ।।
data.es: Rama saw hundreds of trees crushed by the trunks of elephants and by monkeys. He saw some trees echoing with notes of hundreds of intoxicated birds. He saw tree tops coiled with creepers in full bloom.
data.anv: रामः Rama, हस्तिहस्तैः trunks of elephants, विमृदितान् crushed, वानरैः by monkeys, उपशोभितान् splendidlooking, मत्तै intoxicated, शतशः in hundreds, शकुनि सङ्गैश्च by flocks of birds, प्रणादितान् echoed, पुष्पितान् पुष्पिताग्राभिः flowers in bloom on top of trees, लताभिः by creepers, अनुवेष्टितान् surrounded by, शतशः hundreds, कान्तारपादपान् trees of the forest, ददर्श saw.

data.v: हस्तिहस्तैर्विमृदितान्वानरैरुपशोभितान् । मत्तैः शकुनिसंघैश्च शतशः प्रतिनादितान् ।।
data.es: Rama saw hundreds of trees crushed by the trunks of elephants and by monkeys. He saw some trees echoing with notes of hundreds of intoxicated birds. He saw tree tops coiled with creepers in full bloom.
data.anv: रामः Rama, हस्तिहस्तैः trunks of elephants, विमृदितान् crushed, वानरैः by monkeys, उपशोभितान् splendidlooking, मत्तै intoxicated, शतशः in hundreds, शकुनि सङ्गैश्च by flocks of birds, प्रणादितान् echoed, पुष्पितान् पुष्पिताग्राभिः flowers in bloom on top of trees, लताभिः by creepers, अनुवेष्टितान् surrounded by, शतशः hundreds, कान्तारपादपान् trees of the forest, ददर्श saw.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीत्समीपस्थं रामो राजीवलोचनः । पृष्ठतोऽनुगतं वीरं लक्ष्मणं लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् ।।
data.es: Then the lotuseyed Rama said to the chivalrous, graceful Lakshmana who stood behind him:
data.anv: ततः then, राजीवलोचनः lotuseyed, रामः Rama, पृष्ठतः behind, अनुगतम् following, वीरम् chivalrous one, लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् one who enhances grace by his company, समीपस्थम् who stood nearby, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then the lotus-eyed Rāma said to that enhancer of auspiciousness, the heroic Laks maņa, who was by him, and was following him at his back,

data.v: स्निग्धपत्रा यथा वृक्षा यथा क्षान्ता मृगद्विजाः । आश्रमो नातिदूरस्थो महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः ।।
data.es: The leaves of the trees here are glossy, the animals and birds are peaceful. It appears the hermitage of the selfrealized great sage Agastya is not very far from here.
data.anv: वृक्ष्याः trees, यथा here, स्निग्धपत्राः having glossy leaves, मृगद्विजाः animals and birds, यथा as, क्षान्ताः peaceful, भावितात्मनः of the selfrealised one.  महर्षेः of the great sage, आश्रमः hermitage, नातिदूरस्थः not very far.
data.md: The leaves of these trees are glossy, and the beasts and birds are mild, even as (we had been told). This asylum of the pure-hearted Maharsi must not be far.

data.v: अगस्त्य इति विख्यातो लोके स्वेनैव कर्मणा । आश्रमो दृश्यते तस्य परिश्रान्त श्रमापहः ।।
data.es: Here is the hermitage of Agastya, wellknown in the world for his deeds a place of rest for those tired with hard work.
data.anv: स्वेन by his, कर्मणा by deeds, लोके among people, अगस्त्यः as Agastya, इति  thus, विख्यातः wellknown, तस्य his, परिश्रान्तश्रमापहः place of rest for those who are tired with hard work, आश्रमः hermitage, दृश्यते is seen.
data.md: This asylum capable of removing the fatigue of the weary, belonging to him that is known among men as Agastya by his own acts, is seen, with the (neighbouring woods) filled with smoke, and itself decorated with bark and wreaths, containing herds of mild deer, and ringing with the notes of various birds.

data.v: प्राज्यधूमाकुलवनश्चीरमालापरिष्कृतः । प्रशान्तमृगयूथश्च नानाशकुनिनादितः ।।
data.es: This forest is enveloped with the smoke rising from the sacrificial altar. There are rows of bark robes hanging. Herds of quiet animals lying and different kind of birds chirping around.
data.anv: प्राज्यधूमाकुलवनः forest enveloped with smoke rising from the sacrificial altar, चीरमालापरिष्कृत: lined with rows of bark robes, प्रशान्तमृगयूथश्च with herds of quiet animals, नानाशकुनिनादितः resounding with notes of different kinds of birds.
data.md: This asylum capable of removing the fatigue of the weary, belonging to him that is known among men as Agastya by his own acts, is seen, with the (neighbouring woods) filled with smoke, and itself decorated with bark and wreaths, containing herds of mild deer, and ringing with the notes of various birds.

data.v: निगृह्य तरसा मृत्युं लोकानां हितकाम्यया । दक्षिणा दिक्कृता येन शरण्या पुण्यकर्मणा ।।
data.anv: यस्य whose, भ्रात्रा by the brother, पुण्यकर्मणा of holy deeds, लोकानाम् for the people, हितकाम्यया desirous of their welfare, तपसा with penance, मृत्युम् death, निगृह्य after controlling, इयम् this, दिक् direction, शरण्या worthy of refuge, कृता is rendered.
data.md: The righteous Agastya it is who, wishing for the welfare of the worlds, destroying by virtue of his austerities a Daitya resembling Death, has rendered this quarter habitable.

data.v: तस्येदमाश्रमपदं प्रभावाद्यस्य राक्षसैः । दिगियं दक्षिणा त्रासाद्दृश्यते नोपभुज्यते ।।
data.es: This is his hermitage. On account of his (Agastya's) impact the demons look south but cannot eat the hermits out of fear (for the sage).
data.anv: यस्य by whose, प्रभावात् by his power, राक्षसैः by the demons, इयम् this, दक्षिणा दिक् southern side, त्रासात् out of fear, दृश्यते is seen, नोपभुज्यते cannot be enjoyed, तस्य that Agastya's, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, इदम् this is.
data.md: This is the asylum of that pious one, who destroying (the Asura resembling) Death, has, desirous of the welfare of mankind, rendered the Southern quarter habitable, and through whose potency the Rākşasas from fear barely cast their eyes in this direction, but do not approach.

data.v: यदा प्रभृति चाक्रान्ता दिगियं पुण्यकर्मणा । तदा प्रभृति निर्वैराः प्रशान्ता रजनीचराः ।।
data.es: Since the time Agastya of sacred deeds occupied this direction the demons are quiet, leaving all enmity.
data.anv: यदा प्रभृति since, पुण्यकर्मणा by a man of sacred deeds, इयं दिक् this direction, आक्रान्ता occupied, तदाप्रभृति from then on, रजनीचराः those who move about at night, the demons, निर्वैराः leaving enmity, प्रशान्ताः are quiet.
data.md: Ever since that one of pious ways possessed himself of this quarter, the rangers of the night have foregone their hostility, and assumed a peaceful attitude.

data.v: नाम्ना चेयं भगवतो दक्षिणा दिक्प्रदक्षिणा । प्रथिता त्रिषु लोकेषु दुर्धर्षा क्रूरकर्मभिः ।।
data.es: The southern side favourable to the people was famous by the name Agastya in the three worlds and stood unassailable to the demons.
data.anv: प्रदक्षिणा very considerate place, इयम् दक्षिणा दिक् on the southern side, भगवतः of the Lord (Agastya's), नाम्ना by name, त्रिषु in three, लोकेषु worlds, प्रथिता famous, क्रूरकर्मभिः by men of wicked deeds, दुर्धर्षा unassailable.
data.md: This Southern quarter rendered safe (by Agastya), and incapable of being harassed by those ones of tortuous ways, is created over the three worlds in connection with the name of the reverend ascetic.

data.v: मार्गं निरोद्धुं सततं भास्करस्याचलोत्तमः । संदेशं पालयंस्तस्य विन्ध्यशौलो न वर्धते ।।
data.es: This is the hermitage of the longlived Agastya who is renowned for his deeds and is served by humble people. The great mountain Vindhya that was growing incessantly and obstructing the path of the Sun stopped growing any more in obedience to Agastya's words.
data.anv: श्रीमान् beautiful, विनीतजनसेवितः served by humble people, अयम् this, भास्करस्य Sun's, मार्गम् path, निरोद्धम् to obstruct, निरतः was ever bent upon, अचलोत्तमः that great mountain, विन्ध्य Vindhya, यस्य whose, निदेशम् order, पालयन् obeying, न वर्धते does not grow, तस्य for him, लोके in this world, विश्रुतकर्मणः of a man of renowned deeds, दीर्घायुषः of long life, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, आश्रमः hermitage.
data.md: This graceful asylum ranged by mild beasts belongs to that long-lived one of renowned achievements, Agastya, in obedience to whose command, the Vindhya mountain-foremost of its kind, which had always obstructed the way of the Sun, does not increase.

data.v: अयं दीर्घायुषस्तस्य लोके विश्रुतकर्मणः । अगस्त्यस्याश्रमः श्रीमान्विनीतमृगसेवितः ।।
data.es: This is the hermitage of the longlived Agastya who is renowned for his deeds and is served by humble people. The great mountain Vindhya that was growing incessantly and obstructing the path of the Sun stopped growing any more in obedience to Agastya's words.
data.anv: श्रीमान् beautiful, विनीतजनसेवितः served by humble people, अयम् this, भास्करस्य Sun's, मार्गम् path, निरोद्धम् to obstruct, निरतः was ever bent upon, अचलोत्तमः that great mountain, विन्ध्य Vindhya, यस्य whose, निदेशम् order, पालयन् obeying, न वर्धते does not grow, तस्य for him, लोके in this world, विश्रुतकर्मणः of a man of renowned deeds, दीर्घायुषः of long life, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, आश्रमः hermitage.
