data.md: This graceful asylum ranged by mild beasts belongs to that long-lived one of renowned achievements, Agastya, in obedience to whose command, the Vindhya mountain-foremost of its kind, which had always obstructed the way of the Sun, does not increase.

data.v: एष लोकार्चितः साधुर्हिते नित्यं रतः सताम् । अस्मानधिगतानेष श्रेयसा योजयिष्यति ।।
data.es: We are going to join this sage honoured by the people of the world and ever engaged in the welfare of the virtuous. This augurs well for us.
data.anv: लोकार्चितः worshipped by the people, साधुः a pious man, एषः he, सताम् हिते in the wellbeing of the virtuous, नित्यरतः ever engaged, एषः such, अभिगतान् those who have come, अस्मान् to us, श्रेयसा with welfare, योजयिष्यति will unite.
data.md: This pious one honoured of men, ever engaged in the welfare of the righteous, shall do good to us, who have come to him.

data.v: आराधयिष्याम्यत्राहमगस्त्यं तं महामुनिम् । शेषं च वनवासस्य सौम्य वत्स्याम्यहं प्रभो ।।
data.es: O noble, handsome Lakshmana, I will spend the rest of the exile in this forest in the worship of the great sage Agastya.
data.anv: प्रभो O noble one, अहम् I, अत्र here, तम् him, महामुनिम् to the great ascetic, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya, आराधयिष्यामि I will worship, वनवासस्य while living in the forest, शेषम् rest of the period, सौम्य  O handsome, अहम् वत्स्यामि I will spend.
data.md: I shall adore the mighty ascetic, Agastya, and, O mild one, O master, here pass away the remainder of the term of my banishment.

data.v: अत्र देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । अगस्त्यं नियताहारं सततं पर्युपासते ।।
data.es: The gods along with gandharvas, siddhas and great sages always serve Agastya, observing discipine in their food habits.
data.anv: सगन्धर्वाः with gandharvas, देवाः the gods, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, अत्र here, नियताहारम् controlled diet, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya's, सततम् always, पर्युपासते keep serving.
data.md: Here celestials with the Gandharvas, and Siddhas and eminent saints, observing restrictions in respect of food, aye adore Agastya.

data.v: नात्र जीवेन्मृषावादी क्रूरो वा यदि वा शठः । नृशंसः कामवृत्तो वा मुनिरेष तथाविधः ।।
data.es: This sage is such type that he (his spiritual power) will not allow a liar or a cruel man or a deceitful or lustful or wicked person to thrive here.
data.anv: मृषावादी a liar, क्रूरो वा or a cruel one, यदि वा or perhaps, शठः a deceitful person, नृशंसः a wicked person, कामवृत्तो वा or a lustful person, अत्र here, न जीवेत् will not live, एषः मुनिः this  sage, तथाविधः of such type.
data.md: And the ascetic is such that a liar cannot live here, nor a cunning or a crafty person, nor a wicked wight, nor one that is given to unrighteousness.

data.v: अत्र देवाश्च यक्षाश्च नागाश्च पतगैः सह । वसन्ति नियताहारा धर्ममाराधयिष्णवः ।।
data.es: Here gods, yakshas, nagas and birds live, following the righteous path and observing discipline in food habits.
data.anv: देवाश्च gods also, यक्षाश्च yakshas too, पतगैस्सह along with birds, नागाश्च nagas too, नियताहाराः of controlled diet, धर्मम् righteous path, आराधयिष्णवः those who practise, अत्र here, वसन्ति live.
data.md: And adoring righteousness, celestials, and Yaksas, and Nagas, and birds, live here restricting their fare.

data.v: अत्र सिद्धा महात्मानो विमानैः सूर्यसंनिभैः । त्यक्त्वा देहान्नवैर्देहैः स्वर्याताः परमर्षयः ।।
data.es: Here great souls like sages and siddhas gave up the ghost and with renewed bodies left for heaven on aerochariot resembling the Sun (in brightness).
data.anv: अत्र here, महात्मानः great souls, परमर्षयः great sages, अत्र here, सिद्धाः siddhas, त्यक्तदेहाः giving up their bodies, नवैः with new, देहैः bodies, सूर्यसन्निभैः shining like the Sungod, विमानैः aerochariot, स्वर्याताः went to heaven.
data.md: And high-souled Siddhas and eminent saints, renouncing their bodies, repair to the celestial regions in cars resembling the sun.

data.v: यक्षत्वममरत्वं च राज्यानि विविधानि च । अत्र देवाः प्रयच्छन्ति भूतैराराधिताः शुभैः ।।
data.es: Worshipped by benevolent beings, the gods here bestow on them the status of demigods or of the immortals or several kinds of kingdoms.
data.anv: शुभैः by benevolent ones, भूतैः by beings, अत्र here, आराधिताः those who are worshipped, देवाः gods, यक्षत्वम् status of demigods, अमरत्वं च status of gods, विविधानि several kinds of, राज्यानि च kingdoms also, प्रयच्छन्ति will endow.
data.md: And adored by auspicious individuals, the deities here confer on them the states of Yakşas and celestials, and divers kingdoms.

data.v: आगताः स्माश्रमपदं सौमित्रे प्रविशाग्रतः । निवेदयेह मां प्राप्तमृषये सह सीतया ।।
data.md: Sumitra's son, entering the asylum before us, do you announce to the saints that I along with Sītā, have arrived here.

data.v: स प्रविश्याश्रमपदं लक्ष्मणो राघवानुजः । अगस्त्यशिष्यमासाद्य वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, the younger brother of Rama, entered the hermitage of Agastya and met one of his disciples and said to him these words :
data.anv: राघवानुजः brother of Rama, सः लक्ष्मणः  Lakshmana, आश्रमपदम् at the hermitage, प्रविश्य  entered, अगस्त्यशिष्यम् disciple of Agastya, आसाद्य  met, एतत् all this, वाक्यम् words, उवाच ह said.
data.md: Having entered the asylum, Räghava's younger brother, Lakşmana, coming to a disciple of Agastya, spoke to him.

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम ज्येष्ठस्तस्य सुतो बली । रामः प्राप्तो मुनिं द्रष्टुं भार्यया सह सीतया ।।
data.es: The valiant eldest son of king Dasaratha has come along with his wife Sita to see the sage.
data.anv: दशरथो नाम called Dasaratha, राजा king, तस्य his, ज्येष्ठः सुतः eldest son, बली strong, रामः Rama, भार्यया with wife, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, मुनिम् to the sage, द्रष्टुम् to see, पाप्तः has come.
data.md: There was a king, named Dasaratha. His eldest son, the strong Rāma, has come (to this asylum) along with his wife, Sītā, for seeing the ascetic. Named Lakşmaņa, I am his younger brother, obedient and devoted to him. you may have heard of it.

data.v: लक्ष्मणो नाम तस्याहं भ्राता त्ववरजो हितः । अनुकूलश्च भक्तश्च यदि ते श्रोत्रमागतः ।।
data.es: I am his younger brother Lakshmana, his wellwisher and faithful devotee if you have at all heard about me.
data.anv: अहं तु I am, तस्य his, अवरजः younger to him, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, भ्राता brother, हितः wellwisher, अनुकूलश्च faithful, भक्तश्च devotee, ते श्रोत्रम् आगतः has been heard by you, यदि if at all.
data.md: There was a king, named Dasaratha. His eldest son, the strong Rāma, has come (to this asylum) along with his wife, Sītā, for seeing the ascetic. Named Lakşmaņa, I am his younger brother, obedient and devoted to him. you may have heard of it.

data.v: ते वयं वनमत्युग्रं प्रविष्टाः पितृशासनात् । द्रष्टुमिच्छामहे सर्वे भगवन्तं निवेद्यताम् ।।
data.es: By the command of our father, we have entered this dense forest and desire to see the divine sire. Please report.
data.anv: ते वयम् we, पितृशासनात् by the command of our father, अत्युग्रम् very dense, वनम् forest, प्रविष्टाः have entered, सर्वे all of us, भगवन्तम् divine sire, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामहे desire, निवेद्यताम् it may be reported to him.
data.md: Having entered this horrid forest, in consonance with the mandate of our sire, we desire to see the reverend one. Tell this to him.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणस्य तपोधनः । तथेत्युक्त्वाग्निशरणं प्रविवेश निवेदितुम् ।।
data.es: The ascetic heard Lakshmana, and saying, 'let it be so', entered the firesanctuary to report.
data.anv: तपोधनः the ascetic (endowed with wealth of penance), तस्य लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, तत् वचनम् his words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तथेति let it be so, उक्त्वा said, निवेदितुम् to report, अग्निशरणम् firesanctuary प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: Hearing Laksmana's words, that ascetic, saying, “So be it," entered the chamber of the sacrificial fire, for the purpose of communicating (the news to Agastya).

data.v: स प्रविश्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं तपसा दुष्प्रधर्षणम् । कृताञ्जलिरुवाचेदं रामागमनमञ्जसा ।।
data.es: Having promptly entered, Agastya's favourite disciple with folded hands reported as he was told by Lakshmana about Rama's arrival to the great sage who was armed with the inviolable powers of penance :
data.anv: अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, सम्मतः favourite, शिष्यः disciple, सः that, अञ्जसा promptly, प्रविश्य  entered, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, यथोक्तमेव as told by him, तपसा with penance, दुष्प्रधर्षणम्  who can not be violated , मुनिश्रेष्ठम् the best among the ascetics, रामागमनम् about Rama 's arrival, इदम् thus, उवाच said.
data.md: Entering in, Agastya's beloved disciple, with joined hands communicated to that foremost of ascetics, incapable of being repressed*, exactly what Laksmana had told him, *Some texts:-Effulgent.

data.v: पुत्रौ दशरथस्येमौ रामो लक्ष्मण एव च । प्रविष्टावाश्रमपदं सीतया सह भार्यया ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana, the two sons of Dasaratha along with Sita, wife of Rama, have arrived at the hermitage.
data.anv: रामः Rama, लक्ष्मण एव च Lakshmana also, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, इमौ both, पुत्रौ sons, भार्यया with wife, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, आश्रमपदम् to the hermitage, प्रविष्टौ entered.
data.md: For seeing the reverend one, and serving him as well, those subduers of their foes, Dasaratha's sons, Rama and Laksmana, accompanied by Sītā, have entered this asylum. It now behoves you to command what is to be done next.

data.v: द्रष्टुं भवन्तमायातौ शुश्रूषार्थमरिंदमौ । यदत्रानन्तरं तत्त्वमाज्ञापयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Both the subduers of enemies have come here now to see and serve your Holiness. You may order what is to be done next.
data.anv: अरिन्दमौ subduers of enemies (Rama and Lakshmana), भवन्तम् to your Holiness, द्रष्टुम् to see, शुश्रूषार्थम् to serve, अयातौ both have come, अत्र here, यत् whatever, अनन्तरम् nexl, तत् that, त्वम् you, आज्ञापयितुम् to order, अर्हसि you may be pleased to.
data.md: For seeing the reverend one, and serving him as well, those subduers of their foes, Dasaratha's sons, Rama and Laksmana, accompanied by Sītā, have entered this asylum. It now behoves you to command what is to be done next.

data.v: ततः शिष्यादुपश्रुत्य प्राप्तं रामं सलक्ष्मणम् । वैदेहीं च महाभागामिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard from the disciple about the arrival of Rama, Lakshmana and great daughter of the king of Videha the sage said :
data.anv: ततः then, शिष्यात् from the disciple, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, प्राप्तम् arrived, उपश्रुत्य having heard, महाभागाम् great, वैदेहीं Sita, daughter of the king of Videha, च and, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing from his disciple that Rāma had come along with Lakşmaņa and the highly virtuous Vaidehi, Agastya said,

data.v: दिष्ट्या रामश्चिरस्याद्य द्रष्टुं मां समुपागतः । मनसा काङ्क्षितं ह्यस्य मयाप्यागमनं प्रति ।।
data.es: It is good fortune that Rama has come here after a long time to see me. I was longing for his arrival.
data.anv: दिष्ट्या fortunately, रामः Rama, चिरस्य after a long time, माम् me, द्रष्टुम् to see, अद्य today, समुपागतः arrived here luckily, अस्य his, आगमनं प्रति coming here, मया by me, मनसा at heart, काङ्क्षितं हि was desired indeed.
data.md: By luck it is that after a long time, Rāma has come to see me. I had mentally wished for his arrival. Go you; and let Rāma, having been respectfully received, come before me. Why have you not brought himself?

data.v: गम्यतां सत्कृतो रामः सभार्यः सहलक्ष्मणः । प्रवेश्यतां समीपं मे किं चासौ न प्रवेशितः ।।
data.es: Go quickly and with due hospitality conduct Rama, his wife Sita and brother Lakshmana into my presence. Why was he not ushered in so long?
data.anv: गम्यताम् go (quickly), सभार्यः along with his wife, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, सत्कृतः rendering due hospitality, मे my, समीपम् presence, प्रवेश्यताम् may be ushered in, असौ he, किम् why, न प्रवेशितः  not brought in so far ?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु मुनिना धर्मज्ञेन महात्मना । अभिवाद्याब्रवीच्छिष्यस्तथेति नियताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'So be it ' said the disciple respectfully with folded palms in response to what the great sage, knower of dharma, commanded.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञेन by the knower of rightousness, महात्मना  by the great soul, मुनिना by the sage, एवम् thus, उक्तः  asked, शिष्यः disciple, नियताञ्जलिः with folded palms, अभिवाद्य  respectfully, तथेति ,so be it, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus addressed by the high-souled and righteous ascetic, the disciple saluting him, with joined hands, said, So be it.

data.v: ततो निष्क्रम्य संभ्रान्तः शिष्यो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् । क्वासौ रामो मुनिं द्रष्टुमेतु प्रविशतु स्वयम् ।।
data.es: Then the disciple in a state of excitement came out of the hermitage and said to Lakshmana, 'Where is Rama? Let him come himself to see the sage'.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, शिष्यः the disciple, सम्भ्रान्तः exited, निष्क्रम्य after coming out, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said, असौ he, रामः Rama, क्व where is he?, मुनिम् sage, द्रष्टुम् to see, एतु he may come, स्वयम् himself, प्रविशतु let him come in.
data.md: Then issuing out, the disciple said to Laks mana, Where is Rama? Let him come and enter in.

data.v: ततो गत्वाश्रमपदं शिष्येण सह लक्ष्मणः । दर्शयामास काकुत्स्थं सीतां च जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: Then Lakshmana reached the entrance of the hermitage with the disciple and showed Rama of the Kakutstha race and Sita, daughter of Janaka .
data.anv: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शिष्येण सह along with the disciple, आश्रमद्वारम् entrance of the hermitage, गत्वा after reaching, काकुत्स्थम् Rama of the Kakutstha family, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, सीतां च Sita also, दर्शयामास showed.
data.md: Threat, going to the asylum in company with the disciple (of Agastya), Laksmana showed to him Kākutstha and the daughter of Janaka, Sītā.

data.v: तं शिष्यः प्रश्रितं वाक्यमगस्त्यवचनं ब्रुवन् । प्रावेशयद्यथान्यायं सत्कारार्थं सुसत्कृतम् ।।
data.es: The disciple humbly reported Agastya's words and ushered him in with befitting hospitality.
data.anv: शिष्यः disciple, प्रश्रितः most obediently, अगस्त्यवचनम् Agastya's words, वाक्यम् utterance, ब्रुवन् while informing, सत्कारार्हम् one who deserved hospitality, सुसत्कृम् treating with respect, तम् him, यथान्याम् in an appropriate way, प्रावेशयत् ushered in.
data.md: Then joyfully communicating to Rāma the words of the reverend one, the disciple (of Agastya) duly took in that one worthy of being honoured.

data.v: प्रविवेश ततो रामः सीतया सहलक्ष्मणः । प्रशान्तहरिणाकीर्णमाश्रमं ह्यवलोकयन् ।।
data.es: Then Rama, Sita and Lakshmana entered the hermitage, watching herds of quietly moving deer (undisturbed by their entry).
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, सीतया with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणः and with Lakshmana, प्रशान्तहरिणाकीर्णम् full of quietly moving deer, आश्रमम् hermitage, अवलोकयन् observing, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: And seeing the asylum teeming with mild deer, Rama entered in with Laksmana and Sita. And there Rāma beheld the place of Brahmä, and that of Agni,

data.v: स तत्र ब्रह्मणः स्थानमग्नेः स्थानं तथैव च । विष्णोः स्थानं महेन्द्रस्य स्थानं चैव विवस्वतः ।।
सोमस्थानं भगस्थानं स्थानं कौबेरमेव च । धातुर्विधातुः स्थानं च वायोः स्थानं तथैव च ।।
ततः शिष्यैः परिवृतो मुनिरप्यभिनिष्पतत् । तं ददर्शाग्रतो रामो मुनीनां दीप्ततेजसं । अब्रवीद्वचनं वीरो लक्ष्मणं लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter surrounded by the disciples the sage came out. Rama saw him coming in front of the effulgent sages.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, शिष्यैः by disciples, परिवृतः surrounded by, मुनिरपि sage also, अभिनिष्पतत् approaching, रामः Rama, दीप्ततेजसाम् shinnig brightly among them, मुनीनाम् of the sages, अग्रतः in the forefront, तम् him, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And it came to pass that, surrounded by his disciples, the ascetic came (before Rāma). And Rāma saw that one of flaming energy at the head of the ascetics, and the hero said to Lakşınana, enhancer of auspiciousness.

data.v: एष लक्ष्मण निष्क्रामत्यगस्त्यो भगवानृषिः । औदार्येणावगच्छामि निधानं तपसामिमम् ।।
data.es: The valiant Rama said to Lakshmana, the enhancer of prosperity, O Lakshmana, sage Agastya is coming out. By virtue of his noble appearance, I know this sage to be a great treasuretrove of penances.
data.anv: वीरः  hero, लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् augmenter of prosperity, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, भगवान् glorious, एषः this person, अगस्त्यः Agastya, ऋषिः sage, निष्क्रामति is coming here, औदार्येण by nobility, इमम् him, तपसाम् of penance, निधानम् a treasuretrove, अवगच्छामि I understand.
data.md: O Laksmana, the revered saint, Agastya, is coming out. I recognize that mass of asceticism by a certain kind of majesty (that characterises him).

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहुरगस्त्यं सूर्यवर्चसं । जग्राह परमप्रीतस्तस्य पादौ परंतपः ।।
data.es: Having said so, the mightyarmed Rama, the scorcher of enemies, grasped the feet of Agastya who was shining like the Sun.
data.anv: महाबाहुः one with mighty arms, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, सूर्यवर्चसम् shining like the Sun, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, परमप्रीतः with great pleasure, तस्य his, पादौ feet, जग्राह grasped.
data.md: Having said this touching Agastya of the splendour of the sun, that son of Raghu took hold of his feet.

data.v: अभिवाद्य तु धर्मात्मा तस्थौ रामः कृताञ्जलिः । सीतया सह वैदेह्या तदा राम सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Then righteous Rama with Sita, the princess of Videha, and Lakshmana offered respects with folded palmsstanding.
data.anv: तदा then, धर्मात्मा righteous self, रामः Rama, वैदेह्या with princess of Videha, सीतया with Sita, सलक्ष्मणः and with Lakshmana, अभिवाद्य having offered respects, कृताज्ञलिः with folded palms, तस्थौ stood.
data.md: Then, having paid him homage, Rama with joined hands stood there in company with Videha's daughter, Sītā, and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च काकुत्स्थमर्चयित्वासनोदकैः । कुशलप्रश्नमुक्त्वा च आस्यतामिति सोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Agastya received Rama by offering him seat and water, enquired about his wellbeing and said: Please be seated,
data.anv: आसनोदकैः seat and water, अर्चयित्वा honouring, काकुत्स्थम् to Rama (Kakutstha), प्रतिजग्राह received, कुशलप्रश्नम् made enquiries of his welfare, उक्त्वा said, आस्यताम् be seated, इति च these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereat, embracing Rāma and honouring him with water and a seat, and asking him questions anent his welfare, the saint said, Welcome!

data.v: अग्निं हुत्वा प्रदायार्घ्यमतिथिं प्रतिपूज्य च । वानप्रस्थेन धर्मेण स तेषां भोजनं ददौ ।।
data.es: After giving oblations to the fire, and providing respectful offerings, the sage worshipped the guests according to the tradition of hermits and served them food.
data.anv: सः he, अग्निम् fire, हुत्वा after offering oblations, अर्घ्यम् water etc, प्रदाय after providing, अतिथीन् guests, प्रतिपूज्य च after worshipping, वानप्रस्थेन according to hermit's, धर्मेण tradition, तेषाम् to them, भोजनम् food, ददौ gave.

data.v: प्रथमं चोपविश्याथ धर्मज्ञो मुनिपुंगवः । उवाच राममासीनं प्राञ्जलिं धर्मकोविदम् ।।
data.es: And then the great sage Agastya, knower of dharma first took his seat and addressed Rama, an export in the knowledge of dharma, seated with folded palms.
data.anv: अथ and then, धर्मज्ञः the knower of dharma, मुनिपुङ्गवः great among the sages, प्रथमम् first, उपविश्य after sitting, आसीनम् seated, प्राञ्जलिम् one with folded palms, धर्मकोविदम् knower of dharma, रामम् to Rama, उवाच said.

data.v: अन्यथा खलु काकुत्स्थ तपस्वी समुदाचरन् । दुःसाक्षीव परे लोके स्वानि मांसानि भक्षयेत् ।।
data.es: O scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, only after offering oblations to the Firegod, a guest should be worshipped with water etc. Otherwise the host will have to eat his own flesh in the other world like a false witness.
data.anv: अग्निम् fire, हुत्वा after making an offering, अर्घ्यम् water, प्रदाय after providing, अतिथिम् guest, प्रतिपूजयेत् should worship, काकुत्स्थ O Rama, अन्यथा otherwise, समुदाचरन् by adopting, तपस्वी the sage, दुःसाक्षीव like a false witness, परे लोके in other world, स्वानि his own, मांसानि flesh, भक्षयेत् will have to eat.

data.v: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य धर्मचारी महारथः । पूजनीयश्च मान्यश्च भवान्प्राप्तः प्रियातिथिः ।।
data.es: You are king of all the worlds, a follower of dharma, a great warrior worthy of worship and an esteemed self. O Rama you are such a dear guest come to me.
data.anv: महायशाः illustrious, श्रीमान् prosperous, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, मम for me, यथा as, पूजनीयश्च worthy of reverence, मान्यश्च worthy of honour, अयम् this, पतगेश्वरः lord of the birds, तथा in the same way.
data.md: The sovereign of all the worlds, righteous, a mighty car warrior, worthy of being honoured and worshipped, you have become our beloved guest.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा फलैर्मूलैः पुष्पैश्चान्यैश्च राघवम् । पूजयित्वा यथाकामं पुनरेव ततोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having said so, the ascetics offered with reverence fruits, roots, flowers and other forest products to Rama and Lakshmana.
data.anv: एवम् in that manner, उक्त्वा having said, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, फलैः with fruits, मूलैः with roots, पुष्पैः with flowers, अन्यैश्च and by other, वन्यैः by forest produce, विविधाहारैः different kinds of food, अपूजयन् offered with reverence.
data.md: Having said this, Agastya, according to his desire, worshipping Rāghava with fruits, roots and flowers, said to him,

data.v: इदं दिव्यं महच्चापं हेमवज्रविभूषितम् । वैष्णवं पुरुषव्याघ्र निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा ।।
data.es: O best among men this divine bow studded with gold and gems belongs to Visnu and designed by Visvakarma. This excellent, unfailing arrow, bright like the Sun, was given to me by Brahma.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्र O tiger among men, हेमरत्नविभूषितम् adorned with gold and gems, दिव्यम् divine, महत् great, इदं चापम् this bow, वैष्णवम् belongs to Visnu, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितम् designed, सूर्यसङ्काशः glittering like the Sun, अमोघः unfailing, शरोत्तमः best of arrows, ब्रह्मदत्तः given by Brahma.

data.v: अमोघः सूर्यसंकाशो ब्रह्मदत्तः शरोत्तमः । दत्तो मम महेन्द्रेण तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ ।।
संपूर्णौ निशितैर्बाणैर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पावकैः । महाराजत कोशोऽयमसिर्हेमविभूषितः ।।
data.es: These two quivers filled fully with sharp inexhaustible arrows, shining like flames of fire and this sword adorned with gold and this big silver sheath were given to me by Indra.
data.anv: अक्षयसायकौ  with inexhaustible arrows, निशितैः  sharp ones, ज्वलद्भि: burning, पावकैरिव like fire, बाणैः with arrows, सम्पूर्णौ  filled, तूणी quiver, मम to me, महेन्द्रेण by Indra, दत्तौ were given, महारजतकोशः a big silver sheath, अयम् this, हेमविभूषितः adorned with gold.

data.v: अनेन धनुषा राम हत्वा संख्ये महासुरान् । आजहार श्रियं दीप्तां पुरा विष्णुर्दिवौकसाम् ।।
data.es: In ancient times Visnu killed the demons in a battle with this bow and brought back the glittering prosperity for the gods.
data.anv: राम O Rama, पुरा in the past, विष्णुः Visnu, सङ्ख्ये in the battle, अनेन धनुषा with this bow, महासुरान् great demons, हत्वा killing, दिवौकसाम् for the gods, दीप्ताम् shining, श्रियम् prosperity, आजहार earned.
data.md: Having, O Rama, slain the mighty Asuras with this bow, Vişņu in days of yorc in battle secured the effulgent Fortune of the celestials. O bestower of honour, do you for securing victory, take this bow, these quivers, this arrow, and this scimitar, like the holder of the thunderbolt, taking the same.

data.v: तद्धनुस्तौ च तूणीरौ शरं खड्गं च मानद । जयाय प्रतिगृह्णीष्व वज्रं वज्रधरो यथा ।।
data.es: O bestower of honour, receive this bow, the two quivers, the sword and the arrow for your victory just like Indra accepts the thunderbolt.
data.anv: मानद O Rama, bestower of honour, तत् that, धनुः bow, तौ both, तूणीरौ quivers, शरम् arrow, खङ्गं च sword, वज्रधरः Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt, वज्रं यथा as his thunderbolt, जयाय to win, प्रतिगृह्णीष्व you may please accept.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः समस्तं तद्वरायुधम् । दत्त्वा रामाय भगवानगस्त्यः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The luminous lord Agastya, having said this, gave all the excellent weapons to Rama. And continued : इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महातेजा: luminous , भगवान् lord, अगस्त्यः Agastya, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, समस्तम् everything, तत् that, वरायुधम् excellent weapons, रामाय to Rama, दत्वा having given, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having said this, that highly energetic one, the reverend Agastya, consigning to Rāma all those weapon, again said. SCCTION 13

data.v: राम प्रीतोऽस्मि भद्रं ते परितुष्टोऽस्मि लक्ष्मण । अभिवादयितुं यन्मां प्राप्तौ स्थः सह सीतया ।।
data.es: O Rama ,I am pleased. I wish you well. I am glad that both of you have come here with Sita to pay respect to me.
data.anv: राम  O Rama, प्रीतः pleased, अस्मि I am, ते भद्रम् wish you well, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, परितुष्टः satisfied, अस्मि I am, यत् to me, सीतया सह with Sita, माम् to me, अभिवादयितुम् to pay  reverence, प्राप्तौ have come , स्थः you both are.
data.md: 'O Rāma, I am pleased with you; good betide you! And, O Laksmana, I am gratified by you. You are in trouble in consequence of the great fatigue that you have undergone on the way. And Janaka's daughter, the noble Maithili, is evidently cager (for rest).

data.v: अध्वश्रमेण वां खेदो बाधते प्रचुरश्रमः । व्यक्तमुत्कण्ठते चापि मैथिली जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: Both of you are tired due to the journey. It is evident that Sita, daughter of Janaka, is anxious (to rest).
data.anv: अध्वश्रमेण due to fatigue caused by the journey, प्रचुरश्रमः much labour, खेदः affliction, वाम् you both, बाधते in troubling, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली चापि Maithili too, व्यक्तम् it is evident, उत्कण्ठते is anxious.
data.md: 'O Rāma, I am pleased with you; good betide you! And, O Laksmana, I am gratified by you. You are in trouble in consequence of the great fatigue that you have undergone on the way. And Janaka's daughter, the noble Maithili, is evidently cager (for rest).

data.v: एषा हि सुकुमारी च दुःखैश्च न विमानिता । प्राज्यदोषं वनं प्रप्ता भर्तृस्नेहप्रचोदिता ।।
data.es: Even though delicate, Sita never feels discouraged by difficulties. She has come to the forest full of obstacles, since she is motivated by her love for her husband.
data.anv: सुकुमारी च she is delicate, दुःखैश्च with difficulties, न विमानिता is not let down, एषा this lady, भर्तृस्नेहप्रचोदिता motivated by love for the husband, प्राज्यदोषम् full of difficulties, वनम् forest, प्राप्ता she came.
data.md: Of tender years and unkn wn to hardship, she has come to the forest rife with troubles, being urged by the love she bears to her lord.

data.v: यथैषा रमते राम इह सीता तथा कुरु । दुष्करं कृतवत्येषा वने त्वामनुगच्छती ।।
data.es: O Rama, help Sita enjoy herself in whatever manner she likes. By following you into the forest, she has accomplished the most difficult task৷৷
data.anv: राम O Rama, इह here, यथा in whatever manner, रमते she feels like enjoying, तथा like that, कुरु do, एषा this lady, वने in this forest, त्वाम् you, अनुगच्छती came following, दुष्करम् difficult, कृतवती she has done.
data.md: Do you, O Rāma, conduct yourself so, that Sītā may find a pleasant time of it. By fcllowing you to the forest, it is a hard task that she is performing.

data.v: एषा हि प्रकृतिः स्त्रीणामासृष्टे रघुनन्दन । समस्थमनुरज्यन्ते विषमस्थं त्यजन्ति च ।।
data.es: O Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty from the beginning of the creation women, by nature, keep the husband company when all goes well and give them up when hard times come.
data.anv: रघुनन्धन  O delight of the Raghu race, आसृष्टे from the beginning of creation, एषा this is, स्त्रीणाम् of women, प्रकृतिः is the nature, समस्थम् when everything is normal, अनुरज्यन्ति they enjoy, विषमस्थम् in hard situations, त्यजन्ति च they  give up.
data.md: O son of Raghu, this has been the nature of the fair sex from the commencement of creation, that they gladden him that is well off, and forsake a person in adversity.

data.v: शतह्रदानां लोलत्वं शस्त्राणां तीक्ष्णतां तथा । गरुडानिलयोः शैघ्र्यमनुगच्छन्ति योषितः ।।
data.es: Women are fickle like lightning, sharp like weapons and fast like Garuda or the windgod.
data.anv: योषितः women, शतह्रदानाम् of the lightnings, लोलत्वम् fickleness, शस्त्राणाम् of weapons, तीक्ष्णताम् sharpness, तथा like that, गरुडानिलयोः of Garuda (king of birds) and wind, शैघ्र्यम् speed, अनुगच्छन्ति follow.
data.md: And women imitate the instability of lightning, the sharpness of weapons, and the celerity of Garuda and the wind.

data.v: इयं तु भवतो भार्या दोषैरेतैर्विवर्जिताः । श्लाघ्या च व्यपदेश्या च यथा देवी ह्यरुन्धती ।।
data.es: Your wife is free from such blemishes. She is praiseworthy and worthy of mention as an example just like the revered Arundhati.
data.anv: भवतः your, भार्या wife, इयं तु this lady, एतैः by these, दोषैः demerits, विवर्जिता is free, देवी revered lady, अरुन्धती यथा like Arundhati, श्लाघ्या च she is praiseworthy, व्यपदेश्या च exemplary too.
data.md: But this wife of yours is absolutely free from all these defects; she is worthy of being extolled and the foremost of those devoted to their lord, like Arundhati among the gods.

data.v: अलंकृतोऽयं देशश्च यत्र सौमित्रिणा सह । वैदेह्या चानया राम वत्स्यसि त्वमरिंदम ।।
data.es: O Rama, subduer of enemies the place where you reside along with Lakshmana and Vaidehi will look adorned, indeed.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, राम Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, अनया by her, वैदेह्याच with Vaidehi, यत्र whereever, वत्स्यसि you reside, अयम् this, देशश्च region, अलङ्कृतः is adorned.
data.md: This region, O Rāma, will be adorned, since, O subduer of enemies, you along with Vaidehī and Sumitra's son, will dwell here.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु मुनिना राघवः संयताञ्जलिः । उवाच प्रश्रितं वाक्यमृषिं दीप्तमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: Thus addressed, Rama held his palms together and said politely to the sage shining like fire:
data.anv: मुनिना by the ascetic, एवम् in that way, उक्तः being told, सः that, राघवः Rama, संयताञ्जलिः with palms held together, दीप्तम् burning, अनलमिव like fire, ऋषिम् to sage, प्रश्रितम् politely, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.
data.md: Thus addressed by the ascetic, Rāghava, joining his hands, humbly observed to that saint resembling flaming fire,

data.v: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि यस्य मे मुनिपुंगवः । गुणैः सभ्रातृभार्यस्य वरदः परितुष्यति ।।
data.es: I consider myself blessed and favoured by a great sage like you, bestower of boons as you have been pleased with me, my brother and my life.
data.anv: सभ्रातृभार्यस्य of me, along with my brother and my wife, यस्य मे of whom, गुणैः qualities, वरदः bestower of boons, मुनिपुङ्गवः great among the sages, परितुष्यति is pleased, धन्यः blessed, अस्मि I am, अनुगृहीतः favoured, अस्मि me.
data.md: Blessed and beholden am I, since the foremost of ascetics is gratified with my merits as well as with those of my brother and wife.

data.v: किं तु व्यादिश मे देशं सोदकं बहुकाननम् । यत्राश्रमपदं कृत्वा वसेयं निरतः सुखम् ।।
data.es: Direct me to a place with water and dense forest where we can build an ashram and live happily.
data.anv: किन्तु but, यत्र there, आश्रमपदम् the hermitage, कृत्वा after building, निरतः always, सुखम् happily, वसेयम् I may live, सोदकम् with water, बहुकाननम् with many forests, देशम् place, मे for me, व्यादिश direct.
data.md: Do you now direct me to a country well watered, and abounding in woods, where rearing an asylum, 1 may dwell delightfully and pleasantly.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्मुनि श्रेष्ठः श्रुत्वा रामस्य भाषितम् । ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं धर्मात्मा धीरो धीरतरं वचः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Rama, Agastya, the best among the sages, coolheaded and righteous, thought a while and uttered these words coolly :
data.anv: ततः thereafter, धर्मात्मा a righteous soul, धीरः cool, मुनिश्रेष्ठः best among sages, रामस्य Rama's, तत् that, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मुहूर्तम् for a while, ध्यात्वा after thinking, धीरतरम् more solemn, वचः word, अब्रवीत् uttered.
data.md: Hearing Rāma's words, that best of ascetics, reflecting for a while, spoke these excellent words.

data.v: इतो द्वियोजने तात बहुमूलफलोदकः । देशो बहुमृगः श्रीमान्पञ्चवट्यभिविश्रुतः ।।
data.es: O dear two yojanas away is a place wellknown as Panchavati, a beautiful resort with many roots, fruits, plenty of water and many animals.
data.anv: तात dear son, बहुमूलफलोदकः a place with many roots, fruits and water, बहुमृगः a place with many animals, श्रीमान् beautiful, पञ्चवट्यभिविश्रुतः popularly known as Panchavati, शः that place, इतः from here, द्वियोजने at a distance of two yojanas.
data.md: Two Yojanas hence, my child, is a region abounding in fruits and roots, containing countless deer, and beautiful-known by the name of Pancavați.

data.v: तत्र गत्वाश्रमपदं कृत्वा सौमित्रिणा सह । रमस्व त्वं पितुर्वाक्यं यथोक्तमनुपालयन् ।।
data.es: Reaching there, you wikk build a hermitage with Lakshmana and enjoy your life given to the fulfilment of the pledge to the father.
data.anv: त्वम् you, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, तत्र there, गत्वा after going, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, कृत्वा building, यथोक्तम् as told, पितुः father's, वाक्यम् words, अनुपालयन् while obeying, रंस्यसे you will enjoy.
data.md: Repairing thither, do you, rearing an asylum, pass your time pleasantly in company with Sumitrā's son, duly doing the mandate of your sire.

data.v: विदितो ह्येष वृत्तान्तो मम सर्वस्तवानघ । तपसश्च प्रभावेन स्नेहाद्दशरथस्य च ।।
data.es: O sinless one, I have kown all these facts about you by the power of penance and love for Dasaratha.
data.anv: अनघ O sinless one, तपसः of the penance, प्रभावेण by the power, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नेहात् due to love, तव your, एषः this, सर्वः all, वृत्तान्तः facts, मम to me, विदितः is known.
data.md: O sinless one, all this news relating to yourself, has from affection been known to me through the potency of my asceticism, as also that relating to Dasaratha.

data.v: हृदयस्थश्च ते छन्दो विज्ञातस्तपसा मया । इह वासं प्रतिज्ञाय मया सह तपोवने ।।
data.es: I know your heart by virtue of my penance. I, therefore, ask you to proceed to Panchavati, after ensuring your stay here with me in this penancegrove for the time being.
data.anv: ते your, हृदयस्थः  of your heart, छन्द: desire, मया by me, तपसा by the power of penance, विज्ञातः is known, अतः therefore, मया सह with me, इह here, तपोवने in this penancegrove, आवासं residence, प्रतिज्ञाय after ensuring, पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, गच्छ you may go, इति thus, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, ब्रूमि telling you.
data.md: Although you have promised to dwell with me in this ascetic grove, yet by virtue of my asceticism I know the desire that is in your heart.

data.v: अतश्च त्वामहं ब्रूमि गच्छ पञ्चवटीमिति । स हि रम्यो वनोद्देशो मैथिली तत्र रंस्यते ।।
data.md: I therefore tell you, repair to Pancavati. That is a charining woodland, and there Mithila's daughter shall dwell with delight.

data.v: स देशः श्लाघनीयश्च नातिदूरे च राघव । गोदावर्याः समीपे च मैथिली तत्र रंस्यते ।।
data.md: And that tract is worthy of all praise, and, O Rāghava, it is not distant from here. It is in the vicinity of the Godāvarī. Mithilā's daughter shall live there agreeably.

data.v: प्राज्यमूलफलैश्चैव नानाद्विज गणैर्युतः । विविक्तश्च महाबाहो पुण्यो रम्यस्तथैव च ।।
data.es: O longarmed Rama,that place has plenty of roots and fruits. It is a solitary, holy and beautiful place teeming with various kinds of birds. Sita will enjoy her stay in the vicinity of river Godavari.
data.anv: मैथिली Maithili, तत्र there, गोदावर्याः of Godavari, समीपे nearby , रंस्यते will enjoy, प्राज्यमूलफलश्चैव roots and fruits are plenty there, नानाद्विजगणायुतः teeming with a kariety of birds, महाबाहो long armed, विविक्तश्च it is a solitary place, पुण्यः holy place,   तथैवच in the same way, रम्यः is beautiful.
data.md: And that spot abounds in fruits and roots, is frequented by various fowls, is retired, O mighty-armed one, and is sacred and beautiful.

data.v: भवानपि सदारश्च शक्तश्च परिरक्षणे । अपि चात्र वसन्रामस्तापसान्पालयिष्यसि ।।
data.es: O Rama, while staying with your wife, you will look after the ascetics living there since you are capable of giving protection.
data.anv: राम O Rama, भवानपि you also, सदारश्च accompanied by your wife, परिरक्षणे in giving protection, शक्तश्च able, अपि च and so, अत्र there, वसन् while living, तापसान् ascetics, पालयिष्यसि you will protect.
data.md: And you of pure ways, and competent to protect the ascetics, shall, O Rāma protect them.

data.v: एतदालक्ष्यते वीर मधुकानां महद्वनम् । उत्तरेणास्य गन्तव्यं न्यग्रोधमभिगच्छता ।।
data.es: O valiant Rama look at the great forest of madhuka trees. Walk north to the forest till you see a great banyan tree.
data.anv: वीर O hero, एतत् this is, मधूकानाम् of madhuka trees, महत् big, वनम् forest, आलक्ष्यते is seen, अस्य its, उत्तरेण northern side, न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, अभिगच्छता while going towards, गन्तव्यम् you should go.
data.md: O hero, yonder is the mighty wood of Madhūkas. Directing your course to the asylum of Nyagrodha trees, go by the north of this Madhūka wood. Then arriving at a spot hard by a hill, (you will) come upon the celebrated Pañcavați, crowned with blossoming woods.

data.v: ततः स्थलमुपारुह्य पर्वतस्याविदूरतः । ख्यातः पञ्चवटीत्येव नित्यपुष्पितकाननः ।।
data.es: Then climb the elevated ground not very far from the mountain. There is the wellknown Panchavati with forests, ever in full bloom.
data.anv: ततः there, स्थलम् ground, उपारुह्य getting to the elevated, पर्वतस्य of the mountain, अविदूरतः not very far from there, पञ्चवटीत्येव is Panchavati, ख्यातः wellknown, नित्यपुष्पितकाननः  where the forest is always in full bloom.
data.md: O hero, yonder is the mighty wood of Madhūkas. Directing your course to the asylum of Nyagrodha trees, go by the north of this Madhūka wood. Then arriving at a spot hard by a hill, (you will) come upon the celebrated Pañcavați, crowned with blossoming woods.

data.v: अगस्त्येनैवमुक्तस्तु रामः सौमित्रिणा सह । सात्कृत्यामन्त्रयामास तमृषिं सत्यवादिनम् ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Agastya, Rama with Lakshmana paid respects to the sage wedded to truth and took leave of him.
data.anv: अगस्त्येन by Agastya, एवम् thus, उक्तः was said, सौमित्रिणा सह with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, सत्यवादिनम्  to the truthful, तम् that, ऋषिम् sage, सत्कृत्य after worshipping with respect, आमन्त्रयामास took leave .
data.md: Thus accosted by Agastya, Rāma along with Sumitra's son, honouring the truth-speaking saint, greeted him.

data.v: तौ तु तेनाभ्यनुज्ञातौ कृतपादाभिवन्दनौ । तदाश्रमात्पञ्चवटीं जग्मतुः सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Both of them worshipped the feet of sage Agastya, and proceeded to Panchavati with his permission.
data.anv: तेन by him, अभ्यनुज्ञातौ permitted, तौ both, कृतपादाभिवन्दनौ worshipping his feet, सीतया सह along with Sita, तदाश्रमात् from that hermitage, पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, जग्मतुः proceeded.
data.md: Then, having saluted his feet, they, taking the saint's permission, set out along with Sītā for the hermitage of Pañcavați.

data.v: गृहीतचापौ तु नराधिपात्मजौ; विषक्ततूणी समरेष्वकातरौ । यथोपदिष्टेन पथा महर्षिणा; प्रजग्मतुः पञ्चवटीं समाहितौ ।।
data.es: Both the princes, unafraid of battles, held their bows, tied the quivers and carefully proceeded towards Panchavati along the path suggested by the sage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: समरेषु in wars, अकातरौ never frightened, नराधिपात्मजौ two princes, गृहीतचापौ holding bows, विषक्ततूणौ tying the quivers, समाहितौ made attentive, महर्षिणा by the great sage, यथोपदिष्टेन as per the directions, पथा by the path, पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, प्रजग्मतुः proceeded.
data.md: And, taking their bows and quivers those sons of the king, of undiminished martial virtue, with intent minds bent their course to Pañcavați by the way laid down by the Maharși.

data.v: अथ पञ्चवटीं गच्छन्नन्तरा रघुनन्दनः । आससाद महाकायं गृध्रं भीमपराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: On the way to Panchavati, Rama, the delight of the Raghu race, met a vulture with a huge body and fearful strength.
data.anv: अथ and then, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghus (Rama), पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, गच्छन्  while going, अन्तरा in the middle, महाकायम् of huge body, भीमपराक्रमम् of fearful strength गृध्रम् vulture, आससाद met.
data.md: As he was proceeding to Pancavati, Raghu's son saw a huge-bodied vulture of terrible prowess.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा तौ महाभागौ वनस्थं रामलक्ष्मणौ । मेनाते राक्षसं पक्षिं ब्रुवाणौ को भवानिति ।।
data.es: Seeing the bird on the banyan tree, venerable Rama and Lakshmana mistook him for a demon and enquired who he was.
data.anv: महाभागौ both the venerable, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ  Rama and Lakshmana, वटस्थम् on the banyan tree, तं पक्षिम् that bird, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, भवान् you, कः who are, इति this way, ब्रुवाणौ (while) saying so, राक्षसम् demon, मेनाते thought.
data.md: And seeing him in the forest, the exalted Rāma and Lakşmaņa, as they were conversing with each other, knowing the bird to be (in reality) a Raksasa, asked him, saying, Who are you?

data.v: स तौ मधुरया वाचा सौम्यया प्रीणयन्निव । उवाच वत्स मां विद्धि वयस्यं पितुरात्मनः ।।
data.es: With a sweet, pleasing, and gentle voice he said to both of them, O dear know me to be a friend of your father.
data.anv: सः he, तौ to them, मधुरया sweetly, सौम्यया in a gentle way, वाचा in a tone, प्रीणयन्निव   pleasing them, उवाच said, वत्स dear child, माम् me, आत्मनः पितुः your father's, वयस्यम् friend, विद्धि know.
data.md: There-upon, in soft and sweet words, he, pleasing them, said, My child, know me for a friend of your father.'

data.v: स तं पितृसखं बुद्ध्वा पूजयामास राघवः । स तस्य कुलमव्यग्रमथ पप्रच्छ नाम च ।।
data.es: Rama knew he was a friend of his father. So he enquired in a cool, composed voice his name and his lineage.
data.anv: सः राघवः Rama, तम् him, पितृसखम् father's friend, बुद्ध्वा after knowing, पूजयामास paid obeisance, अथ then, सः he, अव्यग्रम् in a cool and composed manner, तस्य his, कुलम् lineage, नाम च name also, पप्रच्छ enquired of.
data.md: Knowing him to be a friend of his sire, Rāghava paid him homage, and enquired for his name and lineage.

data.v: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा कुलमात्मानमेव च । आचचक्षे द्विजस्तस्मै सर्वभूतसमुद्भवम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Rama's words, the bird started narrating the origin of all beings including his own family:
data.anv: द्विजः  bird, रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा  hearing, सर्वभूतसमुद्भवम् the origin of all beings, कुलम् family, आत्मानमेव च about his own family, तस्मै to him, आचचक्षे started narrating.
data.md: Hearing Rama's words, he mentioned his own lineage, and related the origin of all beings.

data.v: पूर्वकाले महाबाहो ये प्रजापतयोऽभवन् । तान्मे निगदतः सर्वानादितः शृणु राघव ।।
data.es: O mightyarmed Rama hear from me while I am telling you about the lords of creation from the very beginning.
data.anv: महाबाहो O mightyarmed, राघव Rama, पूर्वकाले in ancient times, ये those, प्रजापतय: lords of creation, अभवन् were there, तान् सर्वान् all of them, मे while I, निगदतः mention, आदितः from the beginning, शृणु listen.
data.md: O mighty-armed one, I shall describe (to you) from the very beginning the (history of) those that were Prajāpatis in days of yore.

data.v: कर्दमः प्रथमस्तेषां विकृतस्तदनन्तरम् । शेषश्च संश्रयश्चैव बहुपुत्रश्च वीर्यवान् ।।
स्थाणुर्मरीचिरत्रिश्च क्रतुश्चैव महाबलः । पुलस्त्यश्चाङ्गिराश्चैव प्रचेताः पुलहस्तथा ।।
दक्षो विवस्वानपरोऽरिष्टनेमिश्च राघव । कश्यपश्च महातेजास्तेषामासीच्च पश्चिमः ।।
प्रजापतेस्तु दक्षस्य बभूवुरिति नः श्रुतम् । षष्टिर्दुहितरो राम यशस्विन्यो महायशः ।।
data.es: O glorious Rama it is wellknown that Daksha, the creator had sixty daughters of great fame.
data.anv: महायशः very  glorious, राम Rama, प्रजापतेः of the lords, दक्षस्य of Daksha, षष्टिः sixty, यशस्विन्यः glorious, दुहितरः daughters, बभूवुः इति were born thus, विश्रुतम् very well known .
data.md: The Prajāpati Dakşa, it has been heard by us, O Rāma, had sixty famous and illustrious daughters.

data.v: कश्यपः प्रतिजग्राह तासामष्टौ सुमध्यमाः । अदितिं च दितिं चैव दनूमपि च कालकाम् ।।
data.es: Out of them(daughters of Daksha) Kasyapa married eight women of beautiful waist called Aditi, Diti, Danu also Kalika,Tamra, Krodhavasa, Anala and Manu.
data.anv: काश्यपः Kasyapa, तासाम् among them, अदितिं च Aditi and, दितिं चैव Diti too, दनुमपि and Danu, अथ also, कालिकाम् Kalika, ताम्राम् Tamra, क्रोधवशां चैव Krodhavasa too, मनुं च and Manu, अनलामपि Anala, अष्टौ eight, सुमध्यमाः of beautiful waist, प्रतिजग्राह married,
data.md: Of these Kaśyapa wed eight, with elegant waists; Aditi, Diti, Danu, Kālikā, Tamră, Krodhavāśa, Manu and Analā.

data.v: ताम्रां क्रोधवशां चैव मनुं चाप्यनलामपि । तास्तु कन्यास्ततः प्रीतः कश्यपः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
पुत्रांस्त्रैलोक्यभर्तॄन्वै जनयिष्यथ मत्समान् । अदितिस्तन्मना राम दितिश्च दनुरेव च ।।
कालका च महाबाहो शेषास्त्वमनसोऽभवन् । अदित्यां जज्ञिरे देवास्त्रयस्त्रिंशदरिंदम ।।
आदित्या वसवो रुद्रा अश्विनौ च परंतप । दितिस्त्वजनयत्पुत्रान्दैत्यांस्तात यशस्विनः ।।
data.es: O dear Rama, Diti bore glorious sons called Daityas and this earth with all the forests and seas belonged to them.
data.anv: तात dear child, दितिस्तु Diti bore, यशस्विनः glorious, दैत्यान् Daityas, पुत्रान् sons, अजनयत् gave birth to, सवनार्णवा including the forests and seas, इयम् this, वसुमती earth, तेषाम् to them, आसीत् belonged.

data.v: तेषामियं वसुमती पुरासीत्सवनार्णवा । दनुस्त्वजनयत्पुत्रमश्वग्रीवमरिंदम ।।
नरकं कालकं चैव कालकापि व्यजायत । क्रौञ्चीं भासीं तथा श्येनीं धृतराष्ट्रीं तथा शुकीम् ।।
data.es: To Tamra were born, Krounchi, Bhasi, Syeni, Dhrutharashtri and Suki. Altogether they were five beautiful young maids famous in the world.
data.anv: ताम्रापि Tamra also, क्रौञ्चीम् Krounchi, भासीम् Bhasi, तथा similarly, श्येनीम् Syeni, धृतराष्ट्रीम् Dhrutharashtri, तथा like that, शुकीम् Suki, एताः all of them, लोकविश्रुताः famous in the world, पञ्च five, कन्याः young girls, सुषुवे she gave birth to.

data.v: ताम्रापि सुषुवे कन्याः पञ्चैता लोकविश्रुताः । उलूकाञ्जनयत्क्रौञ्ची भासी भासान्व्यजायत ।।
श्येनी श्येनांश्च गृध्रांश्च व्यजायत सुतेजसः । धृतराष्ट्री तु हंसांश्च कलहंसांश्च सर्वशः ।।
data.es: Krounchi gave birth to owls, Bhasi to Bhasa birds, Synei to bright hawks and vultures, Dhrutharashtri to swans and chakravakas with sweet notes.
data.anv: क्रौञ्ची Krounchi, उलूकान् owls, जनयत् gave birth to, भासी Bhasi, भासान् Bhasa birds, व्यजायत delivered, श्येनी Syeni, सुतेजसः very bright, श्येनांश्च Syena birds(hawks), गृध्रांश्च Vultures, व्यजायत gave birh to, धृतराष्ट्री तु Dhrutharashtri too, हंसांश्च Swans, सर्वशः all types of swans, कलहंसांश्च waterbirds of sweet note.

data.v: चक्रवाकांश्च भद्रं ते विजज्ञे सापि भामिनी । शुकी नतां विजज्ञे तु नताया विनता सुता ।।
data.es: Dhrutharashtri, a female bird of great lustre gave birth to chakravakas too. Suki gave birth to Nata and from Nata, Vinata was born. Be blessed, O Rama
data.anv: सा she, भामिनी woman, चक्रवाकांश्चापि chakravakas too, विजज्ञे created, ते for you, भद्रम् welfare, शुकी Suki, नताम् of Nata, विजज्ञे gave birth to, विनता Vinata, नतायः from Nata, सुता daughter.

data.v: दशक्रोधवशा राम विजज्ञेऽप्यात्मसंभवाः । मृगीं च मृगमन्दां च हरीं भद्रमदामपि ।।
data.es: O Ramato Krodhavasa were born Mrugi, Mrugamanda, Hari, Bhadramada, Mathangi, Sardooli, Sweta, Surabhi and Surasa, Kadruva and endowed with all virtues.
data.anv: राम Rama, क्रोधवशा Krodhavasa, मृगींच Mrugi, मृगमन्दां च Mrugamanda, हरीम् Hari, भद्रमदामपि Bhadramada, मातङ्गीमपि Matangi, शार्धूलीम् Sarduli, श्वेताम् Sweta, तथा सुरभिम् Surabhi, सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नाम् endowed with all virtues, सुरसाम् Surasa, कद्रुकामपि Kadruka, दश ten, आत्मसम्भवा offsprings, विजज्ञे were born.
data.md: And Krodhavasā, O Rāma, brought forth ten daughters viz., Mrgi, Mrgamanda, Hari, Bhadramadā, Mātangi, Śårdūlī, Śvetā, Surabhi crowned with every (auspicious mark), Surasā and Kadrukā.

data.v: मातङ्गीमथ शार्दूलीं श्वेतां च सुरभीं तथा । सर्वलक्षणसंपन्नां सुरसां कद्रुकामपि ।।
data.es: O Ramato Krodhavasa were born Mrugi, Mrugamanda, Hari, Bhadramada, Mathangi, Sardooli, Sweta, Surabhi and Surasa, Kadruva and endowed with all virtues.
data.anv: राम Rama, क्रोधवशा Krodhavasa, मृगींच Mrugi, मृगमन्दां च Mrugamanda, हरीम् Hari, भद्रमदामपि Bhadramada, मातङ्गीमपि Matangi, शार्धूलीम् Sarduli, श्वेताम् Sweta, तथा सुरभिम् Surabhi, सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नाम् endowed with all virtues, सुरसाम् Surasa, कद्रुकामपि Kadruka, दश ten, आत्मसम्भवा offsprings, विजज्ञे were born.
data.md: And Krodhavasā, O Rāma, brought forth ten daughters viz., Mrgi, Mrgamanda, Hari, Bhadramadā, Mātangi, Śårdūlī, Śvetā, Surabhi crowned with every (auspicious mark), Surasā and Kadrukā.

data.v: अपत्यं तु मृगाः सर्वे मृग्या नरवरोत्तम । ऋष्काश्च मृगमन्दायाः सृमराश्चमरास्तथा ।।
data.es: O best of men, all kinds of animals were born of Mrugi.To Mrugamanda were born bears and chamara (a different kind of deer).
data.anv: नरवरोत्तम O best of men, सर्वे all kinds of, मृगाः animals, अपत्यम् offsprings, ऋक्षाश्च bears, सृमराः deer, तथा similarly, चमराश्च chamara deer, मृगमन्दायाः to Mrugamanda.
data.md: You foremost of the best of men, Mrgi's sons were all the deer, and those of Mſgamandã were bears, Srmaras and Camaras.

data.v: ततस्त्विरावतीं नाम जज्ञे भद्रमदा सुताम् । तस्यास्त्वैरावतः पुत्रो लोकनाथो महागजः ।।
data.md: And Bhadramadā bore one daughter, Irāvati. And Irāvati's son is the mighty elephant; who is the lord of the worlds.

data.v: हर्याश्च हरयोऽपत्यं वानराश्च तपस्विनः । गोलाङ्गूलांश्च शार्दूली व्याघ्रांश्चाजनयत्सुतान् ।।
data.es: To Hari were born lions, and swiftmoving monkeys and to Bhadramada, a daughter by name Iravati.
data.anv: हरयः lions, वानराश्च monkeys also, तरस्स्विनः awift, हर्याः to Hari, अपत्यम् offspring, ततः as, भद्रमदा Bhadramada, इरावतीं नाम by name Iravati, सुताम् a daughter, जज्ञे gave birth to.
data.md: And Hari's sons are lions and the nimble monkeys. And Śārdúlí brought forth as her sons, Golāngūlas, and tigers; and the offspring of Matangi were mad elephants, O best of men. And Śvetā, O Kākutstha, gave birth to the elephants of the cardinal points.

data.v: मातङ्ग्यास्त्वथ मातङ्गा अपत्यं मनुजर्षभ । दिशागजं तु श्वेताक्षं श्वेता व्यजनयत्सुतम् ।।
ततो दुहितरौ राम सुरभिर्देव्यजायत । रोहिणीं नाम भद्रं ते गन्धर्वीं च यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: Surabhi gave birth to Rohini and Gandharvi,the two famous daughters. May you be happy, Rama
data.anv: राम O Rama, ततः then, सुरभिः देवी the divine Surabhi, रोहिणीं नाम by name Rohini, यशस्स्विनीम् famed, गन्धर्वीं च Gandharvi too, दुहितरौ two daughters, अजायत gave birth to, ते भद्रम् be blessed.
data.md: O Rāma, then, Surabhi gave birth to two daughters-the famous Rohini, and Gandharvi.

data.v: रोहिण्यजनयद्गा वै गन्धर्वी वाजिनः सुतान् । सुरसाजनयन्नागान्राम कद्रूश्च पन्नगान् ।।
data.es: O Rama Rohini procreated cows, and Gandharvi, horses as offsprings. Surasa delivered cobras and Kadru, ordinary serpents.
data.anv: राम Rama, रोहिणी Rohini, गाव: cows, अजनयत् procreated, गन्धर्वी Gandharvi, वाजिनः horses, सुतान् as chidren, सुरसा Surasa, नागान् cobras, कद्रूस्तु Kadru, पन्नगान् other serpents, अजनयत् procreated.
data.md: Rohini produced kine, and the sons of Gandharvī are horses. And Surasā, O Rāma, gave birth to Nāgas, and Kadru to Pannagas.

data.v: मनुर्मनुष्याञ्जनयत्कश्यपस्य महात्मनः । ब्राह्मणान्क्षत्रियान्वैश्याञ्शूद्रांश्च मनुजर्षभ ।।
data.es: O Rama, bull among men Manu procreated brahmins, kshatriyas, vaisyas and sudras all famed human beings.
data.anv: मनुजर्षभ O bull among men, राम Rama, मनु Manu, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, क्षत्रियान् kshtriyas, वैश्यान् vaisyas, शूद्रांश्च and sudras , यशस्विनः illustrious, मनुष्यान् human beings, पुत्रान् sons, अजनयत् procreated.
data.md: Kāśyapa's other wife Manu begot mankind-Brahmanas, Ksatriyas, Vaisyas, and Sudras.

data.v: मुखतो ब्राह्मणा जाता उरसः क्षत्रियास्तथा । ऊरुभ्यां जज्ञिरे वैश्याः पद्भ्यां शूद्रा इति श्रुतिः ।।
data.md: From the mouth, it is known sprang Brahmanas, from the breast, Ksatriya, from the thighs, Vaisyas, and from the feet, Sudras.

data.v: सर्वान्पुण्यफलान्वृक्षाननलापि व्यजायत । विनता च शुकी पौत्री कद्रूश्च सुरसा स्वसा ।।
data.es: Anala (wife of Kasyapa) procreated trees with sacred fruits. Vinata was the granddaughter of Suki, and Kahdruva and Surasa were her sisters.
data.anv: अनलापि Anala too, पुण्यफलान् sacred fruits, सर्वान् of several kinds, वृक्षान् trees, व्यजायत procreated, विनता च and Vinata, शुकीपौत्री granddaughter of Suki, कद्रूश्च from Kadhruva सुरसास्वसा sibling of Surasa.
data.md: And Anală produced all trees bearing sacred fruits. Vinatā (was) Śuki' grand-daughter, and Kadru, Surasā's aunt.

data.v: कद्रूर्नागसहस्क्रं तु विजज्ञे धरणीधरम् । द्वौ पुत्रौ विनतायास्तु गरुडोऽरुण एव च ।।
data.es: Kadhru produced a thousandhooded serpent(Adisesha) who held the whole earth on his head and Vinata, two sons, Garuda and Aruna.
data.anv: कद्रूः Kadhruva, सहस्रास्यम् thousandheaded, धरणीधरम् he which held the whole earth, नागम् serpent, विजज्ञे produced, विनतायास्तु of Vinata too, गरुडः Garuda, अरुण Aruna, एव च द्वौ two, पुत्रौ sons.
data.md: And Kadru gave birth to a thousand Nāgas with the holder of the Earth. And Vinatā brought forth two sons-Garuda and Aruna.

data.v: तस्माज्जातोऽहमरुणात्संपातिश्च ममाग्रजः । जटायुरिति मां विद्धि श्येनीपुत्रमरिंदम ।।
data.es: I am born to Aruna and my elder brother is Sampati. O subduer of enemies, know me as Jatayu, son of Syeni.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O Subduer of enemies, अहम् I, तस्मात् from him, अरुणात् from Aruna, जातः was born, सम्पातिः Sampati, मम my, अग्रज: elder brother, श्येनीपुत्रम् son of Syeni, माम् me, जटायुरिति as Jatayu, विद्धि know.
data.md: An from Aruņa sprang myself and my elder brother Sampāti subduer of enemies, know me for Jatayu, the son of Syeni.

data.v: सोऽहं वाससहायस्ते भविष्यामि यदीच्छसि । सीतां च तात रक्षिष्ये त्वयि याते सलक्ष्मणे ।।
data.es: If you so desire I will be helpful to you in guarding your hut. O dear, it is a difficult forest full of wild animals and demons. When you and Lakshmana are away I will protect Sita.
data.anv: सः अहम् that I am, इच्छसि यदि if you so desire, ते to you, वाससहायः guard, भविष्यामि I shall be, दुर्गम् difficult, इदं कान्तारम् this forest, मृगराक्षससेवितम् full of wild animals and demons, तात dear, सलक्ष्मणे with Lakshmana, त्वयि you, याते having gone, सीताम् Sita, रक्षिष्ये will protect.
data.md: If you will, I shall become your help during your abode (in the woods). And, O child, I shall protect Sītā when you shall go out along with Laksimana.

data.v: जटायुषं तु प्रतिपूज्य राघवो; मुदा परिष्वज्य च संनतोऽभवत् । पितुर्हि शुश्राव सखित्वमात्मवा;ञ्जटायुषा संकथितं पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: Rama worshipped Jatayu and bending down, embraced him. He heard from him again and again several events relating to Jatayu's friendship with his father.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, तं जटायुषम् to that Jatayu, प्रतिपूज्य having worshipped, मुदा with joy, परिष्वज्य च having embraced, सन्नतः bent down, अभवत् he became, आत्मवान् selfpossessed Rama, जटायुषा with Jatayu, पुनः पुनः again and again, सङ्कथितम् narrated, पितुः father's, सखित्वम् friendship, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: There Rāghava paying homage to Jațāyu, and embracing him jcyfully, bent low; and that selfpossessed one listened to the story of Jațāyu's friendship with his father, as related by him repeatedly.

data.v: स तत्र सीतां परिदाय मैथिलीं; सहैव तेनातिबलेन पक्षिणा । जगाम तां पञ्चवटीं सलक्ष्मणो; रिपून्दिधक्षञ्शलभानिवानलः ।।
data.es: Entresting the protection of Sita, the princess of Mithila, to that strong vulture, Jatayu, and accompanied by Lakshmana Rama went to Panchavati wishing to destroy the enemies like fire burning the moths.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामयणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सः Rama, मैथिलीम् princess of Mithila, सीताम् Sita, परिदाय leaving the responsibility, सलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, अतिबलेन by very strong bird, तेन by that, पक्षिणासहैव with Jatayu, अनलः fire, शलभानिव like moths, रिपून् enemies, दिधक्षन् desirous of burning, तां पञ्चवटीम् that Panchavati, जगाम went.
data.md: Then consigning to that bird of exceeding strength, Mithila's daughter, Sita, Rama accompanied by Lakşmana went to Pañcavatī, destroying his foes and protecting the worlds.

data.v: ततः पञ्चवटीं गत्वा नानाव्यालमृगायुताम् । उवाच भ्रातरं रामो लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसं ।।
data.es: On reaching Panchavati, which was full of various vicious animals, Rama said to Lakshmana, his brother who was glowing like fire:
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, नानाव्यालमृगायुताम् filled with different kinds of vicious animals, पञ्चवटीम् Panchavati, गत्वा on going, दीप्ततेजसम् glowing like fire, भ्रातरम् brother, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, उवाच said.
data.md: Then repairing to Pañcavațī filled with various animals and beasts of prey, Rāma remarked to his brother Laksmana of flaming energy,

data.v: आगताः स्म यथोद्दिष्टममुं देशं महर्षिणा । अयं पञ्चवटी देशः सौम्य पुष्पितकाननः ।।
data.es: O handsome one, following the directions of the great sage, we have arrived at Panchavati, a place full of blossoming trees.
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome one, महर्षिणा by the great sage, यथोद्दिष्टम् as directed by, अमुम् to this,देशं place, आगताः स्म: we have come, पुष्पितपादपः (trees full of flowers) full of flowering trees, अयम् this, देशः place, पञ्चवटी Panchavati.
data.md: (Now) we have come to the place to which we had been directed by the ascetic This, O amiable one, is Pañcavați furnished with blossoming woods.

data.v: सर्वतश्चार्यतां दृष्टिः कानने निपुणो ह्यसि । आश्रमः कतरस्मिन्नो देशे भवति संमतः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana cast your eyes all around the forest for a suitable place (for building a hermitage). Indeed, you are good at judging things.

data.v: पद्मपत्रेक्षणः श्यामः श्रीमान्निरुदरो महान् । धर्मज्ञः सत्यवादी च ह्रीनिषेधो जितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: He has a blue complexion, a pair of eyes like lotus petals, a thin waist and long arms. He is selfrestrained, softspoken, sweettempered and truthful. He knows his duty and maintains a low profile. A subduer of enemies, he is heroic and great. Such Bharata has given up the diverse pleasures of life and has surrendered himself to you with all his soul.
data.anv: पद्मपत्रेक्षणः  with eyes like lotus petals, वीरः valiant, श्यामः  of blue complexion, निरुदरः of thin waist, महान् great, धर्मज्ञः knower of his duty, सत्यवादी च  truthful, ह्रीनिषेधः one who maintains a low profile,  जितेन्द्रियः self controlled, प्रियाभिभाषी  softspoken, मधुरः sweet in temperament, दीर्घबाहुः  longarmed, अरिन्दमः a subduer of enemies, विविधान् diverse, भोगान् pleasures, सन्त्यज्य  giving up, सर्वात्मना with all his efforts, आर्यम् your, श्रितः devoted to.
data.md: Of eyes resembling lotus petals, grey-hued, endued with grace, with a navel depressed, and mighty, Bharata understand righteousness, is truth-speaking, of restrained senses (in respect of other' wives) and also of subdued senses. And he speak fair, and is sweet-tempered, and longarmed and the vanquisher of foes. And renouncing various pleasures, he has devoted himself to the noble one.

data.v: प्रियाभिभाषी मधुरो दीर्घबाहुररिंदमः । संत्यज्य विविधान्सौख्यानार्यं सर्वात्मनाश्रितः ।।
data.es: He has a blue complexion, a pair of eyes like lotus petals, a thin waist and long arms. He is selfrestrained, softspoken, sweettempered and truthful. He knows his duty and maintains a low profile. A subduer of enemies, he is heroic and great. Such Bharata has given up the diverse pleasures of life and has surrendered himself to you with all his soul.

data.md: Of eyes resembling lotus petals, grey-hued, endued with grace, with a navel depressed, and mighty, Bharata understand righteousness, is truth-speaking, of restrained senses (in respect of other' wives) and also of subdued senses. And he speak fair, and is sweet-tempered, and longarmed and the vanquisher of foes. And renouncing various pleasures, he has devoted himself to the noble one.

data.v: जितः स्वर्गस्तव भ्रात्रा भरतेन महात्मना । वनस्थमपि तापस्ये यस्त्वामनुविधीयते ।।
data.es: Although you dwell in the forest, your great brother Bharata has won the kingdom of heaven by faithfully adopting your asceticism.
data.anv: यः who, वनस्थमपि dwelling in the forest, त्वाम् yourself, तापस्ये in adopting asceticism, अनुविधीयते faithfully follows, तव भ्रात्रा your brother, महात्मना great self, भरतेन by Bharata, स्वर्गः heaven, जितः won.
data.md: Your high-souled brother has secured heaven, since he, resorting to asceticism, is iinitating you that resident in the woods.

data.v: न पित्र्यमनुवर्न्तन्ते मातृकं द्विपदा इति । ख्यातो लोकप्रवादोऽयं भरतेनान्यथाकृतः ।।
data.es: The saying that men follow mother's path but not the path of the father, has been disproved by Bharata.
data.anv: द्विपदाः humans, पित्र्यम् father's, न अनुवर्तन्ते do not follow, मातृकम् mother's, इति this way, ख्यातः wellknown, अयम् this, लोकप्रवादः saying in the world, भरतेन by Bharata, अन्यथा otherwise, कृतः is rendered.
data.md: The saying that people follow their mother and not their father, is falsified in the case of Bharata.

data.v: भर्ता दशरथो यस्याः साधुश्च भरतः सुतः । कथं नु साम्बा कैकेयी तादृशी क्रूरदर्शिनी ।।
data.es: How could mother Kaikeyi, who has a husband like Dasaratha and a noble son like Bharata, be so wicked by nature ?
data.anv: यस्याः whose, दशरथः Dasaratha, भर्ता husband, साधुः noble, भरतः Bharata, सुतः son, सा she, अम्बा mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, तादृशी such a lady, क्रूरशीलिनी a woman of wicked nature, कथं नु how did it happen?
data.md: How can mother Kaikeyī, whose husband is Daśaratha and son the righteous Bharata, have such crooked way?

data.v: इत्येवं लक्ष्मणे वाक्यं स्नेहाद्ब्रुवति धार्मिके । परिवादं जनन्यास्तमसहन्राघवोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When pious Lakshmana said thus to Rama out of his love for him, Rama replied, unable to tolerate the words of censure against mother (Kaikeyi) :
data.anv: धार्मिके generous, लक्ष्मणे Lakshmana, स्नेहात् out of love, इत्येवम् in this way, वाक्यम् words, ब्रुवते as he was uttering, राघवः Rama, जनन्याः mother's, तम् him, परिवादम् censure, असहन् unable to tolerate, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: As the virtuous Lakṣmaṇa was speaking thus from affection, Rāghava, not bearing the blame cast upon his mother (Kaikeyi), said, My brother, you should by no means, tax our second mother. Do you talk of that lord of the Ikşvāku race, Bharata.

data.v: न तेऽम्बा मध्यमा तात गर्हितव्या कथंचन । तामेवेक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य भरतस्य कथां कुरु ।।
data.es: O dear, Kaikeyi, our second mother, is never to be criticised like that. You may, however, speak more of Bharata, the lord of the Iksvakus.
data.anv: तात dear, मध्यमा middle, अम्बा mother, कथञ्चन never, ते by you, न गर्हितव्या not to be criticised, इक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य of the lord of the Ikshvakus, भरतस्य Bharata's, तां कथामेव about him, कुरु you may.
data.md: As the virtuous Lakṣmaṇa was speaking thus from affection, Rāghava, not bearing the blame cast upon his mother (Kaikeyi), said, My brother, you should by no means, tax our second mother. Do you talk of that lord of the Ikşvāku race, Bharata.

data.v: निश्चितापि हि मे बुद्धिर्वनवासे दृढव्रता । भरतस्नेहसंतप्ता बालिशीक्रियते पुनः ।।
data.es: Even though I have made up my mind to dwell in the forest and keep my vow, my love for Bharata makes me waver like a child (Rama does not want Bharata to suffer on his account).
data.anv: मे my, बुद्धि: mind, निश्चितापि even though determined, वनवासे to dwell in the forest, दृढव्रता firmly to keep my vow, भरतस्नेहसन्तप्ता concern for his love of Bharata, पुनः again, बालिशीक्रियते waver like a child.
data.md: Albeit my mind is firm as regards my sojourn in the woods, yet is my mind unsteady, being inflained with affection for Bharata.

data.v: इत्येवं विलपंस्तत्र प्राप्य गोदावरीं नदीम् । चक्रेऽभिषेकं काकुत्स्थः सानुजः सह सीतया ।।
data.es: Expressing his grief in such manner, Rama reached Godavari where he took his bath with his brother and Sita.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: Kakutstha, (Rama) तत्र there, स इत्येवम् he in that manner, विलपन् crying aloud, गोदावरीं नदीम् to river Godavari, प्राप्य having reached, सानुजः with his brother, सीतया सह and with Sita, अभिषेकम् bath, चक्रे took.
data.md: Having bewailed thus, Kākutstha, coming to the river Godāvarī, there performed his ablutions in company with his younger brother and Sītā.

data.v: तर्पयित्वाथ सलिलैस्ते पितॄन्दैवतानि च । स्तुवन्ति स्मोदितं सूर्यं देवताश्च समाहिताः ।।
data.es: And then poised, they offered libations of water to their forefathers and gods and prayer to the rising Sun.
data.anv: अथ and then, ते they, सलिलैः with water, पितृ़न् forefathers, दैवतानि च and gods, तर्पयित्वा offered oblations, उदितम् risen, सूर्यम् Sun, देवताश्च deities also, समाहिताः poised together, स्तुवन्ति स्म sang in praise.
data.md: Then having offered his adorations with water to the gods and the pitrs, those sinless ones hymned the risen sun as well as the celestials.

data.v: कृताभिषेकः स रराज रामः; सीताद्वितीयः सह लक्ष्मणेन । कृताभिषेकस्त्वगराजपुत्र्या; रुद्रः सनन्दिर्भगवानिवेशः ।।
data.es: Accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana,Rama finished his bath in the river.He looked splendid like Lord Rudra followed by Nandi and the daughter of the king of the mountains (Parvati). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षोडशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सीताद्वितीयः accompanied by Sita, सः रामः that Rama, कृताभिषेकः completing his bath, सहलक्ष्मणेन along with Lakshmana, गिरिराजपुत्र्या with the daughter of the king of the mountains, कृताभिषेकः ablution over, सनन्दी along with Nandi, ईशः Isvara, रुद्रः इव like  Rudra, रराज shone.
data.md: Having with Sītā as the second and Laksmana, performed his bath. Rama looked beautiful like that lord the reverend Rudra in company with Nandi and the daughter of the king of mountains.

data.v: कृताभिषेको रामस्तु सीता सौमित्रिरेव च । तस्माद्गोदावरीतीरात्ततो जग्मुः स्वमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Ablution over, Rama, accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana, went back from the bank of the river Godabari to their hermitage.
data.anv: कृताभिषेकः bath over, रामस्तु Rama too, सीता Sita, सौमित्रिरेव च and also Lakshmana, ततः then, तस्मात् therefrom, गोदावरीतीरात् from the bank of Godavari, स्वम् their, आश्रमम् hermitage, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Having bathed, Rāma Sītā and Sumitrā's son went to their own asylum from the banks of the Godāvarī.

data.v: आश्रमं तमुपागम्य राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः । कृत्वा पौर्वाह्णिकं कर्म पर्णशालामुपागमत् ।।
data.es: On reaching the hermitage, Rama and Lakshmana performed the forenoon rituals and entered the leafthatched cottage.
data.anv: सहलक्ष्मणः accompanied by Lakshmana, राघवः Rama, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitage, उपागम्य on reaching, पौर्वाह्णिकम् rituals to be performed in the forenoon, कर्म rituals, कृत्वा after doing, पर्णशालाम् cottage thatched with leaves, उपागमत् went in.
data.md: Arriving at the asylum, Rāghava along with Lakşmana, performing his morning devotions, entered the cottage.

data.v: स रामः पर्णशालायामासीनः सह सीतया । विरराज महाबाहुश्चित्रया चन्द्रमा इव । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चकार विविधाः कथाः ।।
data.es: Honoured by the ascetics , Rama stayed there peacefully with brother Lakshmana, discussing diverse matters (from time to time).
data.anv: महर्षिभिः by ascetics, पूज्यमानः worshipped by, तत्र there, सुखितः peacefully, उवास stayed, भ्रात्रा brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, विविधाः diverse, कथाः talks, चकार making.
data.md: And honoured of the Maharsis, Rāma happily dwelt in that cottage; and seated with Sītā that mighty-armed one looked like the moon in conjunction with Citrā. And he carried on various converse with his brother Lakşınana.

data.v: तदासीनस्य रामस्य कथासंसक्तचेतसः । तं देशं राक्षसी काचिदाजगाम यदृच्छया ।।
data.es: While Rama was thus seated, engrossed in conversation, there incidentally appeared a demoness.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, कथासंसक्तचेतसः  engrossed in conversation, तथा like that, आसीनस्य while he was sitting, काचित् one, राक्षसी demoness, यदृच्छया by chance, तं देशम् to that place, आजगाम came.

data.v: सा तु शूर्पणखा नाम दशग्रीवस्य रक्षसः । भगिनी राममासाद्य ददर्श त्रिदशोपमम् ।।
data.es: Surpanakha, sister of the tenheaded demon (Ravana) approached Rama shining like a god.
data.anv: राक्षसः demon, दशग्रीवस्य of the tenheaded (Ravana), भगिनी sister, शूर्पणखा नाम by name Surpanakha, सा तु she, त्रिदशोपमम्  resembling god, रामम् Rama, आसाद्य near, ददर्श saw.

data.v: सिंहोरस्कं महाबाहुं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् । सुकुमारं महासत्त्वं पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितम् ।।
राममिन्दीवरश्यामं कन्दर्पसदृशप्रभम् । बभूवेन्द्रोपमं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसी काममोहिता ।।
data.md: And beholding Rāma dark-blue like the lotus, and becoming like Kandarpa himself, and resembling Indra, the Rākşasi was maddened with desire.

data.v: सुमुखं दुर्मुखी रामं वृत्तमध्यं महोदरी । विशालाक्षं विरूपाक्षी सुकेशं ताम्रमूर्धजा ।।
data.md: Rāma graced with beauteous continence, that Raksasi had a hideous face; Ráma had a slender waist, she had a huge abdomen; he had expansive eyes, she had terrible eyes; he was gifted with an elegant head of hair, she had coppery hair; Rāma was of a dear presence, she was of an unsightly presence; Rāma had a sonorous voice, she had a hideous voice.

data.v: प्रियरूपं विरूपा सा सुस्वरं भैरवस्वना । तरुणं दारुणा वृद्धा दक्षिणं वामभाषिणी ।।
न्यायवृत्तं सुदुर्वृत्ता प्रियमप्रियदर्शना । शरीरजसमाविष्टा राक्षसी राममब्रवीत् ।।
जटी तापसरूपेण सभार्यः शरचापधृक् । आगतस्त्वमिमं देशं कथं राक्षससेवितम् ।।
data.es: O Rama you are wearing matted hair like an ascetic, but living with your wife and holding bow and arrows. What brings you to this place haunted by demons ? You should tell me the truth ?
data.anv: त्वम् you, जटी  having matted hair, सभार्यः  with your wife, शरचापधृत्  holding bow and arrows, तापसरूपेण in the form of an ascetic, राक्षससेवितम् haunted by demons, इमं this, देशम् place, कथम् how, आगतः have you come, ते your, आगमनकृत्यम् reason for coming, किम् what, तत्वम् truth, अख्यातुम् to tell, अर्हसि  should.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु राक्षस्या शूर्पणख्या परंतपः । ऋजुबुद्धितया सर्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Thus asked by the demoness Surpanakha, Rama, scorcher of foes began telling her everything due to his simplemindedness.
data.anv: राक्षस्या by the demoness, शूर्पणख्या by Surpanakha, एवम् in that way, उक्तः  asked, परन्तपः a scorcher of foes, ऋजुबुद्धितया  due to simplemindedness, सर्वम् everything, आख्यातुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे started.
data.md: Thus accosted by the Rākṣasī, Śūrpanakhă, that subduer of his foes from sincerity of disposition began to relate everything;

data.v: आसीद्दशरथो नाम राजा त्रिदशविक्रमः । तस्याहमग्रजः पुत्रो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः ।।
data.es: (Rama replied) There was a king named Dasaratha who was mighty like the gods. I am his eldest son known among the people as Rama.
data.anv: त्रिदशविक्रमः  mighty like the gods, दशरथो नाम Dasaratha by name, राजा king, आसीत् was, अहम् I am, तस्य his, अग्रजः eldest, पुत्रः son, रामो Rama, नाम by name, जनैः by people, श्रुतः heard.
data.md: There was a king named Dasaratha endued with the prowess of a celestial. I am his eldest son known among men by the name of Rāma.

data.v: भ्रातायं लक्ष्मणो नाम यवीयान्मामनुव्रतः । इयं भार्या च वैदेही मम सीतेति विश्रुता ।।
data.es: Here is Lakshmana , my younger brother, who always follows me . And this is the daughter of the king of Videha and my wife, wellknown as Sita.
data.anv: अयम् he is, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, यवीयान् younger one, भ्राता brother, माम् to me, अनुव्रतः always following me, वैदेही  daughter of king of Videha, इयम् this, मम my, भार्या wife, सीतेति as Sita, विश्रुता wellknown.
data.md: This is my younger brother (named) Laks inana, (ever)serving me. This is my wife, known by the name of Sītā.

data.v: नियोगात्तु नरेन्द्रस्य पितुर्मातुश्च यन्त्रितः । धर्मार्थं धर्मकाङ्क्षी च वनं वस्तुमिहागतः ।।
data.es: I have come here, commanded by the king, my father and mother.Intending to obey the orders of my father, and impelled by duty to establish righteousness I have come to reside here.
data.anv: नरेन्द्रस्य king's, पितुः father's, मातुश्च and mother's, नियोगात् by the order, यन्त्रितः impelled, धर्मकाङ्क्षी च one desirous of establishing righteousness, धर्मार्थम् for the sake of duty, इह here, वस्तुम् to reside, वनम् to the forest, आगतः I have come.
data.md: Commanded by my father and mother, I in obedience their mandate, desirous of acquiring religious merits, have for the purpose of securing righteousness, come to the forest for dwelling here.

data.v: त्वां तु वेदितुमिच्छामि कथ्यतां कासि कस्य वा । इह वा किंनिमित्तं त्वमागता ब्रूहि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: I wish to know who you are. Tell me who your kins are. With lovely limbs you do not appear to be a demoness.
data.anv: त्वाम् you, वेदितुम् to know, इच्छामि I wish, कथ्यताम् you may speak, क्व who, असि you are, कस्य वा whose, मनोज्ञाङ्गी a woman of beautiful limbs, राक्षसी demoness, मे to me, न प्रतिभासि seem not.
data.md: I also am anxious to know you. Whose daughter are you? And what is your name, and what your lineage? Possessed of a captivating form, you appear to me as a Rākşasī. Tell me truly why you have come here. to

data.v: साब्रवीद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षसी मदनार्दिता । श्रूयतां राम वक्ष्यामि तत्त्वार्थं वचनं मम ।।
data.md: Hearing these words the Rákşasi, afflicted with lust said, Listen, O Rāma. I will relate everything truly. I am a Räkșasī, capable of wearing shapes at will. My name in Śūrpanakhā.

data.v: अहं शूर्पणखा नाम राक्षसी कामरूपिणी । अरण्यं विचरामीदमेका सर्वभयंकरा ।।
data.es: My name is Surpanakha. I am a demoness who can assume any form at will, I move in this forest alone, unleashing a reign of terror.
data.anv: अहम् myself, शूर्पणखा नाम is Surpanakha by name, कामरूपिणी assume the form I desire, राक्षसी a demoness, एका alone, सर्वभयङ्करा can terrorise all creatures, इदम् this, अरण्यम् forest, विचरामि I move about.

data.v: रावणो नाम मे भ्राता राक्षसो राक्षसेश्वरः । प्रवृद्धनिद्रश्च सदा कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः ।।
data.anv: बलीयान् strongman, वीरः a hero, विश्रवस: Visrava's, पुत्रः son, रावणो नाम by name Ravana, राक्षसेश्वरः lord for all demons, मे my, भ्राता brother, ते to you, श्रोत्रम् is heard,यदि I suppose.

data.v: विभीषणस्तु धर्मात्मा न तु राक्षसचेष्टितः । प्रख्यातवीर्यौ च रणे भ्रातरौ खरदूषणौ ।।
data.es: Kumbhakarna is another brother of mine. He is very strong. He is always in deep sleep. Vibhisna another brother. He is righteous free from any demoniac trait. My other two brothers are Khara and Dusana who are wellknown heroes of war.
data.anv: सदा always, प्रवृद्धनिद्रः in deep sleep, महाबलः very strong, कुम्भकर्णः च Kumbhakarna, धर्मात्मा a righteous one, विभीषणस्तु Vibhisana also, तु but, राक्षसचेष्टितः nature of the demon, न not, रणे in war, प्रख्यातवीर्यौ both very wellknown heroes, खरदूषणौ च Khara and Dusana, भ्रातरौ two  brothers.
data.md: My brother Råvana is a valiant son of Viśravā if you have heard of him. And he that is given to long sleep-the mighty Kumbhakarna, the righteous Vibhīşaņa, who never serves the Rākşasas, and the brothers Khara and Düşaņa renowned in conflict (are also my brothers).

data.v: तानहं समतिक्रान्ता राम त्वापूर्वदर्शनात् । समुपेतास्मि भावेन भर्तारं पुरुषोत्तमम् । चिराय भव भर्ता मे सीतया किं करिष्यसि ।।
data.es: Setting them aside, I came here, as soon as I saw you. You are the finest among men and I am here wishing you to be my husband.
data.anv: राम O Rama, अहम् I, तान् them, समतिक्रान्ता transgressing all of them, पूर्वदर्शनात् as soon as I saw, पुरुषोत्तमम् finest of men, त्वा you, भर्तारम् as husband, भावेन with that feeling, समुपेता  approached, अस्मि I am.
data.md: O Rāma, I have surpassed them all (in prowess). At first sight of you, I approach you, you best of men, as iny husband, with (feelings of) love.

data.v: विकृता च विरूपा च न सेयं सदृशी तव । अहमेवानुरूपा ते भार्यारूपेण पश्य माम् ।।
data.es: She is ugly, deformed, unsuitable for you. I am alone fit for you. Look upon me as your wife.
data.anv: विकृता च an ugly form, विरूपा च deformed too, इयम् this woman, तव your, न सदृशी is not suitable to you, ते you, अहमेव I alone, अनुरूपा suitable, माम् me, भार्यारूपेण as wife, पश्य look upon.
data.md: Deformed and unsightly, she is not worthy of you. I am fit for you. Do you look upon me as a wife.

data.v: इमां विरूपामसतीं करालां निर्णतोदरीम् । अनेन सह ते भ्रात्रा भक्षयिष्यामि मानुषीम् ।।
data.es: I will devour your brother along with this disfigured, unchaste and fearful lady with a flat belly.
data.anv: विरूपाम् deformed, असतीम् unchaste, करालाम् frightful, निर्णतोदरीम् flat bellied woman, इमां मानुषीम् to this lady, ते भ्रात्रासह along with your brother, भक्षयिष्यामि I will eat up.
data.md: This unsightly, grim unchaste and human one with me, with a lean abdomen, will I devour up, along with this brother of yours.

data.v: ततः पर्वतशृङ्गाणि वनानि विविधानि च । पश्यन्सह मया कान्त दण्डकान्विचरिष्यसि ।।
data.es: O darling, thereafter you can keep wandering with me in this Dandaka forest, enjoying the beauty of the mountain tops and forests.
data.anv: कान्त O darling, ततः thereafter, पर्वतशृङ्गाणि tops of mountains, विविधानि many kinds, वनानि च forests also, पश्यन् while seeing, मया सह with me, दण्डकान् Dandaka forest, विचरिष्यसि will wander.
data.md: Then having your wish, in company you will range the Daņdakas, surveying the various mountain summits and forests.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्तः काकुत्स्थः प्रहस्य मदिरेक्षणाम् । इदं वचनमारेभे वक्तुं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: Thus addressed, Rama, skilled in speech, laughed and started speaking to that woman of bewitching eyes.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: इत्येवम् in this way, उक्तः said, वाक्यविशारदः expert in speech, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, प्रहस्य laughing, मदिरेक्षणाम् to her with bewitching eyes, इदं वचनम् these words, वक्तुम् to speak, आरेभे started.
data.md: Thus addressed, Kākutstha having charming eyes, well skilled in speech, with a smile, began to speak thus.

data.v: तां तु शूर्पणखां रामः कामपाशावपाशिताम् । स्वेच्छया श्लक्ष्णया वाचा स्मितपूर्वमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: To Surpanakha bound by the noose of passion Rama with a smile replied in a clear, lucid manner:
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, कामपाशावपाशिताम् to one who was overcome by lust, शूर्पणखाम् to Surpanakha, स्वच्छया with clear, श्लक्ष्णया with lucid, वाचा with words, स्मितपूर्वम् with a smile, अथ then, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: With a smile, Rāma jestingly addressed Śūrpanakhā who had been ensnared in the noose of love, in soft words.

data.v: कृतदारोऽस्मि भवति भार्येयं दयिता मम । त्वद्विधानां तु नारीणां सुदुःखा ससपत्नता ।।
data.es: O lady I am married and here is my wife who is dear to me. To be a cowife to some one is indeed painful for people like you.
data.anv: भवति O Lady, कृतदारः married, अस्मि I am, इयम् this woman, मम myself, दयिता dear, भार्या wife, त्वद्विधानाम् of people like you, नारीणाम् for women, ससपत्नता being a cowife, सुदुःखा very painful.
data.md: Gentle one, I am already wedded; this is my beloved wife. To females like to you co-wifehood is exceedingly miserable.

data.v: अनुजस्त्वेष मे भ्राता शीलवान्प्रियदर्शनः । श्रीमानकृतदारश्च लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Here is my younger brother Lakshmana. He is a man of good conduct, good look, valiant and virtuous. (Besides) he is not with his wife.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणो नाम by name Lakshmana, एषः this man, मे my, अनुजः younger, भ्राता brother, शीलवान् a man of good conduct, प्रियदर्शनः goodlooking, श्रीमान् virtuous,  अकृतदारश्च single, वीर्यवान् heroic.
data.md: This young brother of mine is good-looking, and is of an excellent character; he is graceful, and is still unwived. The powerful one is named Laksmana. He has not yet tested the pleasures of a wife's company, and is desirous of having a spouse. And he is youthful and of an inviting presence. He will become a fit husband for you, considering this your beauty.

data.v: अपूर्वी भार्यया चार्थी तरुणः प्रियदर्शनः । अनुरूपश्च ते भर्ता रूपस्यास्य भविष्यति ।।
data.es: He is not with his wife, and is in need of one. He is young, handsome and worthy. He will be an appropriate husband to you.
data.anv: अपूर्वी not accompanied by his, भार्यया wife, अर्थी a man in need, तरुणः young, प्रियदर्शनः handsome, ते to your, रूपस्य beauty, अनुरूपः worthy of, भर्ता husband, भविष्यति will be.

data.v: एनं भज विशालाक्षि भर्तारं भ्रातरं मम । असपत्ना वरारोहे मेरुमर्कप्रभा यथा ।।
