data.es: Very powerful kings assume five forms like fire, Indra, Moon, Varuna and Yama.
data.anv: अमितौजस: very powerful , राजानः kings, अग्नेः of fire, इन्द्रस्य of Indra, सोमस्य Moon's, वरुणस्य Varuna's, यमस्य च and of lord of death, पञ्च five, रूपाणि forms, धारयन्ति will assume.
data.md: Sovereigns of superb prowess assume the semblance of five deities–Agni, Indra, Moon, Yama, and Varuna. Powerful kings, O Ranger of the night, assume haughtiness, power, a placid look and contentment and administer punishment to the wicked.

data.v: तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु मान्याः पूज्याश्च पार्थिवाः । त्वं तु धर्ममविज्ञाय केवलं मोहमास्थितः ।।
अभ्यागतं मां दौरात्म्यात्परुषं वदसीदृशम् । गुणदोषौ न पृच्छामि क्षमं चात्मनि राक्षस । अस्मिंस्तु स भवान्कृत्ये साहाय्यं कर्तुमर्हति ।।
सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः । प्रलोभयित्वा वैदेहीं यथेष्टं गन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Be a wonderful golden deer dappled with silver dots and roam in front of Sita in Rama's hermitage.
data.anv: त्वम् you, रजतबिन्दुभिः dappled with silver dots, चित्रः wonderful, सौवर्णः golden, मृगः deer, भूत्वा  become, तस्य रामस्य that Rama's, आश्रमे in hermitage, सीतायाः of Sita, प्रमुखे in front, चर move.
data.md: Listen what you shall have to do at my request in my aid; assuming the shape of a deer having golden skin painted with silvery drops do you proceed to the asylum of Rāma, and ranging at large before Vaidehī do you after captivating her take your wished-for way.

data.v: त्वां तु मायामृगं दृष्ट्वा काञ्चनं जातविस्मया । आनयैनमिति क्षिप्रं रामं वक्ष्यति मैथिली ।।
data.es: Seeing the illusory golden deer, Sita, wonderstruck, will at once ask Rama to get the deer.
data.anv: मैथिली Sita, काञ्चनम् golden, मायामृगम् illusory deer, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, जातविस्मया  wonderstruck, एनं this deer, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आनय get me, इति thus, रामम् Rama, वक्ष्यति will say.
data.md: Vaidehi, being struck with wonder seeing you a golden deer capable of illusions, shall request Rāma to get you soon for her.

data.v: अपक्रान्ते च काकुत्स्थे लक्ष्मणे च यथासुखम् । आनयिष्यामि वैदेहीं सहस्राक्षः शचीमिव ।।
data.es: When Rama and Lakshmana are away I will comfortably abduct Vaidehi like the thousandeyed Indra brought Sachi.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थे when Rama, लक्ष्मणे च and Lakshmana, अपक्रान्ते are away, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Indra, शचीमिव like Sachi, यथासुखम् comfortably, आनयिष्यामि will get Sita.
data.md: When both Rāma and Laksmana shall go elsewhere in this way, I shall to my felicity carry away Vaidehī like to the thousand-eyed deity carrying away Sací.

data.v: एवं कृत्वा त्विदं कार्यं यथेष्टं गच्छ राक्षस । राज्यस्यार्धं प्रदास्यामि मारीच तव सुव्रत ।।
data.es: You may go wherever you want after accomplishing this task. I will give you, O demon of determination half my kingdom.
data.anv: राक्षस O demon, इदम् this, कार्यम् work, एवम् in that way, कृत्वा having done, यथेष्टम् wherever you please, गच्छ go, सुव्रत a person of good determination, मारीच Maricha, तव to you, राज्यस्य of my kingdom, अर्धम् half, प्रयच्छामि I will offer.
data.md: O Rākşasa, do you go wherever you like after doing this. I shall confer on you, O Mārīca, half of my kingdom.

data.v: गच्छ सौम्य शिवं मार्गं कार्यस्यास्य विवृद्धये । प्राप्य सीतामयुद्धेन वञ्चयित्वा तु राघवम् । लङ्कां प्रति गमिष्यामि कृतकार्यः सह त्वया ।।
data.es: Go and accomplish this task. Let your path be auspicious. I will follow you on the chariot into the Dandaka forest.
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of this task, विवृद्धये for fulfilment, शिवम् auspicious, मार्गम् path, गच्छ go, अहम् I, सरथः riding on the chariot, दण्डकावनम् to Dandaka forest, अनुगमिष्यामि I will follow.
data.md: Acquiring Sītā without any conflict, after imposing upon Rāma I shall return to Lankā successful along with you.

data.v: एतत्कार्यमवश्यं मे बलादपि करिष्यसि । राज्ञो हि प्रतिकूलस्थो न जातु सुखमेधते ।।
data.es: O Maricha if you do not do this, I will kill you now. Or, by force make you do this work. No one who goes against the king lives in comfort.
data.anv: मारीच Maricha, न करोषि चेत् if you do not do this, अहम् I, अद्य वै now itself, हन्मि I will kill, मे myself, एतत् this, कार्यम् task, बलादपि forcibly also , अवश्यम् certainly, करिष्यसि will make you do, राज्ञः to the king, प्रतिकूलस्थः against, जातु generally, सुखम् in comfort, न एधते हि will not live.
data.md: I shall kill you, O Mārīca, if do you not obey my behest. I shall compel you to do this. No body can attain to prosperity and happiness, acting against his sovereign's will.

data.v: आसाद्य तं जीवितसंशयस्ते; मृत्युर्ध्रुवो ह्यद्य मया विरुध्य । एतद्यथावत्परिगृह्य बुद्ध्या; यदत्र पथ्यं कुरु तत्तथा त्वम् ।।
data.es: Your survival is doubtful after facing Rama in combat. But your death is certain if you oppose me now. Think carefuly and do whatever is desirable for you in the present circumstances.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तम् to him, आसाद्य  facing in a combat, ते to you, जीवितसंशयः doubtful to be alive, मया with me, विरुध्य  picking up, अद्य now, मृत्युः death, ध्रुवः sure, एतत् as such, बुद्ध्या think, यथावत् do as you like, प्रतिगृह्य accept, अत्र here, यत् whatever, पथ्यम्  desirable, तत् that, त्वम् you, तथा like that, कुरु do.
data.md: Truly shall you risk your life if you approaches Rāma, but you shall meet with sure destruction if do you act against my will. Consider about it, and do what you think proper.

data.v: आज्ञप्तो राजवद्वाक्यं प्रतिकूलं निशाचरः । अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं मारीचो राक्षसाधिपम् ।।
data.es: At this royal command which was against his interest Maracha used harsh words to the demonking:
data.anv: निशाचरः demon, प्रतिकूलम् adversely, राजवत् royal, आज्ञप्तः commanded, मारीचः Maricha, राक्षसाधिपम् to the king of the demons, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Being thus commended by Rāvana like a king to act against his will Mārica fearlessly addressed the lord of the Rākṣasas with the following bold words.

data.v: केनायमुपदिष्टस्ते विनाशः पापकर्मणा । सपुत्रस्य सराष्ट्रस्य सामात्यस्य निशाचर ।।
data.es: Who is that sinner who has given you this advice which will spell destruction on you, your sons, your kingdom and your ministers ?
data.anv: निशाचर Ravana, सपुत्रस्य with your sons, सराष्ट्रस्य with the kingdom, सामात्यस्य with the ministers, ते to you, अयम् this, विनाशः destruction, पापकर्मणा sinful action, केन by whom, उपदिष्टः advised.
data.md: What person of impious deeds has advised you ( ranger of the night thus in order to exterminate you with your kingdom, counsellors and children?

data.v: कस्त्वया सुखिना राजन्नाभिनन्दति पापकृत् । केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते मृत्युद्वारमुपायतः ।।
data.es: Which sinner is not able to see you happy? O king by whom is this gate of death shown to you cunningly?
data.anv: राजन् king, कः who, पापकृत् sinner, सुखिना happy one, त्वया by you, नाभिनन्दति not tolerate, मृत्युद्वारम् death gate, इदम् this, केन by whom, ते you, उपायतः cunningly, उपदिष्टम्  advised.
data.md: Who of a vicious heart, O King, dose not feel himself happy at your welfare? Who has pointed out to you the way of your death under the cover of your means?

data.v: शत्रवस्तव सुव्यक्तं हीनवीर्या निशाचर । इच्छन्ति त्वां विनश्यन्तमुपरुद्धं बलीयसा ।।
data.es: This is clear that your enemy demons are now powerless. Hence they want you to be engaged with a stronger power and be destroyed.
data.anv: तव your, शत्रवः enemies, हीनवीर्याः deprived of valour, निशाचराः demons, त्वाम् you, बलीयसा by a strong person, उपरुद्धम् obstructed, विनश्यन्तम् being destroyed, इच्छन्ति they like, सुव्यक्तम् it is very clear,
data.md: O Ranger of night surely do your weak enemies wish to bring about your destruction by making you enter into a conflict with a powerful man.

data.v: केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते क्षुद्रेणाहितवादिना । यस्त्वामिच्छति नश्यन्तं स्वकृतेन निशाचर ।।
data.es: O Ravana by which mean fellow is this advice given against your welfare? Who wants you to be destroyed by your own action.
data.anv: निशाचर O nightwalker (Ravana), यः he who, त्वाम् to you, स्वकृतेन by your own action, नश्यन्तम् being destroyed, इच्छति wishes, क्षुद्रेण by a mean fellow, अहितवादिना one who gives wrong advice, केन by whom, इदम् this, ते to you, उपदिष्टम् advised.
data.md: What little-minded man of evil intent has counselled you thus? O Ranger of night, really do they desire that you do bring destruction upon yourself by your own actions.

data.v: वध्याः खलु न हन्यन्ते सचिवास्तव रावण । ये त्वामुत्पथमारूढं न निगृह्णन्ति सर्वशः ।।
data.es: O Ravana the ministers should have prevented you by all means from adopting this wrong path. Since they have not done so, they deserve to be spain.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, उत्पथम् wrong path, आरूढम् you ascended, त्वाम् you, ये those, सर्वशः by all means, न निगृह्णन्ति do not prevent, तव सचिवाः your ministers, वध्याः खलु deserve to be slayed, न हन्यन्ते they are not slain?
data.md: You do not exterminate your counsellors O Rāvana, albeit they are worthy of being destroyed. For they do not prevent these entirely from your evil course.

data.v: अमात्यैः कामवृत्तो हि राजा कापथमाश्रितः । निग्राह्यः सर्वथा सद्भिर्न निग्राह्यो निगृह्यसे ।।
data.es: Good ministrers should always prevent a lustful king from taking resourse to an evil path. Why were you not stopped, even though you deserve to be checked.
data.anv: कामवृत्तः lustful, कापथम् evil path, आश्रितः resorted to, राजा king, सद्भि: by the good people, अमात्यैः by ministers, सर्वथा always, निग्राह्यः हि should be stopped, निग्राह्यः prevent, न निगृह्यसे not prevented.
data.md: Wise counsellors do always restrain a king who wends a vicious track being guided by his impulses and passions; but about you they are quite unmindful, though you should by every means be brought under restraint.

data.v: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च यशश्च जयतां वर । स्वामिप्रसादात्सचिवाः प्राप्नुवन्ति निशाचर ।।
data.es: O Ravana the best among the successful ministers attain piety, prosperity, pleasures and fame by the grace of the king.
data.anv: जयताम् among the successful, वर best, निशाचर demons, Ravana, सचिवाः ministers, धर्मम् righteousness, अर्थं च prosperity, कामं च and pleasures, यशश्च and fame, स्वामिप्रसादात् by the grace of the king, प्राप्नुवन्ति attain.
data.md: O you the best of conquerors, O you the ranger of high, ministers by the grace of their sovereign attain virtue, wealth, desires and fame.

data.v: विपर्यये तु तत्सर्वं व्यर्थं भवति रावण । व्यसनं स्वामिवैगुण्यात्प्राप्नुवन्तीतरे जनाः ।।
data.es: Otherwise evrything will become useless, O Ravana Others will suffer calamities on account of their master's vices.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, विपर्यये if it be otherwise, तत् then, सर्वम् everything (the four attainments), व्यर्थं भवति will become useless, स्वामि वैगुण्यात् by the vices of the king, इतरे जनाः others, व्यसनम् calamity, प्राप्नुवन्ति suffer.
data.md: But those objects are never attained O Rāvana when they are not in good odour with their sovereign; moreover the subjects meet with dangers when he is devoid of all qualities.

data.v: राजमूलो हि धर्मश्च जयश्च जयतां वर । तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु रक्षितव्यो नराधिपः ।।
data.es: O Ravana, the best among the victorious indeed the king is at the root of righteousness and victory.Therefore, the king should be protected by all at every stage.
data.anv: जयताम् among the victorious, वर best one, धर्मश्च righteousness, जयश्च victory, राजमूल: the king is the root, हि indeed, तस्मात् therefore, सर्वासु in all, अवस्थासु stages, नराधिपाः kings, रक्षितव्याः deserve to be protected.
data.md: O you the best of conquerors, the king is the root of virtue and fame to the subjects; he should therefore be always protected by them.

data.v: राज्यं पालयितुं शक्यं न तीक्ष्णेन निशाचर । न चापि प्रतिकूलेन नाविनीतेन राक्षस ।।
data.es: O nightwalking demon a kingdom cannnot be governed by a king who is rude or hostile or impolite.
data.anv: राक्षस demons, निशाचर nightwalker, तीक्ष्णेन by a rude one, राज्यम् kingdom, पालयितुम् to rule, न शक्यम् is not possible, प्रतिकूलेन by a hostile one, न not, अविनीतेन by an impolite one, न not.
data.md: O ranger of night, proud kings of cruel temperament, acting against the subjects can never administer their kingdoms.

data.v: ये तीक्ष्णमन्त्राः सचिवा भज्यन्ते सह तेन वै । विषमेषु रथाः शीघ्रं मन्दसारथयो यथा ।।
data.es: Ministers who adopt improper strategies go down along with the king just like swift horses driven by a slow charioteer on a rugged terrain.
data.anv: ये whoever, सचिवाः ministers, तीक्ष्णमन्त्राः who adopt improper strategies, मन्दसारथयः when the charioteer is driving slow, शीघ्राः swiftly, तुरगाः horses, विषमे यथा on a rugged surface, likewise, तेन by that, सह along with, भज्यन्ते वै are overthrown.
data.md: So do the ministers of cruel counsel meet with their end like to a chariot driven into a wild track by an unskilled charioteer.

data.v: बहवः साधवो लोके युक्तधर्ममनुष्ठिताः । परेषामपराधेन विनष्टाः सपरिच्छदाः ।।
data.es: There were many pious men in this world who practise yoga and dharma .They have been destroyed along with their retinue due to mistakes committed by others.
data.anv: लोके in the world, युक्ताः absorbed in, धर्मम् righteous ways, अनुष्ठिताः followers, बहवः many, साधव: pious people, परेषाम् of others, अपराधेन by their mistake, सपरिच्छदाः along with all their followers, विनष्टाः are destroyed.
data.md: Many persons pious and devoted to asceticism on this earth have met with destruction for another's misdeeds.

data.v: स्वामिना प्रतिकूलेन प्रजास्तीक्ष्णेन रावण । रक्ष्यमाणा न वर्धन्ते मेषा गोमायुना यथा ।।
data.es: O Ravana, people who are ruled by a cruel and hostile king will not grow like the sheep protected by a jackal.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, प्रतिकूलेन by an unfavourable, तीक्ष्णेन by a rude one, स्वामिना by the  master, रक्ष्यमाणाः protected, प्रजाः people, गोमायुना by a jackal, मेषाः यथा like sheep, न वर्धन्ते do not grow.
data.md: Verily the subjects, O Ravana, can never expect to prosper under the regime of hotnatured sovereigns acting against their subjects like to deer under the protection of a jackal.

data.v: अवश्यं विनशिष्यन्ति सर्वे रावण राक्षसाः । येषां त्वं कर्कशो राजा दुर्बुद्धिरजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Under a rude, crooked king whose senses are not under his control the demons will surely perish.
data.anv: रावण O Ravana, येषाम् of whom, कर्कशः  rude , दुर्बुद्धि: evilminded, अजितेन्द्रियः having no control over the senses, त्वम् you, राजा king, सर्वे all, राक्षसाः demons, अवश्यम् surely, विनशिष्यन्ति perish.
data.md: All the Rākşasas shall surely die, O Rāvana whose lord are you, foolish, cruel and under the control of your passions.

data.v: तदिदं काकतालीयं घोरमासादितं त्वया । अत्र किं शोभनं यत्त्वं ससैन्यो विनशिष्यसि ।।
data.es: I am faced with this dreadful disaster accidentally. You will not only be in a miserable state because of your misdeeds, you will perish along with your army.
data.anv: मया I, काकतालीयम् accidental, घोरम् dreadful, तत् that, इदम् this, आसादितम् reached, अत्र here, किम् what, त्वम् you, शोचनीयः deplorable, ससैन्यः along with your army, विनशिष्यसि   will perish.
data.md: I shall not be the least sorry if I do meet with a sudden accident—what I do deplore most is that you shall meet in no time with destruction along with your soldiery.

data.v: मां निहत्य तु रामोऽसौ नचिरात्त्वां वधिष्यति । अनेन कृतकृत्योऽस्मि म्रिये यदरिणा हतः ।।
data.es: Rama will kill you not long after killing me.Hence even if I die in the hands of the enemy, my desire will be fulfilled.
data.anv: रामः Rama, माम् me, निहत्य after killing, न चिरात् soon, त्वाम् you, वधिष्यति will kill, अरिणा by the enemy, हतः slayed, म्रियेयम् I will die, अनेन by this, कृतकृत्यः accomplished, अस्मि I will be.
data.md: Compassing my end Rāma shall exterminate you in no time and blessed I shall be being killed by an enemy in the conflict.

data.v: दर्शनादेव रामस्य हतं मामुपधारय । आत्मानं च हतं विद्धि हृत्वा सीतां सबान्धवम् ।।
data.es: Yu most understand that if I die at the very sight of Rama, you along with your relatives will perish with the abduction of Sita.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, दर्शनादेव by mere sight, माम् me, हतम् a dead one, अवधारय presume, सीताम् Sita, हृत्वा abducting, सबान्धवम् along with your kith and kin, आत्मानम् yourself, हतम् killed, विद्धि  understand.
data.md: Surely do you know that no sooner shall I see Rāma I shall be done away with; you shall carrying away Sītā meet with your end along with your kinsmen.

data.v: आनयिष्यसि चेत्सीतामाश्रमात्सहितो मया । नैव त्वमसि नैवाहं नैव लङ्का न राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: If you bring Sita from the hermitage with my assistance, know that none of us will surviveyou nor I, nor Lanka , nor the demons.
data.anv: मया सहितः along with me, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, सीताम् Sita, आनयिष्यसि चेत् if you bring, त्वम् नैव असि you will not survive, अहं च I also, न लङ्का nor Lanka, नैव not, राक्षसाः demons, न not.
data.md: And if do you bring Şītā with me from the asylum, none shall be saved, me, yourself, the city of Lankā and the Rākşasas.

data.v: निवार्यमाणस्तु मया हितैषिणा; न मृष्यसे वाक्यमिदं निशाचर । परेतकल्पा हि गतायुषो नरा; हितं न गृह्णन्ति सुहृद्भिरीरितम् ।।
data.es: O Ravana, you do not understand this word of warning coming from your wellwisher. Men who are going to die do not heed the advice given by their friends.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: निशाचर Ravana, हितैषिणा by your wellwisher, मया by me, निवार्यमाणः  warned, इदम् this, वाक्यम् words, न मृष्यसे do not comprehend, गतायुषः men of reduced life span, परेतकल्पाः almost dead, नराः people, सुहृद्भि: by friends, ईरितम् told, हितम्  good advice, न गृह्णन्ति हि not accept.
data.md: You do not relish my words O ranger of the night though prevented by me, who wishes you welfare; those men who range on the verge of death, well-nigh finishing the term of their existence do not receive with good grace the counsels of friends.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु परुषं मारीचो रावणं ततः । गच्छावेत्यब्रवीद्दीनो भयाद्रात्रिंचरप्रभोः ।।
data.es: Having thus spoken to the demonking, the distressed Maricha said out of fear, Let both of us go.
data.anv: ततः then, मारीचः Maricha, एवम् in that way, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा spoken, रात्रिंचरप्रभोः of the king of the nightrangers, भयात् out of fear, दीनः distressed , गच्छाव let us both go, इति thus, रावणम् to Ravana, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Speaking these harsh words to Rāvana, Mārīca being afraid of him said, We shall both go.

data.v: दृष्टश्चाहं पुनस्तेन शरचापासिधारिणा । मद्वधोद्यतशस्त्रेण विनष्टं जीवितं च मे ।।
data.es: If that warrior Rama carrying bow, arrows and sword sees me once again he will raise his weapon to kill me, and I will cease to be.
data.anv: अहम् I, शरचापासिधारिणा holding bow, arrows and sword, मद्वधोद्यतशस्त्रेऽण who raises weapon to slay me, तेन by him, पुनः again, दृष्टः seen, मे my, जीवितं च विनष्टम्  life will cease.
data.md: Surely shall I be deprived of my life b, (Rāma) taking up his scimitar and having a bow and arrows in his hands, if I go before hiin again.

data.v: किं तु कर्तुं मया शक्यमेवं त्वयि दुरात्मनि । एष गच्छाम्यहं तात स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु निशाचर ।।
data.es: What can I do if you remain evilminded? O dear demon, I am going. May your path be auspicious
data.anv: त्वयि when you, एवम् in that way, दुरात्मनि  evilminded, मया I, कि नु what, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् is possible, तात dear one, निशाचर O demons, एष here, अहम् I am, गच्छामि  am going, ते to you, स्वस्ति be auspicious, अस्तु let it be.
data.md: You are vicious-souled, what can I do for you? be you crowned with success O ranger of the night, I shall go.

data.v: प्रहृष्टस्त्वभवत्तेन वचनेन स राक्षसः । परिष्वज्य सुसंश्लिष्टमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Ravana was so overwhelmed with joy to hear those words that he embraced him tightly and said:.
data.anv: सः रावणः that, Ravana, तेन वचनेन with those words, प्रहृष्टः felt happy, तु अभवत् he was, सुसंश्लिष्टम् tightly, परिष्वज्य  embracing, इदम् these, वचनम् words , अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: The Lord of Rākşasas being pleased with Mārīca's words embraced him warmly and said,

data.v: एतच्छौण्डीर्ययुक्तं ते मच्छन्दादिव भाषितम् । इदानीमसि मारीचः पूर्वमन्यो निशाचरः ।।
data.es: Act according to my wish. It befits your valour. You were a different demon earlier. Now you are Maricha.
data.anv: मच्छन्दवशवर्तिनः act according to my wish, ते to you, एतत् this, शौण्डीर्ययुक्तम् it  befits your valour, इदानीम् now, मारीचः Maricha, असि you are, पूर्वम् earlier, अन्यः other, राक्षसः हि demons.
data.md: This is worthy of your heroism that you have addressed yourself to act after my desire. You were another Raksasa before and have now become true Mārīca.

data.v: आरुह्यतामयं शीघ्रं खगो रत्नविभूषितः । मया सह रथो युक्तः पिशाचवदनैः खरैः ।।
data.es: Ascend quickly with me this chariot encrusted with gems and yoked with donkeys with devils' faces৷৷
data.anv: तथा similarly, पिशाचवदनैः with devilish faces, खरैः with donkeys, युक्तः yoked, रत्नविभूषितः encrusted with gems, रथः chariot, शीघ्रम् quickly, मया सह along with me, आरुह्यताम्  ascend.
data.md: Do you now with me ascend this chariot coursing in the air, crested with jewels and driven by asses having faces of a demon.

data.v: ततो रावणमारीचौ विमानमिव तं रथम् । आरुह्य ययतुः शीघ्रं तस्मादाश्रममण्डलात् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Ravana and Maricha ascended the chariot, which was like an aerial car, and quickly departed from that cluster of hermitages.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, रावणमारीचौ Ravana and Maricha, तं रथम् that chariot, विमानमिव like an aerial chariot, आरुह्य  ascending, तस्मात् from that, आश्रममण्डलात् cluster of hermitages, शीघ्रम् quickly, ययतुः departed.
data.md: Thereupon Tārakā's son assented to Rāvana's words, and both of them ascending the chariot like to a heavenly car set out for the hermitage.

data.v: तथैव तत्र पश्यन्तौ पत्तनानि वनानि च । गिरींश्च सरितः सर्वा राष्ट्राणि नगराणि च ।।
data.es: And likewise, they went past towns, forests, mountains, streams, states and cities.
data.anv: तथैव and likewise, तत्र there, पत्तनानि towns, वनानि च and forests, गिरींश्च mountains, सर्वाः all, सरितः streams, राष्ट्राणि states, नगराणि च cities, पश्यन्तौ seeing
data.md: And beholding diverse towns, forests, mountains, rivers, kingdoms and cities they reached the forest of Dandaka and the asylum of Rāma.

data.v: समेत्य दण्डकारण्यं राघवस्याश्रमं ततः । ददर्श सहमरीचो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: Ravana, king of the demons, accompanied by Maricha, then reached Dandaka forest and saw Rama's hermitage.
data.anv: सहमारीचः accompanied by Maricha, राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, रावणः Ravana, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, समेत्य reached, ततः then, राघवस्य Rama's, आश्रमम् hermitage, ददर्श noticed.
data.md: And beholding diverse towns, forests, mountains, rivers, kingdoms and cities they reached the forest of Dandaka and the asylum of Rāma.

data.v: अवतीर्य रथात्तस्मात्ततः काञ्चनभूषणात् । हस्ते गृहीत्वा मारीचं रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then Ravana got off the chariot decorated with golden embellishments and, holding Maricha's hand, said:.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, काञ्चनभूषणात् decorated with golden ornaments, तस्मात् from that, रथात् chariot, अवतीर्य  getting down, ततः then, मारीचम् Maricha, हस्ते by hand, गृहीत्वा, held, वाक्यम्  words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And descending now from the golden car the lord of Rākşasas together with Mārīca beheld Răma's asylum. Taking him (Mārīca) by the hand Ravana spoke.

data.v: एतद्रामाश्रमपदं दृश्यते कदलीवृतम् । क्रियतां तत्सखे शीघ्रं यदर्थं वयमागताः ।।
data.es: O friend here is the site of the hermitage surrounded by banana plants. Quickly get to work on the purpose for which we have come.
data.anv: सखे O friend, कदलीवृतम् surrounded by banana plants, एतत् this, तत् that, आश्रमपदम् site of hermitage, दृश्यते is seen, वयम् we, यदर्थम् the purpose for which, आगताः we came, तत् that, शीघ्रम् quickly, क्रियताम् should be done.
data.md: There stands the asylum of Rāma surrounded by palm trees. Do you do that for which we have come here.

data.v: स रावणवचः श्रुत्वा मारीचो राक्षसस्तदा । मृगो भूत्वाश्रमद्वारि रामस्य विचचार ह ।।
data.es: Hearing Ravana's words, Maricha transformed himself into a deer and started moving at the entrance of Rama's hermitage.
data.anv: तदा then, सः that, राक्षसः demon, मारीचः Maricha, रावणवचः Ravana's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मृगः deer, भूत्वा transformed, रामस्य Rama's, आश्रमद्वारि at the entrance of the hermitage, विचचार ह started moving.
data.md: Hearing the words of Rāvaņa, the Rāksasa Mārīca assuming the wonderful shape of a (golden) deer began to range at large before Rama's hermitage.

data.v: मणिप्रवरशृङ्गाग्रः सितासितमुखाकृतिः । रक्तपद्मोत्पलमुख इन्द्रनीलोत्पलश्रवाः ।।
किंचिदभ्युन्नत ग्रीव इन्द्रनीलनिभोदरः । मधूकनिभपार्श्वश्च कञ्जकिञ्जल्कसंनिभः ।।
वैदूर्यसंकाशखुरस्तनुजङ्घः सुसंहतः । इन्द्रायुधसवर्णेन पुच्छेनोर्ध्वं विराजितः ।।
मनोहरस्निग्धवर्णो रत्नैर्नानाविधैर्वृतः । क्षणेन राक्षसो जातो मृगः परमशोभनः ।।
वनं प्रज्वलयन्रम्यं रामाश्रमपदं च तत् । मनोहरं दर्शनीयं रूपं कृत्वा स राक्षसः ।।
data.md: And in no time the Rākşasa assumed the shape of a beautiful deer. To tempt Vaidehī that ranger of the night, assuming a beautiful countenance painted with diverse metals, illumining the beautiful forest and Rāma's asylum with its beauty, and ranging at large on the green field and living on grass, began to

data.v: प्रलोभनार्थं वैदेह्या नानाधातुविचित्रितम् । विचरन्गच्छते सम्यक्शाद्वलानि समन्ततः ।।
data.es: Transfigured into a beautiful, magnificent form painted with the colours of different minerals in order to tempt Sita, Maricha roamed all around the grassland.
data.anv: सः that, राक्षसः demon, नानाधातुविचित्रितम् painted with colours of different minerals, मनोहरम् delightful, दर्शनीयम् beautiful, रूपम् form, कृत्वा after transforming, वैदेह्याः to Sita, प्रलोभनार्थम् to tempt, विचरन् while grazing, तस्मात् from that place, समन्ततः all around, शाद्वलानि grassland, गच्छते moved about.
data.md: And in no time the Rākşasa assumed the shape of a beautiful deer. To tempt Vaidehī that ranger of the night, assuming a beautiful countenance painted with diverse metals, illumining the beautiful forest and Rāma's asylum with its beauty, and ranging at large on the green field and living on grass, began to

data.v: रूप्यबिन्दुशतैश्चित्रो भूत्वा च प्रियदर्शनः । विटपीनां किसलयान्भङ्क्त्वादन्विचचार ह ।।
data.es: That deer with hundreds of silver spots on the body appeared enchanting and pleasing to the eyes while he wandered about nibbling the tender leaves of trees.
data.anv: सः that, रूप्यैः by silver, बिन्दुशतैः with hudreds of spots, चित्रः was wonderful, भूत्वा on transforming, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing to the eyes, विटपीनाम् trees, किसलयान् tender leaves, भङ्त्क्वा nibbling, अदन् eating, विचचार ह wandered about.
data.md: That one of lively presence having its body painted with hundreds of silver drops and living on twigs of trees began to range in the forest.

data.v: कदलीगृहकं गत्वा कर्णिकारानितस्ततः । समाश्रयन्मन्दगतिः सीतासंदर्शनं तदा ।।
data.es: The deer went wandering about the banana groves surrounding Rama's hermitage and moved slowly towards the karnikara trees in order to catch the attention of Sita.
data.anv: कदलीगृहकम् groves of banana, गत्वा on going, कर्णिकारान् the karnikara flowers, इतस्ततः hither and thither, मन्दगतिः at a slow pace, तथा likewise, सीतासन्दर्शनम् the sight of Sita, समाश्रयत् resorted.
data.md: Sometimes walking into the plantain house, sometimes walking around the forest of Karņikā, sometimes coming within the compass of Sītā's vision, that best of deer having its back painted with gold began to range slowly around the hermitage.

data.v: राजीवचित्रपृष्ठः स विरराज महामृगः । रामाश्रमपदाभ्याशे विचचार यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: That magnificent deer glittered with the colour of blue lotus on its back, wandered merrily in the vicinity of Rama's hermitage.
data.anv: सः that, महामृगः magnificent deer, राजीवचित्रपृष्ठः his back with the colour of blue lotus, विरराज glittered, रामाश्रमपदाभ्याशे in the vicinity of Rama's hermitage, यथासुखम् comfortably, विचचार wandered.
data.md: It began to walk at pleasure near Rāma's asylum. Sometimes going, sometimes stopping, at one time running very swiftly and receding the next moment, that best of deer began to range at large.

data.es: The wonderful deer moved to and fro, now disappearing and now swiftly returning.
data.anv: मृगोत्तमः best of deer, गत्वा on going, पुनः again, निवृत्तश्च came back, विचचार wandered, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, गत्वा after going, पुनः again, त्वरया swiftly, प्रतिनिवर्तते returned.
data.md: It began to walk at pleasure near Rāma's asylum. Sometimes going, sometimes stopping, at one time running very swiftly and receding the next moment, that best of deer began to range at large.

data.v: विक्रीडंश्च पुनर्भूमौ पुनरेव निषीदति । आश्रमद्वारमागम्य मृगयूथानि गच्छति ।।
data.es: The deer is now sporting, now sitting on the ground, now standing at the entrance of the hermitage and now running with the herds of deer.
data.anv: विक्रीडंश्च while sporting so, पुनरेव again, क्वचित् sometimes, भूमौ on the ground, पुनरेव again, निषीदति squat, आश्रमद्वारम् at the entrance of the hermitage, आगम्य after reaching, मृगयूथानि flock of deer, गच्छति goes.
data.md: Sometimes playing around, sometimes lying on earth and sometimes following the deer-herd having come within the thresh hold of the asylum and then followed again by them that Rākṣasa assuming the form of a deer came back to see Sītā.

data.v: मृगयूथैरनुगतः पुनरेव निवर्तते । सीतादर्शनमाकाङ्क्षन्राक्षसो मृगतां गतः ।।
data.es: Followed by herds of deer and coming back to see Sita again and again, the deer cavorted and pranced and frisked in circles in a wonderful way.

data.md: Sometimes playing around, sometimes lying on earth and sometimes following the deer-herd having come within the thresh hold of the asylum and then followed again by them that Rākṣasa assuming the form of a deer came back to see Sītā.

data.md: He then began to range at large in the beautiful forest (extending far and wide). Seeing him other forest-deer came (by hiin) and smelling him fled away into different quarters.

data.v: उपगम्य समाघ्राय विद्रवन्ति दिशो दश । राक्षसः सोऽपि तान्वन्यान्मृगान्मृगवधे रतः ।।
data.md: That Raksasa, though expert in killing deer, did not eat them up, though touching, in order to hide his real self.

data.md: In the meantime Vaidehī, of auspicious looks whose eyes inebriate like wine, being engaged in plucking flowers, was going sometimes to the Karņikā grove and sometimes to the mango grove.

data.es: The great lady Sita, unworthy of dwelling in the forest, saw the wonderful deer decked with gems, with spots of pearls all over the body.

data.md: That best of women, ever inured to living in the forest and possessed of a graceful countenance, walking and plucking flowers, saw that jewelled deer, having its body diversified with pearls and diamonds,

data.v: तं वै रुचिरदण्तौष्ठं रूप्यधातुतनूरुहम् । विस्मयोत्फुल्लनयना सस्नेहं समुदैक्षत ।।
data.es: A lady with beautiful teeth and lips, Sita saw the deer having silver and mineral coloured hair on the body. She gazed at the animal with wonder and joy and love.
data.anv: रुचिरदन्तोष्ठी a lady of beautiful teeth and lips, सा that Sita, रूप्यधातुतनूरुहम् animal with silver and mineral coloured hair on the body, तम् deer, विस्मयोत्फुल्लनयना with eyes of wonder and joy, सस्नेहम् with affection, समुदैक्षत gazed at.
data.md: It had beautiful teeth and lips and had its down resembling silver. She began to behold with affection and with her eyes expanded with surprise.

data.v: स च तां रामदयितां पश्यन्मायामयो मृगः । विचचार ततस्तत्र दीपयन्निव तद्वनम् ।।
data.es: That illusory deer saw Rama's wife and moved around wonderfully as if illuminating the forest with his radiance.
data.anv: मायामयः illusory one, सः that, मृगश्च the deer, तां her, रामदयिताम् Rama's wife, पश्यन् on seeing, तत् वनम् that forest, दीपयन्निव as if illuminating, पुनः again, चित्रम् wonderfully, विचचार moved around.
data.md: That illusive deer seeing Rāma's wife began to inove around as if lighting up that forest (with the fire of its beauty).

data.es: Seeing such an unprecedented deer decorated with different gems, Sita, daughter of Janaka, stood amazed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.md: Beholding that deer ornamented with diverse jewels, and the like of which she had never seen before, the daughter of Janaka was struck with immense wonder. data.es: Sita while plucking flowers Sita who had fine hips, flawless beautiful limbs and pure golden complexion felt delighted to see the deer with gold and silver colours on both sides of his body. She called out to Rama and Lakshmana who were equipped with arms.

data.md: Beholding that deer with its sides painted with gold and silver, while collecting flowers, Sītā, having blameless limbs and beautiful hips and having the colour of her body like that of pure gold became immensely pleased and called aloud her husband and Lakşmaņa with scimitars in their hands.

data.es: Sita while plucking flowers Sita who had fine hips, flawless beautiful limbs and pure golden complexion felt delighted to see the deer with gold and silver colours on both sides of his body. She called out to Rama and Lakshmana who were equipped with arms.

data.v: तयाहूतौ नरव्याघ्रौ वैदेह्या रामलक्ष्मणौ । वीक्षमाणौ तु तं देशं तदा ददृशतुर्मृगम् ।।
data.es: When Sita called Rama and Lakshmana, the two tigers among men, they looked around and saw the deer.
data.anv: तया by her, वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, आहूतौ called, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, (तं) देशम् that place, वीक्षमाणौ while glancing, तदा then, मृगम् deer, ददृशतुः saw.
data.md: Having called (her husband) again and again in this strain she continued beholding that deer. Being thus called by the daughter of the king of Videha those two best of men Rāma and Laks maņa, casting their looks around beheld that deer.

data.v: शङ्कमानस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणो राममब्रवीत् । तमेवैनमहं मन्ये मारीचं राक्षसं मृगम् ।।
data.es: Seeing the deer, Lakshmana suspected him to be Maricha and said this to Rama.

data.md: Seeing him Lakşmana, struck with fear, said Me-thinks, this deer is the Raksasa Marica.

data.v: चरन्तो मृगयां हृष्टाः पापेनोपाधिना वने । अनेन निहता राम राजानः कामरूपिणा ।।
data.es: Many kings, while on hunting expedition in the forest, have been deceitfully killed by malicious Maricha, who could assume any form at his free will.
data.anv: राजन् O king, हृष्टाः happy, मृगयां चरन्तः while on hunting expedition, राजानः kings, कामरूपिणा assuming any form at his free will, अनेन by him, पापेन malicious, वने in the forest, उपाधिना deceitfully, निहताः killed.
data.md: This vicious Mārīca, O Rāma, assuming the shape of a deer oftentimes kills at pleasure the kings who come here a-hunting.

data.v: अस्य मायाविदो मायामृगरूपमिदं कृतम् । भानुमत्पुरुषव्याघ्र गन्धर्वपुरसंनिभम् ।।
data.es: O tiger among men, this deceitful demon (Maricha) has been transformed into the illusory form of a radiant deer which does not exist.

data.md: He is cognizant of illusions, by virtue of which he has assumed this shape, O best of men; its countenance is perfectly fine like the abode of Gandharvas and resplendent like the Sun; there is no such jewelled deer on earth. O Rāghava, O Lord of earth, there is no doubt that this is nothing but illusion.

data.v: मृगो ह्येवंविधो रत्नविचित्रो नास्ति राघव । जगत्यां जगतीनाथ मायैषा हि न संशयः ।।
data.es: O Rama, lord of the world nowhere on earth does exist this kind of wonderful deer sparkling with gems. That it is a mere trick, an illusion there is no doubt.

data.es: O prince O longarmed one, this deer has captivated my mind. Fetch him for me.This will be our playmate.

data.md: O son of the worshipful Sire, this deer has attracted my mind, get it for me, pray, O you of mighty arms: it shall be an object of sport for us.

data.v: इहाश्रमपदेऽस्माकं बहवः पुण्यदर्शनाः । मृगाश्चरन्ति सहिताश्चमराः सृमरास्तथा ।।
data.es: Here at the hermitage there are many lovely deer, yaks and antelopes wandering in herds.
data.anv: अस्माकम् for us, इह here, आश्रमपदे at the hermitage, पुण्यदर्शनाः piouslooking, बहवः many, मृगाः deer, सृमराः antelopes, तथा similarly, चमराः yaks, सहिताः in herds, चरन्ति wandering.

data.es: O longarmed one, most beautiful animals like bears, antelopes and groups of monkeys and kinneras are wandering here.

data.es: O prince this kind of beautiful, tame and glittering deer I have never seen before.
data.anv: राजन् O Prince, अयम् this, मृगसत्तमः great deer, यथा as, तेजसा by lustre, क्षमया by forbearance, दीप्त्या by glitter, अस्य his, सदृशः equal, मृगः animal, मया by me, न दृष्टपूर्वः never seen before.

data.es: Its body glittering with different colours, speckled with gems of different kinds, is like the Moon shining and illuminating the forest.

data.md: Its cntire body is diversified with various colours, nay, it is a jewel itself. It moves before me beautifying the forest with its resplendence, like to Moon himself.

data.es: Oh what a beauty, Oh what rich call what delightful, wonderful, graceful limbs This deer captivates my heart.

data.md: Ah! what beauty, what beautiful a lustre, how musical a voice, this wonderful deer of variegated countenance, has indeed captivated my heart!

data.v: यदि ग्रहणमभ्येति जीवन्नेव मृगस्तव । आश्चर्यभूतं भवति विस्मयं जनयिष्यति ।।
data.es: If this deer can be caught alive, it will be thrilling, it will work wonders.
data.anv: मृगः deer, जीवन्नेव alive, तव your, ग्रहणम् caught, अभ्येति यदि if it can be obtained, आश्चर्यभूतम् thrilling, भवति will be, विस्मयम् wonder, जनयिष्यति will create.
data.md: If can you get by this deer alive, O what wonder, what surprise!

data.v: समाप्तवनवासानां राज्यस्थानां च नः पुनः । अन्तःपुरविभूषार्थो मृग एष भविष्यति ।।
data.es: After the completion of exile in the forest, when we are back in the kingdom, this deer will add beauty to the harem.
data.anv: एषः this, मृगः deer, समाप्तवनवासानाम् after the completion of exile in the forest, पुनः again, राज्यस्थानाम् and established in the kingdom, नः for us, अन्तःपुरविभूषार्थः add beauty to the  harem, भविष्यति will be.
data.md: When shall we regain our kingdom after the expire of the term of our banishment, this deer shall beautify the interior of our palace.

data.v: भरतस्यार्यपुत्रस्य श्वश्रूणां मम च प्रभो । मृगरूपमिदं दिव्यं विस्मयं जनयिष्यति ।।
data.es: O king this deer will create amazement in Bharata, in mothersinlaw, in you and in me as well.
data.anv: प्रभो O king, इदम् this, मृगरूपम् this form of a deer, भरतस्य to Bharata, आर्यपुत्रस्य for you, श्वश्रूणाम् for mothersinlaw, मम च to me, व्यक्तम् certainly, विस्मयम् wonder, जनयिष्यति will generate.
data.md: O Lord, truly shall this celestial deer create surprise in Bharata, yourself, me and my mothers-in-law.

data.v: जीवन्न यदि तेऽभ्येति ग्रहणं मृगसत्तमः । अजिनं नरशार्दूल रुचिरं मे भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O best among men, if this great deer cannot be captured alive, I will wear its beautiful skin.
data.anv: नरशार्दूल O tiger among men, मृगसत्तमः great deer, जीवन् with life, ते to you, ग्रहणम् catch, न not, अभ्येति यदि can be caught, मे for me, रुचिरम् this beautiful, अजिनम् skin, भविष्यति will be.
data.md: O best of men, if can you not get hold of it alive its skin shall also look very beautiful (to us).

data.v: निहतस्यास्य सत्त्वस्य जाम्बूनदमयत्वचि । शष्पबृस्यां विनीतायामिच्छाम्यहमुपासितुम् ।।
data.es: If this animal is killed and its golden skin is spread on a tender grass cushion, there will I like to sit.
data.anv: शष्पबृस्यां on a cushion of tender grass, विनीतायाम् it spread, निहतस्य if killed, अस्य सत्त्वस्य this animal's, जाम्बूनदमयत्वचि its golden skin, अहम् I, उपासितुम् to sit, इच्छामि desire.
data.md: Spreading on Kuća the skin of this golden deer when killed do I wish to invoke the Almighty.

data.v: कामवृत्तमिदं रौद्रं स्त्रीणामसदृशं मतम् । वपुषा त्वस्य सत्त्वस्य विस्मयो जनितो मम ।।
data.es: This kind of request arising out of a woman's desire may sound terrible, still then the beauty of this animal's skin has produced in me a wonder.
data.anv: रौद्रम् terrible, इदम् this, कामवृत्तम्  arising out of desire, स्त्रीणाम् for a woman, असदृशम् not desirable, मतम्  opinion, तु you, अस्य even so, सत्त्वस्य  this animal's, वपुषा beauty of skin, मम me, विस्मयः amazing, जनितः creating.
data.md: It looks (no doubt) unseemly and terrible and smacks of wilfulness, on the part of a wife to command her husband in this way, but I am sunk in surprise seeing the countenance of the deer.

data.v: तेन काञ्चनरोम्णा तु मणिप्रवरशृङ्गिणा । तरुणादित्यवर्णेन नक्षत्रपथवर्चसा । बभूव राघवस्यापि मनो विस्मयमागतम् ।।
data.es: By his golden colour resembling the rising Sun, by his horns with excellent gems shining like the milkyway, even Rama's mind was wonderstruck.
data.anv: काञ्चनवर्णेन by its golden colour, मणिप्रवरशृङ्गिणा horned with excellent gems, तरुणादित्यवर्णेन by its colour resembling the rising Sun, नक्षत्रपथवर्चसा by shining like the milkyway, तेन by, राघवस्य of Rama, मनः अपि mind also, विस्मयम् amazement, आगतम् arose.

data.v: एवं सीतावचः श्रुत्वा दृष्ट्वा च मृगमद्भुतम् । उवाच राघवो हृष्टो भ्रातरं लक्ष्मणं वचः ।।
data.es: On hearing Sita's words and seeing the wonderful deer, Rama was tempted by its appearance.Prompted by Sita,he joyfully said this to Lakshmana:
data.anv: राघवः Rama, एवम् in that manner, सीतावचः Sita's words, श्रुत्वा listening, अद्भुतम् wonderful, तं मृगम् that deer, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तेन रूपेण by its appearance, लोभितः tempted, सीतया च by Sita, प्रचोदितः prompted, हृष्टः gladly, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, वचः words, उवाच said.

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्याः स्पृहां मृगगतामिमाम् । रूपश्रेष्ठतया ह्येष मृगोऽद्य न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, see the eagerness of Sita. Such a deer of exceptional beauty will not be found in this forest. There is no equal to this animal even in the Nandan garden of Indra, or the Chaitraratha, the garden of Kubera. Where can such an animal be found on earth?
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, वैदेह्याः Sita's, मृगगताम् pertaining to this deer, स्पृहाम् desire, पश्य  you may see, सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अद्य now, रूपश्रेष्ठतया due to its excellent beauty, एषः this, मृगः deer, वने in the forest, न भविष्यति will not be found, नन्दनोद्धेशे in the Nandana garden of Indra, न not, चैत्ररथसंश्रये in Chaitraratha,( garden of Kubera), न not, यः any such, अस्य its, समः equal, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, कुतः where do (we find).
data.md: Behold, O Laksmana, it has immensely excited Vaidehi's desire. On account of its exquisite beauty it shall loose its life to-day.

data.v: न वने नन्दनोद्देशे न चैत्ररथसंश्रये । कुतः पृथिव्यां सौमित्रे योऽस्य कश्चित्समो मृगः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, see the eagerness of Sita. Such a deer of exceptional beauty will not be found in this forest. There is no equal to this animal even in the Nandan garden of Indra, or the Chaitraratha, the garden of Kubera. Where can such an animal be found on earth?
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, वैदेह्याः Sita's, मृगगताम् pertaining to this deer, स्पृहाम् desire, पश्य  you may see, सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अद्य now, रूपश्रेष्ठतया due to its excellent beauty, एषः this, मृगः deer, वने in the forest, न भविष्यति will not be found, नन्दनोद्धेशे in the Nandana garden of Indra, न not, चैत्ररथसंश्रये in Chaitraratha,( garden of Kubera), न not, यः any such, अस्य its, समः equal, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, कुतः where do (we find).
data.md: It has its equal no where on the earth-neither in the celestial garden nor in the Caitraratha forest.

data.v: प्रतिलोमानुलोमाश्च रुचिरा रोमराजयः । शोभन्ते मृगमाश्रित्य चित्राः कनकबिन्दुभिः ।।
data.es: The stretches of hair on the deer's body bent both in the natural order and in the opposite direction look beautiful. The spots of gold on the skin are wonderful.
data.anv: प्रतिलोमानुलोमाः च hair bent in the opposite direction and hair bent in the natural order, रुचिराः beautiful, कनकबिन्दवः golden spots, चित्राः beautiful, रोमराजयः the stretches of hair on the body, मृगम् the deer, आश्रित्य resorting to, शोभन्ते are looking delightful.
data.md: The hairs of its body being arranged in regular and contrary courses and being painted with golden drops do indeed look very beautiful.

data.v: पश्यास्य जृम्भमाणस्य दीप्तामग्निशिखोपमाम् । जिह्वां मुखान्निःसरन्तीं मेघादिव शतह्रदाम् ।।
data.es: Look at his tongue stretched out of the mouth while yawning. It is glowing like flaming fire. It is like the lightning sparkling in the cloud.
data.anv: जृम्भमाणस्य while it is yawning, अस्य its, मुखात् from the mouth, निस्सरन्तीम् stretching, दीप्ताम् glowing, अग्निशिखोपमाम् like flaming fires, मेघात् from the cloud, शतह्रदाम् इव like the lightning, जिह्वाम् tongue, पश्य see.
data.md: Do you see, while expanding its inouth, its tongue comes out resembling flaming fire like to a thunder-bolt reaving the mass of clouds.

data.v: मसारगल्वर्कमुखः शङ्खमुक्तानिभोदरः । कस्य नामानिरूप्योऽसौ न मनो लोभयेन्मृगः ।।
data.es: His face is a drinking pot of emerald, the belly is a conch or a pearl. Whose mind will not be attracted by this indescribable beauty ?
data.anv: मसारगल्लर्कमुखः face like a drinking pot made of emerald, शङ्खमुक्तानिभोदरः belly like conch or pearl, अभिरूप्यः indescribable, असौ मृगः this deer, कस्य नाम whose, मनः mind, न लोभयेत् not be attracted.
data.md: Its face is like a glass made of a best blue sapphire, its belly resembling a conch and pearl, and it is very difficult to ascertain its shapes. Beholding it who is there (on earth) whose heart is not enamoured?

data.v: कस्य रूपमिदं दृष्ट्वा जाम्बूनदमयप्रभम् । नानारत्नमयं दिव्यं न मनो विस्मयं व्रजेत् ।।
data.es: Whose mind will not be filled with wonder on seeing this divine beauty glittering like lustrous gold and studded with a variety of gems ?
data.anv: जाम्बूनदमयप्रभम् glittering like the lustre of gold, नानारत्नमयम् adorned with a variety of gems, दिव्यम् divine, इदम् this, रूपम् beauty, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कस्य whose, मनः heart, विस्मयम् wonder, न व्रजेत् not attain.
data.md: Its beauty resembles the rays of gold and is variegated with diverse hues of jewels. Whose heart is not enveloped with surprise beholding such a celestial beauty, O Laksmana?

data.v: मांसहेतोरपि मृगान्विहारार्थं च धन्विनः । घ्नन्ति लक्ष्मण राजानो मृगयायां महावने ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana kings who wield bows in hunting expeditions kill deer in the forest for sport as well as for venison.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राजानः king, महावने in a great forest, मृगयायाम् in hunting expedition, मांसहेतोः for meat, धन्वनः archers, विनोदार्थम् for sporting, मृगान् deer, घ्नन्ति will kill.
data.md: Princes, with bows in their hands, while-a hunting in a deep forest destroy deer either for flesh or for sport.

data.v: धनानि व्यवसायेन विचीयन्ते महावने । धातवो विविधाश्चापि मणिरत्नसुवर्णिनः ।।
data.es: From huge forests a variety of mineral wealth consisting of gems, stones and gold are collected with great effort.
data.anv: महावने in the huge forest, व्यवसायेन with great effort, धनानि wealth, मणिरत्नसुवर्णिनः gems and gold etc, विविधाः of variety , धातवः precious minerals, विचीयन्ते will be collected.
data.md: Moreover while engaged in sporting they collect many a jewel and various metals as gold and silver, in the woods.

data.v: तत्सारमखिलं नॄणां धनं निचयवर्धनम् । मनसा चिन्तितं सर्वं यथा शुक्रस्य लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana the essence of forest wealth is mineral wealth, which helps the growth of the treasury. It is conceived mentally as in the case of Venus.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अखिलम् all, तत् all that, सारम् essence, धनम् wealth, नृ़णाम् of men, मनसा in the mind, चिन्तितम् thought over, सर्वम् all, शुक्रस्य यथा like Venus (Venus controls prosperity leading to procreation), निचयवर्धनम् growth of treasure.
data.md: There is not the least doubt that these wild riches filling up their coffers are comparatively far better (than the wealth acquired by other sources) like to the objects of enjoyment, enjoyed at their fancy by the people inhabiting the celestial region.

data.v: अर्थी येनार्थकृत्येन संव्रजत्यविचारयन् । तमर्थमर्थशास्त्रज्ञः प्राहुरर्थ्याश्च लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: A materialist moves about thoughtlessly for making money. Economists call it material wealth.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अर्थी materialist, येन by whichever, अर्थकृत्येन  done for material wealth, अविचारयन् without thinking, संव्रजति moves about, तम् that, अर्थशास्त्रज्ञाः economists, अर्थ्याः scientists, अर्थम् material, प्राहुः called.
data.md: The object which persons desirous of acquiring wealth follow without any discretion in their actions, is the true definition of wealth given by the political economists.

data.v: एतस्य मृगरत्नस्य परार्ध्ये काञ्चनत्वचि । उपवेक्ष्यति वैदेही मया सह सुमध्यमा ।।
data.anv: सुमध्यमा a lady of slender waist, वैदेही Vaidehi, एतस्य of this, मृगरत्नस्य of the gem of a deer, परार्ध्ये in an excellent, काञ्चनत्वचि in a golden skin, मया सह with me also, उपवेक्ष्यति  will sit.
data.md: Vaidehi of slender waist desire to sit with me on the exquisitely fine golden skin of this gem of a deer, me-seems no deer skin is so comfortable to touch as this neither the skin of Kādali, Priyaki, Praveni nor of Caviki.

data.v: न कादली न प्रियकी न प्रवेणी न चाविकी । भवेदेतस्य सदृशी स्पर्शनेनेति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: The skins of various types of deer like Priyaki, Kadali or goats or sheep cannot be compared in softness to the skin of this deer.
data.anv: स्पर्शनेन by touch, कादली blackstriped antelope, एतस्य of this, सदृशी comparable, न भवेत् will be there, प्रियकी goat's, न or even, प्रवेणी a hairy one, न not, आविकी च of a sheep, न not, इति like this, मे I, मतिः I think.
data.md: Vaidehi of slender waist desire to sit with me on the exquisitely fine golden skin of this gem of a deer, me-seems no deer skin is so comfortable to touch as this neither the skin of Kādali, Priyaki, Praveni nor of Caviki.

data.v: एष चैव मृगः श्रीमान्यश्च दिव्यो नभश्चरः । उभावेतौ मृगौ दिव्यौ तारामृगमहीमृगौ ।।
data.es: This majestic deer and the deer flying in heaven (the deer's figure seen in the Moon called Mrgasira) both the deer of the star in the sky and the deer of the earth are divine.
data.anv: श्रीमान् majestic, एषः this one, मृगश्चैव that deer too, नभश्चरः flying in the sky, यश्च whoever, दिव्यः divine, दिव्यौ both are divine, एतौ these two, तारामृगमहीमृगौ deer of the stars and deer of the earth, उभौ both, मृगौ deer.
data.md: Truly handsome in this deer and the one that range in the welkin, indeed these two deer only are celestial—the one that range in the sky* (Mrgasirā) and this that range on earth. This refers to Mrgaşiră, the fifth lunar constellation which resembles a deer.

data.v: यदि वायं तथा यन्मां भवेद्वदसि लक्ष्मण । मायैषा राक्षसस्येति कर्तव्योऽस्य वधो मया ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, as you say, if it is the illusion of a demon, even then it should be killed by me.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, एषा this, राक्षसस्य of a demon, माया an illusion, इति thus, माम् me, यत् which, वदसि you say, तथा so also, अयम् surely, भवेद्यदि if it is, वा or, मया by me, अस्य his, वधः death, कर्तव्यः should be done.
data.md: And if it be a Raksasa's illusion as you say, O Laksmana, then it must be killed by me.

data.v: एतेन हि नृशंसेन मारीचेनाकृतात्मना । वने विचरता पूर्वं हिंसिता मुनिपुंगवाः ।।
data.es: The great sages were tortured and killed earlier by this cruel, evilminded Maricha while wandering in the forest.
data.anv: नृशंसेन by  cruel, अकृतात्मना by evilminded, वने in the forest, विचरता while wandering, एतेन by him, मारीचेन Maricha, पूर्वम् earlier, मुनिपुङ्गवाः great sages, हिंसिताः are harassed.
data.md: This cruel vicious-souled Mārica made away with many eminent ascetics, while travelling in the forest; and this Räkşasa assuming the shape of an illusive deer destroyed many kings-mighty archers while a-hunting in this forest; it is for this that this deer must be killed.

data.v: उत्थाय बहवो येन मृगयायां जनाधिपाः । निहताः परमेष्वासास्तस्माद्वध्यस्त्वयं मृगः ।।
data.es: Many kings who were great archers who set out on hunting expedition were killed by him. Therefore, this animal deserves to be killed.
data.anv: येन since, उत्थाय after rising, मृगयायाम् during hunting expedition, बहवः many, परमेष्वासाः great archers, जनाधिपाः kings, निहताः killed, तस्मात् therefore, मृगः deer, वध्यः तु should be killed.
data.md: This cruel vicious-souled Mārica made away with many eminent ascetics, while travelling in the forest; and this Räkşasa assuming the shape of an illusive deer destroyed many kings-mighty archers while a-hunting in this forest; it is for this that this deer must be killed.

data.v: पुरस्तादिह वातापिः परिभूय तपस्विनः । उदरस्थो द्विजान्हन्ति स्वगर्भोऽश्वतरीमिव ।।
data.es: Earlier in this forest, Vatapi used to humiliate the ascetic brahmins and to kill them by entering into their stomach like a womb killing the female mule.
data.anv: पुरस्तात् earlier, इह here, वातापिः Vatapi, तपस्विनः ascetics, परिभूय defeating, उदरस्थः   stationed in the stomach, अश्वतरीम् female mule, स्वगर्भः इव as its own womb, द्विजान् brahmins, हन्ति killed.
data.md: Formerly this Vātăpi entering into the womb of twice-born ones used to come out reaving them like to the embryo of a mule. The name of an Asur devoured by Agastya.

data.v: स कदाचिच्चिराल्लोके आससाद महामुनिम् । अगस्त्यं तेजसा युक्तं भक्ष्यस्तस्य बभूव ह ।।
data.es: That Vatapi after a long time, once greedily entered into the stomach of the great lustrous sage Agastya and became his food.
data.anv: सः that Vatapi, चिरात् after a long time, कदाचित् once, लोभात् greedily, तेजसा by prowess, युक्तम् one endowed, महामुनिम् great sage, अगस्त्यम् Agasthya, आससाद reached, तस्य his, भक्षः food, बभूव ह became.
data.md: Once on a time this Vātāpi approached the eminent saint Agastya and was devoured by him.

data.v: समुत्थाने च तद्रूपं कर्तुकामं समीक्ष्य तम् । उत्स्मयित्वा तु भगवान्वातापिमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When the venerable sage Agastya got up (after eating), he observed Vatapi wishing to turn into his real form. So smiling at him, he said:
data.anv: समुत्थाने  when he rose, तत् that, रूपम् form, कर्तुकामम् to turn into real form, तम् him, वातापिम् Vatapi, समीक्ष्य after  seeing, भगवान् venerable sage, उत्स्मयित्वा by smiling at him, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: After the Šrāddha ceremony had been over, finding that Bātāpi desirous of assuming the shape of a Rākṣasa the great saint Agastya said smiling.

data.v: त्वयाविगण्य वातापे परिभूताश्च तेजसा । जीवलोके द्विजश्रेष्ठास्तस्मादसि जरां गतः ।।
data.es: 'O Vatapi you killed the best of brahmins living in this world, disregarding them because of your power. Hence you were digested by me.'
data.anv: वातापे O Vatapi, जीवलेके  in the world of living beings, द्विजश्रेष्ठाः best of brahmins, त्वया by you, अविगण्य disregarding, स्वतेजसा with your power, परिभूताः are insulted, तस्मात् on account of that, जरां गतः got digested, असि you are.
data.md: Being blinded with your prowess O Vātāpi, you have destroyed many eminent twice-born ones on this earth and for this that I do digest you.

data.v: एवं तन्न भवेद्रक्षो वातापिरिव लक्ष्मण । मद्विधं योऽतिमन्येत धर्मनित्यं जितेन्द्रियम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana just like Vatapi, this demon will not live. Whoever violates a person of my kind who is ever righteous and selfcontrolled will be killed
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, वातापिरिव just as Vatapi, तत् that, रक्षः demon, न भवेत् not live, यः who, धर्मनित्यम् always righteous, जितेन्द्रियम् senses controlled , मद्विधम् my kind, अतिमन्येत whoever violates, अयम् this, मां me, गतः gone, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, वातापिरिव like Vatapi, हतः be killed,  भवेत् will be.
data.md: Truly that Raksasa, O, Laksmana who wish to surpass one like me who has controlled his senses and is ever engaged in pious offices shall meet with his end like to this Vātāpi.

data.v: भवेद्धतोऽयं वातापिरगस्त्येनेव मा गतिः । इह त्वं भव संनद्धो यन्त्रितो रक्ष मैथिलीम् ।।
data.md: Therefore this Mārīca approaching me shall be killed by me like to Vātāpi being devoured by Agastya. Do you therefore vigilantly protect Vaidehi with mail and armours on.

data.v: अस्यामायत्तमस्माकं यत्कृत्यं रघुनन्दन । अहमेनं वधिष्यामि ग्रहीष्याम्यथ वा मृगम् ।।
data.md: It is our prime duty, O descendant of Raghu, to protect Jānaki. I shall either kill this deer or shall get hold of it.

data.v: यावद्गच्छामि सौमित्रे मृगमानयितुं द्रुतम् । पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेहीं मृगत्वचि गतस्पृहाम् ।।
data.md: Look, O Laksmana, Vaidehi is extremely anxious to get the skin of this deer I shall therefore proceed at once, O son of Sumitrā, to catch this deer.

data.v: त्वचा प्रधानया ह्येष मृगोऽद्य न भविष्यति । अप्रमत्तेन ते भाव्यमाश्रमस्थेन सीतया ।।
data.md: The skin of this deer is the best of its kind; for certain shall it loose its life today. As long as I do not kill this deer, O Lakşmaņa, do you with Sītā remain with vigilance in this asylum. I shall in no time come back with its skin after killing in with one arrow.

data.v: यावत्पृषतमेकेन सायकेन निहन्म्यहम् । हत्वैतच्चर्म आदाय शीघ्रमेष्यामि लक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: Keep vigil over Sita at the hermitage, O Lakshmana I will certainly kill the speckled antelope with a single arrow, get his skin and come back quickly.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, आश्रमस्थेन staying at the hermitage, ते by you, सीतया with Sita, अप्रमत्तेन   vigilant, भाव्यम् should be, पृषतम् speckled antelope, एकेन by only one, बाणेन by arrow, अहम् I, यावत् by the time, निहन्मि I will kill, हत्वा after killing, एतच्चर्म his skin, आदाय getting, शीघ्रम् quickly, एष्यामि I will come.
data.md: The skin of this deer is the best of its kind; for certain shall it loose its life today. As long as I do not kill this deer, O Lakşmaņa, do you with Sītā remain with vigilance in this asylum. I shall in no time come back with its skin after killing in with one arrow.

data.v: प्रदक्षिणेनातिबलेन पक्षिणा; जटायुषा बुद्धिमता च लक्ष्मण । भवाप्रमत्तः प्रतिगृह्य मैथिलीं; प्रतिक्षणं सर्वत एव शङ्कितः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, be vigilant in guarding Sita, suspecting danger every moment from all directions. Take the help of Jatayu, the mighty and wise bird who will be on his rounds.इत्याषे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga in Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मैथिलीम् Sita, परिगृह्य  guarding her, प्रतिक्षणम् every moment, सर्वतः एव from all directions, शङ्कितः suspecting danger, प्रदक्षिणेन  going round, अतिबलेन by the  mighty, बुद्धिमता by wise, पक्षिणा by the bird, जटायुषा Jatayu, अप्रमत्तः vigilant, भव be.
data.md: Do you stay here, O Lakşmaņa, with Jānakī in constant fear and vigilance, along with the mighty Jațāyu, intelligent and ever engaged in pious offices.

data.v: तथा तु तं समादिश्य भ्रातरं रघुनन्दनः । बबन्धासिं महातेजा जाम्बूनदमयत्सरुम् ।।
data.es: The brilliant Rama, delight of the Raghu dynasty, thus instructed his brother and fastened a sword with a golden handle to his waist.
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu dynasty, भ्रातरम् brother, तम् to him, तथा in that way, समादिश्य  instructed, जाम्बूनदमयत्सरुम्  golden  handle , असिम् the sword, बबन्ध tied.
data.md: Having thus directed his brother, the highly energetic son of Raghu equipped himself with his gold-hilted scimitar.

data.v: ततस्त्रिविणतं चापमादायात्मविभूषणम् । आबध्य च कलापौ द्वौ जगामोदग्रविक्रमः ।।
data.es: A man of indomitable prowess, he took the bow with three curves that was like an ornament to him, tied two quivers at the back and left.

data.md: And girding himself with his bow bent at three places, which served him ornament,—as well as a couple of quivers, that one of fierce energy sallied out.

छिन्नाभ्रैरिव संवीतं शारदं चन्द्रमण्डलम् । मुहूर्तादेव ददृशे मुहुर्दूरात्प्रकाशते ।।
दर्शनादर्शनेनैव सोऽपाकर्षत राघवम् । आसीत्क्रुद्धस्तु काकुत्स्थो विवशस्तेन मोहितः ।।
अथावतस्थे सुश्रान्तश्छायामाश्रित्य शाद्वले । मृगैः परिवृतो वन्यैरदूरात्प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: That demon transformed himself into a deer and, surrounded by the animals of the forest at close range, attracted his attention.

data.md: And that ranger of the night, wearing the form of a deer, maddening Rāma, discovered himself (again) at a distance surrounded by (other) deer,

data.v: दृष्ट्वा रामो महातेजास्तं हन्तुं कृतनिश्चयः । संधाय सुदृढे चापे विकृष्य बलवद्बली ।।
तमेव मृगमुद्दिश्य ज्वलन्तमिव पन्नगम् । मुमोच ज्वलितं दीप्तमस्त्रब्रह्मविनिर्मितम् ।।
data.es: Powerful Rama, destroyer of foes, lifted in a rage his arrow blazing like the light of the Sun, strung it to his sturdy bow and drew it with all his force. He then aimed at the deer and released the shining arrow created by Brahma which went hissing like a serpent.
data.anv: तत्र there, भूयः again, कुपितः enraged, अरिमर्दनः destroyer of foes, बली powerful,राघवः Rama, सूर्यरश्मिप्रतीकाशम् glowing like the rays of the Sun, ज्वलन्तम् blazing, शरम् dart, उद्धृत्य lifting, सुदृढे in a sturdy, चापे in bow, सन्धाय  aiming, बलवत् with force, विकृष्य drew, श्वसन्तम् sighing, पन्नगम् इव like the serpent, ज्वलितम् burning, दीप्तम् shining, ब्रह्मनिर्मितम् created by Brahma, अस्त्रम् weapon, तम् him, मृगमेव on the deer, उद्दिश्य aiming, मुमोच released.

data.v: स भृशं मृगरूपस्य विनिर्भिद्य शरोत्तमः । मारीचस्यैव हृदयं विभेदाशनिसंनिभः ।।
data.es: The great arrow which was like a thunderbolt first pierced into the body of Maricha who had assumed the form of a deer and then tore his heart.
data.anv: आशनिसन्निभः  like thunderbolt, शरोत्तमः the great arrow, मृगरूपस्य  assuming deer form, शरीरम् body, विनिर्भिद्य  pierced, मारीचस्य Maricha's, हृदयमेव heart, बिभेद tore.
data.md: And that best of arrows, like to a thunderbolt, deeply pierced the breast of Mārīca, wearing the shape of a deer.

data.v: तालमात्रमथोत्पत्य न्यपतत्स शरातुरः । व्यनदद्भैरवं नादं धरण्यामल्पजीवितः । म्रियमाणस्तु मारीचो जहौ तां कृत्रिमां तनुम् ।।
data.es: And, hurt by the dart, Maricha roared frighteningly, leaped as high as a palm tree and dropped down on earth almost dead.
data.anv: अथ and then, सः Maricha, शरातुरः hurt by the dart, अल्पजीवितः very little life left, भैरवं नादम् frightening sound, विनदन् released, तालमात्रम् to the height of a palm tree, उत्प्लुत्य leaped up, धरण्याम् on earth, न्यपतत् dropped.
data.md: Thereat bounding up high as a palmyra palm, that one whose saws had almost run out, uttered terrible sounds, lying on the earth.

data.v: संप्राप्तकालमाज्ञाय चकार च ततः स्वरम् । सदृशं राघवस्यैव हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च ।।
data.es: Then Maricha realised that the appropriate time had come. In a voice similar to Rama's, he shouted loudly 'Alas Sita, Alas Lakshmana '
data.anv: ततः then, सः Maricha, प्राप्तकालम् the right time, आज्ञाय having realised, राघवस्य Rama's, सदृशम् similar, हा सीते Alas, Sita, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, इति च like that, स्वनम् a sound, चकार  released.
data.md: And pierced to the marrow by that peerless shaft, Marica, renouncing his deer form, resumed his Rākşasa lineaments; and giving up his life attaining a huge person, considering the time had come (for availing himself of the advice tendered by Rāvana), began to cry with the voice of Rāghava, Ah Sita! Ah Laksmana!

data.v: तेन मर्मणि निर्विद्धः शरेणानुपमेन हि । मृगरूपं तु तत्त्यक्त्वा राक्षसं रूपमात्मनः । चक्रे स सुमहाकायो मारीचो जीवितं त्यजन् ।।
data.es: Struck in the vital part by Rama's matchless dart, Maricha gave up the form of the deer and assumed his huge body of the demon.

data.v: ततो विचित्रकेयूरः सर्वाभरणभूषितः । हेममाली महादंष्ट्रो राक्षसोऽभूच्छराहतः ।।
तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ राक्षसं घोरदर्शनम् । जगाम मनसा सीतां लक्ष्मणस्य वचः स्मरन् ।।
data.es: Seeing that terrific demon fallen on the ground, drenched in blood, and strring his limbs, Rama thought of Lakshmana's words and reached Sita mentally (thought of her).

data.md: And seeing that grim-visaged Rākşasa lying low on the ground, with his person bathed in blood, and rolling hither and thither, Rāma proceeded towards the asylum thinking of Sītā and revolving within himself Laksmana's words.

data.v: हा सीते लक्ष्मणेत्येवमाक्रुश्य तु महास्वरम् । ममार राक्षसः सोऽयं श्रुत्वा सीता कथं भवेत् ।।
data.es: This demon Maricha screamed aloud saying, 'Alas, Sita, Alas, Lakshmana'. He is now dead. How would Sita react to this voice? What would be the condition of Lakshmana? While righteous Rama reflected on this, his hair stood on end.
