data.v: तत्र रामं भयं तीव्रमाविवेश विषादजम् । राक्षसं मृगरूपं तं हत्वा श्रुत्वा च तत्स्वरम् ।।
data.es: After killing the demon in the figure of a deer and hearing his voice, Rama was overtaken by intense fear born of despair.
data.anv: मृगरूपम् in the form of a deer, राक्षसम् demon, हत्वा having killed, तत्स्वरम् that sound, श्रुत्वा च having heard, तत्र there, रामम् Rama, विषादजम् born of sadness, तीव्रम् intense, भयम् fear, आविवेश came over.
data.md: While pondering thus the hairs of the virtuous-souled Rāma stood on their end. Killing that Räkşasa assuming the shape of a deer and hearing his terrible cry Rāma was overwhelmed with fear arising out of sorrow.

data.v: निहत्य पृषतं चान्यं मांसमादाय राघवः । त्वरमाणो जनस्थानं ससाराभिमुखस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then Rama killed another deer, collected the venison and hastened to Janasthana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तदा then, राघवः Rama, अन्यम् another, पृषतम् deer, निहत्य having killed, मांसम् venison, आदाय  collected, त्वरमाणः quickly, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, अभिमुखः towards, ससार departed.
data.md: Thereupon killing a deer and taking its flesh he hastened towards Janasthāna.

data.v: आर्तस्वरं तु तं भर्तुर्विज्ञाय सदृशं वने । उवाच लक्ष्मणं सीता गच्छ जानीहि राघवम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the voice in distress and recognising that it was similar to her husband's voice, Sita said to Lakshmana, 'Go and find out Rama's whereabouts'.
data.anv: सीता Sita, वने in the forest, भर्तुः husband, सदृशम् similar, तम् that, आर्तस्वरम् voice in distress, विज्ञाय knowing, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, उवाच said, गच्छ go, राघवम् Rama, जानीहि know (what happened).
data.md: Hearing that cry in the forest resembling her husband's voice Sítā spake to Laksmana saying Do you go and learn what has befallen Rāghava.

data.v: न हि मे जीवितं स्थाने हृदयं वावतिष्ठते । क्रोशतः परमार्तस्य श्रुतः शब्दो मया भृशम् ।।
data.es: I clearly heard Rama calling out in great distress. Indeed, my heart as well as my life is not in its place (restless). You ought to go and protect your brother who is crying in pain in the forest.
data.anv: भृशम् greatly, क्रोशतः परमार्तस्य crying out in great distress, शब्द: voice, मया by me, श्रुतः heard, मे my, हृदयम् heart, जीवितं वा my life too, स्थाने in its place, न अवतिष्ठति is not resting, हि indeed, वने in the forest, आक्रन्दमानम् crying in pain, भ्रातरम् brother, त्रातुम् to protect, अर्हसि you ought to.
data.md: He is crying aloud in pitiable accents; hearing them my life and soul are incapable of remaining any longer in their proper places.

data.v: आक्रन्दमानं तु वने भ्रातरं त्रातुमर्हसि । तं क्षिप्रमभिधाव त्वं भ्रातरं शरणैषिणम् ।।
data.md: It behoveth you to save your brother who is crying aloud in the forest; do you immediately repair hence to save him, who is in need of your help. He has been over-powered by the Rākşasas like to a bullock brought under the power of a lion, Remembering the behest of Rāma, Laks maņa did not go, though accosted thus by Sītā.

data.v: रक्षसां वशमापन्नं सिंहानामिव गोवृषम् । न जगाम तथोक्तस्तु भ्रातुराज्ञाय शासनम् ।।
data.md: It behoveth you to save your brother who is crying aloud in the forest; do you immediately repair hence to save him, who is in need of your help. He has been over-powered by the Rākşasas like to a bullock brought under the power of a lion, Remembering the behest of Rāma, Laks maņa did not go, though accosted thus by Sītā.

data.v: तमुवाच ततस्तत्र कुपिता जनकात्मजा । सौमित्रे मित्ररूपेण भ्रातुस्त्वमसि शत्रुवत् ।।
data.md: Extremely mortified, the daughter of Janaka spake to him saying O Son of Sumitra, you are an enemy to Rāma, in the grab of a brother. You did not proceed for the relief of they brother who has been reduced to such a plight.

data.v: यस्त्वमस्यामवस्थायां भ्रातरं नाभिपद्यसे । इच्छसि त्वं विनश्यन्तं रामं लक्ष्मण मत्कृते ।।
data.md: Extremely mortified, the daughter of Janaka spake to him saying O Son of Sumitra, you are an enemy to Rāma, in the grab of a brother. You did not proceed for the relief of they brother who has been reduced to such a plight.

data.v: व्यसनं ते प्रियं मन्ये स्नेहो भ्रातरि नास्ति ते । तेन तिष्ठसि विस्रब्धस्तमपश्यन्महाद्युतिम् ।।
data.es: I think Rama's adversity is welcome to you. You do not have any love towards your brother. It is for this that you stand unconcerned instead of proceeding to help your brilliant brother.
data.anv: ते to you, व्यसनम् distrees, प्रियम् dear, मन्ये I think, ते to you, भ्रातरि for your brother, स्नेहः love, नास्ति is not there, तेन by that, महाद्युतिम् brilliiant, तम् him, अपश्यन् not seen, विश्रब्धम्  confident, तिष्ठसि you are standing.

data.v: किं हि संशयमापन्ने तस्मिन्निह मया भवेत् । कर्तव्यमिह तिष्ठन्त्या यत्प्रधानस्त्वमागतः ।।
data.es: When he for whose service you have primary come here, has met with difficulty, what is the use of your being here? What purpose you serve by staying here with me ?
data.anv: त्वम् you, यत्प्रधानः इह primarily to serve Rama, आगतः came here, तस्मिन् when he , संशयम् in difficulty, आपन्ने has met with, इह here, तिष्ठन्त्या remaining, मया by me, किम् what, कर्तव्यम् duty भवेत् be.
data.md: For this it is that you did sit here without anxiety not seeing the highly effulgent (Rāma). Råma, following whom you have repaired to this forest, being in danger, of what avail is life to me.?'

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणं वैदेहीं बाष्पशोकपरिप्लुताम् । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणस्त्रस्तां सीतां मृगवधूमिव ।।
data.es: As Rama was thus full of tears of sorrow, Lakshmana sighed heavily in anger like a hissing serpant in confinement. And said:
data.anv: काकुत्स्थे when Rama of the Kakutstha family, इति this way, ब्रुवति while he spoke, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, बाष्पशोकपरिप्लुते full of tears of sorrow, क्रुद्धः angry, रुद्धः tied up, नागः इव like a serpent, श्वसन् hissing, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Vaidehī speaking thus being influenced by sorrow, and with tears in her eyes, like to a deer, Laksmana spoke to her.

data.v: देवि देवमनुष्येषु गन्धर्वेषु पतत्रिषु । राक्षसेषु पिशाचेषु किंनरेषु मृगेषु च ।।
data.es: O brilliant Devi none among gods or men, gandharvas, birds or goblins kinnaras, wild animals or dreadful demons can encounter Rama in war.
data.anv: शोभने देवि O brilliant Devi, समरे वासवोपमम् like Indra in war, रामम् Rama, यः who, प्रतियुध्येत may encounter, देवमनुष्येषु among gods or men, गन्धर्वेषु among gandharvas, पतत्रिषु among birds, राक्षसेषु among demons, पिशाचेषु among goblins, किन्नरेषु even among kinnaras, मृगेषुच even animals, घोरेषु dreadful, दानवेषु demons, न विद्येत not found.

data.v: दानवेषु च घोरेषु न स विद्येत शोभने । यो रामं प्रतियुध्येत समरे वासवोपमम् ।।
data.es: O brilliant Devi none among gods or men, gandharvas, birds or goblins kinnaras, wild animals or dreadful demons can encounter Rama in war.
data.anv: शोभने देवि O brilliant Devi, समरे वासवोपमम् like Indra in war, रामम् Rama, यः who, प्रतियुध्येत may encounter, देवमनुष्येषु among gods or men, गन्धर्वेषु among gandharvas, पतत्रिषु among birds, राक्षसेषु among demons, पिशाचेषु among goblins, किन्नरेषु even among kinnaras, मृगेषुच even animals, घोरेषु dreadful, दानवेषु demons, न विद्येत not found.

data.v: अवध्यः समरे रामो नैवं त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि । न त्वामस्मिन्वने हातुमुत्सहे राघवं विना ।।
data.es: Rama is indestructible in war. It is not proper for you to say what you said. When he is not here I do not wish to leave you alone here in the forest.
data.anv: रामः Rama, समरे in war, अवध्यः indestructible, त्वम् you, एवम् in this way, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसि it is not proper, त्वाम् you, राघवं विना without Rama, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, हातुम् to leave alone, न उत्सहे I do not wish.

data.v: अनिवार्यं बलं तस्य बलैर्बलवतामपि । त्रिभिर्लोकैः समुद्युक्तैः सेश्वरैः सामरैरपि ।।
data.es: He cannot be stopped by the strength of the mighty, or by Indra supported by gods or by the wellequipped armies of all the three worlds.
data.anv: बलवताम् of strong people, बलैरपि even with all their strength, सेश्वरैः by Indra, सामरैरपि even by those supported by gods, समुद्युक्तै: by the wellequipped, त्रिभिः लोकै by the three worlds, अपि also, तस्य his, बलम् strength, अनिवार्यम् irresistible.

data.v: हृदयं निर्वृतं तेऽस्तु संतापस्त्यज्यतामयम् । आगमिष्यति ते भर्ता शीघ्रं हत्वा मृगोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: May your heart be relieved (of this fear) Give up this grief. Your husband will soon return with the excellent deer killed.
data.anv: ते your, हृदयम् heart, निर्वृतम् relieved, अस्तु may be, अयम् this, सन्तापः sorrow, त्यज्यताम् give up, ते भर्ता your husband, मृगोत्तमम् excellent deer, हत्वा after killing, श्रीघ्रम् quickly, आगमिष्यति will come back.

data.v: न स तस्य स्वरो व्यक्तं न कश्चिदपि दैवतः । गन्धर्वनगरप्रख्या माया सा तस्य रक्षसः ।।
data.es: Surely it is not his voice. It is contrived by some one's illusory power. It is the illusion created by that demon, like the city of the gandharvas. (which does not exist.)
data.anv: तस्य his, स्वरः voice, न not, व्यक्तम् it is clear, केन चित् by some one, मायया deceptively, कृतः is made, सा that, तस्य रक्षसः of that demon, गन्धर्वनगरप्रख्या like the city of the gandharvas, माया illusion.
data.md: Sooner shall your husband return killing the best of deer. It is not his voice nor one sent by any deity. It is but an illusion of that Rākşasa (Mārīca).

data.v: न्यासभूतासि वैदेहि न्यस्ता मयि महात्मना । रामेण त्वं वरारोहे न त्वां त्यक्तुमिहोत्सहे ।।
data.es: O best of women Vaidehi great Rama has entrusted your safty to me. I do not wish to leave you here alone.
data.anv: वरारोहे O beautiful lady, वैदेहि Vaidehi, न्यासभूतासि  entrusted for safety, महात्मना by the great self, रामेण by Rama, मयि with me, न्यस्ता  entrusted, इह here, त्वाम् you, त्यक्तुम् to leave, नोत्सहे  not act.
data.md: O Vaidehī, you have been left to my charge by the high-souled (Rama)-I therefore do not dare leave you behind, O you the jewel of a damsel.

data.v: कृतवैराश्च कल्याणि वयमेतैर्निशाचरैः । खरस्य निधने देवि जनस्थानवधं प्रति ।।
data.es: O Vaidehi since the killing of Khara and the residents of Janasthana we have developed enmity with the demons.
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, खरस्य Khara's, निधनादेव since his killing, जनस्थानवधं प्रति towards killing of the residents of Janasthana, वयम् we, एतैः by these, निशाचरैः by the demons, कृतवैराः  developed enmity.
data.md: We have made these night-rangers our enemies. For compassing the destruction of Khara, O worshipful one, and devastating Janasthāna, Rākṣasas oftentimes use improper words to us in this extensive forest.

data.v: राक्षसा विधिना वाचो विसृजन्ति महावने । हिंसाविहारा वैदेहि न चिन्तयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: These demons wander about tormenting others and spreading rumours of all kinds. You need not worry about them.
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, महावने in the great forest, हिंसा विहाराः who wander by torturing, राक्षसाः demons, विविधाः different , वाचः words, विसृजन्ति they spread, चिन्तयितुम् to worry, नार्हसि you need not.
data.md: O Vaidehī, to create mischief to the pious is the only amusement of these Rākşasas-you shoudst not therefore be anxious for this.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्ता तु क्रुद्धा संरक्तलोचना । अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यवादिनम् ।।
data.es: Addressed thus by Lakshmana, Sita got mighty angry. Her eyes turned red and she spoke harshly to truthful Lakshmana
data.anv: लक्ष्मणेन by  Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been told, सा Sita, क्रुद्धा an angry, संरक्तलोचना with eyes turned red, सत्यवादिनम् to the truthful, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् she spoke.
data.md: Being thus addressed by him her eyes were reddened with ire, and she spake these harsh words to the truthful Lakşmaņa.

data.v: अनार्य करुणारम्भ नृशंस कुलपांसन । अहं तव प्रियं मन्ये तेनैतानि प्रभाषसे ।।
data.es: O ignoble, cruel Lakshmana, you are a disgrace to your family. I think this great disaster of Rama is a pleasure to you.
data.anv: अनार्यकरणारम्भ man of bad conduct, नृशंस cruel one, कुलपांसन disgrace to your family, रामस्य at Rama's, महत् great, व्यसनम् disaster, तव yours, प्रियम् pleasing, अहम् I, मन्ये I think.
data.md: O cruel one! O you the destroyer of your line! it is a disgrace to you that you wishest to protect me (killing Răma). Methinks, this mighty disaster of Rāma is welcome to you, or else why should you seeing this, speak thus, O Laksmana.

data.v: नैतच्चित्रं सपत्नेषु पापं लक्ष्मण यद्भवेत् । त्वद्विधेषु नृशंसेषु नित्यं प्रच्छन्नचारिषु ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana,do you speak such words seeing the disaster of Rama? No wonder that cruel men who always move like you in disguise will thus resort to sinful action against rivals.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, रामस्य व्यसनम् Rama's disaster, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, तेन by that, एतानि these words, (प्र)भाषसे speak, नित्यम् always, प्रच्छन्नचारिषु  who move in disguise, नृशंसेषु cruel men, त्वद्विधेषु among men like you, सपत्नेषु among rivals, पापम् sin, भवेत् इति यत् will be thus, एतत् this, चित्रम् wonder, न not .
data.md: It is not a wonder that an evil desire lurks in you who are a hypocrite and a cruel-hearted cnemy.

data.v: सुदुष्टस्त्वं वने राममेकमेकोऽनुगच्छसि । मम हेतोः प्रतिच्छन्नः प्रयुक्तो भरतेन वा ।।
data.es: You are very wicked. You are hiding your true identity, and employed by Bharata, you are following Rama in the forest as he is alone.
data.anv: सुदुष्टः very wicked , त्वम् you, एकः alone, प्रतिच्छन्नः  hiding your true self, हेतोः reason, भरतेन by Bharata, प्रयुक्तः वा or employed,  एकम् alone, रामम् Rama, वने in forest, अनुगच्छसि you are following.
data.md: Verily are you a monster of wickedness, that Rāma repairing to woods, you have, being lustful for me, followed him alone. Or hast you been engaged by Bharata to act thus?

data.v: कथमिन्दीवरश्यामं रामं पद्मनिभेक्षणम् । उपसंश्रित्य भर्तारं कामयेयं पृथग्जनम् ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana such intention of yours or even of Bharata's will not be fulfilled. I have held the hands of Rama who has eyes like the lotus petal, who has the complexion of the blue lotus. How can I prefer some other man?
data.anv: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, तव वा yours or, भरतस्य वा or Bharata's, तत् such, नसिध्यति will not be fulfilled, पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् eyes like lotus petals, इन्दीवरश्यामम् looks like a blue lotus,  भर्तारम् husband, उपसंश्रित्य held the hands of, पृथग्जनम् other men, कथम् how, कामयेयम् can I prefer ?
data.md: But your or Bharata's intention shall not be satisfied, O Saumitre. How shall I desire another man after serving the lotus-eyed Rāma of dark blue hue as my husband?

data.v: समक्षं तव सौमित्रे प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्ये न संशयः । रामं विना क्षणमपि न हि जीवामि भूतले ।।
data.es: I will undoubtedly give up my life in your presence.I will not live even for a moment on earth without Rama, O son of Sumitra
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, तव in your, समक्षम् presence, प्राणाम् life, त्यक्ष्ये I  give up, संशयः doubt, न not, रामं विना without Rama, क्षणमपि even a moment, भूतले on earth, न जीवामि हि I will not live.
data.md: I shall renounce my life before you, therefore, O Laksmana; without Rāma I shall not maintain my being for a moment on this earth.

data.v: इत्युक्तः परुषं वाक्यं सीतया सोमहर्षणम् । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणः सीतां प्राञ्जलिर्विजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: The selfcontrolled Lakshmana with folded palms replied to Sita's harsh, horripilating words:
data.anv: विजितेन्द्रियः  selfcontrolled, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सीतया by Sita, इति in this way, रोमहर्षणम् causing horripilation, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, उक्तः uttered, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, सीताम् to Sita, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing these brazen words of Sītā, capable of making one's down stand on end, the selfcontrolled Lakşmaņa with joined hands spake to her saying You are a very Goddess to me, I therefore dare not answer you.

data.v: उत्तरं नोत्सहे वक्तुं दैवतं भवती मम । वाक्यमप्रतिरूपं तु न चित्रं स्त्रीषु मैथिलि ।।
data.es: O princess from Mithila, I do not want to use such harsh words. To me you are a deity (worthy of adoration). It is not surprising that women of the world use such undeserving words. It is their nature.
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, उत्तरम् reply, वक्तुम् to tell, नोत्सहे not wish, भवती yourself, मम for me, दैवतम् deity, अप्रतिरूपम् unworthy, वाक्यम् word, स्त्रीषु among women, चित्रम् wonder, न not, एषः such, नारीणाम् women's, स्वभावस्तु nature, लोकेषु in the world, एवम् likewise, दृश्यते is  seen.

data.v: स्वभावस्त्वेष नारीणामेषु लोकेषु दृश्यते । विमुक्तधर्माश्चपलास्तीक्ष्णा भेदकराः स्त्रियः ।।
उपशृण्वन्तु मे सर्वे साक्षिभूता वनेचराः । न्यायवादी यथा वाक्यमुक्तोऽहं परुषं त्वया ।।
data.es: I speak what is just while you use harsh and unjust words. Let all beings who move in the forest bear witness.
data.anv: न्यायवादी am just in speaking, अहम् I, त्वया by you, यथा like this, परुषम् harsh words, अन्यायम् unjustified, उक्तः spoken, मे to me, साक्षिभूताः witnesses , सर्वे all, वनेचराः  foresters, उपशृण्वन्तु listen.

data.v: धिक्त्वामद्य प्रणश्य त्वं यन्मामेवं विशङ्कसे । स्त्रीत्वाद्दुष्टस्वभावेन गुरुवाक्ये व्यवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: Fie upon you. Like a woman of wicked nature you doubt me when I stood firm by my brother's words. You will go to ruin.
data.anv: त्वाम् you, धिक् fie upon, स्त्रीत्वात् दुष्टस्वभावेन  woman's wicked nature, त्वम् you, गुरुवाक्ये on the word of my brother, व्यवस्थितम् stood firmly, माम् me, यत्  since, एवम् thus, विशङ्कसे doubting, प्रणश्य you will fall to ruin.

data.v: गमिष्ये यत्र काकुत्स्थः स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु वरानने । रक्षन्तु त्वां विशालाक्षि समग्रा वनदेवताः ।।
data.es: O beautiful lady, I will go to Rama wherever he may be. Be happy. O largeeyed one, may all the deities of the forest protect you.
data.anv: वरानने O beautiful lady, काकुत्स्थ Rama, यत्र whereever he be, गमिष्ये will go, ते स्वस्ति अस्तु be happy, विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, त्वाम् to you, समग्राः all the, वनदेवताः sylvan deties, रक्षन्तु protect you.

data.v: निमित्तानि हि घोराणि यानि प्रादुर्भवन्ति मे । अपि त्वां सह रामेण पश्येयं पुनरागतः ।।
data.es: O daughter of Janaka O princess from Videha, I see dreadful omens. I do not know whether I will see you when I am back with Rama.
data.anv: जनकात्मजे daughter of Janaka, वैदेहि Vaidehi, घोराणि dreadful, यानि those, निमित्तानि omens, मे me, प्रादुर्भवन्ति are manifesting, पुनः again, आगतः when I return, त्वाम् you, सह along with, रामेण with Rama, अपि पश्येयम् will I ever see, न वा or not, इत्येतत् in this way, न जानामि I do not know.
data.md: May the deities of the forest protect you, O you of expansive eyes! many a bad omen appear before me. My I see you again when I shall come back with Rāina.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्ता तु रुदती जनकात्मजा । प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं तीव्रं बाष्पपरिप्लुता ।।
data.es: At these words of Lakshmana Sita started crying. With eyes filled with tears she replied with harshness :
data.anv: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, एवम् likewise, उक्ता spoken, सा जनकात्मजा she, the daughter of Janaka, ततः then, रुदन्ती while crying, बाष्पपरिप्लुता eyes filled with tears, तीव्रम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Being thus accosted by Lakşmaņa the daughter of Janaka replied weeping and being bathed in tears.

data.v: गोदावरीं प्रवेक्ष्यामि विना रामेण लक्ष्मण । आबन्धिष्येऽथ वा त्यक्ष्ये विषमे देहमात्मनः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana without Rama I will drown myself in Godavari or hang myself or leap from a cliff into death.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, रामेण विना without Rama, गोदावरीम् Godavari, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter, अथवा or else, अबन्धिष्ये hang myself, विषमे  cliff ( dangerous place), आत्मनः myself, देहम् body, त्यक्ष्ये will give up.

data.v: पिबामि वा विषं तीक्ष्णं प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम् । न त्वहं राघवादन्यं पदापि पुरुषं स्पृशे ।।
data.es: I will drink deadly poison or enter fire and die, but will not touch any other man even with my feet.
data.anv: अहम् I, तीक्ष्णम् विषम् venom, पिबामि I will drink, हुताशनम् fire, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter, तु but, अहम् I, राघवात् Rama's, अन्यम् other, पुरुषम् man, पदापि even with feet, न स्पृशे I will not touch.
data.md: Without Rama, O Laksmana, I shall drink virulent poison, enter fire or dive into the Godāverī. I shall destroy this body either by hanging or by falling down from the top of a high object. I shall never be able to touch another man but Rāma.

data.v: इति लक्ष्मणमाक्रुश्य सीता दुःखसमन्विता । पाणिभ्यां रुदती दुःखादुदरं प्रजघान ह ।।
data.es: Thus Sita cried in distress, sadly hitting her belly with both the hands, blaming Lakshmana (all the time).
data.anv: सीता Sita, इति thus, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, आक्रुश्य दुःखसमन्विता blaming and crying in distress, रुदती crying, दुःखात् with grief, पाणिभ्याम् by her hands, उदरम् belly, प्रजघान ह hit herself.
data.md: Speaking thus to Lakşmaņa, Sītā, being enveloped with grief, weeping, struck her belly* with her hands. Properly it should be Struck her breast. But it has a special significance here, i.e.-she would not be satisfied until her belly be filled with all the Raksasas salin.तामार्तरूपां विमना रुदन्ती

data.v: तामार्तरूपां विमना रुदन्तीं; सौमित्रिरालोक्य विशालनेत्राम् । आश्वासयामास न चैव भर्तु;स्तं भ्रातरं किंचिदुवाच सीता ।।
data.es: Saumitri saw the largeeyed, dejected Sita crying in distress.He pacified and consoled her but she did not say anything at all to her husband's brother.
data.anv: सौमित्रिः Saumitri, विमनाः dejected, आर्तरूपाम्  in a pitiable state, रुदन्तीम् crying, ताम् her, विशालनेत्राम् largeeyed, आलोक्य seeing, आश्वसयामास  consoled, सीता Sita, भर्तुः husband's, भ्रातरम् brother, तम् him, किञ्चित् any thing, न उवाच did not speak.
data.md: Seeing the daughter of Janaka of expansive eyes weep thus in pitiable accents, Lakşmaņa losing his attention began to console her.

data.v: ततस्तु सीतामभिवाद्य लक्ष्मणः; कृताञ्जलिः किंचिदभिप्रणम्य । अवेक्षमाणो बहुशश्च मैथिलीं; जगाम रामस्य समीपमात्मवान् ।।
data.md: Afterwards the pure-hearted Laksmana, having control over his senses, saluting Sītā with clasped palms and bending low a little proceeded where Rāma was, casting again and again his glance upon her as he went.

data.v: तया परुषमुक्तस्तु कुपितो राघवानुजः । स विकाङ्क्षन्भृशं रामं प्रतस्थे नचिरादिव ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, brother of Rama, hurt by the harsh words of Sita, hastened with Rama's wellbeing in mind.
data.anv: तया by her, परुषम् harsh, उक्तः said, सः he, राघवानुजः brother of Rama, कुपितः angry, भृशम् very much, विकांक्षन्  wished, न चिरादिव very soon, रामम् to Rama, प्रतस्थे  went.
data.md: Having been addressed with those harsh words the younger brother of Rāghava, enraged, proceeded at once, being anxious to see Rāma.

data.v: तदासाद्य दशग्रीवः क्षिप्रमन्तरमास्थितः । अभिचक्राम वैदेहीं परिव्राजकरूपधृक् ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana who was in hiding assumed the guise of a wandering mendicant and approached Sita.
data.anv: अन्तरम् inside, आस्थितः in hiding, दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, तत् there, आसाद्य assuming, परिव्राजकरूपधृक् assuming the form of a wandering mendicant, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अभिचक्राम approached.
data.md: Thereupon the ten-necked one, availing of this opportunity came before Vaidehī assuming the semblance of a mendicant.

data.v: श्लक्ष्णकाषायसंवीतः शिखी छत्री उपानही । वामे चांसेऽवसज्याथ शुभे यष्टिकमण्डलू । परिव्राजकरूपेण वैदेहीं समुपागमत् ।।
data.es: And then Ravana wearing fine orange robes, with hair knotted on the head, carrying a parasol, wearing sandals, hanging a kamandalu (waterpot), and a staff on the auspicious left shoulder walked towards Vaidehi like a mendicant.
data.anv: अथ then, श्लक्ष्णकाषायसंवीतः wearing fine orange robes, शिखी with knotted hair on the head, छत्री with a parasol, उपानही wearing sandals, वामे अंसे on his left shoulder, शुभे auspicious, यष्टिकमण्डलू staff and water pot, आसज्य hung to the shoulder, परिव्राजकरूपेण as  a mendicant, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अन्वपद्यत walked towards.
data.md: Wearing a soft silken cloth, with a lock of hair on his head with an umbrella and shoes and having on his left shoulder a rod and kamandalu the highly powerful one assuming the appearance of a wandering devotee carrying three long bamboo staves appeared before Vaidehi in the forest when there was none of the brothers by her.

data.v: तामाससादातिबलो भ्रातृभ्यां रहितां वने । रहितां सूर्यचन्द्राभ्यां संध्यामिव महत्तमः ।।
data.es: Mighty Ravana approached Sita deprived of both the brothers, Like darkness encompasses the evening twilight in the absence of the Sun and the Moon.
data.anv: अतिबलः mighty Ravana, वने in the forest, भ्रातृभ्याम् with both brothers, रहिताम् in the absence of, ताम् them, चन्द्रसूर्याभ्याम् by both Sun and Moon, सन्ध्याम् in the evening twilight, महत् great, तमः इव like darkness, आससाद reached.

data.v: तामपश्यत्ततो बालां राजपुत्रीं यशस्विनीम् । रोहिणीं शशिना हीनां ग्रहवद्भृशदारुणः ।।
data.es: The extremely cruel Ravana saw the illustrious young wife of Rama just as Ketu looks at Rohini star in the absence of the Moon.
data.anv: ततः then, भृशदारुणः extremely cruel, यशस्विनीम् illustrious lady, रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, बालाम् young lady, ताम् her, शशिना Moon, हीनाम् without, रोहिणीम्  at  Rohini, ग्रहवत् like planet Ketu, अपश्यत् gazed.
data.md: He saw there the young and pious daughter of the king like to an evening void of both sun and moon and as the highly terrible Rahu eyes Rohini forsaken by Moon.

data.v: तमुग्रं पापकर्माणं जनस्थानरुहा द्रुमाः । समीक्ष्य न प्रकम्पन्ते न प्रवाति च मारुतः ।।
data.es: Seeing the ferocious Ravana, the huge trees at Janasthana shook vidently. Even the wind ceased to blow.
data.anv: उग्रतेजःकर्माणम् of ferocious activities, तम् him, समीक्ष्य  saw, जनस्थानरुहाः at Janasthana, महाद्रुमाः huge trees, सम्प्रकम्पन्ते  shaken up, मारुतः च even the wind, न प्रवाति blows not.

data.v: शीघ्रस्रोताश्च तं दृष्ट्वा वीक्षन्तं रक्तलोचनम् । स्तिमितं गन्तुमारेभे भयाद्गोदावरी नदी ।।
data.es: Seeing Ravana with his bloodred eyes, the swiftflowing river Godavari slowed down out of fear.
data.anv: शीघ्रस्रोताः swiftflowing, गोदावरीनदी river Godavari, रक्तलोचनम् bloodred eyes, वीक्षन्तम् looked at, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, भयात् out of fear, स्तिमितम् slow, गन्तुम् आरेभे started flowing
data.md: Seeing that terrible one the doer of evil deeds, the trees of Janasthāna did not move nor the wind did blow. Seeing him eye Sītā with his blood-red eyes, the fast streaming river Godāverī even slackened its course out of fear.

data.v: रामस्य त्वन्तरं प्रेप्सुर्दशग्रीवस्तदन्तरे । उपतस्थे च वैदेहीं भिक्षुरूपेण रावणः ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana who was waiting for Rama's absence now got it. Disguised as a mendicant he stepped toward to where Sita was.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, अन्तरप्रेप्सुः waiting for a chance, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, रावणः Ravana, तदन्तरे  in his absence, भिक्षुरूपेण disguised in the form of a mendicant, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, उपतस्थे went close.
data.md: In the mean time the Ten-necked Rävana, enquiring about Rāma's weak points appeared before Vaidehī in the guise of a mendicant.

data.v: अभव्यो भव्यरूपेण भर्तारमनुशोचतीम् । अभ्यवर्तत वैदेहीं चित्रामिव शनैश्चरः ।।
data.es: The evilminded Ravana in the guise of a holy man, like Saturn moves towards Chitra star, came close to Sita who was brooding over her husband.
data.anv: अभव्यः evil one, भर्तारम् about husband, अनुशोचतीम्  worried , वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, भव्यरूपेण disguised like a holy man, शनैश्चरः like the Saturn moving to, चित्रामिव towards Chitra , अभ्यवर्तत stood near.
data.md: Like to Sani approaching citră, that impious one, assuming the appearance of a pious man like a well covered with grass, approached Vaidehī who was bewailing her husband.

data.v: स पापो भव्यरूपेण तृणैः कूप इवावृतः । अतिष्ठत्प्रेक्ष्य वैदेहीं रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: Just like a well is concealed by an overgrowth of grass, Ravana guised as a holy man stood looking at illustrious Sita, the wife of Rama.
data.anv: कूपः well, तृणै by grass, भव्यरूपेण disguised like a holy man, आवृतः concealed, इव like, सः he, पापः that sinner, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, प्रेक्ष्य after seeing, अतिष्ठत् stood.
data.md: And seeing that pious spouse of Rāma-Vaidehi, Ravana stood before her.

data.v: शुभां रुचिरदन्तौष्ठीं पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् । आसीनां पर्णशालायां बाष्पशोकाभिपीडिताम् ।।
data.es: The wicked demon came close to that auspicious princess from Videha sitting in the cottage Her face was like the full moon. Her teeth and lips were lovely. She was clad in yellow silk. Her eyes were like lotus petals tormented by tears of grief.
data.anv: दुष्टचेताः wicked, सः निशाचरः that nightwalker, शुभाम् auspicious lady, रुचिरदन्तोष्ठीम् lwith lovely teeth and lips, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् face like the fullmoon, पर्णशालायाम् in the cottage, आसीनाम् seated, बाष्पशोकाभिपीडिताम् tormented by tears of grief, पद्मपलाशाक्षीम् eyes like lotus petals, पीतकौशेयवासिनीम् clad in yellow silk, तां वैदेहीम् that Vaidehi, अभ्यगच्छत came close.
data.md: Her lips and teeth were extremely fine, her face resembled the full moon and her eyes were like lotus-petals. She had a yellow siiken cloth on and sat in the thatched cottage, overwhelmed with grief and bathed in tears.

data.v: स तां पद्मपलाशाक्षीं पीतकौशेयवासिनीम् । अभ्यगच्छत वैदेहीं दुष्टचेता निशाचरः ।।
data.es: The wicked demon came close to that auspicious princess from Videha sitting in the cottage Her face was like the full moon. Her teeth and lips were lovely. She was clad in yellow silk. Her eyes were like lotus petals tormented by tears of grief.
data.anv: दुष्टचेताः wicked, सः निशाचरः that nightwalker, शुभाम् auspicious lady, रुचिरदन्तोष्ठीम् lwith lovely teeth and lips, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् face like the fullmoon, पर्णशालायाम् in the cottage, आसीनाम् seated, बाष्पशोकाभिपीडिताम् tormented by tears of grief, पद्मपलाशाक्षीम् eyes like lotus petals, पीतकौशेयवासिनीम् clad in yellow silk, तां वैदेहीम् that Vaidehi, अभ्यगच्छत came close.
data.md: And that ranger of the night with a pleased heart approached Vaidehī.

data.v: स मन्मथशराविष्टो ब्रह्मघोषमुदीरयन् । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं रहिते राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: Thus addressed, Sita was enraged and her eyes turned red. She replied in harsh words to the chief of the demons in that solitary place:.

Waiting eagerly for her husband, she only saw the vast stretch of green forest but not Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, सुवेषम् that beautiful form of Rama, मृगयागतम् gone to hunt the deer, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, पतिम् husband, प्रतीक्षमाणा while waited, तदा then, विवीक्षमाणा  while she looked with eagerness, हरितम् green, तत् that, महत् dense, वनम् forest, ददर्श saw, रामलक्ष्मणौ तु for Rama and Lakshmana, नैव not seen.
data.md: She was anxiously expecting the return of Rāma who had gone a-hunting with Lakşmaņa; she looked around and beheld but on all sides the spacious yellow forest-land-~-there was neither Rāma nor Lakşmaņa.

data.v: रावणेन तु वैदेही तदा पृष्टा जिहीर्षुणा । परिव्राजकरूपेण शशंसात्मानमात्मना ।।
data.es: Then Ravana in the guise of a mendicant with crooked intention to abduct her, asked Vaidehi to tell him about herself.
data.anv: तदा then, जिहीर्षुणा of crooked intention of abducting, परिव्राजकरूपेण in the guise of a mendicant, रावणेन by Ravana, पृष्टा was asked, वैदेही Vaidehi, आत्मानम् about her, आत्मना herself, शशंस told.
data.md: Being thus addressed by Rāvaņa under the guise of a mendicant, desirous of carrying her away Vaidehī thought within herself.

data.v: ब्राह्मणश्चातिथिश्चैष अनुक्तो हि शपेत माम् । इति ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं तु सीता वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: 'He is a brahmin and also a guest. If unanswered he may curse me'. Thinking this Sita thought for a moment and said:
data.anv: ब्राह्मणश्च a brahmin, अतिथिश्च also a guest, अयम् this man, अनुक्तः unanswered, माम् me, शपेत हि may curse, इति thus, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, ध्यात्वा thought, सीता Sita, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: This person is my guest and a Brahmin; he may curse me if I do not speak to him. Thinking this for a moment Sītā said.

data.v: दुहिता जनकस्याहं मैथिलस्य महात्मनः । सीता नाम्नास्मि भद्रं ते रामभार्या द्विजोत्तम ।।
data.es: O best of brahmins be pleased to know I am Sita by name, daughter of the great Janaka, king of Mithila and wife of Rama.
data.anv: द्विजोत्तम O best of brahmin, अहम् I am, मैथिलस्य of the king of Maithila, महात्मनः of the great king, जनकस्य Janaka's, दुहिता daughter, नाम्ना by name, सीता अस्मि Sita, रामभार्या wife of Rama, ते to you, भद्रम् be pleased.
data.md: May good betide you! I am the daughter of the high-souled Janaka, the king of Mithilā, the beloved Queen of Rāma and my name is Sītā.

data.v: संवत्सरं चाध्युषिता राघवस्य निवेशने । भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी ।।
data.es: I lived in the house of the Ikshvakus for twelve years and enjoyed all kinds of pleasures meant for mortals.
data.anv: द्वादश twelve, समाः years, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of the Ikshvaku family, निवेशने in the house, उषित्वा  lived, मानुषान् of mortals, भोगान् pleasures, भुञ्जाना enjoying, सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी all my desires fulfilled.
data.md: Dwelling in the palace of Ikşäkus for twelve years, I enjoyed many things passing human and had all my desires satisfied.

data.v: ततः संवत्सरादूर्ध्वं सममन्यत मे पतिम् । अभिषेचयितुं रामं समेतो राजमन्त्रिभिः ।।
data.es: In the thirteenth year, the king and lord Dasaratha consulted other kings and ministers to consecrate Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, प्रभुः राजा king and lord, त्रयोदशे वर्षे in the thirteenth year, राजमन्त्रिभिः   kings and ministers, समेतः together, रामम् for Rama, अभिषेचयितुम् to consecrate, अमन्त्रयत  consulted.
data.md: On the thirteenth year king (Dasaratha) counselled with his ministers about the installation of Rāma.

data.v: तस्मिन्संभ्रियमाणे तु राघवस्याभिषेचने । कैकेयी नाम भर्तारं ममार्या याचते वरम् ।।
data.es: Arrangements for consecration were on when queen Kaikeyi sought a boon from the king.
data.anv: राघवस्य Rama's, तस्मिन् in that, अभिषेचने consecration, सम्भ्रियमाणे  arrangements were being made, कैकेयी नाम Kaikeyi by name, सा she, भर्तारम् her husband, आर्या lady, वरम् boon, याचते sought.
data.md: Accordingly everything necessary for the installation being made ready, KaikeyI, one of my mothers-in-law, begged of her husband a boon.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य तु कैकेयी श्वशुरं सुकृतेन मे । मम प्रव्राजनं भर्तुर्भरतस्याभिषेचनम् । द्वावयाचत भर्तारं सत्यसंधं नृपोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: For the fulfilment of the promise made to Kaikeyi earlier by my truthful fatherin law, who, to my good luck, was the best of kings, she asked for two boons. One was banishment of my husband and second, consecration of Bharata.
data.anv: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, मे श्वशुरम् my fatherinlaw, सुकृतेन by good luck, प्रतिगृह्य  extracted a  promise ( married for a consideration), सत्यसन्धम् truthful, नृपोत्तमम् best of kings, भर्तारम् husband's, मम भर्तुः of my husband, प्रव्राजनम् banishment, भरतस्य Bharata's, अभिषेचनम् consecration, द्वौ two (boons), अयाचत asked.
data.md: Bringing my father-in-law under control by means of her virtuous deeds, Kaikeyi begged, of that truthful, best of monarchs, two boons namely the exile of my husband into woods and the installation of Bharata,

data.v: नाद्य भोक्ष्ये न च स्वप्स्ये न पास्येऽहं कदाचन । एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते ।।
data.es: 'I shall not eat, or sleep or even drink if Rama is consecrated and I shall put an end to my life itself' (said Kaikeyi).
data.anv: अद्य today, रामः Rama, यदिअभिषिच्यते if consecrated, न भोक्ष्ये I will not eat, न च स्वप्स्ये I will not sleep, कथञ्चन in any way, नपास्ये च I will not drink, एषः this is, मे my, जीवितस्य life's, अन्तः an end.
data.md: And said-I shall never eat, drink or sleep and (if Rāma be installed) I shall end my life.

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणां कैकेयीं श्वशुरो मे स मानदः । अयाचतार्थैरन्वर्थैर्न च याच्ञां चकार सा ।।
data.es: The king, my fatherinlaw, who respected her offered riches. Which she did not accept.
data.anv: इति thus, ब्रुवाणाम् while speaking, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, मानदः respectable, सः he, मे my, श्वशुरः fatherinlaw, अन्वर्थैः अर्थैः riches, अयाचत requested, सा she, याञ्चाम् soliciting, न च चकार not agreed.
data.md: Kaikeyī speaking thus, that lord of earth, my father-in-law begged her to accept diverse riches; but Kaikeyi did not agree.

data.v: मम भर्ता महातेजा वयसा पञ्चविंशकः । रामेति प्रथितो लोके गुणवान्सत्यवाक्शुचिः । विशालाक्षो महाबाहुः सर्वभूतहिते रतः ।।
data.es: My husband known in the world as Rama is largeeyed, longarmed, virtuous, truthful, pure and is always engaged in the welfare of all beings.
data.anv: रामेति known as Rama, लोके in the world, प्रथितः famous, गुणवान् virtuous, सत्यवान् truthful, शुचिः pure, विशालाक्षः  large eyed, महाबाहुः  largearmed, सर्वभूतहिते in the wellbeing of all, रतः engaged.
data.md: My husband is known all over the world under the name of Rāma he is truthful, goodnatured, of pure character, ever engaged in the welfare of all created beings, of mighty-arms and expansive eyes.

data.v: अभिषेकाय तु पितुः समीपं राममागतम् । कैकेयी मम भर्तारमित्युवाच द्रुतं वचः ।।
data.es: When my husband Rama approached his father for the consecration she said these unhesitating words:
data.anv: अभिषेकाय for consecration, तु but, समीपम् near, आगतम् reached, मम भर्तारम् to my husband, रामम् Rama, इति धृतम् in unhesitating  वचः words, उवाच said.
data.md: When Rāma came to his father for being installed Kaikeyi spoke to my husband the following cruel words.

data.v: तव पित्रा समाज्ञप्तं ममेदं शृणु राघव । भरताय प्रदातव्यमिदं राज्यमकण्टकम् ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, listen, your father has ordered that this kingdom be bestowed on Bharata without any obstacles.
data.anv: राघव O Rama, तव your, पित्रा by father, समाज्ञप्तम् is ordered, इदम् this way, शृणु listen, अकण्टकम् without any obstacles, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, भरताय to Bharata, प्रदातव्यम् should be bestowed.
data.md: Do you hear, O Rāghava, how I have been ordered by your Sire. This kingdom, rid of thorns is to be conferred of Bharata, and you shall have to sojourn into woods for years nine and five. Do you therefore repair to forest, O Kākutstha and save your Sire from untruth.

data.v: त्वया तु खलु वस्तव्यं नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च । वने प्रव्रज काकुत्स्थ पितरं मोचयानृतात् ।।
data.es: 'O Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty, you should live in the forest for fourteen years and save your father from falsehood'.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty, त्वया by you, नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि fourteen years, वने in the forest, वस्तव्यम् खलु you should live indeed, प्रव्रज  proceed in exile, पितरम् to father, अनृतात् from falsehood, मोचय save him.
data.md: Do you hear, O Rāghava, how I have been ordered by your Sire. This kingdom, rid of thorns is to be conferred of Bharata, and you shall have to sojourn into woods for years nine and five. Do you therefore repair to forest, O Kākutstha and save your Sire from untruth.

data.v: तथेत्युवाच तां रामः कैकेयीमकुतोभयः । चकार तद्वचस्तस्या मम भर्ता दृढव्रतः ।।
data.es: My husband Rama, a man of fearlessness and firm resolution, said to Kaikeyi 'Be it so' and carried out her words.
data.anv: अकुतोभयः a fearless man, दृढव्रतः of firm resolution, मम भर्ता my husband, रामः Rama, तथेति be it so, ताम् her, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, उक्त्वा said, तस्याः her, तत् those, वचः words, चकार executed.
data.md: Whereto Rāma fearlessly replied 'So be it!' Hearing her words my husband of firm vows acted accordingly.

data.v: दद्यान्न प्रतिगृह्णीयात्सत्यब्रूयान्न चानृतम् । एतद्ब्राह्मण रामस्य व्रतं ध्रुवमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: O brahmin this is his firm resolve and his great vow: 'One should give and never take one should speak the truth and nothing but he truth.'
data.anv: दद्यात् giver, न प्रतिगृह्णीयात् not receive, सत्यम् truth, ब्रूयात् utter, अनृतम् other than truth, न च not utter, ब्राह्मण brahmin, एतत् this is, रामस्य Rama's, धृवम् resolve, अनुत्तमम् very great, व्रतम् vow.
data.md: He always maketh gifts and taketh none. He always speaketh truth and never telleth an untruth. This is his best observance O Brāhmana.

data.v: तस्य भ्राता तु वैमात्रो लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान् । रामस्य पुरुषव्याघ्रः सहायः समरेऽरिहा ।।
data.es: Son to the second mother of Rama, his mighty halfbrother, by name, Lakshmana, a tiger among men and a slayer of enemies in battle is a companion to him.
data.anv: तस्य रामस्य such Rama's, द्वैमात्रः भ्राता second mother's son, half brother, वीर्यवान् strong, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, अरिहा slayer of enemies, लक्ष्मणो नाम by name Lakshmana, समरे in battle, सहाय: companion.
data.md: His half-brother named Lakşmaņa is of mighty prowess. That best of men is Rāma's help and the destroyer of foes in battle. That brother of his named Lakşmaņa is of firm resolution and given to asceticism.

data.v: स भ्राता लक्ष्मणो नाम धर्मचारी दृढव्रतः । अन्वगच्छद्धनुष्पाणिः प्रव्रजन्तं मया सह ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, his brother, is righteous and steadfast. Bow in hand, he followed Rama along with me, into exile.
data.anv: धर्मचारी righteous, दृढव्रतः steadfast, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, सः भ्राता his brother, धनुष्पाणिः wielder of bow, मया सह along with me, प्रव्रजन्तम् as he was being exiled, अन्वगच्छत् came along.

data.v: ते वयं प्रच्युता राज्यात्कैलेय्यास्तु कृते त्रयः । विचराम द्विजश्रेष्ठ वनं गम्भीरमोजसा ।।
data.es: O best of brahmins three of us have been wandering with courage in the deep forest, dislodged from the kingdom on account of Kaikeyi.
data.anv: द्विजश्रेष्ठ O best among brahmins, ते those of us, वयम् we, त्रयः three of us, कैकेय्याः कृते on account of Kaikeyi, राज्यात् from kingdom, प्रच्युताः dislodged, ओजसा  with valour, गम्भीरम् deep, वनम् forest, विचरामः wandering.

data.v: समाश्वस मुहूर्तं तु शक्यं वस्तुमिह त्वया । आगमिष्यति मे भर्ता वन्यमादाय पुष्कलम् ।।
data.es: Rest here awhile. My husband will return with plenty of meat of many kinds from the forest, killing deer, alligators and wild boars.
data.anv: मुहूर्तम् for a while, समाश्वस take rest, त्वया by you, इह here, वस्तुम् to stay, शक्यम् it is possible, मे भर्ता my husband, रुरून् deer, गोधाः alligators, वराहांश्च boars, हत्वा after killing, बहून् many of them, आमिषान् varieties of meat, आदाय would fetch, पुष्कलम् in plenty, वन्यम् from the forest, आदाय getting, आगमिष्यति will come.

data.v: स त्वं नाम च गोत्रं च कुलमाचक्ष्व तत्त्वतः । एकश्च दण्डकारण्ये किमर्थं चरसि द्विज ।।
data.es: O brahmin, tell me your name, your gotra and your pedigree. And the purpose for which you are going about all alone in this Dandaka forest
data.anv: द्विज O brahmin, सः such as you, त्वम् you, नाम च name and, गोत्रञ्च gotram, कुलं च race, तत्त्वतः truly, आचक्ष्व tell me, एकः च alone, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, किमर्थम् for what purpose, चरसि going about.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवत्यां सीतायां रामपत्न्यां महाबलः । प्रत्युवाचोत्तरं तीव्रं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: To these words of Sita, Rama's wife, Ravana, the powerful king of demons, replied sharp:
data.anv: रामपत्न्याम् when Rama's wife, सीतायाम् Sita, एवम् in that way, ब्रुवन्त्याम् speaking, महाबलः   powerful, राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, रावणः Ravana, तीव्रम् sharp, उत्तरम् reply, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: Sītā the wife of Rāma speaking thus, the mighty Lord of Rākşasas-Rävana replied with these harsh words,

data.v: येन वित्रासिता लोकाः सदेवासुरपन्नगाः । अहं स रावणो नाम सीते रक्षोगणेश्वरः ।।
data.es: O Sita I am called Ravana, the lord of demons by whom all the worlds of demons, snakes and gods are frightened.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, अहम् I am, येन by whom, सदेवासुरपन्नगाः asuras and pannagas along with gods, लोकाः worlds, वित्रासिताः are frightened, रक्षोगणेश्वरः lord of demons, रावणो नाम Ravana by name.
data.md: O Sītā I am that Rāvaņa, the lord of Rākşasas, whoin fear the celestials, Asuras and human beings.

data.v: त्वां तु काञ्चनवर्णाभां दृष्ट्वा कौशेयवासिनीम् । रतिं स्वकेषु दारेषु नाधिगच्छाम्यनिन्दिते ।।
data.es: O flawless beauty of golden complexion seeing you clad in silk, I am not inclined to show any interest in my own wives.
data.anv: अनिन्दिते O flawless lady, काञ्चनवर्णाभाम् of golden complexion, कौशेयवासिनीम् clad in silk, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, स्वकेषु my own, दारेषु wives, रतिम् love, नाधिगच्छामि do not feel.
data.md: O you of blameless beauty, seeing you of golden hue and wearing silk cloth I do not relish my own wives.

data.v: बह्वीनामुत्तमस्त्रीणामाहृतानामितस्ततः । सर्वासामेव भद्रं ते ममाग्रमहिषी भव ।।
data.es: You will be the chief queen among the best of women I have won in wars. Be blessed.
data.anv: इतस्तत: from various places, आहृतानाम् won over, बह्वीनाम् of many women, सर्वासामेव of all of them, उत्तमस्त्रीणाम् of the best of women, मम myself, अग्रमहिषी chief queen, भव be, ते भद्रम् be blessed.
data.md: I have brought many a beautiful damsel from various quarters, do you become my foremost Queen among them.

data.v: लङ्का नाम समुद्रस्य मध्ये मम महापुरी । सागरेण परिक्षिप्ता निविष्टा गिरिमूर्धनि ।।
data.es: My great city called Lanka is on the peak of a mountain surrounded by, and in the middle of, the sea.
data.anv: लङ्का नाम by name Lanka, मम my, महापुरी great city, समुद्रस्य of the sea, मध्ये in the  middle, सागरेण by sea, परिक्षिप्ता surrounded, नगमूर्धनि on the peak of a mountain, निविष्टा it is situated.
data.md: That great city in the midst of the ocean, Larkā, encircled on all sides by the sea and situated on the summit of a hill, is my capital.

data.v: तत्र सीते मया सार्धं वनेषु विचरिष्यसि । न चास्यारण्यवासस्य स्पृहयिष्यसि भामिनि ।।
data.es: O Sita, you can stroll with me in my pleasuregardens. O beautiful lady, you will not like living in the forest (thereafter).
data.anv: सीते O Sita, तत्र there, मया सार्धम् with me, वनेषु in the gardens, विहरिष्यसि can stroll with pleasure, भामिनि O beautiful woman, अस्य of this, अरण्यस्य वासस्य living in the forest, न च स्पृहयिष्यसि will not like.
data.md: There shall you with me, O Sītā, walk in gardens, and thus you shall no more long for living in the forest.

data.v: पञ्चदास्यः सहस्राणि सर्वाभरणभूषिताः । सीते परिचरिष्यन्ति भार्या भवसि मे यदि ।।
data.es: O Sita if you become my wife, five thousand female attendants adorned with all ornaments will attend on you.
data.anv: सीते Sita, मे my, भार्या wife, भवसि यदि if you become so, सर्वाभरणभूषिताः adorned with all kinds of ornaments, सहस्राणि thousands, पञ्च five, दास्यः female attendants, परिचरिष्यन्ति they will serve you.
data.md: If you did become my wife, O Sītā, five thousand maid-servants decorated with divers ornaments shall serve you.

data.v: रावणेनैवमुक्ता तु कुपिता जनकात्मजा । प्रत्युवाचानवद्याङ्गी तमनादृत्य राक्षसं ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Ravana, Janaki, a lady of blemishless limbs, got enraged and replied without caring for the demon:
data.anv: रावणेन by Ravana, एवम् like that, उक्ता having been told, अनवद्याङ्गी a lady of blemishless limbs, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter(Janaki), कुपिता in rage, तम् that, राक्षसम् demon, अनादृत्य without caring, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: That blameless daughter of Janaka, being thus addressed by Ravana, was highly enraged, and, passing by him, replied.

data.v: महागिरिमिवाकम्प्यं महेन्द्रसदृशं पतिम् । महोदधिमिवाक्षोभ्यमहं राममनुव्रता ।।
data.es: I am devoted to Rama, my husband, who is unshakeable like a huge mountain, is comparable to lord Indra and is imperturbable like the mighty ocean.
data.anv: महागिरिमिव like a huge mountain, अकम्प्यम् unshakeable, महेन्द्रसदृशम् equal to great Indra, महोदधिमिव like a mighty sea, अक्षोभ्यम् imperturbable, पतिम् husband, रामम् Rama, अहम् I, अनुव्रता faithful follower.
data.md: I am a dependant of Rāma, who is incapable of being, shaken, like to a mighty mountain, incapable of being agitated, like to a vast ocean, and resembling Mahendra in effulgence.

data.v: महाबाहुं महोरस्कं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् । नृसिंहं सिंहसंकाशमहं राममनुव्रता ।।
data.es: I am the faithful wife of the longarmed, broadchested Rama, a lion among men. His gait is the gait of an advancing, invincible lion.
data.anv: अहम् I am, महाबाहुम् longarmed hero, महोरस्कम् broadchested, सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् takes strides like an advancing lion, नृसिंहम् like a lion among men, सिंहसङ्काशम् invincible  like lion, रामम् Rama, अनुव्रता faithful wife.
data.md: I am a dependant of that lion among men, Rāma, of mighty arms, of a spacious breast an treading like a lion.

data.v: पूर्णचन्द्राननं वीरं राजवत्सं जितेन्द्रियम् । पृथुकीर्तिं महाबाहुमहं राममनुव्रता ।।
data.es: I am the devoted wife of great Rama, whose face is like a fullmoon, who is the son of a king, who has conquered his senses and whose fame is widespread (on earth).
data.anv: अहम् I am, पुर्णचन्द्राननम् face like the full Moon, राजवत्सम् son of a king, जितेन्द्रियम्  who has conquered his senses, पृथुकीर्तिम् whose fame is widespread, महात्मानम् great self, रामम् Rama, अनुव्रता devoted wife.
data.md: I am a dependant of that son of a king, Rāma, of mighty arms, having control over his passions, whose face resembles the full moon and whose fame has spread far and wide over the earth.36

data.v: त्वं पुनर्जम्बुकः सिंहीं मामिहेच्छसि दुर्लभाम् । नाहं शक्या त्वया स्प्रष्टुमादित्यस्य प्रभा यथा ।।
data.es: You are a jackal, and you want a lioness like me who is difficult to win. I am like the Sun's radiance whom you cannot even touch.
data.anv: जम्बुकः jackal, त्वं पुनः you are, सुदुर्लभाम् most difficult to have, सिंहीम् a lioness, माम् me, इच्छसि you are desiring, आदित्यस्य like the Sun's, प्रभा यथा radiance, अहम् I am, त्वया by you, स्प्रष्टुम् even to touch, न शक्या not possible.
data.md: Why do you being a tiger wish for a she-lion? You shall not be able to touch me like to the rays of the sun.

data.v: पादपान्काञ्चनान्नूनं बहून्पश्यसि मन्दभाक् । राघवस्य प्रियां भार्यां यस्त्वमिच्छसि रावण ।।
data.es: O luckless Ravana you want the beloved wife of Rama.You will, for sure, see golden trees. (which those close to death do).
data.anv: रावण O Ravana, यः one who, त्वम् you, राघवस्य Rama's, प्रियाम् dear, भार्याम् wife, इच्छसि you want, मन्दभाक् unfortunate, नूनम् certainly, काञ्चनान् golden, पादपान् trees, पश्यसि you will see.
data.md: O you wretched Rākşasa, when you have desired to steal away Raghhava's beloved spouse, surely do you see these trees (before you) as made of gold.

data.v: क्षुधितस्य च सिंहस्य मृगशत्रोस्तरस्विनः । आशीविषस्य वदनाद्दंष्ट्रामादातुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You are seeking to pull the teeth from the mouth of a hungry and powerful lion who is considered the enemy of the deer(which you are). You intend to pull the fang of a poisonous snake.
data.anv: मृगशत्रोः enemy of the deer, तरस्विनः of the powerful, क्षुधितस्य of a hungry, सिंहस्य lion's, आशीविषस्य of a poisonous snake, मुखात् from the mouth, दंष्ट्राम् teeth, आदातुम् to seize, इच्छसि intending.

data.v: मन्दरं पर्वतश्रेष्ठं पाणिना हर्तुमिच्छसि । कालकूटं विषं पीत्वा स्वस्तिमान्गन्तुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You are trying to carry the greatest of mountains, the Mandara, with one hand. You are wishing to go safe after drinking deadly poison (produced from the churning of the ocean).
data.anv: पर्वतश्रेष्ठम् greatest of the mountains, मन्दरम् Mandara, पाणिना with a hand, हर्तुम् to carry, इच्छसि want, कालकूटं विषम् deadly poison (produced from the churning of the ocean), पीत्वा after drinking, स्वस्तिमान् safely, गन्तुम् to go, इच्छसि wishing.

data.v: अक्षिसूच्या प्रमृजसि जिह्वया लेढि च क्षुरम् । राघवस्य प्रियां भार्यामधिगन्तुं त्वमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You wish to violate the loving wife of Rama. You are rubbing your eyes with a needle and licking the razor with your tongue.
data.anv: यः he who, त्वम् you, राघवस्य प्रियाम् dear to Rama, भार्याम् wife, अधिगन्तुम् violate, इच्छसि desiring to, सूच्या by needle, अक्षि eyes, प्रमृजसि rubbing, जिह्वया by your tongue, क्षुरम् razor, लेक्षि licking.

data.v: अवसज्य शिलां कण्ठे समुद्रं तर्तुमिच्छसि । सूर्या चन्द्रमसौ चोभौ प्राणिभ्यां हर्तुमिच्छसि । यो रामस्य प्रियां भार्यां प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You want to assault Rama's dear wife. It is like girding a stone round the neck and trying to cross the sea.It is like intending to take the Sun and the Moon with both your hands.
data.anv: यः he who, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियाम् very dear, भार्याम् wife, प्रधर्षयितुम् assault, इच्छसि desiring, कण्ठे in the neck, शिलाम् stone, अवसज्य after girding round the neck, समुद्रम् sea, तर्तुम् cross, इच्छसि desiring, सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ Sun and Moon, उभौ both, पाणिभ्याम् with both hands, हर्तुम् to carry, इच्छसि desiring,

data.v: अग्निं प्रज्वलितं दृष्ट्वा वस्त्रेणाहर्तुमिच्छसि । कल्याण वृत्तां रामस्य यो भार्यां हर्तुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You intend to assaut the wife of Rama, who is a lady of virtuous conduct. You wish to hold blazing fire in your cloth.
data.anv: यः one who, रामस्य Rama's, कल्याणवृत्ताम् a woman of virtuous conduct, भार्याम् wife, हर्तुम् to seize, इच्छसि you intend to, प्रज्वलितम् blazing, अग्निम् fire, दृष्ट्वा after seeing that, वस्त्रेण by cloth, आहर्तुम् to hold, इच्छसि desiring.

data.v: अयोमुखानां शूलानामग्रे चरितुमिच्छसि । रामस्य सदृशीं भार्यां योऽधिगन्तुं त्वमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: You wish to violate the loving wife of Rama. You are rubbing your eyes with a needle and licking the razor with your tongue.
data.anv: यः he who, त्वम् you, राघवस्य प्रियाम् dear to Rama, भार्याम् wife, अधिगन्तुम् violate, इच्छसि desiring to, सूच्या by needle, अक्षि eyes, प्रमृजसि rubbing, जिह्वया by your tongue, क्षुरम् razor, लेक्षि licking.

data.v: यदन्तरं सिंहशृगालयोर्वने; यदन्तरं स्यन्दनिकासमुद्रयोः । सुराग्र्यसौवीरकयोर्यदन्तरं; तदन्तरं दाशरथेस्तवैव च ।।
data.es: The difference between you and Rama is the difference between a jackal and a lion in the forest, between a ditch and the sea, and between sour gruel and the best of wines.
data.anv: वने in the forest, सिंहशृगालयोः between a lion and a jackal, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, स्यन्दिनिकासमुद्रयोः between a ditch and a sea, यत् that, अन्तरम् difference, सुराग्र्य सौवीरकयोः best of wines and sour gruel, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, तव your, राघवस्य च and Rama, तत् there, अन्तरम् difference.

data.v: यदन्तरं काञ्चनसीसलोहयो;र्यदन्तरं चन्दनवारिपङ्कयोः । यदन्तरं हस्तिबिडालयोर्वने; तदन्तरं दशरथेस्तवैव च ।।
data.es: The difference between you and Rama is the difference between gold and lead, sandal and slime, an elephant and a cat of the forest.
data.anv: काञ्चनसीसलोहयोः between gold and lead, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, चन्दनवारिपङ्कयोः between sandal and slime, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, हस्तिबिडालयोर्वने between the elephant and the cat in the forest, दाशरथेः of Dasaratha's son, तवैव च and yours, तत् that, अन्तरम् difference.

data.v: यदन्तरं वायसवैनतेययो;र्यदन्तरं मद्गुमयूरयोरपि । यदन्तरं सारसगृध्रयोर्वने; तदन्तरं दाशरथेस्तवैव च ।।
data.es: The difference between you and Rama is the difference between gold and lead, sandal and slime, an elephant and a cat of the forest.
data.anv: काञ्चनसीसलोहयोः between gold and lead, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, चन्दनवारिपङ्कयोः between sandal and slime, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, हस्तिबिडालयोर्वने between the elephant and the cat in the forest, दाशरथेः of Dasaratha's son, तवैव च and yours, तत् that, अन्तरम् difference.

data.v: तस्मिन्सहस्राक्षसमप्रभावे; रामे स्थिते कार्मुकबाणपाणौ । हृतापि तेऽहं न जरां गमिष्ये; वज्रं यथा मक्षिकयावगीर्णम् ।।
data.es: So long Rama, equal in prowess to the thousandeyed Indra stands with bow and arrows in hand, I will not, although abducted, wither away like a diamond gulped by an insect (fly).
data.anv: हृतापि even if I am abducted, अहम् I, सहस्राक्षसमप्रभावे a man equal in prowess to the thousandeyed Indra, कार्मुक बाणपाणौ armed with bow and arrows, तस्मिन् when he, रामे while Rama, स्थिते when he stands, मक्षिकया by fly, अवगीर्णम् gulped (presuming it to be a grain of  rice), वज्रं यथा like a diamond, ते to you, जरां न गमिष्ये will not be withered.

data.v: इतीव तद्वाक्यमदुष्टभावा; सुदृष्टमुक्त्वा रजनीचरं तम् । गात्रप्रकम्पाद्व्यथिता बभूव; वातोद्धता सा कदलीव तन्वी ।।
data.es: Having said thus to the wicked nightwalker Ravana, Sita, pure in thought remained distressed.Her slender body started trembling like a banana plant becomes shaken by a violent wind.
data.anv: अदुष्टभावा pure in thought, तन्वी slim, सा that, सुदुष्टम् forcefully, तं रजनीचरम् nightwalker, तत् that, वाक्यम् words, इति thus, उक्त्वा said, गात्रप्रकम्पात् due to trembling of the body, वातोद्धता shaken by violent wind, कदलीव banana, व्यथिता distressed, बभूव became.
data.md: Addressing those words to that wicked ranger of the night, that innocent ($ītā) shook like a plantain tree shaken by the wind.

data.v: तां वेपमानामुपलक्ष्य सीतां; स रावणो मृत्युसमप्रभावः । कुलं बलं नाम च कर्म चात्मनः; समाचचक्षे भयकारणार्थम् ।।
data.es: Beholding Sita who was trembling, Ravana, powerful like death, started telling about himself, his clan, his strength and his deeds to instil more fear in her.इत्तयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: मृत्युसमप्रभावः powerful like death, सः that, रावणः Ravana, वेपमानाम् trembling, ताम् she, उपलक्ष्य beholding, भयकारणार्थम् to create more fear, आत्मनः of himself, कुलम् clan, बलं च and strength, कर्म च deeds, समाचचक्षे gave an account of.
data.md: There upon Rāvaņa, like to Death in prowess, trembling, began to relate to her with a view to frighten (her) his race, power, name and actions.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवत्यां सीतायां संरब्धः परुषाक्षरम् । ललाटे भ्रुकुटीं कृत्वा रावणः प्रत्युवाच ह ।।
data.es: Addressed thus by Sita, Ravana, his anger roused, knitted his eyebrows with a frown on his forehead and replied to her harshly:
data.anv: सीतायाम् when Sita, एवम् in that way, बृवन्त्याम् as she spoke, रावणः Ravana, संरब्धः roused to anger, ललाटे forehead, भृकुटीम् knitted eyebrows, कृत्वा doing, परुषम् harsh, वचः words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
data.md: After Sītā had spoken these harsh words, Rāvana, enraged, with a frown, replied.

data.v: भ्राता वैश्रवणस्याहं सापत्न्यो वरवर्णिनि । रावणो नाम भद्रं ते दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान् ।।
data.es: O paragon of beauty I am the halfbrother of Kubera, born of his stepmother. I am known as the tenheaded, powerful Ravana. Be blessed
data.anv: वरवर्णिनि most beautiful woman, अहम् I, वैश्रवणस्य of Kubera's, सापत्न्यः stepmother's son, भ्राता brother, दशग्रीवः ten headed, प्रतापवान् powerful, रावणो नाम called Ravana, ते to you, भद्रम् be pleased.
data.md: O you of a beatiful countenance, I am the step-brother of the Lord of wealth and my name is the mighty Ten-necked Rāvana May good betide you!

data.v: यस्य देवाः सगन्धर्वाः पिशाचपतगोरगाः । विद्रवन्ति भयाद्भीता मृत्योरिव सदा प्रजाः ।।
data.es: Just as people get scared of death, all (creatures) including gandharvas, gods, evil spirits, birds and snakes run away from me.
data.anv: प्रजाः people, मृत्योरिव like death, यस्य whose, भयात् out of fear, भीताः scared of, सगन्धर्वाः including gandharvas, देवाः gods, पिशाचपतगोरगा: evil spirits, birds and serpents, विद्रवन्ति run away.

data.v: येन वैश्रवणो भ्राता वैमात्रः कारणान्तरे । द्वन्द्वमासादितः क्रोधाद्रणे विक्रम्य निर्जितः ।।
data.es: For some reason or other a duel took place between me and king Kubera. With my prowess, I defeated him in the duel.
data.anv: येन by whom, कारणान्तरे for some other reason, क्रोधात् in anger, द्वन्द्वम् duel, आसादितः took place, द्वैमात्रः stepmother, वैश्रवणः राजा king Vaisravana, रणे in war, विक्रम्य with my prowess, निर्जितः was defeated.
data.md: Like to people fearing Death, the celestials, Gandharvas, Piśāchas, Pannagas and Serpents fly in diverse directions being frightened by me. I have subdued by my prowess, my step-brother, the Lord of wealth in a conflict, quarrelling with him for some reason.

data.v: मद्भयार्तः परित्यज्य स्वमधिष्ठानमृद्धिमत् । कैलासं पर्वतश्रेष्ठमध्यास्ते नरवाहनः ।।
data.es: Out of fear for me, Kubera is residing on the mighty mount Kailasa, leaving his own earlier prosperous place of residence.
data.anv: नरवाहनः Kubera (having a human being as his carrier), यद्भयार्तः due to fear of whom, ऋद्धिमत् prosperous, स्वम् his own, अधिष्ठानम् place of residence, परित्यज्य giving up, पर्वतश्रेष्ठम् mighty mountain, कैलासम् Kailasa, अध्यास्ते  residing.
data.md: Thereat, that one carried by men, renouncing out of my fear this wealthy abode of Lankā, has been living on that Lord of mountains, Kailāśa.

data.v: यस्य तत्पुष्पकं नाम विमानं कामगं शुभम् । वीर्यादावर्जितं भद्रे येन यामि विहायसं ।।
data.es: O noble lady with my valour I gained over from Kubera the aerial chariot 'Pushpaka', which can go wherever one desires and in which I move about in the sky.
data.anv: भद्रे O noble lady, यस्य whose, तत् that, पुष्पकं नाम by name Pushpaka, कामगम् goes where one desires, शुभम् auspicious, विमानम् chariot, वीर्यादेव by valour alone, आर्जितम् gained over, येन in which, विहायसम् sky, यामि I move about.
data.md: O you auspicious one, by virtue of my prowess I have taken away that beautiful chariot of his called Puspaka. Ascending that chariot you shall travei by the ethereal route.

data.v: मम संजातरोषस्य मुखं दृष्ट्वैव मैथिलि । विद्रवन्ति परित्रस्ताः सुराः शक्रपुरोगमाः ।।
data.es: O Princess from Mithila, seeing my angry face even gods led by Indra take to their heels in fear.
data.anv: मैथिलि O Maithili, सञ्जातरोषस्य when I get angry, मम my, मुखम् face, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing alone, परित्रस्ताः frightened , शक्रपुरोगमाः led by Indra, सुराः gods, विद्रवन्ति run away.
data.md: O Maithilee, when I am excited with ire, Indra and other celestials at the mere sight of my countenance fly away in divers directions out of fear.

data.v: यत्र तिष्ठाम्यहं तत्र मारुतो वाति शङ्कितः । तीव्रांशुः शिशिरांशुश्च भयात्संपद्यते रविः ।।
data.es: Wherever I am, the Windgod blows with hesitation. So are the Sun and the Moon afraid of me. Afraid of me the Sun duly discharges his duties.
data.anv: अहम् I am, यत्र wherever, तिष्ठामि stay, तत्र there, मारुतः the Windgod, शङ्कितः hesitantly, वाति blows, तीव्रांशुः the Sun with scorching rays, रविः च even Sun, भयात् in fear, शिशिरांशुः Moon of cool radiance, सम्पद्यते discharges duties.
data.md: Wherever I live, the Wind bloweth cautiously and the Sun (of piercing rays) out of fear for me appeareth in the welkin like the Moon.

data.v: निष्कम्पपत्रास्तरवो नद्यश्च स्तिमितोदकाः । भवन्ति यत्र यत्राहं तिष्ठामि च चरामि च ।।
data.es: Wherever I stay or move about, the leaves of trees do not shake, and the waters in rivers remain still.
data.anv: अहम् I am, यत्र यत्र wherever, तिष्ठामि stay, विचरामि move about, उदकाः water, निष्कम्पपत्राः  with their leaves, तरवः trees, नद्यश्च the rivers also, स्तिमितोदकाः have still waters, भवन्ति   remain.
data.md: What shall I say more? Wherever I live, even the leaves of the trees do not flutter and the currents of the rivers are stopped.

data.v: मम पारे समुद्रस्य लङ्का नाम पुरी शुभा । संपूर्णा राक्षसैर्घोरैर्यथेन्द्रस्यामरावती ।।
data.es: My city known as Lanka, teeming with terrific demons, is on the other side of the sea. It is beautiful like the city of Indra's Amaravati.
data.anv: घोरैः by the terrific, राक्षसैः by demons, सम्पूर्णा filled with, लङ्का नाम known as Lanka, शुभा auspicious, इंद्रस्य Indra's, अमरावतीव like Amaravati, मम my, पुरी city, समुद्रस्य on these, पारे shore.
data.md: Beyond the ocean stands my beautiful capital Larikā like to Indra's Amaravati, (the capital of the Lord of celestials), guarded on all sides by the terrible night-rangers and encircled by yellow walls.

data.v: प्राकारेण परिक्षिप्ता पाण्डुरेण विराजिता । हेमकक्ष्या पुरी रम्या वैदूर्यमय तोरणा ।।
data.es: The beautiful city of Lanka shines with its pale white ramparts and golden interiors. The entrance gates are encrusted with vaidurya (cat'seye).
data.anv: रम्या beautiful, पाण्डुरेण pale white, विराजता  shining , प्राकारेण by a ramparts, परिक्षिप्ता surrounded, हेमकक्ष्या interiors built of gold, वैढूर्यमयतोरणा entrance gates encrusted with vaidurya (cat's eye).
data.md: That beautiful city has gate-ways of ornamented and jewelled arches and golden apartinents.

data.v: हस्त्यश्वरथसंभाधा तूर्यनादविनादिता । सर्वकामफलैर्वृक्षैः संकुलोद्यानशोभिता ।।
data.es: It is crowded with elephants, horses and chariots. It resounds with the music of trumpets. The trees in the delightful pleasuregardens yield fruits in all seasons.
data.anv: हस्त्यश्वरथसम्बाधा crowded with elephants, horses, and chariots, तूर्यनादविनादिता resounding with trumpets, सर्वकालफलैः yielding fruits in all seasons, वृक्षैः by  trees, सङ्कुलोद्यानशोभिता looks splendid with delightful pleasuregardens.
data.md: It is filled with clephants, horses and chariots, always resounds with the sounds of bugles, and is beautified with gardens having divers trees of wished-for fruits.

data.v: तत्र त्वं वसती सीते राजपुत्रि मया सह । न स्रमिष्यसि नारीणां मानुषीणां मनस्विनि ।।
data.es: O highminded princess, O Sita while living with me, you will not even think of other women.
data.anv: राजपुत्रि princess, मनस्विनि highminded, सीते Sita, तत्र there, मया सह along with me, वसती  while residing, मानुषीणाम् of human beings, नारीणाम् of women, न स्मरिष्यसि you will not think of.
data.md: O Sītā, O you the daughter of a king, in this city shall you dwell with me. O large-minded damsel, you shall never think of earthly women.

data.v: भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्दिव्यांश्च वरवर्णिनि । न स्मरिष्यसि रामस्य मानुषस्य गतायुषः ।।
data.es: O blessed lady of fine complexion, while enjoying both human and heavenly pleasures with me there, you will not remember Rama who is a mortal of short lifespan.
data.anv: वरवर्णिनि blessed lady of excellant complexion, मानुषान् mortals, भोगान् pleasures, दिव्यांश्च  wonderful as well as divine, भुञ्जाना enjoying, मानुषस्य mortals, गतायुषः of a short lifespan, रामस्य Rama's, न स्मरिष्यिसि not think of.
data.md: O you of an exquisite countenance, enjoying these many things passing human, you shall not any more think of Rāma a human being of brief existence.

data.v: स्थापयित्वा प्रियं पुत्रं राज्ञा दशरथेन यः । मन्दवीर्यः सुतो ज्येष्ठस्ततः प्रस्थापितो वनम् ।।
data.es: Considering the eldest son a weakling, king Dasaratha has sent him away to the forest so that he could consecrate his dear son(Bharata).
data.anv: राज्ञा by the king, दशरथेन Dasaratha's, प्रियम् dear, पुत्रम्  son (Bharata), स्थापयित्वा consecrating, ततः then, मन्दवीर्यः weakling, ज्येष्ठः सुतः eldest son, यः one who is, वनम् forest, प्रस्थापितः sent away.
data.md: Placing his beloved son on the throne, king Dasaratha has sent away his eldest son of weak prowess into the woods. O you of expansive eyes, what shall you do with that wretched ascetic Rāma who has been deprived of his kingdom?

data.v: तेन किं भ्रष्टराज्येन रामेण गतचेतसा । करिष्यसि विशालाक्षि तापसेन तपस्विना ।।
data.es: O largeeyed Sita dislodged from the kingdom, Rama has lost his capacity to think. He is doing penance, assuming an ascetic role. What can he do (for you)?
data.anv: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed, भ्रष्टराज्येन  dislodged from the kingdom, गतचेतसा lost the capacity to think, तापसेन ascetic, तपस्विना by a pitiable man, तेन रामेण such Rama, किं करिष्यसि what can he do (for you) ?
data.md: Placing his beloved son on the throne, king Dasaratha has sent away his eldest son of weak prowess into the woods. O you of expansive eyes, what shall you do with that wretched ascetic Rāma who has been deprived of his kingdom?

data.v: सर्वराक्षसभर्तारं कामात्स्वयमिहागतम् । न मन्मथशराविष्टं प्रत्याख्यातुं त्वमर्हसि ।।
data.es: I am lord of all the demons. You should not reject me I am here (only because I am) overcome by the arrows of the god of love.
data.anv: कामात् owing to passion, स्वयम् I myself, इह here, आगतम् came, मन्मथशराविष्टम्   overcome by the arrows of the god of love, सर्वराक्षसभर्तारम् lord of all demons, त्वम्  you, प्रत्याख्यातुम् to reject, न अर्हसि not proper.
data.md: I am the lord of the whole world of Rākşasas; being pierced by the shafts of Kāma have I come by you. It does not behave you therefore to pass by me.

data.v: प्रत्याख्याय हि मां भीरु परितापं गमिष्यसि । चरणेनाभिहत्येव पुरूरवसमुर्वशी ।।
data.es: O timid lady if you reject me, you will regret like Urvasi who kicked Pururava and regretted later.
data.anv: भीरु O timid lady, माम् me, प्रत्याख्याय after you reject, पुरूरवसम् Pururava, चरणेन by the feet, अभिहत्य kicking, ऊर्वशीव like Urvasi, परितापम् regret, गमिष्यसि will you experience later.
data.md: O timid damsel, truly shall you repent afterwards if you did disregard me, like to Urvasi kicking Pururavā.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही क्रुद्धा संरक्तलोचना । अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं रहिते राक्षसाधिपम् ।।
data.es: Addressed thus by Lakshmana, Sita got mighty angry. Her eyes turned red and she spoke harshly to truthful Lakshmana
data.anv: लक्ष्मणेन by  Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been told, सा Sita, क्रुद्धा an angry, संरक्तलोचना with eyes turned red, सत्यवादिनम् to the truthful, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् she spoke.
data.md: Being thus addressed by him her eyes were reddened with ire, and she spake these harsh words to the truthful Lakşmaņa.

data.v: कथं वैश्रवणं देवं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् । भ्रातरं व्यपदिश्य त्वमशुभं कर्तुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: Why do you wish to do something inauspicious by calling Lord Kubera who is worshipped by all beings your brother ?
data.anv: सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् worshipped by all beings, देवम् god, वैश्रवणम्  Kubera, भ्रातरम् brother, व्यपदिश्य addressing him, त्वम् you, अशुभम् inauspicious deed, कर्तुम् to do, कथम् how come, इच्छसि you desire.
data.md: How do you wish to perpetrate such an impious deed after introducing as your brother that highly worshipful Kubera adored by all the deities.

data.v: अवश्यं विनशिष्यन्ति सर्वे रावण राक्षसाः । येषां त्वं कर्कशो राजा दुर्बुद्धिरजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Under a rude, crooked king whose senses are not under his control the demons will surely perish.
data.anv: रावण O Ravana, येषाम् of whom, कर्कशः  rude , दुर्बुद्धि: evilminded, अजितेन्द्रियः having no control over the senses, त्वम् you, राजा king, सर्वे all, राक्षसाः demons, अवश्यम् surely, विनशिष्यन्ति perish.
data.md: All the Rākşasas shall surely die, O Rāvana whose lord are you, foolish, cruel and under the control of your passions.

data.v: अपहृत्य शचीं भार्यां शक्यमिन्द्रस्य जीवितुम् । न तु रामस्य भार्यां मामपनीयास्ति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: It may be possible (for some one) to live after abducting Indra's wife, Sachi, but it is not possible for any one to live after kidnapping the wife of Rama.
data.anv: इन्द्रस्य Indra's, भार्याम् wife, शची Sachi, अपहृत्य after abducting, जीवितुम् to live, शक्यम् may be possible, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, माम् me, अपनीय after carrying away, जीवितम् life, नास्ति not there.
data.md: One can breathe on this earth carrying away Indra's wife, Śacī—but stealing me, the wife of Rāma, no body shall be able to live in peace.

data.v: जीवेच्चिरं वज्रधरस्य हस्ता;च्छचीं प्रधृष्याप्रतिरूपरूपाम् । न मादृशीं राक्षसधर्षयित्वा; पीतामृतस्यापि तवास्ति मोक्षः ।।
data.es: O demon, you may live long after forcibly snatching the most beautiful Sachi, from the hands of Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, but after abusing a woman like me, you will not be released from death even if you drink nectar.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyeighty sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: राक्षस demon, अप्रातिरूपरूपाम् most beautiful lady, शचीम् Sachi, वज्रधरस्य wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra's, हस्ताम् from the hands, प्रधृष्य after snatching, चिरम् long, जीवेत्  may live, मादृशीम् one like me, दूषयित्वा after assualting, पीतामृतस्यापि even after drinking  nectar, तव your, मोक्षः release from death, न not possible.
data.md: O Räkşasa, it might be possible for one to live on this earth treating contemptuously the wife of the holder of thunder-bolt, but insulting me none shall escape the hands of Death even if he drinketh nectar.

data.v: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान् । हस्ते हस्तं समाहत्य चकार सुमहद्वपुः ।।
data.es: On hearing the Sita's words, the powerful Ravana struck his palms one over the other and assumed a huge form (original figure).
data.anv: प्रतापवाम् powerful, दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, हस्ते by the palm, हस्तम् palm, समाहत्य  striking, सुमहत् very great, वपुः body, चकार  assumed.
data.md: Hearing those words of Sītā the highly powerful Ten necked one striking his hands together, increased his body too high.

data.v: स मैथिलीं पुनर्वाक्यं बभाषे च ततो भृशम् । नोन्मत्तया श्रुतौ मन्ये मम वीर्यपराक्रमौ ।।
data.es: Ravana again said to that princess from Mithila, I suppose you are too insane to disregard my strength and valour.
data.anv: सः Ravana, मैथिलीम् Maithili, पुनः again, वाक्यम् these words, भृशम् very much, बभाषे said, उन्मत्तया by madness, मम my, वीर्यपराक्रमौ strength and valour, न श्रुतौ not heard, मन्ये I suppose.
data.md: Thereupon, that one skilled in speech again spake to Maithili, Methinks you have run mad. Have you not heard of my valour and prowess?

data.v: उद्वहेयं भुजाभ्यां तु मेदिनीमम्बरे स्थितः । आपिबेयं समुद्रं च मृत्युं हन्यां रणे स्थितः ।।
data.es: Standing in the sky, I can lift the earth with my arms. I can drink the oceans. I can kill even the god of death in a combat.
data.anv: अम्बरे in the sky, स्थितः standing, भुजाभ्याम् with my arms, मेदिनीम् the earth, उद्वहेयम् lift, समुद्रं च and oceans, आपिबेयम् can drink away, रणे in war, स्थितः standing, मृत्युम् for death, हन्याम् can cause death.
data.md: Stationing myself in the welkin I can with my hands raise up the earth. I can drink up the waters of the ocean. And engaged in conflict I can destroy Death itself

data.v: अर्कं रुन्ध्यां शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्विभिन्द्यां हि महीतलम् । कामरूपिणमुन्मत्ते पश्य मां कामदं पतिम् ।।
data.es: I can obstruct the Sun and shatter the earth with my sharp arrows. O mad woman I am a husband who can fulfil your desires, and can assume any form at my own free will. Look at me.
data.anv: अर्कम् Sun, ऱुन्ध्याम् can obstruct, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, महीतलम् earth, विभिन्द्याम् I can shatter, उन्मत्ते O mad woman, कामदम् who can fulfil desires, पतिम् husband, कामरूपिणम् who can assume any form at will, माम् me, पश्य see.
data.md: With my sharpened shafts I can pierce the Sun and cut asunder the earth. You are mad with your beauty. Do you look upon me, who am capable of illusions.

data.v: एवमुक्तवतस्तस्य रावणस्य शिखिप्रभे । क्रुद्धस्य हरिपर्यन्ते रक्ते नेत्रे बभूवतुः ।।
data.es: As Ravana exploded in anger, his ambercoloured eyes turned red like the radiance of the flaming fire, and almost as bright as the Sun.
data.anv: एवम् in that manner, उक्तवतः as he spoke, क्रुद्धस्य  full of anger, तस्य his, सूर्यकल्पे almost like the Sun, शिखिप्रभे  radiance of flaming fire, हरिपर्यन्ते ambercoloured at the corners, नेत्रे eyes, रक्ते red, बभुवतुः became.
data.md: When he had spoken thus, his yellow eyes became blood-red with rage and assumed the, semblance of flaming fire.

data.v: सद्यः सौम्यं परित्यज्य भिक्षुरूपं स रावणः । स्वं रूपं कालरूपाभं भेजे वैश्रवणानुजः ।।
data.es: Ravana, brother of Kubera, shed the gentle figure of a mendicant and assumed the form of the god of death.
data.anv: वैश्रवणानुजः younger brother of Kubera, सद्यः instantly, सौम्यम् gentle, भिक्षुरूपम् form of a  mendicant, परित्यज्य shed, स्वम् his, कालरूपाभम् the form of the god of death, रूपम् figure, भेजे assumed.
data.md: Thereat Răvana, the younger brother of the Lord of wealth, changing his placid countenance, instantly assumed his own terrible shape resembling that of Yama.

data.v: संरक्तनयनः श्रीमांस्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः । दशास्यः कार्मुकी बाणी बभूव क्षणदाचरः ।।
data.es: Overcome by intense anger, Ravana's eyes reddened. The nightranger, stood armed with bow and arrows and shining with glittering gold ornaments, appeared like a black cloud.
data.anv: महता with intense, क्रोधेन with anger, आविष्टः overcome, संरक्तनयनः with reddened eyes, श्रीमान् shining, तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणः  glittering golden ornaments, नीलजीमूतसन्निभः looking like a dark cloud, दशास्यः the tenfaced Ravana, कार्मुकी with bow, बाणी with arrows, क्षणदाचरः nightranger, बभूव became.

data.v: स परिव्राजकच्छद्म महाकायो विहाय तत् । प्रतिपेदे स्वकं रूपं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: Ravana, chief of the demons, shed the mendicant's form and assumed his real self. Clad in red garments, his eyes turned red in anger. Looking like layers of clouds, he stood in front of Sita, a gem among women.
data.anv: राक्षसाधिपः chief of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, तत् that, परिव्राजकच्छद्म figure of a mendicant, विहाय shedding, स्वकम् his real, रूपम् form, प्रतिपद्य assuming, क्रोधात् in anger, संरक्त नयनः red eyes, जीमूतनिचयप्रभः radiating like layers of clouds, रक्ताम्बरधरः wearing red garments, स्त्रीरत्नम् gem of a woman, मैथिलीम् to Sita, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, तस्थौ stood in front.

data.v: संरक्तनयनः क्रोधाज्जीमूतनिचयप्रभः । रक्ताम्बरधरस्तस्थौ स्त्रीरत्नं प्रेक्ष्य मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: Ravana, chief of the demons, shed the mendicant's form and assumed his real self. Clad in red garments, his eyes turned red in anger. Looking like layers of clouds, he stood in front of Sita, a gem among women.
data.anv: राक्षसाधिपः chief of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, तत् that, परिव्राजकच्छद्म figure of a mendicant, विहाय shedding, स्वकम् his real, रूपम् form, प्रतिपद्य assuming, क्रोधात् in anger, संरक्त नयनः red eyes, जीमूतनिचयप्रभः radiating like layers of clouds, रक्ताम्बरधरः wearing red garments, स्त्रीरत्नम् gem of a woman, मैथिलीम् to Sita, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, तस्थौ stood in front.
data.md: Leaving aside the semblance of a mendicant, that lord of Raksasas, Ravana, increasing in bulk, assumed his own shape. And wearing a blood-red cloth he stood there fixing his look upon that jewel of a damsel–Maithili.

data.v: स तामसितकेशान्तां भास्करस्य प्रभामिव । वसनाभरणोपेतां मैथिलीं रावणोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Ravana said to the princess from Mithila, whose black hair was shining, who was luminous like the Sun and was clad in the best of cothes and ornaments.
data.anv: सः that, रावणः Ravana, असितकेशान्ताम् a lady with shining black hair, भास्करस्य the Sun's, प्रभामिव like the radiance, वसनाभरणोपेताम् robed in the best of clothes and ornaments, मैथिलीम् to SIta, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon Rāvaņa spake to Mathili like to the rays of the sun, having a head of black hair and wearing apparel and ornaments, saying, O you fine damsel, if you did wish to have a husband known all over the world, do you surrender yourself to me.

data.v: त्रिषु लोकेषु विख्यातं यदि भर्तारमिच्छसि । मामाश्रय वरारोहे तवाहं सदृशः पतिः ।।
data.es: O beautiful lady if you desire a husband who is famous in the three worlds, take refuge in me. I am fit to be your husband.
data.anv: वरारोहे O beautiful lady, त्रिषुलोकेषु in the three worlds, विख्यातम् famous, भर्तारम् husband, इच्छसि you desire, यदि so, माम् me, आश्रय take refuge in, अहम् I, तव your, सदृशः fit, पतिः husband.
data.md: Thereupon Rāvaņa spake to Mathili like to the rays of the sun, having a head of black hair and wearing apparel and ornaments, saying, O you fine damsel, if you did wish to have a husband known all over the world, do you surrender yourself to me.

data.v: मां भजस्व चिराय त्वमहं श्लाघ्यस्तव प्रियः । नैव चाहं क्वचिद्भद्रे करिष्ये तव विप्रियम् । त्यज्यतां मानुषो भावो मयि भावः प्रणीयताम् ।।
data.es: I am your praiseworthy husband. I will not cause any unpleasantness to you at any time. Abandon on your inclination towards, a (mere) mortal. Divert your love to me.
data.anv: भद्रे O auspicious lady, चिराय for long, माम् me, भजस्व accept, अहम् I am, तव your, श्लाघ्यः praiseworthy, प्रियः (पतिः) husband, अहम् I am, क्वचित् at any time, तव your, विप्रियम् unpleasantness, न करिष्ये चwill not cause, मानुषे mortal , भावः your attachment, त्यज्यताम्  abandon, मयि in me, भावः inclination, प्रणीयताम् diverted.
data.md: I am a worthy husband for you. Do you serve me for ever, your praiseworthy husband. O fine lady, I hall never do what you did not like.

data.v: राज्याच्च्युतमसिद्धार्थं रामं परिमितायुषम् । कैर्गुणैरनुरक्तासि मूढे पण्डितमानिनि ।।
