data.es: O stupid woman you think you are very wise. What is there in Rama so that you are attached to him ? He has left the kingdom and his kith and kin due to the words of a woman. He has not accomplished anything (in life). He has a limited life span and now lives in this forest haunted by wild animals.
data.anv: मुढे O stupid woman, पण्डितमानिनि you think you are wise, दुर्मतिः wicked, यः he, स्त्रियाः woman's, वचनात् word, ससुहृज्जनम् including friends, राज्यम् kingdom, विहाय after leaving, व्यालानुचरिते  haunted by wild animals, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, चरति moves, राज्यात् from the kingdom, च्युतम् banished, असिद्धार्थम् who has not accomplished any objective, परिमितायुषम् of limited life, रामम् Rama, कैः by what, गुणैः virtues, अनुरक्ता a attached, असि are you.

data.v: यः स्त्रिया वचनाद्राज्यं विहाय ससुहृज्जनम् । अस्मिन्व्यालानुचरिते वने वसति दुर्मतिः ।।
data.es: O stupid woman you think you are very wise. What is there in Rama so that you are attached to him ? He has left the kingdom and his kith and kin due to the words of a woman. He has not accomplished anything (in life). He has a limited life span and now lives in this forest haunted by wild animals.
data.anv: मुढे O stupid woman, पण्डितमानिनि you think you are wise, दुर्मतिः wicked, यः he, स्त्रियाः woman's, वचनात् word, ससुहृज्जनम् including friends, राज्यम् kingdom, विहाय after leaving, व्यालानुचरिते  haunted by wild animals, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, चरति moves, राज्यात् from the kingdom, च्युतम् banished, असिद्धार्थम् who has not accomplished any objective, परिमितायुषम् of limited life, रामम् Rama, कैः by what, गुणैः virtues, अनुरक्ता a attached, असि are you.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा मैथिलीं वाक्यं प्रियार्हां प्रियवादिनीम् । जग्राह रावणः सीतां बुधः खे रोहिणीमिव ।।
data.es: Just as Budha (planet Mercury) catches Rohini (a cluster of five stars) in the sky, the evilminded, infatuated Ravana advanced towards the pitiable, pleasing Sita and caught hold of her.
data.anv: सुदुष्टात्मा evilminded, काममोहितः infatuated, राक्षसः demon, रावणः Ravana, प्रियार्हाम् worthy of pity, प्रियवादिनीम् speaks pleasing words, मैथिलीम् Maithili, इति thus, उक्त्वा said, अभिगम्य going towards, खे बुधः Mercury in the sky, रोहिणीमिव like Rohini, सीताम् Sita, जग्राह caught hold of.
data.md: Speaking thus to Maithili, sweet-speeched and worthy of being sweetly addressed, that highly wicked Raksasa, Rāvaņa, being exercised with lust, approached towards Sītā and got hold of her, like to Budha holding Rohinī in the sky.

data.v: वामेन सीतां पद्माक्षीं मूर्धजेषु करेण सः । ऊर्वोस्तु दक्षिणेनैव परिजग्राह पाणिना ।।
data.es: Ravana seized with his left hand the lotuseyed Sita by the hair and lifted her by the thighs with his right hand.
data.anv: सः that Ravana, पद्माक्षीम् lotuseyed, सीताम् Sita, वामेन करेण with his left hand, मूर्धजेषु  holding her hair, दक्षिणेन पाणिना with right hand, ऊर्वोः under her thighs, प्रतिजग्राह held her.
data.md: With his left hand he held her, having eyes like to lotus-petals, by the hair, and with his right hand got hold of her thighs.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा गिरिशृङ्गाभं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रं महाभुजम् । प्राद्रवन्मृत्युसंकाशं भयार्ता वनदेवताः ।।
data.es: The sylvan deities fled out of fear on seeing the dreadful appearance of Ravana who had sharp teeth and mighty arms. He looked like a mountain, a veritable god of death.
data.anv: मृत्युसङ्काशम् like the god of death, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रम् with sharp teeth, महाभुजम् mightyarmed, गिरिसङ्काशम्  like a mountain, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, वनदेवताः deities of the forest, भयार्ताः out of fear, प्राद्रवन् fled.
data.md: Seeing Rāvaņa of sharpened teeth, and mighty arms, resembling the summit of a mountain and like to death itself, the deities of the forest became highly terrified and fled in different directions.

data.v: स च मायामयो दिव्यः खरयुक्तः खरस्वनः । प्रत्यदृश्यत हेमाङ्गो रावणस्य महारथः ।।
data.es: There arrived the great golden chariot of Ravana, illusive and wonderful, harnessed with donkeys and braying like donkeys.
data.anv: मायामयः illusive form, दिव्यः divine, खरयुक्तः harnessed by donkeys, खरस्वनः brayins of  asses, हेमाङ्गः goldenlimbed, रावणस्य Ravana's, सः महारथः that great chariot, प्रत्यदृश्यत apeared.
data.md: Instantly appeared there the celestial car of Ravana, decked in gold, drawn by asses and making a terrible sound.

data.v: ततस्तां परुषैर्वाक्यैरभितर्ज्य महास्वनः । अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीं रथमारोपयत्तदा ।।
data.es: Reproaching the princess from Videha loudly and harshly, Ravana took her on his lap and put her on the chariot.
data.anv: तदा then, महास्वनः Ravana in a loud voice, सः he, तां वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, परुषैः with harsh, वाक्यैः words, भर्त्सयन् reproaching, अङ्केन on his lap, आदाय on lifting, रथम् chariot, आरोपयत् placed.
data.md: Thereupon, that one emmiting terrible accents, remonstrated with Vaidehī in harsh words and clasping her ascended the car.

data.v: सा गृहीतातिचुक्रोश रावणेन यशस्विनी । रामेति सीता दुःखार्ता रामं दूरगतं वने ।।
data.es: Seized by Ravana, illustrious Sita screamed aloud Alas, Rama. for one who was far away in the forest.
data.anv: रावणेन by Ravana, गृहीता seized, यशस्स्विनी illustrious, सा सीता that Sita, दुःखार्ता helpless in grief, वने in the forset, दूरगतम् who was far away, रामम् Rama, राम इति saying, Alas Rama, विचुक्रोश screamed aloud.
data.md: The virtuous Sīta, being thus caught by Ravana, began to cry aloud, addressing Rama, who had gone away to a distant forest.

data.v: तामकामां स कामार्तः पन्नगेन्द्रवधूमिव । विवेष्टमानामादाय उत्पपाथाथ रावणः ।।
data.es: Passionate Ravana took hold of Sita who was not willing and was writhing in pain. He seized her like (an eagle carrying away) a serpent queen and flew up.
data.anv: अथ then, कामार्तः passionate, सः that, रावणः Ravana, अकामाम् not willing, पन्नगेन्द्रवधूमिव like a serpent queen, विवेष्टमानाम् writhing hard, ताम् her, आदाय seized,उत्पपात flew up.
data.md: Rāvaņa, racked with lust, rose high up with her like to the wife of a Pannaga, though she tried her best (to get rid of him), for she was not in the least attached to him.

data.v: ततः सा राक्षसेन्द्रेण ह्रियमाणा विहायसा । भृशं चुक्रोश मत्तेव भ्रान्तचित्ता यथातुरा ।।
data.es: While Sita was being carried off in the sky by the king of demons, she screamed a lot in agony and anxiety like a mad woman in a bewildered state:
data.anv: ततः then, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the king of demons, विहायसा through the sky, ह्रियमाणा being carried off, सा that Sita, मत्तेव like a mad woman, भ्रान्तचित्ता with a bewildered mind, आतुरा anxious, यथा like, भृशम् चुक्रोश screamed a lot in agony.
data.md: Being thus carried away by the ethereal track by that Lord of Rākṣasas, Sītā began to cry aloud, like one mad, distressed and of deranged senses.

data.v: हा लक्ष्मण महाबाहो गुरुचित्तप्रसादक । ह्रियमाणां न जानीषे रक्षसा कामरूपिणा ।।
data.es: Alas, O longarmed Lakshmana, you who used to entertain your brother do not know that I am being carried away by this ruthless demon.
data.anv: महाबाहो O longarmed Lakshmana, गुरुचित्तप्रसादक  who entertains the brother's mind, हा लक्ष्मण Alas, Lakshmana, अमर्षिणा by this angry, रक्षसा demon, माम् me, ह्रियमाणाम् being carried away, न जानीषे you do not know.
data.md: Ah! mighty Laksmana, ever ministering to the satisfaction of your superiors, do you not know that I have been stolen away by a Rākṣasa assuming shapes at will?

data.v: जीवितं सुखमर्थांश्च धर्महेतोः परित्यजन् । ह्रियमाणामधर्मेण मां राघव न पश्यसि ।।
data.es: O Rama, you have given up your life, pleasure and treasure for the sake of righteousness. Do you not see me carried off by an unrighteous fellow ?
data.anv: जीवितम् life, सुखम् comfort, अर्थांश्च treasure, धर्महेतोः for the sake of righteousness, परित्यजन् giving up, राघव O Rama, अधर्मेण by unrighteous, ह्रियमाणाम्   carried off, माम् me, न पश्यसि do you not see.
data.md: O Rāghava, for virtue have you renounced your life, happiness and wealth,-do you not see that I have been carried away by one of mighty iniquity?

data.v: ननु नामाविनीतानां विनेतासि परंतप । कथमेवंविधं पापं न त्वं शाधि हि रावणम् ।।
data.es: O scorcher of enemies you are the chastiser of the haughty. Why do you not punish such a sinner like Ravana.
data.anv: परन्तप scorcher of enemies, अविनीतानाम् of the haughty, विनेता a chastiser, असि ननु as such, एवंविधम् such, पापम् sinner, रावणम् Ravana, कथम् how is it, हि indeed, शासि you are not punishing?
data.md: O you the subduer of foes, you did always control the rebellious,-why do you not punish such a vicious Rākşasa?

data.v: ननु सद्योऽविनीतस्य दृश्यते कर्मणः फलम् । कालोऽप्यङ्गी भवत्यत्र सस्यानामिव पक्तये ।।
data.es: The effect of arrogant action cannot be seen right away. Just as the crop yields results only after ripening, in the same way it takes time. Time acts as a supporting factor.
data.anv: अविनीतस्य arrogant, कर्मणः action, फलम् result, सद्यः right now, न दृश्यते नु not seen, सस्यानाम् crop, पक्तये इव ripening, अत्र in the same way, कालोऽपि it takes time also, अङ्गीभवति serves as a supporting factor.
data.md: The vicious do not instantaneously meet with the fruits of their actions, as for corn to ripen requires the assistance of time.

data.v: स कर्म कृतवानेतत्कालोपहतचेतनः । जीवितान्तकरं घोरं रामाद्व्यसनमाप्नुहि ।।
data.es: Time has taken a toll of your senses. This has made you do what you have done. A great calamity is awaiting you in the hands of Rama. It will end your life.
data.anv: त्वम् you, कालोपहतचेतनः time has taken a toll of your senses, एतत् this, कर्म action, कृतवान् have done, रामात् from Rama, जीवितान्तकरम् leading towards the end of your life, घोरम् dreadful, व्यसनम् sorrow, आप्नुहि will befall.
data.md: For this iniquitous deed, which you have perpetrated, availing of the time and losing your sense, you shall meet with a mighty disaster from Rāma, bringing about your end.

data.v: हन्तेदानीं सकामा तु कैकेयी बान्धवैः सह । ह्रियेयं धर्मकामस्य धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनः ।।
data.es: Alas, the lawful wife of the glorious and righteous Rama is being abducted now. Let Kaikeyi along with her relations be happy with her desire fulfilled.
data.anv: धर्मकामस्य of one who wants to discharge righteous duties, यशस्विनः of the glorious, धर्मपत्नी lawful wife, यत् such, ह्रिये being carried away, इदानीम् now, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, बान्धवैः सह along with her relations, सकामा her desires, अस्तु may be fulfilled, हन्त alas.
data.md: Ah! being the virtuous wife of the virtuous and far-famed Rāma, I have been stolen away. Now has the desire of Kaikeyi and other relations been fulfilled.

data.v: आमन्त्रये जनस्थानं कर्णिकारांश्च पुष्पितान् । क्षिप्रं रामाय शंसध्वं सीतां हरति रावणः ।।
data.es: O karnikar trees in full bloom in Janasthana, tell Rama quickly that Ravana is kidnapping Sita.
data.anv: जनस्थाने in Janasthana, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, कर्णिकारान् karnikara trees, आमन्त्रये pray, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, हरति is abducting, क्षिप्रम् at once, रामाय to Rama, शंसध्वम् tell him.
data.md: I invoke this Janasthāna and these flowery Karnikās to tell Rāma that Rāvana has stolen away Sītā.

data.v: माल्यवन्तं शिखरिणं वन्दे प्रस्रवणं गिरिम् । क्षिप्रं रामाय शंसध्वं सीतां हरति रावणः ।।
data.es: O karnikar trees in full bloom in Janasthana, tell Rama quickly that Ravana is kidnapping Sita.
data.anv: जनस्थाने in Janasthana, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, कर्णिकारान् karnikara trees, आमन्त्रये pray, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, हरति is abducting, क्षिप्रम् at once, रामाय to Rama, शंसध्वम् tell him.
data.md: I invoke you, O Godāvarī, having swans and cranes sporting in your stream, to tell Ráma that Rāvana has stolen away Sītã.

data.v: हंससारससंघुष्टां वन्दे गोदावरीं नदीम् । क्षिप्रं रामाय शंसध्वं सीतां हरति रावणः ।।
data.es: O karnikar trees in full bloom in Janasthana, tell Rama quickly that Ravana is kidnapping Sita.
data.anv: जनस्थाने in Janasthana, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, कर्णिकारान् karnikara trees, आमन्त्रये pray, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, हरति is abducting, क्षिप्रम् at once, रामाय to Rama, शंसध्वम् tell him.
data.md: I invoke this Janasthāna and these flowery Karnikās to tell Rāma that Rāvana has stolen away Sītā.

data.v: दैवतानि च यान्त्यस्मिन्वने विविधपादपे । नमस्करोम्यहं तेभ्यो भर्तुः शंसत मां हृताम् ।।
data.es: I offer my salutations to different deities residing in this forest abounding in trees of many kinds. Tell my husband about me that I am being whisked away.
data.anv: विविधपादपे various trees, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, यानि those, दैवतानि deities, (सन्ति residing here), तेभ्यः to them, अहम् I, नमस्करोमि I offer salutations, माम् me, हृताम् taken away, भर्तुः to my husband, शंसत Tell.
data.md: I salute and invoke the deities that live in this forest of many trees to tell my husband of my being stolen away (by Ravana).

data.v: यानि कानिचिदप्यत्र सत्त्वानि निवसन्त्युत । सर्वाणि शरणं यामि मृगपक्षिगणानपि ।।
data.es: I seek refuge in all those living beings as well as herds of animals and birds in the forest.
data.anv: अत्र here, यानि कानि चित् all the animals of the forest, सत्त्वानि living beings, निवसन्ति are  residing, सर्वाणि all, मृगपक्षिगणानपि including herds of animals and birds, शरणम् I seek refuge, यामि I seek.

data.v: ह्रियमाणां प्रियां भर्तुः प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम् । विवशापहृता सीता रावणेनेति शंसत ।।
data.es: Tell Rama that his dear wife Sita whom he loves more than his life is abducted helplessly.
data.anv: प्राणेभ्योऽपि more than his life, गरीयसीम्  valuable lady, ह्रियमाणाम्  carried away, प्रियाम् beloved, विवशा helpless lady, सीता Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, अपहृता इति is abducted like this, भर्तुः to my husband, शंसत tell.
data.md: I do seek the refuge of all deer, birds and other animals that live in this forest, and may they all cominunicate to Rāma the news of his dear spouse being carried away, and tell him that Sītā, losing her control, has been stolen away by Rāvana.

data.v: विदित्वा मां महाबाहुरमुत्रापि महाबलः । आनेष्यति पराक्रम्य वैवस्वतहृतामपि ।।
data.es: If he knows that I am abducted by Yama, the god of death, that mighty, longarmed hero will save me even from there by virtue of his valour.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, महाबाहुः longarmed, वैवस्वतहृतामपि even if abducted by Vaivasvata, lord of death, माम् me, अमुत्रापि from there also, विदित्वा knowing, पराक्रम्य by his valour, आनेष्यति can get back.
data.md: Even if I am taken away by Yama, and if the mighty-armed Rāma is apprised of it, surely shall he bring me back by the display of his prowess.

data.v: रामाय तु यथातत्त्वं जटायो हरणं मम । लक्ष्मणाय च तत्सर्वमाख्यातव्यमशेषतः ।।
data.es: O Jatayu narrate to Rama and Lakshmana the exact facts of my abduction and all the details without any omission.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: जटायोः Jatayu, मम my, हरणम् abduction, यथातत्त्वम् exact fact, तत् सर्वम् everything, अशेषतः without any omission, रामाय to Rama, लक्ष्मणाय च and Lakshmana, आख्यातव्यम् please narrate.
data.md: Do you relate to Rāma and to Lakşmaņa everything about my being carried away from the beginning to the end.

data.v: तं शब्दमवसुप्तस्य जटायुरथ शुश्रुवे । निरैक्षद्रावणं क्षिप्रं वैदेहीं च ददर्श सः ।।
data.es: While reposing, Jatayu heard the cry and at once looked up and saw Ravana and Vaidehi.
data.anv: अवसुप्तः reposing, जटायुः Jatayu, तं शब्दम् that sound, शुश्रुवे heard, अथ and, सः he, क्षिप्रम् at once, निरीक्ष्य observed, रावणम् Ravana, वैदेहीं च and Vaidehi, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Hearing these words Jațāyu, who lay buried in a deep slumber, awoke and beheld both Rāvana and Janaki.

data.v: ततः पर्वतकूटाभस्तीक्ष्णतुण्डः खगोत्तमः । वनस्पतिगतः श्रीमान्व्याजहार शुभां गिरम् ।।
data.es: Glorious Jatayu, the best among the birds, looked like the peak of a mountain.His beak was sharp. His words were auspious. He spoke from the top of the tree:
data.anv: ततः then, पर्वतकूटाभः looking like a part of the mountain, तीक्ष्णतुण्डः sharpbeaked, श्रीमान् glorious, वनस्पतिगतः from the top of the tree, खगोत्तमः best among birds, शुभाम् auspicious, गिरम् words, व्याजहार uttered.
data.md: There-at the lord of birds resting on the tree, having a big sharp beak like to the summit of a hill, addressed these soft words to Rāvana,

data.v: दशग्रीवस्थितो धर्मे पुराणे सत्यसंश्रयः । जटायुर्नाम नाम्नाहं गृध्रराजो महाबलः ।।
data.es: O tenheaded Ravana, I am Jatayu, king of vultures. I am mighty. An eternal follower, of dharma, I am an adherent to truth.
data.anv: दशग्रीव tenheaded Ravana, अहम् I, पुराणे धर्मे in eternal dharma, स्थितः adhering to dharma, सत्यसंश्रयः  who abides in truth, महाबलः mighty, गृध्रराजः king of vultures, नाम्ना by name, जटायुर्नाम Jatayu.
data.md: O brother Ten-necked one, I am conversant with Purāņas, of truthful vows and abide by religion. It does not behove you to perpetrate such an iniquitous deed before me. I am Jātayu, the mighty lord of vultures.

data.v: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः । लोकानां च हिते युक्तो रामो दशरथात्मजः ।।
data.es: Rama, Dasaratha's son, is the king of the entire world. He is equal to Indra and Varuna. He is ever engaged in the welfare of the entire world.
data.anv: दशरथात्मजः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, सर्वस्य of the entire, लोकस्य world, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः equal to Indra and Varuna, लोकानाम् in the world, हिते in the wellbeing, युक्तः engaged.
data.md: Daśaratha's son Rāma is the lord of all men like to Mahendra and Varuņa. He is ever engaged in the welfare of all men.

data.v: तस्यैषा लोकनाथस्य धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनी । सीता नाम वरारोहा यां त्वं हर्तुमिहेच्छसि ।।
data.es: The lady you want to abduct from here is the famous Sita, the lawful wife of Rama, the lord of the world.
data.anv: याम् whom, त्वम् you, इह from here, हर्तुम् to take away, इच्छसि are desiring, एषा she is, सीता नाम Sita by name, वरारोहा a beautiful lady, यशस्विनी illustrious, लोकनाथस्य of the lord of the world, तस्य his, धर्मपत्नी wife.
data.md: This exquisitely beautiful and far-famed Sītā whom you are about to steal away, is the married wife of that lord of men.

data.v: कथं राजा स्थितो धर्मे परदारान्परामृशेत् । रक्षणीया विशेषेण राजदारा महाबलः । निवर्तय मतिं नीचां परदाराभिमर्शनम् ।।
data.es: How can a king who adheres to righteousness outrage another's wife ? O powerful one, a king's wife in particular should be protected.
data.anv: धर्मे in righteousness, स्थितः adheres, राजा king, परदारान् another's wife, कथम् how, परामृशेत् can any one violate, महाबल powerful, राजदाराः king's wife, विशेषेण specially, रक्षणीयाः should be protected.

data.v: न तत्समाचरेद्धीरो यत्परोऽस्य विगर्हयेत् । यथात्मनस्तथान्येषां दारा रक्ष्या विमर्शनात् ।।
data.es: Refrain yourself from the vile thought of violating other's wives. Wise men do not adopt what is censured by others. Just like one's own, the wise should protect other's wives.
data.anv: नीचाम् mean, मतिम् in mind, परदाराभिमर्शनात् thought of touching another's wife, निवर्तय refrain yourself, परः others, अस्य his, यत् such deeds, विगर्हयेत् if he reproaches, तत् that, धीरः learned, न समाचरेत् should not adopt, विपश्चिता by the wise man, आत्मनः his own, यथा likewise, तथा in the same way, अन्येषाम् another's, दाराः wife, रक्ष्याः be protected.

data.v: अर्थं वा यदि वा कामं शिष्टाः शास्त्रेष्वनागतम् । व्यवस्यन्त्यनु राजानं धर्मं पौरस्त्यनन्दन ।।
data.es: O son of Paulastya learned men determine the path of dharma artha and kama, following a king's conduct even if they are not declared in sastras.
data.anv: पौलस्त्यनन्दन O son of Paulastya, शिष्टाः learned, शास्त्रेषु sastras, अनागतम् unknown, अर्थं वा wish for material, यदि वा even if, कामम् pleasures, धर्मम् righteousness, राजानम् अनु kings follow, व्यवस्यन्ति prescribe.
data.md: O son of Paulastya, at the instance of the king mild subjects perform many an action conducing to virtue, wealth and desire, though not mentioned in the Šāstras.

data.v: राजा धर्मश्च कामश्च द्रव्याणां चोत्तमो निधिः । धर्मः शुभं वा पापं वा राजमूलं प्रवर्तते ।।
data.es: A king is the best repository of rigteousness, material wealth and pleasures. The king is the root of dharma, virtue and sin.
data.anv: धर्मस्य of righteousness, कामस्य of pleasures, द्रव्याणां च and for material wealth, राजा king, उत्तमः best, निधिः repository, धर्मः righteousness, शुभंवा good or, पापं वा or bad, राजमूलम् king is at the root, प्रवर्तते is practised.
data.md: The king is the virtue, the king is the desire and the king is the prime jewel of all subjects. Virtue, desire or sin-every thing ariseth from the king.

data.v: पापस्वभावश्चपलः कथं त्वं रक्षसां वर । ऐश्वर्यमभिसंप्राप्तो विमानमिव दुष्कृती ।।
data.es: O best of demons by nature you are sinful, and fickleminded. You do all forbidden acts. Otherwise,how could you get this wealth, like the celestial chariot?
data.anv: रक्षसाम् of demons, वर best one, पापस्वभावः of sinful nature, चपलः fickleminded, त्वम् you are, दुष्कृतिः who does forbidden acts, विमानमिव like this celestial chariot, ऐश्वर्यम् wealth, कथम् how, अभिसम्प्राप्तः did you get?
data.md: O you the best of Rākṣasas, you are vicious and unsteady; how have you come by riches like to a sinner attaining to the abode of celestials?

data.v: कामस्वभावो यो यस्य न स शक्यः प्रमार्जितुम् । न हि दुष्टात्मनामार्य मा वसत्यालये चिरम् ।।
data.es: Indeed, it is not possible to erase the nature of any one, whatever it be. Prosperity does not rest for long in the house of the evilminded.
data.anv: यः whatever, यस्य  his, स्वभावः nature, परिमार्जितुम् to erase, कामम् indeed, न शक्यः not possible, दुष्टात्मनाम् evilminded people, आलये in the house, चिरम् for long time, आर्यम् prosperity, न आवसति हि will not be.
data.md: A vicious person can never relinquish his sinful habits—virtue does never reside in the abodes of impious persons.

data.v: विषये वा पुरे वा ते यदा रामो महाबलः । नापराध्यति धर्मात्मा कथं तस्यापराध्यसि ।।
data.es: Powerful and righteous Rama has not offended you, your kingdom or your city. Why do you offend him?
data.anv: महाबलः powerful, धर्मात्मा righteous self, रामः Rama, यदा since, ते to you, विषये वा in your kingdom, पुरे वा or in the city, नापराध्यति has not offended, तस्य his, कथम् how, अपराध्यसि do you offend.
data.md: The mighty and the virtuous-souled Rāma has committed nothing wrong in your city or your dominions. Why do you then commit wrong by him?

data.v: यदि शूर्पणखाहेतोर्जनस्थानगतः खरः । अतिवृत्तो हतः पूर्वं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।
data.es: For the sake of Surpanakha, Khara of Janasthana committed excesses and got killed by Rama who can accomplish things with ease.Tell me truly if Rama did violate anything here.
data.anv: जनस्थानगतः staying at Janasthana, खरः Khara, शूर्पणखाहेतोः for the sake of Surpanakha, पूर्वम् earlier, अतिवृत्तः a person who exceeded his limits, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा by one who can accomplish a work easily, रामेण by Rama, हतः slain, यदि if, अत्र here, रामस्य Rama's, व्यतिक्रमः violation, कः what, यथातत्त्वम् truly, ब्रूहि tell me.
data.md: Though the wicked Khara of Janasthāna has been slain by him on Sūrpanakhā's account, yet how is he to blame for it do you truly speak.

data.v: अत्र ब्रूहि यथासत्यं को रामस्य व्यतिक्रमः । यस्य त्वं लोकनाथस्य हृत्वा भार्यां गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: On account of Surpanakha, Khara trespassed into Janasthana and got killed by Rama, without much effort. Tell me truly, what transgression (of dharma) did he commit for which you are stealing away the wife of Rama who is the lord of this world?.
data.anv: शूर्पणखाहेतोः on account of Surpanakha, जनस्थानगतः staying in Janasthana, खरः Khara, अतिवृत्तः trespassed, आक्लिष्टकर्मणा by one who does something without much effort, रामेण Rama, पूर्वम् earlier, हतः यदि if killed, अत्र here, लोकनाथस्य lord of the world (Rama), यस्य whose, भार्याम् wife, त्वम् you, हृत्वा गमिष्यसि (हरिष्यसि) taking away, रामस्य Rama's, व्यतिक्रमः transgression of dharma, कः what, यथातत्त्वम् truly, ब्रूहि tell.
data.md: Khara of Janasthāna is highly wicked and if Rāma of blameless actions has killed him on Surpanakha's account how is he to blame? Why do you then carry away the wife of that lord of men?

data.v: क्षिप्रं विसृज वैदेहीं मा त्वा घोरेण चक्षुषा । दहेद्दहन भूतेन वृत्रमिन्द्राशनिर्यथा ।।
data.es: Leave Vaidehi at once lest with her fierce looks you should be burnt down like demon Vrtra by the thunderbolt of Indra.
data.anv: क्षिप्रम् at once, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, विसृज leave, त्वा you, इन्द्राशनिः Indra's thunderbolt, वृत्रं यथा like Vritra, दहनभूतेन with fury, घोरेण with fierce, चक्षुषा with looks, मा दहेत् may not burn.
data.md: Do you soon leave off Vaidehī. Like to Indra burning down Vịtrāsura, Rāma, looking with his terrible eyes like flaming fire, shall reduce you to ashes.

data.v: सर्पमाशीविषं बद्ध्वा वस्त्रान्ते नावबुध्यसे । ग्रीवायां प्रतिमुक्तं च कालपाशं न पश्यसि ।।
data.es: You are not aware that you are tying a venomous snake with the skirt of your cloth. worn by you. You are not able to see the noose of death tightened around your neck.
data.anv: आशीविषम् venomous, सर्पम् serpent, वस्रान्ते with the skirt of your cloth, बद्ध्वा binding, नावबुध्यसे not understand, ग्रीवायाम् to the neck, प्रतिसक्तम् fastened tightly, कालपाशम् noose of death, न पश्यसि do not see.
data.md: Do you not understand that you have tied with cloth a virulent serpent? Do you not see that you have placed around your neck the noose of death?

data.v: स भारः सौम्य भर्तव्यो यो नरं नावसादयेत् । तदन्नमुपभोक्तव्यं जीर्यते यदनामयम् ।।
data.es: O gentle Ravana one should carry that much of weight which does not tire him. One should eat only that wholesome food which can be easily digested.
data.anv: सौम्य O gentle one, यः that which, नरम् man, नावसादयेत् does not fatigue, सः such, भारः weight, भर्तव्यः should be carried, यत् which, अनामयम् free from any disease, जीर्यते is digested, तत् that only, अन्नम् food, भोक्तव्यम् should be eaten, अपि even.
data.md: It is always proper to carry such a weight as does not exhaust (him who carries); it is always proper to take such a food as does not cause illness.

data.v: यत्कृत्वा न भवेद्धर्मो न कीर्तिर्न यशो भुवि । शरीरस्य भवेत्खेदः कस्तत्कर्म समाचरेत् ।।
data.es: Who will do such a deed which cannot beget dharma, fame or glory in the world? Who will do such deeds that bring only exhaustion to the body?
data.anv: यत् by what, कृत्वा doing, धर्मः duty, न भवेत् does not beget, भुवि world, कीर्तिः fame, न nor, यशः glory, न nor, शरीरस्य to the body, खेदः exhaustion, भवेत् brings, तत् that, कर्म deed, कः who, समाचरेत् will practise?
data.md: Who engageth himself in such an action as does not confer virtue, fame or glory, but bring about physical affliction only?

data.v: षष्टिवर्षसहस्राणि मम जातस्य रावण । पितृपैतामहं राज्यं यथावदनुतिष्ठतः ।।
data.es: Sixty thousand years ago I was born, O Ravana Since then I have ruled justly my hereditary kingdom.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, पितृपैतामहम् hereditary, राज्यम् kingdom, यथावत् justly, अनुतिष्टतः while ruling, जातस्य since birth, मम me, षष्टिः sixty, वर्षसहस्राणि thosand years are completed.
data.md: O Rāvana, I am sixty thousand years old and have been administering regularly my ancestral kingdom.

data.v: वृद्धोऽहं त्वं युवा धन्वी सरथः कवची शरी । तथाप्यादाय वैदेहीं कुशली न गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: I am old, you are young, wielding a bow and arrows, with shield to protect and chariot to ride. Even then I will not let you go safe with Vaidehi kidnapped.
data.anv: अहम् I am, वृद्धः old, त्वम् you, युवा young, धन्वी wielding bow, सशरः and arrows, कवची shield, रथी riding on the chariot, तथापि even then, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, आदाय carrying, कुशली safely, न गमिष्यसि will not go.
data.md: Old though I am, you shall not be able to carry away with safety Jānakī in my presence, young, accoutred in mails as you are with bow and arrows in your hands and ascending a car.

data.v: न शक्तस्त्वं बलाद्धर्तुं वैदेहीं मम पश्यतः । हेतुभिर्न्यायसंयुक्तैर्ध्रुवां वेदश्रुतीमिव ।।
data.es: You cannot carry Vaidehi by force within my very sight just as the everlasting revelations of the Vedas cannot be robbed by mere logic of reason.
data.anv: मम पश्यतः within my very sight, त्वम् you, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न्यायसंसिद्धैः by those bound by logic, हेतुभिः by reason, ध्रुवाम् everlasting, वेदश्रुतीमिव like revelations of the Vedas, बलात् by force, हर्तुम् abduct, न शक्तः not possible for you.
data.md: As it is not easy to destroy, by the reasonings of Logic, Vedas and Śrutis containing eternal and immutable truths, so you shall not be able to carry away Vaidehi by force before me.

data.v: युध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि मुहूर्तं तिष्ठ रावण । शयिष्यसे हतो भूमौ यथापूर्वं खरस्तथा ।।
data.es: O Ravana, if you are brave, fight with me. In a moment, you will be killed like Khara and lie down on the ground.
data.anv: रावण O Ravana, शूरः असि यदि if you are a hero, युद्ध्यस्व do fight with me, मुहूर्तम् तिष्ठ stay awhile, पूर्वम् earlier, खरः Khara, यथा as he was, तथा likewise, हतः slayed, भूमौ on the earth, शयिष्यसे will sleep.
data.md: If you are a hero do you fight. Or do you wait for a moment, O Rāvana, you shall also embrace the earth like to Khara.

data.v: असकृत्संयुगे येन निहता दैत्यदानवाः । नचिराच्चीरवासास्त्वां रामो युधि वधिष्यति ।।
data.es: Clad in bark garments, Rama, who has often slain demons in the past will soon kill you in war.
data.anv: येन by whom, असकृत् many times, संयुगे in war, दैत्यदानवाः demons, निहताः were slain, त्वाम् you, नचिरात् soon, चीरवासाः clad in bark robes, रामः Rama, युधि in war, वधिष्यति will slay৷৷
data.md: Soon shall Rāma clad in bark destroy you in the battle field, who had many a time and oft destroyed in conflict the celestials and Dānavas.

data.v: किं नु शक्यं मया कर्तुं गतौ दूरं नृपात्मजौ । क्षिप्रं त्वं नश्यसे नीच तयोर्भीतो न संशयः ।।
data.es: What can I do? O mean fellow the two princes have gone far away.You will soon be destroyed out of fear for them. There is no doubt.
data.anv: मया by me, किं नु what else, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् am able, नृपात्मजौ the two princes, दूरम् far away, गतौ have gone, नीच mean fellow, तयोः both of them, भीतः fearing, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् at once, नश्यसे will be destroyed, संशयः doubt, न not.
data.md: These two princes Rāma and Lakşmaņa are at a distance, what shall I do now? O vile being, undoubtedly shall you, terrified, be destroyed by thein.

data.v: न हि मे जीवमानस्य नयिष्यसि शुभामिमाम् । सीतां कमलपत्राक्षीं रामस्य महषीं प्रियाम् ।।
data.es: I will not let you take away the auspicious, lotuseyed Sita, the dear consort of Rama as long as I am alive.
data.anv: मे myself, जीवमानस्य while I am alive, शुभाम् auspicious, कमलपत्राक्षीम् lotuseyed lady, रामस्य प्रियाम् Rama's dear, महिषीम् consort, इमाम् this lady, सीताम् Sita, न नयिष्यसि will not take.
data.md: Myself drawing my breath you shall not be able to carry away this beloved queen of Rāma, the pure-natured Sitä having eyes resembling lotuses.

data.v: अवश्यं तु मया कार्यं प्रियं तस्य महात्मनः । जीवितेनापि रामस्य तथा दशरथस्य च ।।
data.es: I should do this important work of those great souls, Rama and Dasaratha, even if it claims my life.
data.anv: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, तथा so, दशरथस्य च and Dasaratha's, मया my, अवश्यम् certainly, जीवितेनापि even giving up my life, प्रियम् dear, कार्यम् task.
data.md: It is my duty to do good to the high-souled Rāma and Dasaratha even at the sacrifice of my life.

data.v: तिष्ठ तिष्ठ दशग्रीव मुहूर्तं पश्य रावण । युद्धातिथ्यं प्रदास्यामि यथाप्राणं निशाचर । वृन्तादिव फलं त्वां तु पातयेयं रथोत्तमात् ।।
data.es: O ten headed Ravana stay, stay for a while. O demon as long as I am alive I will treat you with the hospitality of war. You will be pulled down from this best of the chariots like a ripe fruit drops from the stalk.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: दशग्रीव tenheaded, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, तिष्ठ तिष्ठ stay, stay, रावण Ravana, पश्य look, निशाचर nightwalker, यथाप्राणम् as long as I am alive, युद्धातिथ्यम् hospitality of war , प्रदास्यामि will accord, वृन्तात् from the stalk, फलमिव like a ripe fruit is dropped down, त्वाम् you, रथोत्तमात् from the best of the chariots, पातयेयम् will pull you down.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्य यथान्यायं रावणस्य जटायुषा । क्रुद्धस्याग्निनिभाः सर्वा रेजुर्विंशतिदृष्टयः ।।
data.es: Ravana's twenty eyes glowed like fire in anger after Jatayu thus rightly said.
data.anv: जटायुषा by Jatayu, यथान्यायम् justly, इति in this manner, उक्तस्य  told, क्रुद्धस्य of the enraged, रावणस्य Ravana's, सर्वाः all, विंशतिदृष्टयः twenty eyes, अग्निनिभाः like fire, रेजुः glowed.

data.v: संरक्तनयनः कोपात्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः । राक्षसेन्द्रोऽभिदुद्राव पतगेन्द्रममर्षणः ।।
data.es: As the bright gold earrings of the intolerant king of demons glittered, his eyes turned red in rage and he pounced upon Jatayu, the lord of birds.
data.anv: तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः bright gold earrings, अमर्षणः intolerant, राक्षसेन्द्रः king of demons, कोपात् in anger, संरक्तनयनः eyes turned red, पतगेन्द्रम् to lord of birds (Jatayu), अभिदुद्राव leaped.
data.md: While Jatayu, the king of birds, spake this, Rāvana, the lord of Rākşasas, wearing pendants made of pure gold, having his eyes reddened with ire, darted towards him.

data.v: स संप्रहारस्तुमुलस्तयोस्तस्मिन्महावने । बभूव वातोद्धतयोर्मेघयोर्गगने यथा ।।
data.es: The clash between them was tumultuous and it appeared like the clash of two pieces of clouds in the sky raised by stormy winds.
data.anv: तस्मिन् in that, महावने in the huge forest, तयोः between them, तुमुलः tumultuous, सः सम्प्रहारः fight, गगने in the sky, वातोद्धतयोः stormy wind that arose, मेघयोर्यथा like two flakes of clouds, बभूव appeared.
data.md: Thereupon they began a terrible conflict in the welkin, like to clouds driven by wind.

data.v: तद्बभूवाद्भुतं युद्धं गृध्रराक्षसयोस्तदा । सपक्षयोर्माल्यवतोर्महापर्वतयोरिव ।।
data.es: The duel between Ravana and Jatayu looked as though it was a fight between two huge winged mountains of Malyavan range.
data.anv: तदा then, (तयोः of both of them), गृध्रराक्षसयोः vulture and demon, तत् that, अद्भुतम् wonderful, युद्धम् war, सपक्षयोः of the winged ones, माल्यवतोः of Malyavan range, महापर्वतयोरिव between two huge mountains, बभूव took place.
data.md: There occurred a mighty conflict between Jatayu, the lord of vultures, and Ravana, the lord of Raksasas, like to two Malyavān* hills supplies with wings. A mountainous range described as one of the smaller mountains of India proper, lying eastward of mount Meru.—

data.v: ततो नालीकनाराचैस्तीक्ष्णाग्रैश्च विकर्णिभिः । अभ्यवर्षन्महाघोरैर्गृध्रराजं महाबलः ।।
data.es: The bodies of the demons torn into pieces by the very sharp iron arrows and by the arrows called vikarni, they cried and shouted aloud in pitiable voices.
data.anv: ततः then, नालीकनाराचैः with iron arrows, तीक्ष्णाग्रैः with sharp tops, विकर्णिभिः by shafts called vikarni, भिद्यमानाः torn into parts, निशाचराः demons, भीमम् terrible, आर्तस्वरम् pitiable cries, चक्रुः made.
data.md: As a mighty elephant is struck with the goad, Rāma in the conflict attacked (his opponent) with nalikas and nārācas and sharp-pointed vikarna.

data.v: स तानि शरजालानि गृध्रः पत्ररथेश्वरः । जटायुः प्रतिजग्राह रावणास्त्राणि संयुगे ।।
data.es: Jatayu, lord of the birds, faced the arrows and other weapons showered by Ravana.
data.anv: पत्ररथेश्वरः lord of birds, गृध्रः vulture, जटायुः Jatayu, संयुगे in encounter, तानि those, शरजालानि all the arrows, रावणास्त्राणि Ravana's weapons, प्रतिजग्राह endured.
data.md: Jatayu, the king of birds, began to withstand in conflict the arrows and weapons darted by Rāvana, and wounded Rāvana's person with his feet supplies with sharpened talons.

data.v: तस्य तीक्ष्णनखाभ्यां तु चरणाभ्यां महाबलः । चकार बहुधा गात्रे व्रणान्पतगसत्तमः ।।
data.es: The mighty, virtuous vulture with his sharp claws wounded many parts of the body of Ravana.
data.anv: महाबलः very strong, पतगसत्तमः virtuous vulture, तीक्ष्णनखाभ्याम् with sharp claws, चरणाभ्याम् with both feet, तस्य his, गात्रे on the limbs, बहुधा many ways, व्रणान् wounds, चकार pierced.
data.md: Jatayu, the king of birds, began to withstand in conflict the arrows and weapons darted by Rāvana, and wounded Rāvana's person with his feet supplies with sharpened talons.

data.v: अथ क्रोधाद्दशग्रीवो जग्राह दशमार्गणान् । मृत्युदण्डनिभान्घोराञ्शत्रुमर्दनकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: Ravana in a rage took ten dreadful darts (looking) like the staff of death with a desire to crush the enemy.
data.anv: अथ at that time, दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, क्रोधात् enraged, शत्रुमर्दनकाङ्क्षया with a desire to crush the enemy, मृत्युदण्डनिभान् like the staff of death, घोरान् fierce, दश मार्गणान् ten darts, जग्राह unleashed.

data.v: स तैर्बाणैर्महावीर्यः पूर्णमुक्तैरजिह्मगैः । बिभेद निशितैस्तीक्ष्णैर्गृध्रं घोरैः शिलीमुखैः ।।
data.es: The mighty Ravana fully released his dreadful, sharp arrows that went straight and pierced the vulture.
data.anv: महावीर्यः mighty, सः he, पूर्णमुक्तै: fully released, अजिह्मगैः going straight, निशितैः whetted, तीक्ष्णै with sharp, घोरैः dreadful, शिलीमुखैः with arrows, तैः those, बाणैः arrows, गृध्रम् at the vulture, बिभेद pierced.
data.md: Thereupon, to destroy his enemy, that mighty hero, the Ten-necked Ravana, being exercised with ire, took up ten terrible arrows like to the sceptre of Death, and stretching the bow to the full he shot those straight-coursing sharpened shafts at Jatayu, the king of birds.

data.v: स राक्षसरथे पश्यञ्जानकीं बाष्पलोचनाम् । अचिन्तयित्वा बाणांस्तान्राक्षसं समभिद्रवत् ।।
data.es: Seeing Sita, daughter of Janaka, on the demon's chariot with eyes full of tears, Jatayu without minding the arrows renewed his attack.
data.anv: सः that, राक्षसरथे on the demon's chariot, बाष्पलोचनाम् eyes filled with tears, जानकीम् Sita, daughter of Janaka, पश्यन् observing, तान् those, बाणान् arrows, अचिन्तयित्वा without minding, राक्षसम् to the demon, समभिद्रवत् attacked again.
data.md: Beholding Jānaki with tears in her eyes in that Raksasa's car, Jatayu, the king of birds, disregarding those arrows, darted towards Rāvana, and with his feet broke asunder his bow with the arrows, adorned with pearls and diamonds.

data.v: ततोऽस्य सशरं चापं मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् । चरणाभ्यां महातेजा बभञ्ज पतगेश्वरः ।।
data.es: The glorious lord of birds crushed with his feet the bow and arrow of Ravana with pearls and gems encrusted.
data.anv: ततः then, महातेजाः glorious, पतगेश्वरः lord of birds, अस्य his, मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् encrusted with pearls and gems, सशरम् along with that arrow, चापम् bow, चरणाभ्याम् with his feet, बभञ्ज broke.

data.v: तच्चाग्निसदृशं दीप्तं रावणस्य शरावरम् । पक्षाभ्यां च महातेजा व्यधुनोत्पतगेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Mighty Jatayu, lord of the birds, shattered with his wings the armour of Ravana that was glowing like fire.
data.anv: महावीर्यः mighty, सः Jatayu, पतगेश्वरः lord of the birds, रावणस्य Ravana's, अग्निसदृशम् burning like fire, दीप्तम् glowing, तत् that, शरावरम् armour, पक्षाभ्याम् with the wings, व्याधुनोत् tore asunder.
data.md: Pushing away these arrows by the wind of his wings, he again snapped that mighty bow with his feet, and with a stroke of his wings shattered Rāvaņa's flaming shield like to burning fire.

data.v: काञ्चनोरश्छदान्दिव्यान्पिशाचवदनान्खरान् । तांश्चास्य जवसंपन्नाञ्जघान समरे बली ।।
data.es: Powerful Jatayu killed in the combat, the splendid, swiftmoving, devilfaced asses with golden shields yoked to the chariot.
data.anv: बली powerful, काञ्चनोरश्छदान् golden shield, दिव्यान् splendid, पिशाचवदनान् devil's face, जवसम्पन्नान् endowed with great speed, तान् those, खरान् च asses, समरे in the combat, जघान killed.
data.md: Thereupon moving away with the wind of his wings Rāvana's blazing cuirass resembling flaming fire, Jațāyu in that conflict made away with his fleet-coursing asses having the faces of demons.

data.v: वरं त्रिवेणुसंपन्नं कामगं पावकार्चिषम् । मणिहेमविचित्राङ्गं बभञ्ज च महारथम् । पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतीकाशं छत्रं च व्यजनैः सह ।।
data.es: Then he(Jatayu) broke down the great chariot(of Ravana) glowing like fire, glittering with gold and gems, made of three bamboo reeds, and capable of flying wherever the rider willed.
data.anv: वरम् excellent, त्रिवेणुसम्पन्नम् endowed with three bamboo reeds, कामगम् go wherever one desired, पावकार्चिषम् glowing like fire, मणिहेमविचित्राङ्गम् glittering with gold and gems, महारथम् great chariot, बभञ्ज broke.

data.v: स भग्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः । अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीं पपात भुवि रावणः ।।
data.es: Then, with bow broken, chariot destroyed, horses and charioteer dead, Khara jumped down the chariot and stood on the ground holding a mace.
data.anv: तदा then, प्रभग्नधन्वा with bow broken, विरथः without chariot, हताश्वः horses killed, हतसारधिः with charioteer dead, खरः Khara, गदापाणिः holding a mace in hand, अवप्लुत्य jumping down the chariot, भूमौ on the ground, तस्थौ stood.
data.md: Having his bow snapped and deprived of his car, horses and charioteer, Rāvana fell down to the earth, taking Vaidehi on his lap.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा निपतितं भूमौ रावणं भग्नवाहनम् । साधु साध्विति भूतानि गृध्रराजमपूजयन् ।।
data.es: Seeing Dusaana collapse dead on the ground, all beings hailed Rama, saying, 'Well done, well done'.
data.anv: रणे in battle, निहतम् killed, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen down, तं दूषणम् that Dusana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सर्वभूतानि all beings, काकुत्स्थम् Rama, साधु साधु इति saying, 'well done well done', अपूजयन् hailed.
data.md: Seeing Dūşaņa down on the ground, and slain in battle, all creatures, saying, ''well done! well done!" paid homage to Kākutstha.

data.v: परिश्रान्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा जरया पक्षियूथपम् । उत्पपात पुनर्हृष्टो मैथिलीं गृह्य रावणः ।।
data.es: Seeing the lord of the flocks of birds exhausted due to age still fighting, Ravana felt glad. He flew back into the sky taking Sita, princess of Mithila, with him.
data.anv: पक्षियूथपम् the lord of the flocks of birds (Jatayu), तम् him, जरया with old age, परिश्रान्तम् exhausted (after a long fight), दृष्ट्वा seeing, रावणः Ravana, हृष्टः glad, मैथिलीम् Maithili, गृह्य took, पुनः again, उत्पपात flew into the sky.
data.md: Thereupon, finding the lord of birds worn out on account of his old age, Ravana, highly encouraged, again rose high up in the welkin, taking Maithill with him.

data.v: तं प्रहृष्टं निधायाङ्के गच्छन्तं जनकात्मजाम् । गृध्रराजः समुत्पत्य जटायुरिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Seeing Sita, Janaka's daughter, happily carried away into the sky by Ravana on his lap. Jatayu, the mighty king of vultures chased him, and obstructing his path said :
data.anv: गृध्रराजः king of the vultures, महातेजाः mighty, जटायुः Jatayu, समुत्पत्य flew up.प्रहृष्टम् happy, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter ( Sita), अङ्के on the lap, निथाय placed, गच्छन्तम् while going, तं रावणम् to that Ravana, समभिद्रुत्य chased, समावार्य obstructing, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: He had all his weapons broken in the conflict, and had but his dagger left to him. beholding him proceed thus pleased, taking the daughter of Janaka on his lap, all his weapons having been lost, with his sword alone left, the mighty and powerful lord of vultures, Jațāyu, rose up and, darting towards Rāvana, resisted him and said,

data.v: वज्रसंस्पर्शबाणस्य भार्यां रामस्य रावण । अल्पबुद्धे हरस्येनां वधाय खलु रक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: Foolish Ravana, you are kidnapping this lady, wife of Rama, whose arrows can hit like a thunderbolt. This will lead to the destruction of all demons.
data.anv: अल्पबुद्धे foolish, रावण Ravana, वज्रसंस्पर्शबाणस्य whose arows can hit like a thunderbolt, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, एनाम् this lady, रक्षसाम् of demons, वधाय for destruction, हरसि  kidnapping.
data.md: O Rāvana of feeble sense, it is for the destruction of the whole line of Rākşasas that you carries away this spouse of Răma, having arrows like to thunderbolts.

data.v: समित्रबन्धुः सामात्यः सबलः सपरिच्छदः । विषपानं पिबस्येतत्पिपासित इवोदकम् ।।
data.es: You are drinking poison along with all your friends, relatives, ministers, the army and your allies. like a thirsty man drinks water.
data.anv: मित्रबन्धुः along with kith and kin, सामात्यः with ministers, सबलः with army, सपरिच्छदः with all your allies, पिपासितः thirsty man, उदकमिव like water, एतत् this, विषपानम् poison, पिबसि you  are drinking.
data.md: Like one thirsty drinking water, you do address yourself to drinking poison along with your friends, courtiers, four-fold forces, servants and relatives.

data.v: अनुबन्धमजानन्तः कर्मणामविचक्षणाः । शीघ्रमेव विनश्यन्ति यथा त्वं विनशिष्यसि ।।
data.es: Fools who do not know the consequences of their action perish soon. Similarly you are going to die soon.
data.anv: कर्मणाम् of the deeds, अनुबन्धम् consequences, अजानन्तः not knowing, अविचक्षणाः unwise, यथा similarly, श्रीघ्रमेव soon, विनश्यन्ति get destroyed, त्वम् you, विनशिष्यसि will be destroyed.
data.md: Foolish persons unaware of the fruit of their actions, meet in a short time with their own destruction, so shall you very soon meet with your own end.

data.v: बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन क्व गतस्तस्य मोक्ष्यसे । वधाय बडिशं गृह्य सामिषं जलजो यथा ।।
data.es: You are bound by the noose of death like a fish holding on to the bait of the fishing hook. Where can you go now?
data.anv: त्वम् you, कालपाशेन by the noose of death, वधाय to die, बद्धः are bound, सामिषम् with a bait, बडिशम् fishhook, गृह्य having taken, जलजः fish, यथा so also, तस्य its, क्व गतः where can it go, मोक्ष्यसे will you get out.
data.md: You have been bound up by the noose of Death; and, proceeding whither, shall you save yourself, like to fish eating up baits with hooks for their own destruction?

data.v: न हि जातु दुराधर्षौ काकुत्स्थौ तव रावण । धर्षणं चाश्रमस्यास्य क्षमिष्येते तु राघवौ ।।
data.es: O Ravana know that Rama and Lakshmana, the Kakutsthas, are invincible. They will not forgive the asssault you have made on their hermitage.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, दुराधर्षौ both invincible, काकुत्स्थौ both Kakutsthas, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, तव your, अस्य आश्रमस्य their hermitage, धर्षणम् assault, जातु surely, न क्षमिष्येते not forgive.
data.md: O Rāvana, it is beyond your power to defeat the Kakutsthas. They shall not forgive you for this your encroachment upon their asylum.

data.v: यथा त्वया कृतं कर्म भीरुणा लोकगर्हितम् । तस्कराचरितो मार्गो नैष वीरनिषेवितः ।।
data.es: Your cowardly action will be condemned by the whole world. The path you have chosen is the path of a thief and not of a hero.
data.anv: भीरुणा by a timid, त्वया you are, यथा like this, लोकगर्हितम् condemned by the whole world, कर्म  act, कृतम् is done, तस्कराचरितः adopted by thieves, मार्गः this path, वीरनिषेवितः followed by heroes, नैव not at all.
data.md: What have been perpetrated by you coward, is blamed by all, and is the way taken recourse to by thieves and not by heroes.

data.v: युध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि मुहूर्तं तिष्ठ रावण । शयिष्यसे हतो भूमौ यथा भ्राता खरस्तथा ।।
data.es: O Ravana, if you are brave, fight with me. In a moment, you will be killed like Khara and lie down on the ground.
data.anv: रावण O Ravana, शूरः असि यदि if you are a hero, युद्ध्यस्व do fight with me, मुहूर्तम् तिष्ठ stay awhile, पूर्वम् earlier, खरः Khara, यथा as he was, तथा likewise, हतः slayed, भूमौ on the earth, शयिष्यसे will sleep.
data.md: If you are a hero do you fight. Or do you wait for a moment, O Rāvana, you shall also embrace the earth like to Khara.

data.v: परेतकाले पुरुषो यत्कर्म प्रतिपद्यते । विनाशायात्मनोऽधर्म्यं प्रतिपन्नोऽसि कर्म तत् ।।
data.es: You have resorted to unrighteous action like a dying man. This will spell your destruction.
data.anv: पुरुषः man, परेतकाले at the time of death, यत् whatever, कर्म actions, प्रतिपद्यते does, अधर्म्यम् unrighteous, तत् such, कर्म action, आत्मनः yourself, विनाशाय for destruction, प्रतिपन्नः  undertaken, असि you are.
data.md: Truly have you for your own destruction engaged yourself in these impious acts, which are perpetrated by men on the eve of their death.

data.v: पापानुबन्धो वै यस्य कर्मणः को नु तत्पुमान् । कुर्वीत लोकाधिपतिः स्वयम्भूर्भगवानपि ।।
data.es: If the consequences of an action be sin, who will do it ? Even the selfborn lord of the world may not.
data.anv: यस्य by whomsoever, कर्मणः action, पापानुबन्धः resulting in sin, तत् such, कर्म action, लोकाधिपतिः lord of the world, भगवान् स्वयंभूरपि selfborn lord (Brahma) too, कः who, कुर्वीत may do, नु indeed, तत् that.
data.md: What person do that which lead solely into sin? neither the lord of celestials nor the selfcreate Deity do engage in such an action.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा शुभं वाक्यं जटायुस्तस्य रक्षसः । निपपात भृशं पृष्ठे दशग्रीवस्य वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Brave Jatayu having thus said these cautious words to the demon dashed against his back again and again.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् brave,जटायुः Jatayu, एवम् in that manner, शुभम् auspicious (cautious), वाक्यम् words, उक्त्वा having  said, रक्षसः of that demon, तस्य रावणस्य पृष्ठे at Ravana's back, भृशम् repeatedly, निपपात dashed.

data.v: तं गृहीत्वा नखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्विरराद समन्ततः । अधिरूढो गजारोहि यथा स्याद्दुष्टवारणम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, seizing Ravana, Jatayu ascended on his back and pierced his body all over with his sharp claws just as a rider goads an unruly elephant.
data.anv: (ततः thereafter), तं गृहीत्वा seizing him, अधिरूढः ascended, गजारोहः riding on an elephant, दुष्टवारणम् unruly elephant, यथा so also, स्यात् he, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, नखैः claws, समन्ततः all over, विददार pierced.

data.v: विरराद नखैरस्य तुण्डं पृष्ठे समर्पयन् । केशांश्चोत्पाटयामास नखपक्षमुखायुधः ।।
data.es: Jatayu who had his claws, wings and beak as the only weapons pierced and pricked Ravana all over with his nails by pressing his beak on his back and pulled out his hair.
data.anv: अस्य his, पृष्ठे back, तुण्डम् beak, समर्पयन् pressing, नखैः claws, विददार pierced, नखपक्षमुखायुधः a warrior with claws, wings and beak as the only weapons, केशांश्च hair too, उत्पाटयामास pulled out.

data.v: स तथा गृध्रराजेन क्लिश्यमानो मुहुर्मुहुः । अमर्षस्फुरितौष्ठः सन्प्राकम्पत स राक्षसः ।।
data.es: Thus tormented again and again by the king of vultures, Ravana shook with anger, his lips quivering.
data.anv: गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, तथा in that manner, क्लिश्यमानः being tormented, सः रावणः he, Ravana, अमर्षफुरितोष्ठः सन् with his lips quivering with anger, प्राकम्पत was shaken.
data.md: Being thus afflicted again and again by the king of vultures, the Răkşasa shook, with his lips quivering in anger.

data.v: संपरिष्वज्य वैदेहीं वामेनाङ्केन रावणः । तलेनाभिजघानार्तो जटायुं क्रोधमूर्छितः ।।
data.es: Losing his senses, with rage, Ravana held Vaidehi (Sita) with his left arm and hit Jatayu with his palm.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, क्रोधमूर्छितः losing senses with rage, वामेन अङ्केन left arm, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, परिष्वज्य holding firmly, आशु quickly, जटायुम् to Jatayu, तलेन palm, अभिजघान hit him.
data.md: Beside himself with anger, Ravana, holding Jānaki fast by her left flank, struck Jațāyu with his palms.

data.v: जटायुस्तमतिक्रम्य तुण्डेनास्य खराधिपः । वामबाहून्दश तदा व्यपाहरदरिंदमः ।।
data.es: Then Jatayu, lord of the birds, subduer of enemies, overpowered Ravana and dismembered his ten left arms with his beak.
data.anv: तदा then, खगाधिपः lord of the birds, अरिन्दमः  subduer of enemies, जटायुः Jatayu, तम् him, अभिक्रम्य  occupied, तुण्डेन by his beak, अस्य Ravana's, दश ten, वामबाहून् left arms, व्यपाहरत् cut off.
data.md: Jatayu, the subduer of foes, bearing the strokes, tore into pieces his ten left arms with his beak.

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धो दशक्रीवः सीतामुत्सृज्य वीर्यवान् । मुष्टिभ्यां चरणाभ्यां च गृध्रराजमपोथयत् ।।
data.es: Then the tenheaded Ravana left Sita and attacked Jatayu with his fists and feet out of anger.
data.anv: ततः then, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, उत्सृज्य left, मुष्टिभ्याम् with his fists, चरणाभ्यां च and feet, गृध्रराजम् Jatayu, क्रोधात् with anger, अपोथयत् attacked.
data.md: The mighty Ten-necked one, leaving aside Sitä, out of anger bore down Jațāyu with his fists and feet.

data.v: ततो मुहूर्तं संग्रामो बभूवातुलवीर्ययोः । राक्षसानां च मुख्यस्य पक्षिणां प्रवरस्य च ।।
data.es: Between the warriors of unequal valour, Ravana and Jatayu, the chief of the demons and the foremost of the birds, the fight took place for a moment.
data.anv: ततः then, अतुलवीर्ययो: of unequal valour, राक्षसानां मुख्यस्य of the chief of the demons, पक्षिणां प्रवरस्य king of the birds, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, सङ्ग्रामः fight, बभूव took place.
data.md: Thereupon arose a mighty conflict between the lord of vultures and the lord of Rākṣasas of incomparable prowess.

data.v: तस्य व्यायच्छमानस्य रामस्यार्थेऽथ रावणः । पक्षौ पादौ च पार्श्वौ च खड्गमुद्धृत्य सोऽच्छिनत् ।।
data.es: Ravana lifted his sword and cut off both the wings and feet of Jatayu who was fighting relentlessly (for Rama's sake).
data.anv: सः that, रावणः Ravana, खडगम् sword, उद्यम्य after lifting, रामस्य Rama's, अर्थे for the sake of, व्यायच्छमानस्य of one who was fighting relentlessly, तस्य his, पक्षौ two wings, पार्श्वौ च  both sides, पादौ च feet, अच्छिनत् cut off.
data.md: Jațāyu addressing himself to displaying his prowess for the benefit of Rāma, Rāvaņa taking out his dagger, cut off his two wings, two legs and two sides.

data.v: स छिन्नपक्षः सहसा रक्षसा रौद्रकर्मणा । निपपात हतो गृध्रो धरण्यामल्पजीवितः ।।
data.es: (Seriously) wounded and almost dead,the vulture fell down on the ground all at once, when his wings were chipped by the demon of terrible deeds.
data.anv: रौद्रकर्मणा one who performs terrible deeds, रक्षसा by the demon, छिन्नपक्षः clipped wings, सः that, गृध्रः vulture, हतः hurt, अल्पजीवितः with very little life left, धरण्याम् on the ground, सहसा immediately, निपपात fell.
data.md: The ranger of the night of cruel deeds having şundered his wings, the king of vultures approaching well-nigh the verge of death, fell। down on the earth.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ क्षतजार्द्रं जटायुषम् । अभ्यधावत वैदेही स्वबन्धुमिव दुःखिता ।।
data.es: Sita, princess of Videha, saw the wounded Jatayu fallen on the ground drenched in blood. Grieving, she ran towards him as if he was her relative.
data.anv: वैदेही Sita, princess of Videha, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen down, क्षतजार्द्रम् drenched in blood , तं जटायुषम् that Jatayu, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, दुःखिता grieved, स्वबन्धुमिव as if he was her relative, अभ्यधावत ran towards him.
data.md: Beholding him fallen on the ground with his person bathed in blood, Sītā became exceedingly aggrieved and darted towards him like to a friend.

data.v: तं नीलजीमूतनिकाशकल्पं; सुपाण्डुरोरस्कमुदारवीर्यम् । ददर्श लङ्काधिपतिः पृथिव्यां; जटायुषं शान्तमिवाग्निदावम् ।।
data.es: Lord of Lanka saw that very bold Jatayu of dark blue colour of the cloud, fair chest, fallen on the ground, looking like the forest fire that had been put out.
data.anv: लङ्काधिपतिः lord of Lanka, नीलजीमूतनिकाशकायम् of colour like the dark bluish cloud, सुपाण्डुरोरस्कम् of fair chest, उदारवीर्यम् bold, शान्तम् made calm, अग्निदावमिव like the forest fire, तं जटायुषम् that Jatayu, पृथिव्याम् on the ground, ददर्श saw.
data.md: The lord of Lankā beheld Jațāyu, fallen on the ground, resembling sable clouds, having a yellow breast and of exceeding prowess, like to an extinguished forest-fire.

data.v: ततस्तु तं पत्ररथं महीतले; निपातितं रावणवेगमर्दितम् । पुनः परिष्वज्य शशिप्रभानना; रुरोद सीता जनकात्मजा तदा ।।
data.es: Then the daughter of Janaka, cheerful Sita, who had a face bright like the moon, embraced Rama, destroyer of demons who was worshipped by the delighted sages. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, शशिप्रभानना face bright like the Moon, जनकात्मजा Sita, daughter of Janaka, राक्षससङ्घमर्दनम् one who destroyed the demons, मुदितैः joyful, महर्षिभिः by the great sages too, सभाज्यमानम् worshipped, तम् him, पुनः again, परिष्वज्य embraced, तदा then, हृष्टा happy, बभूव was.
data.md: Then Sītā the daughter of Janaka, having a moon-like countenance began lamenting, clasping with her hands Jațāyu, crushed and fallen on the ground by the vehemence of Rāvana's prowess.

data.v: तमल्पजीवितं भूमौ स्फुरन्तं राक्षसाधिपः । ददर्श गृध्रं पतितं समीपे राघवाश्रमात् ।।
सा तु ताराधिपमुखी रावणेन समीक्ष्य तम् । गृध्रराजं विनिहतं विललाप सुदुःखिता ।।
data.es: Sita,whose face was like the lord of the stars (Moon), saw Jatayu, king of birds, struck down by Ravana, and lamented in extreme grif :
data.anv: ताराधिपमुखी  with Moonlike face, सा तु that Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, विनिहतम् struck down, तं गृध्रराजम् king of the birds, समीक्ष्य  seeing, सुदुःखिता very  much agonised, विललाप wept.
data.md: Beholding the king of vultures slain by Rāvana, that one possessed of a face fair as the moon, stricken with grief, broke out into lamentations.

data.v: निमित्तं लक्षणज्ञानं शकुनिस्वरदर्शनम् । अवश्यं सुखदुःखेषु नराणां प्रतिदृश्यते ।।
data.es: People, for sure, foresee weal and woe in life from auspicious symptoms and ominous sounds.
data.anv: लक्षणज्ञानम् prognostication, शकुनिस्वरदर्शनम् sounds of ominous birds, नराणाम् for people, सुखदुःखेषु in joy and sorrow, अवश्यम् certainly, निमित्तम् indications, प्रतिदृश्यते are perceived.
data.md: Throbbings of the eyes or other parts of the body, dreams, seeing birds or hearing their voice, are found to augur happiness or misery to men.

data.v: न नूनं राम जानासि महद्व्यसनमात्मजः । धावन्ति नूनं काकुत्स्थ मदर्थं मृगपक्षिणः ।।
data.es: O Rama you are, indeed, unaware of the great disaster that has befallen you. All the animals and birds are running for my sake to tell you about me, O scion of the Kakutsthas.
data.anv: राम Rama, आत्मनः your, महत् great, व्यसनम् disaster, न जानासि not aware, नूनम् surely, मदर्थम् for my sake, मृगपक्षिणः animals and birds, काकुत्स्थम् towards Kakutstha, धावन्ति running to tell you, नूनम् surely.
data.md: And, O Rāma, although birds and beasts are scampering away before you on my account, you under-stand not the mighty mishap that has befallen you.

data.v: त्राहि मामद्य काकुत्स्थ लक्ष्मणेति वराङ्गना । सुसंत्रस्ता समाक्रन्दच्छृण्वतां तु यथान्तिके ।।
data.es: Terribly frightened, the beautiful lady (Sita) cried bitterly, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana, save me', as if they were close by and were listening to her.
data.anv: वराङ्गना beautiful lady, सुसन्त्रस्ता terribly frightened, काकुत्स्थ O Rama, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अद्य and now, माम् me, त्राहि save, इति thus, अन्तिके close by, शृण्वतां यथा as if listening to her, समाक्रन्दत् cried bitterly.
data.md: O Kākutstha, O Laksmana, save me! Thus did that best of females, afflicted with fear, bewail; and those near (her) heard her lamentations.

data.v: तां क्लिष्टमाल्याभरणां विलपन्तीमनाथवत् । अभ्यधावत वैदेहीं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: Ravana, king of the demons, ran towards Sita who was weeping like an orphan with her garlands and ornaments crushed.
data.anv: क्लिष्टमाल्याभरणाम् lady whose garlands were crushed and jewels let loose, अनाथवत् like orphan, विलपन्तीम् weeping lady, तां वैदेहीम् that Vaidehi, राक्षसाधिपः demon king, रावणः Ravana, अभ्यधावत ran towards.
data.md: Thereat, that lord of the Rākşasas, Rāvana, darted towards Vaidehi, who, with a faded wreath for her ornament, was bewailing in forlorn guise.

data.v: तां लतामिव वेष्टन्तीमालिङ्गन्तीं महाद्रुमान् । मुञ्च मुञ्चेति बहुशः प्रवदन्राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: Separated from Rama in the forest, Sita hugged huge trees, running round and round like a creeper coiled, crying loudly, 'Rama, O Rama' . The king of the demons, like Yama, caught hold of her hair only to invite his death, all the time saying, Leave it, Leave it (Leave the tree).
data.anv: अन्तकसन्निभः like Yama, lord of death, राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, लतामिव like a creeper, महाद्रुमान् huge trees, वेष्टन्तीम् coiled  आलिङ्गन्तीम् embracing, वने in the forest, रामेण by Rama, रहिताम् separated from, राम रामेति saying 'Rama, Rama', क्रोशन्तीम् lamenting, ताम् her, मुञ्च मुञ्च इति leave it, leave it, बहुशः several times, प्रवदन् uttering, जीवितान्ताय to bring an end to his life, केशेषु by her hair, जग्राह caught hold.
data.md: Exclaiming repeatedly, Leave off! Leave off, the lord of the Rākşasas got at her, as she was clasping a mighty trees as if it were a creeper.

data.v: क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति रामेण रहितां वने । जीवितान्ताय केशेषु जग्राहान्तकसंनिभः ।।
data.es: Separated from Rama in the forest, Sita hugged huge trees, running round and round like a creeper coiled, crying loudly, 'Rama, O Rama' . The king of the demons, like Yama, caught hold of her hair only to invite his death, all the time saying, Leave it, Leave it (Leave the tree).
data.anv: अन्तकसन्निभः like Yama, lord of death, राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, लतामिव like a creeper, महाद्रुमान् huge trees, वेष्टन्तीम् coiled  आलिङ्गन्तीम् embracing, वने in the forest, रामेण by Rama, रहिताम् separated from, राम रामेति saying 'Rama, Rama', क्रोशन्तीम् lamenting, ताम् her, मुञ्च मुञ्च इति leave it, leave it, बहुशः several times, प्रवदन् uttering, जीवितान्ताय to bring an end to his life, केशेषु by her hair, जग्राह caught hold.
data.md: And as she, bereft of the company of Răma in the wilderness, was wailing, saying, O Rāma, O Rāma, that one resembling the Destroyer himself, with the view of compassing his own end, seized her by her hair. On Vaidehi being thus outraged, this entire world consisting of mobile and immobile objects, had its nature altered. A dense darkness enveloped (everything).

data.v: प्रधर्षितायां वैदेह्यां बभूव सचराचरम् । जगत्सर्वममर्यादं तमसान्धेन संवृतम् ।।
data.es: While Sita was being assaulted, the earth with the animate and the inanimate crossed all limits of moral law and became enveloped in blinding darkness. The wind ceased to blow and the Sun, to shine.
data.anv: सीतायाम् when Sita, प्रधर्षितायाम् was assaulted, सचराचरम् with all beings animate and inanimate, सर्वम् all, जगत् world, अमर्यादम् crossed all moral law, अन्धेन तमसा  by pitch darkness, संवृतम्  enveloped, बभूव became, तत्र then, मारुतः wind, न वाति did not blow, दिवाकरः the Sun, निष्प्रभः lustreless, अभूत् became.
data.md: And as she, bereft of the company of Răma in the wilderness, was wailing, saying, O Rāma, O Rāma, that one resembling the Destroyer himself, with the view of compassing his own end, seized her by her hair. On Vaidehi being thus outraged, this entire world consisting of mobile and immobile objects, had its nature altered. A dense darkness enveloped (everything).

data.v: दृष्ट्वा सीतां परामृष्टां दीनां दिव्येन चक्षुषा । कृतं कार्यमिति श्रीमान्व्याजहार पितामहः ।।
data.es: Brahma, the glorious Grandfather, saw with his divine eyes, Sita in a desperate state caught by the enemy and said, 'The task is accomplished.
data.anv: श्रीमान् glorious, पितामहः grandfather( Brahma), दीनाम् a desperate woman, सीताम् Sita, परामृष्टाम् assaulted by the enemy, दिव्येन divine, चक्षुषा eyes, दृष्ट्वा saw, कार्यम् the task, कृतम् is accomplished, इति thus, व्याजहार said.
data.md: And the air did not breathe there; and the sun grew dim. Espying with his divine vision that Sītā was overcome, that Deity, the graceful Great-father exclaimed, Our work is accomplished.

data.v: प्रहृष्टा व्यथिताश्चासन्सर्वे ते परमर्षयः । दृष्ट्वा सीतां परामृष्टां दण्डकारण्यवासिनः ।।
data.es: All the great seers residing in Dandaka forest felt both happy and sad, happy because the destruction of Ravana is at hand and sad because Sita was in distress.
data.anv: दण्डकारण्यवासिनः residents of Dandaka forest, सर्वे all, ते those, परमर्षयः great seers, सीताम् Sita, परामृष्टाम्  abducted, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, यदृच्छया that which happened naturally, रावणस्य Ravana's, विनाशं च destruction, प्राप्तम् has come, बुद्ध्वा knowing, प्रहृष्टाः happy, व्यथिताश्च distressed, आसन् became.
data.md: And seeing Sītā overpowered, the supreme saints inhabiting the Dandaka forest, concluding the destruction of Rāvaņa to be as good as accomplished without much ado, became at once delighted and aggrieved.

data.v: स तु तां राम रामेति रुदन्तीं लक्ष्मणेति च । जगामाकाशमादाय रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: While Sita was crying, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana', Ravana, lord of the demons, carried her back into the sky.
data.anv: राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, राम रामेति saying, Rama, O Rama, लक्ष्मणेति च O Lakshmana, रुदन्तीम् crying, ताम् her, आदाय taking her, आकाशम् into the  sky, जगाम went.
data.md: As she went on weeping with ( Rāma, O Lakşmaņa, Rāvana-lord of Rākşasas—taking her, coursed through the sky.

data.v: तप्ताभरणसर्वाङ्गी पीतकौशेयवासनी । रराज राजपुत्री तु विद्युत्सौदामनी यथा ।।
data.es: SIta who had put on pure gold ornaments on her body and who was clad in yellow silk shone like lightning.
data.anv: तप्ताभरणजुष्टाङ्गी lady wearing on her limbs pure gold ornaments, पीतकौशेयवासिनी lady clad in yelow silk, राजपुत्री princess, विद्युत् सौदामिनी यथा like lightning, रराज shone.
data.md: And then the king's daughter hued like molten gold, clad in a yellow silken cloth, looked exceedingly beautiful like to lighting.

data.v: उद्धूतेन च वस्त्रेण तस्याः पीतेन रावणः । अधिकं परिबभ्राज गिरिर्दीप इवाग्निना ।।
data.es: Ravana was shining all the more with(her) yellow clothes blowing in the air, and looked like a mountain shining with fire burning around.
data.anv: तस्याः her, उद्धूतेन blown, पीतेन yellow, वस्त्रेण clothes, रावणः Ravana, अग्निना with fire, दीप्तः glowing, गिरिरिव like a mountain अधिकम् more, परिबभ्राज shone.
data.md: And on her yellow cloth streaming up, Rāvaņa looked surpassingly graceful like a hill aflame with fire.

data.v: तस्याः परमकल्याण्यास्ताम्राणि सुरभीणि च । पद्मपत्राणि वैदेह्या अभ्यकीर्यन्त रावणम् ।।
data.es: The red lotus petals worn by the most auspicious Sita, princess of Videha, were showered on Ravana.
data.anv: परमकल्याण्याः of the most auspicious, तस्याः her, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, ताम्राणि copper  coloured, सुरभीणि fragrant, पद्मपत्राणि lotus petals, रावणम् Ravana, अभ्यकीर्यन्त were showered on him.
data.md: And coppery fragrant lotus-leaves belonging to the eminently auspicious Vaidehī showered upon Ravana.

data.v: तस्याः कौशेयमुद्धूतमाकाशे कनकप्रभम् । बभौ चादित्यरागेण ताम्रमभ्रमिवातपे ।।
data.es: As the goldencoloured garment worn by Sita blew in the wind, it looked like a coppercoloured cloud illumined by the evening Sun in the sky.
data.anv: तस्याः her, आकाशे in the sky, उद्धूतम् blown by the wind, कनकप्रभम् goldenhued, कौशेयम् silken robes, आतपे exposed to the evening Sun , आदित्यरागेण by the Sun's redness, ताम्रम् red, अभ्रमिव cloudlike, बभौ appeared.
data.md: And her gold-glowing silken cloth, flying in the air, appeared like clouds coloured by the sunken sun.

data.v: तस्यास्तद्विमलं वक्त्रमाकाशे रावणाङ्कगम् । न रराज विना रामं विनालमिव पङ्कजम् ।।
data.es: Sita's face with her beautiful nose on Ravana's lap and not on Rama's, shone no more like a lotus without its stalk.
data.anv: आकाशे in the sky, रावणाङ्कगम् in the lap of Ravana, सुनसम् with a beautiful nose, तस्याः वक्त्रम् her face, रामं विना without Rama, विनालम् without stalk, पङ्कजम् इव like lotus, न रराज did not shine.
data.md: And her blameless countenance on Rāvana's lap in the sky did not appear beauteous without Rāma, like a lotus without its stalk;

data.v: बभूव जलदं नीलं भित्त्वा चन्द्र इवोदितः । सुललाटं सुकेशान्तं पद्मगर्भाभमव्रणम् । शुक्लैः सुविमलैर्दन्तैः प्रभावद्भिरलंकृतम् ।।
data.es: Sita's face looked beautiful with her smooth forehead, shining hair and spotless complexion like the inside of a lotus, with clean, white, shining teeth, a nice nose and lovely red lips. She was continuously weeping and wiping her tears. Her face which was pleasing like the Moon on the lap of Ravana appeared as though the Moon was rising through dark clouds.
data.anv: सुललाटम् a fine forehead, सुकेशान्तम् beautiful hair, पद्मगर्भाभम्  the glow of the inner side of a fully blossomed lotus, अव्रणम् whose face had no marks, शुक्लैः white, सुविमलैः  clean, प्रभावद्भि: shining, दन्तैः teeth, अलङ्कृतम् decorated, रुदितम् as she wept, व्यपमृष्टास्रम् wiped her tears, सुनासम् of nice nose, चारुताम्रोष्ठम् with lovely red lips, आकाशे in the sky, हाटकप्रभम् having golden glow, रावणाङ्कगम् held by Ravana, तस्याः her, तत् that, विमलम् pure, वक्त्रम् face, नीलम् dark blue, जलदम् rain cloud, भित्त्वा breaking through, उदितः risen, चन्द्र इव like Moon, बभूव appeared.

data.v: रुदितं व्यपमृष्टास्त्रं चन्द्रवत्प्रियदर्शनम् । सुनासं चारुताम्रौष्ठमाकाषे हाटकप्रभम् ।।
राक्षसेन्द्रसमाधूतं तस्यास्तद्वचनं शुभम् । शुशुभे न विना रामं दिवा चन्द्र इवोदितः ।।
data.es: Shaken up by the demon and deprived of Rama's company, Sita's beautiful face looked like the Moon during daytime without any glow.
data.anv: राक्षसेन by the demon, समाधूतम् being shaken, तस्याः her, शुभम् auspicious, तत् that, वदनम् face, रामं विना without Rama, दिवा by daytime, उदितः arisen, चन्द्रः इव Moon like, न शुशुभे did not glow.

data.v: सा हेमवर्णा नीलाङ्गं मैथिली राक्षसाधिपम् । शुशुभे काञ्चनी काञ्ची नीलं मणिमिवाश्रिता ।।
data.es: Goldencomplexioned Sita, princess of Mithila, held by the darkcoloured king of the demons, shone like a girdle resting on a dark blue sapphire.
data.anv: नीलाङ्गम् dark body, राक्षसाधिपम् lord of the demons, आश्रिता was held, हेमवर्णा golden complexioned, सा मैथिली that Maithili, नीलम् मणिम् sapphire, काञ्चनी golden, काञ्ची इव like a girdle, शुशुभे shone.
data.md: And furnished with the hue of gold, Mithila's daughter beside the dark-bodied lord of the Rākşasas, looked like a golden girth round a sable elephant.

data.v: सा पद्मगौरी हेमाभा रावणं जनकात्मजा । विद्युद्घनमिवाविश्य शुशुभे तप्तभूषणा ।।
data.es: Bright like a golden lotus, adorned with gold ornaments, Sita, the daughter of Janaka, held by Ravana, looked like a streak of lightning shining bright in a dark cloud.
data.anv: पद्मगौरी a lady like a bright lotus, हेमाभा of golden colour, तप्तभूषणा with bright gold ornaments, सा जनकात्मजा  that Janaka's daughter, रावणम् to Ravana, आविश्य clinging, घनम् dark cloud, आविश्य held by, विद्युदिव like lightning, शुशुभे shone bright.
data.md: Janaka's daughter, yellow-hued like lotus, having the lustre of gold-and adorned with shining ornaments, coming in contact with Rāvana, appeared like lightning embosomed among clouds.

data.v: तस्या भूषणघोषेण वैदेह्या राक्षसाधिपः । बभूव विमलो नीलः सघोष इव तोयदः ।।
data.es: The lord of the demons by the side of Sita, princess of Videha with her jingling ornaments looked like the darkblue raincloud with its lightning and thunder.
data.anv: राक्षसाधिपः the lord of the demons, तस्याः वैदेह्याः that Vaidehi's, भूषणघोषेण by the tinkling ornaments, सचपलः along with lightning, सघोषः roaring, नीलः dark blue, तोयदः इव like raincloud, बभौ seemed.
data.md: And in consequence of Vaidehi's ornaments sending sounds, the lord of Rākşasas resembled an entirely dark rumbling cloud.

data.v: उत्तमाङ्गच्युता तस्याः पुष्पवृष्टिः समन्ततः । सीताया ह्रियमाणायाः पपात धरणीतले ।।
data.es: As Sita was being carried away, the shower of flowers dropped from her head and scattered on the earth.
data.anv: ह्रियमाणायाः as she was being carried away, तस्याः सीतायाः that Sita's, उत्तमाङ्गात् from the head, च्युताः dropped, पुष्पवृष्टिः rain of flowers, समन्ततः all over, धरणीतले on the earth, पपात fell down.
data.md: As Sītā was being borne away, showers of blossoms, falling off from her head, were scattered all around on the earth beneath.

data.v: सा तु रावणवेगेन पुष्पवृष्टिः समन्ततः । समाधूता दशग्रीवं पुनरेवाभ्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: The shower of flowers that fell flew towards the tenheaded Ravana again in the swirling motion (of the chariot).
data.anv: समन्ततः all over, सा पुष्पवृष्टिः that shower of flowers, रावणवेगेन by the speed of Ravana, समाधूता swirling together, पुनः again, दशग्रीवमेव on to the tenheaded Ravana only, अभ्यवर्तत went towards.
data.md: And that blossoms shower all around, drawn up by the vehemence of the ten-headed Rāvana, again alighted beside him.

data.v: अभ्यवर्तत पुष्पाणां धारा वैश्रवणानुजम् । नक्षत्रमालाविमला मेरुं नगमिवोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: The shower of flowers that dropped went round towards Ravana, brother of Vaisravana, like the bright garland of stars move towards mount Meru.
data.anv: पुष्पाणाम् of the flowers, धारा flow, विमला clean, नक्षत्रमाला rows of stars, उन्नतम् high, मेरुं नगमिव mount Meru, वैश्रवणानुजम् on the brother of Vaisravana, अभ्यवर्तत went towards.
data.md: And the showers of blossoms scattered around Vaisravana's younger brother, looked like rows of burning stars round the foremost of mountains*. Sumerus

data.v: चरणान्नूपुरं भ्रष्टं वैदेह्या रत्नभूषितम् । विद्युन्मण्डलसंकाशं पपात मधुरस्वनम् ।।
data.es: The gemstudded anklet of Sita, looking like an orb of lightning, dropped with a gentle sound.
data.anv: वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, चरणात् from her feet, भ्रष्टम् dropped, रत्नभूषितम् ornament studded with gems, नूपुरम् anklet, विद्युन्मण्डलसङ्काशम् looking like an orb of lightning, मधुरस्वनम् making gentle sound, पपात fell down.
data.md: And the bangles studded with gems, loosened . from Vaidehi's feet, fell on the earth, like the lighting circle. Instead of On the earth-some texts have [bangles] sweet-sounding.

data.v: तरुप्रवालरक्ता सा नीलाङ्गं राक्षसेश्वरम् । प्राशोभयत वैदेही गजं कष्येव काञ्चनी ।।
data.es: With her golden girdle, Sita whose complexion resembled tender leaves looked like a golden chain to bind an elephant with. (Here Ravana is the elephant).
data.anv: तरुप्रवालरक्ता red like tender leaves, सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, नीलाङ्गम् dark coloured, राक्षसेश्वरम् Ravana, काञ्चनी golden, कक्ष्ये binding chain, गजमिव like an elephant, प्राशोभयत made him glow.
data.md: O hue like the light red of tender twigs, Vaidehi set off the dark-bodied lord of Rākşasas, as does a golden cover an elephant.

data.v: तां महोल्कामिवाकाशे दीप्यमानां स्वतेजसा । जहाराकाशमाविश्य सीतां वैश्रवणानुजः ।।
data.es: The younger brother of Vaisravana (Ravana), like a massive comet, carried Sita, who was glowing in the radiance of her own beauty, and entered the sky.
data.anv: वैश्रवणानुजः brother of Vaisravana, महोल्कामिव  like a massive comet, स्वतेजसा in her natural radiance, आकाशे in the sky, दीप्यमानाम् glowing, तां सीताम् Sita, आकाशम् into the sky, आविश्य having entered, जहार carried.
data.md: Vaisravana's younger brother carried away Sītā, who, like a mighty meteor, filled the heavens with her splendour.

data.v: तस्यास्तान्यग्निवर्णानि भूषणानि महीतले । सघोषाण्यवकीर्यन्त क्षीणास्तारा इवाम्बरात् ।।
data.es: Like the dim stars falling from the sky, her ornaments, bright as flame, scattered on the groundtinkling.
data.anv: तस्याः her, अग्निवर्णानि bright as flame, तानि भूषणानि those ornaments, सघोषाणि tinkling, अम्बरात् from the sky, क्षीणाः dim, ताराः इव like the stars, महीतले on the ground, अवकीर्यन्त  scattered.
data.md: And like stars of exhausted religious merit dropping down from the sky, her fiery ornaments began to fall to the earth with sounds.

data.v: तस्याः स्तनान्तराद्भ्रष्टो हारस्ताराधिपद्युतिः । वैदेह्या निपतन्भाति गङ्गेव गगनाच्च्युता ।।
data.es: Sita's necklace shining like the bright Moon slipped from between her breasts like the river Ganga falling down from the sky.
data.anv: तस्याः वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, स्तनान्तरात् from between the breasts, भ्रष्टः fell down, ताराधिपद्युतिः shining like the Moon, हारः necklace, निपतन् fell, गगनात् from the sky, च्युता dropped, गङ्गेव like river Ganga, भाति seemed.
data.md: And the chain of the splendour of the moon, removed from Vaidehi's breast, falling down, shone like the Gangā dropping from the sky.

data.v: उत्पात वाताभिहता नानाद्विज गणायुताः । मा भैरिति विधूताग्रा व्याजह्रुरिव पादपाः ।।
data.es: The trees filled with birds of all kinds, shaken at the top by stormy winds seemed to be saying to Sita, 'Be not afraid'.
data.anv: उत्पातवाताभिहताः hit by the stormy wind, नानाद्विजगणायुताः filled with different flocks of birds, पादपाः trees, विधूताग्राः 'Be not afraid', मा भैः इति saying, 'Be not afraid', व्याजह्रुः इव as if they said.
data.md: The trees filled with various fowls, with their tops waving because of the wind blowing on high and swaying them, seemed to say, No fear, [to Sita.]

data.v: नलिन्यो ध्वस्तकमलास्त्रस्तमीनजले चराः । सखीमिव गतोत्साहां शोचन्तीव स्म मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: Lotusponds with withering lotuses and with disturbed aquatic life like fishes in fright were as if grieving for Sita as one would grieve for a companion who is unable to breathe.
data.anv: ध्वस्तकमलाः with lotuses withering, त्रस्तमीनजलेचराः with disturbed aquatic animals like fishes, नलिन्यः lotus ponds, गतोच्छ्वासाम्  who lost her power to breathe, सखीमिव like a companion, मैथिलीम् Maithili, अन्वशोचन्त felt sorry for her.
data.md: And the pools with their lotuses faded and their fishes agitated, seemed to sorrow for the desponding daughter of Mithilā as for their friend.

data.v: समन्तादभिसंपत्य सिंहव्याघ्रमृगद्विजाः । अन्वधावंस्तदा रोषात्सीताच्छायानुगामिनः ।।
data.es: Then the lions, tigers, deer and birds gathered together in anger (also anguish) and ran after Sita's shadow.
data.anv: तदा then, सिंहव्याघ्रमृगद्विजाः lions, tigers, deer and birds, समन्तात् अभिसम्पत्य coming together from all sides, रोषात् due to anguish, छायानुगामिनः followers of the shadow, सीताम् Sita, अन्वधावन् ran following her.
data.md: And following Sītā's shadow, lions, and tigers, and other beasts and birds, rushed from all sides in wrath.

data.v: जलप्रपातास्रमुखाः शृङ्गैरुच्छ्रितबाहवः । सीतायां ह्रियमाणायां विक्रोशन्तीव पर्वताः ।।
data.es: The mountains were shedding tears in the form of waterfalls, and crying with hands lifted up in the form of peaks, while Sita was being carried away.
data.anv: सीतायाम् Sita, ह्रियमाणायाम् carried away, पर्वताः mountains, जलप्रपातास्रमुखाः with tears rolling down in the form of waterfalls  शृङ्गैः representing the peaks, उच्छ्रितबाहुभिः lifting the hands high, विक्रोशन्तीव seemed as if they were crying in grief.
data.md: And the mountains, with their faces washed with water-falls representing tears, and their summits resembling uplifted arms, seemed to lament for Sītă, as she was being carried away.

data.v: ह्रियमाणां तु वैदेहीं दृष्ट्वा दीनो दिवाकरः । प्रविध्वस्तप्रभः श्रीमानासीत्पाण्डुरमण्डलः ।।
data.es: Seeing Sita abducted, the glorious Sun looked lustreless and distraught. He developed a pale white disk around him.
data.anv: ह्रियमाणाम् while being hijacked, वैदेहीम् Sita, दृष्ट्वा seeing, श्रीमान् glorious, दिवाकरः Sun, दीनः distressed, प्रतिध्वस्तप्रभः with dimmed lustre, पाण्डुरमण्डलः white disk around, आसीत् had.
data.md: And beholding Vaidehỉ carried away, the glorious Sun, oppressed with sadness, had his rays dimmed and his disc darkened.

data.v: नास्ति धर्मः कुतः सत्यं नार्जवं नानृशंसता । यत्र रामस्य वैदेहीं भार्यां हरति रावणः ।।
data.es: When Rama's consort, the princess of Videha, is being carried away by Ravana, how can there be rightousness or truth or uprightness or compassion for men? Thus bewailed all beings in groups.
data.anv: यत्र where, रामस्य Rama's, भार्या wife, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, हरति is abducting, धर्मः dharma, नास्ति is not there, सत्यम् truth, कुतः where is it , आर्जवम् uprightness, न not, अनृशंसता compassion, न not, इति thus, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि beings, गणशः in groups, पर्यदेवयन्  wailed.
data.md: Virtue is not; and where is truth? And there is neither sincerity nor kindness, in a case in which Rāvana is carrying away Rāma's Vaidehī; thus did all creatures lament in numbers. And the young of deer, afflicted with fear, wept with woe-began faces.

data.v: इति सर्वाणि भूतानि गणशः पर्यदेवयन् । वित्रस्तका दीनमुखा रुरुदुर्मृगपोतकाः ।।
उद्वीक्ष्योद्वीक्ष्य नयनैरास्रपाताविलेक्षणाः । सुप्रवेपितगात्राश्च बभूवुर्वनदेवताः ।।
data.md: And the sylvan deities, looking up now and again with eyes betokening fear, had their persons all in a tremble.

data.v: विक्रोशन्तीं दृढं सीतां दृष्ट्वा दुःखं तथा गताम् । तां तु लक्ष्मण रामेति क्रोशन्तीं मधुरस्वराम् ।।
अवेक्षमाणां बहुषो वैदेहीं धरणीतलम् । स तामाकुलकेशान्तां विप्रमृष्टविशेषकाम् । जहारात्मविनाशाय दशग्रीवो मनस्विनाम् ।।
data.es: The ten headed Ravana abducted Sita who was calling out, O Rama, O Lakshmana with her sweet voice, weeping , looking down on the earth her hair dishevelled and auspicious, (vermilion) mark on the forehead erased. Ravana abducted this highminded Sita for his own destruction.
