data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राम Rama, इति saying so, मधुरस्वरम् in a sweet voice, क्रोशन्तीम् while she was weeping, बहुशः many times, धरणीतलम् down to the ground, अवेक्षमाणाम् looknig at, आकुलकेशान्ताम् hair dishevelled, विप्रमृष्ट विशेषकाम् with the  auspicious mark on the forehead erased, मनस्स्विनीम् highminded woman, तां वैदेहीम् to that Vaidehi, सः दशग्रीवः that tenheaded Ravana, आत्मविनाशाय for his own destruction, जहार abducted.
data.md: headed one carried away the intelligent Vaidehī, bewailing bitterly, Sītā, who had come by such misfortune, sweet-voiced, crying, O Lakşmaņa O Rāma, and casting glances on the ground many time and oft, the ends of her hair waving and her tilika wiped out.

data.v: ततस्तु सा चारुदती शुचिस्मिता; विनाकृता बन्धुजनेन मैथिली । अपश्यती राघवलक्ष्मणावुभौ; विवर्णवक्त्रा भयभारपीडिता ।।
data.es: Then Sita whose teeth were beautiful and smile, sweet was distanced from her kins, and, unable to see both Rama and Lakshmana, grew pale in intense fear.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, चारुदती of beautiful teeth, शुचिस्मिला a lady gifted with a sweet smile, बन्धुजनेन विनाकृता  distanced from her relatives, मैथिली Maithili, राघवलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, अपश्यती unable to see, विवर्णवक्त्रा face grew pale, भयभारपीडिता with the stress of fear.
data.md: Then oppressed with the load of fear, Sītā of luminous smiles, Mithila's daughter, bereft of her friends-not beholding either Rāma or Lakşmaņa, became pale of countenance.

data.v: खमुत्पतन्तं तं दृष्ट्वा मैथिली जनकात्मजा । दुःखिता परमोद्विग्ना भये महति वर्तिनी ।।
data.es: Sita, daughter of Janaka, princess of Mithila felt miserable, looking at Ravana taking off and got very much agitated out of fear.
data.anv: जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली Maithili, खम् into the sky, उत्पतन्तम् while flying, तम् Ravana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, परमोद्विग्ना agitated greatly, महति intense, भये fear, वर्तिनी became, दुःखिता miserable.
data.md: Seeing him fly up into the air, Janaka's daughter, Maithili, became aggrieved and exceedingly agitated, and great was the fear that possessed her.

data.v: रोषरोदनताम्राक्षी भीमाक्षं राक्षसाधिपम् । रुदती करुणं सीता ह्रियमाणेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While being carried away, Sita wept piteously and her eyes went red with tears of anger and grief. Looking at the frightening eyes of the king of the demons, she said these words :
data.anv: ह्रियमाणा while being carried away, सीता Sita, करुणम् piteously, रुदन्ती weeping, रोषरोदनताम्राक्षी eyes reddened due to crying out of anger and grief, भीमाक्षम् with frightening  eyes, राक्षसाधिपम् to Ravana, the lord of demons, इदम् these (words), अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Her eyes expressing rage, weeping and fright, Sītā, as she was being carried away, weeping piteously, spoke to the grim-eyed lord of the Raksasas.

data.v: न व्यपत्रपसे नीच कर्मणानेन रावण । ज्ञात्वा विरहितां यो मां चोरयित्वा पलायसे ।।
data.es: O mean Ravana, are you not ashamed of kidnapping me when I was separated (from my husband)?
data.anv: नीच O mean, रावण Ravana, विरहिताम् when I am separated, माम् me, चोरयित्वा having  stolen, पलायसे  run away, इति यत् like this, अनेन by this, कर्मणा by action, न व्यपत्रपसे are you not ashamed?
data.md: Do you not, O base wretch, O Ravana, feel shame on account of this act-you, who, knowing that I was alone fly away, carrying me?

data.v: त्वयैव नूनं दुष्टात्मन्भीरुणा हर्तुमिच्छता । ममापवाहितो भर्ता मृगरूपेण मायया । यो हि मामुद्यतस्त्रातुं सोऽप्ययं विनिपातितः ।।
data.es: O wicked fellow, with an intention to abduct me you enticed my husband to a distance deceitfully in the form of a deer.
data.anv: दुष्टात्मन् O wicked fellow, हर्तुम् to abduct, इच्छता desiring, भीरुणा by a timid one, त्वयैव  yourself, मम my, भर्ता husband, मायया with deceit, मृगरूपेण in the form of deer, अपवाहितः led to a distance.
data.md: Coward that you are, you it was, who, desirous of carrying me off, by the shape of a deer, had, by your (powers of] illusion taken away my lord.

data.v: परमं खलु ते वीर्यं दृश्यते राक्षसाधम । विश्राव्य नामधेयं हि युद्धे नास्ति जिता त्वया ।।
data.es: O lowly demon, you have, indeed, shown your heroism (in killing this old vulture). You have not won me in a battle declared by you.
data.anv: राक्षसाधमः O lowly demon, ते विर्यम्  bravery, परमम् very great, दृश्यते खलु is seen indeed, नामधेयम् your name, विश्राव्य after announcing, त्वया by your, युद्धे war, जिता won, नास्मि हि I am not.
data.md: Great, forsooth, is found to be your might, you vilest of Rākşasas, in that you have carried me off; by simply declaring your name, but have not won me in war. Why do you not, O execrable one, take shame to yourself, having perpetrated such a heinous act-having carried off another's wife in the absence of her husband?

data.v: ईदृशं गर्हितं कर्म कथं कृत्वा न लज्जसे । स्त्रियाश्च हरणं नीच रहिते च परस्य च ।।
data.es: O lowly fellow how is it that you are not ashamed of commiting such a despicable act abducting another's wife when she is alone ?
data.anv: नीच O lowly fellow, रहिते when alone, परस्य च other's, स्त्रियाः woman's, हरणम् abduction, ईदृशम् this way, गर्हितम् despised, कर्म deed, कृत्वा after doing, कथम् how is it, न लज्जसे  are you not ashamed
data.md: Great, forsooth, is found to be your might, you vilest of Rākşasas, in that you have carried me off; by simply declaring your name, but have not won me in war. Why do you not, O execrable one, take shame to yourself, having perpetrated such a heinous act-having carried off another's wife in the absence of her husband?

data.v: कथयिष्यन्ति लोकेषु पुरुषाः कर्म कुत्सितम् । सुनृशंसमधर्मिष्ठं तव शौण्डीर्यमानिनः ।।
data.es: You consider yourself to be brave after committing such a cruel, despicable and unrighteous act for which people of the world will condemn you.
data.anv: शौण्डीर्यमानिनः considering yourself to be brave, तव yourself, सुनृशंसम् this very cruel act, अधर्मिष्ठम् unrighteous, कुत्सितम् despised by others, कर्म action, लोकेषु in the worlds, पुरुषाः people, कथयिष्यन्ति will talk about.
data.md: This fell and foul ict of yours fraught with unrighteousness, heroic persons shall bruit about the world.

data.v: धिक्ते शौर्यं च सत्त्वं च यत्त्वया कथितं तदा । कुलाक्रोशकरं लोके धिक्ते चारित्रमीदृशम् ।।
data.es: Fie upon your heroism and strength about which you boasted. Fie upon your character that would bring calumny to the race and the world. I condemn such behaviour of yours.
data.anv: strength, धिक् fie, लोके in the world, कुलाक्रोशकरम् that which would bring calumny to the family, ते to you, ईदृशम् such, चारित्रम् behaviour, धिक् I condemn.
data.md: Fie on your heroism and your truth, of which you did speak at that time; and fie also on this character of yours, calculated to sully your line in this world.

data.v: किं शक्यं कर्तुमेवं हि यज्जवेनैव धावसि । मुहूर्तमपि तिष्ठस्व न जीवन्प्रतियास्यसि ।।
data.es: Tarry a little, you will not go back with life. What can be done now since you are running away so swiftly?
data.anv: किम् what, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् is possible, यत् since, एवम् in this way, जवेनैव  so swiftly, धावसि you are running, मुहूर्तमपि for a moment also, तिष्ठस्व you stay, जीवन् with life, न प्रतियास्यसि you will not.
data.md: What can I do (to you), as you proceed with speed? But stay you for a moment; and you shall not return with life.

data.v: न हि चक्षुःपथं प्राप्य तयोः पार्थिवपुत्रयोः । ससैन्योऽपि समर्तःस्त्वं मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम् ।।
data.es: If you come within sight of these two princes, it will not be possible for you to live for a moment even if you are with your entire army.
data.anv: तयोः of both of them, पार्थिवपुत्रयोः of the two princes, चक्षुष्पथम् within the range of their sight, प्राप्य on reaching, त्वम् you, ससैन्योऽपि even with your army, मुहूर्तमपि for a moment, जीवितुम् to live, न समर्थः हि not possible.
data.md: Should you come within the range of the vision of those sons of the king, you could not, although you should happen to be accompanied with your army, live for a moment.

data.v: न त्वं तयोः शरस्पर्शं सोढुं शक्तः कथंचन । वने प्रज्वलितस्येव स्पर्शमग्नेर्विहंगमः ।।
data.es: Just as a bird cannot bear the touch of forest fire, you will not be able to endure the mere touch of arrows of the two heroes indeed.
data.anv: वने in the forest, प्रज्वलितस्य of burning, अग्नेः fire, स्पर्शम् touch, विहङ्गमः इव like bird, त्वम् you, तयोः of both of them, शरस्पर्शम् touch of arrows, सोढुम् to endure, कथञ्चन anyhow, न शक्तः it is not possible for you.
data.md: Even as a bird cannot bear the touch of a flaming fire in a forest, you can never bear the touch of their arrows. Effecting your own welfare, do you, O Ravana, leave me.

data.v: साधु कृत्वात्मनः पथ्यं साधु मां मुञ्च रावण । मत्प्रधर्षणरुष्टो हि भ्रात्रा सह पतिर्मम । विधास्यति विनाशाय त्वं मां यदि न मुञ्चसि ।।
data.es: O Ravana be good and do whatever is beneficial to you. It is proper for you to release me. If you do not, enraged over my assault, my husband along with his brother, will bring about your destruction.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, साधु it is only proper, आत्मनः your, पथ्यम् good for your wellbeing, कुरु you may do, माम् me, साधु be good, मुञ्च you may release, त्वम् you, माम् me, न मुञ्चसि you do not leave, यदि what, मत्प्रधर्षणरुष्टः enraged for the assaulting me, मम पतिः my husband, भ्रात्रा सह along with his brother, विनाशाय for destruction, विधास्यति he will arrange.

data.v: येन त्वं व्यवसायेन बलान्मां हर्तुमिच्छसि । व्यवसायः स ते नीच भविष्यति निरर्थकः ।।
data.es: O vile creature, the effort you are making to abduct me forcibly will be fruitless.
data.anv: नीच O mean fellow, त्वम् you, येन by which, व्यवसायेन  effort, माम् me, बलात् by force, हर्तुम् to abduct, इच्छसि desire, ते your, सः that, व्यवसायः determination, निरर्थकः fruitless, भविष्यति will become.

data.v: न ह्यहं तमपश्यन्ती भर्तारं विबुधोपमम् । उत्सहे शत्रुवशगा प्राणान्धारयितुं चिरम् ।।
data.es: I will not be eager to hold on to my life for long to live at the mercy of the enemy without being able to see my godlike husband.
data.anv: अहम् I am, विबुधोपमम् godlike, भर्तारम् husband, तम् him, अपश्यन्ती without seeing him, शत्रुवशगा at the mercy of an enemy, चिरम् long, प्राणान् life, धरयितुम् to hold on, न उत्सहे हि I am not enthused.
data.md: Not beholding my lord resembling a celestial, I cannot, come under the sway of my enemy, bear to live long.

data.v: न नूनं चात्मनः श्रेयः पथ्यं वा समवेक्षसे । मृत्युकाले यथा मर्त्यो विपरीतानि सेवते ।।
data.es: At the time of death, mortals behave very differently. They act contrary to their own welfare. Likewise you are not able to foresee what is beneficial and good for you.
data.anv: मर्त्य: a mortal, मृत्युकाले at the time of death, यथा as, विपरीतानि very differently, सेवते he will resort to, आत्मनः your own, पथ्यम् whatever is beneficial to you, श्रेयो वा your welfare, न समवेक्षसे you are not able to foresee.
data.md: As one dwelling on earth perceives objects in their reversed relations at the time of one's death SO you do not perceive what is for your good or profit. Those moribund do not relish what would do them good.

data.v: मुमूर्षूणां हि सर्वेषां यत्पथ्यं तन्न रोचते । पश्यामीव हि कण्ठे त्वां कालपाशावपाशितम् ।।
data.es: Those who wish to die, do not like anything salutary. I see the noose of death wound round your neck now.
data.anv: मुमूर्षूणाम्  who want to die, सर्वेषाम्  all of them, यत् what, पथ्यम् is salutary, तत् that, न रोचते not like, अद्य now, त्वाम् you, कण्ठे in your neck, कालपाशावपाशितम् noose of death wound round, पश्यामि हि I see.

data.v: यथा चास्मिन्भयस्थाने न बिभेषे दशानन । व्यक्तं हिरण्मयान्हि त्वं संपश्यसि महीरुहान् ।।
data.es: O tenheaded Ravana, since you do not fear the source of fear, evidently you see golden trees. (a symptom of death).
data.anv: दशानन tenheaded Ravana, त्वम् you, अस्मिन् in this, भयस्थाने cause of fear, यथा even so, न बिभेषि you are not scared, हिरण्मयान् golden, महीरुहान् trees, सम्पश्यसि you see, व्यक्तम्  evident.

data.v: नदीं वैरतणीं घोरां रुधिरौघनिवाहिनीम् । खड्गपत्रवनं चैव भीमं पश्यसि रावण ।।
data.es: O Ravana, you see the dreadful river Vaitarani with torrents of blood flowing and frightening forest of trees with swords as leaves.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, रुधिरौघनिवाहिनीम् river carrying torrents of blood flowing, घोराम् dreadful, वैतरणीं नदीम् river Vaitarani, भीमम् frightening, असिपत्रवनं चैव forest of trees with swords as leaves, पश्यसि see.

data.v: तप्तकाञ्चनपुष्पां च वैदूर्यप्रवरच्छदाम् । द्रक्ष्यसे शाल्मलीं तीक्ष्णामायसैः कण्टकैश्चिताम् ।।
data.es: You will see a log of salmali tree with bright golden flowers and excellent vaidurya stone with pointed iron thorns.
data.anv: तप्ककाञ्चनपुष्पाम् with bright golden flowers, वैडूर्यप्रवरच्छदाम् with barks of excellent Vaidurya stones like bark, आयसैः with iron, कण्टकैः thorns, चिताम् logged, तीक्ष्णाम् sharp, शाल्मलीम् salmali (silkcotton) tree, द्रक्ष्यसे you see.

data.v: न हि त्वमीदृशं कृत्वा तस्यालीकं महात्मनः । धारितुं शक्ष्यसि चिरं विषं पीत्वेव निर्घृणः ।।
data.es: You are pitiless. You will not be able to survive for long after deceiving such noble Rama just as man cannot survive after drinking poison.
data.anv: निर्घृणः pitiless, त्वम् you, महात्मनः of the noble, तस्य his, ईदृशम् such, अलीकम् deceiving, कृत्वा after doing, विषम् poison, पीत्वेव as if after drinking, चिरम् for long, धरितुम् to survive, न शक्ष्यसि not possible.
data.md: But, O shameless one, like a person that has drunk poison, having done this wrong to that high-souled one, you with not be able to save yourself. O Rāvana, you are fast fettered in the noose of Death.

data.v: बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन दुर्निवारेण रावण । क्व गतो लप्स्यसे शर्म भर्तुर्मम महात्मनः ।।
data.es: O Ravana you are bound by the inevitable noose of death. Where shall you get away from great Rama, my husband to obtain peace.
data.anv: रावण Ravana, त्वम् you, दुर्निवारेण by the inevitable, कालपाशेन noose of death, बद्धः bound, मम my, भर्तुः husband's, महात्मनः great Rama, क्व where can you, गतः go, शर्म peace, लप्स्यसे will you get.

data.v: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण विना भ्रातरमाहवे । राक्षसा निहता येन सहस्राणि चतुर्दश ।।
data.es: Rama has killed fourteen thousand demons alone without his brother within a moment. He is a strong warrior and wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons. You have stolen his loving wife. How can he live without killing you.
data.anv: येन by whom, महावने in this great forest, भ्रात्रा विना without the help of his brother, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a short while, चतुर्दश सहस्राणि fourteen thousand, राक्षसाः demons, निहताः were killed, वीरः warrior, सर्वास्त्रकुशली wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons, बली strong man, सः that, राघवः Rama, इष्टभार्यापहारिणम्  who has stolen his beloved wife, त्वाम् you, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, कथम् how, न हन्यात् will he not kill?
data.md: Having done this foul turn to that high-souled one, repairing whither, shall you obtain respite? Shall not that strong and heroic Rāghava, skilled in all weapons, who without his brother, in the twinkling of an eye, in battle slew fourteen thousand Rākṣasas, slay you, who carries away his beloved wife?

data.v: स कथं राघवो वीरः सर्वास्त्रकुशलो बली । न त्वां हन्याच्छरैस्तीक्ष्णैरिष्टभार्यापहारिणम् ।।
data.es: Rama has killed fourteen thousand demons alone without his brother within a moment. He is a strong warrior and wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons. You have stolen his loving wife. How can he live without killing you.
data.anv: येन by whom, महावने in this great forest, भ्रात्रा विना without the help of his brother, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a short while, चतुर्दश सहस्राणि fourteen thousand, राक्षसाः demons, निहताः were killed, वीरः warrior, सर्वास्त्रकुशली wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons, बली strong man, सः that, राघवः Rama, इष्टभार्यापहारिणम्  who has stolen his beloved wife, त्वाम् you, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, कथम् how, न हन्यात् will he not kill?

data.v: एतच्चान्यच्च परुषं वैदेही रावणाङ्कगा । भयशोकसमाविष्टा करुणं विललाप ह ।।
data.es: Sita, daughter of Videha, full of sorrow and fear under Ravana's grip uttered these partly harsh and partly piteous wordsweeping.
data.anv: रावणाङ्कगा a lady under Ravana's grip, वैदेही Vaidehi (Sita), भयशोकसमाविष्टा full of fear and sorrow, एतत् च these words, अन्यच्च and other words, परुषम् harsh, करुणम् piteously,  विललाप ह wept.
data.md: Thus and in other ways, Videha's daughter, lying on the lap of Rāvana, overwhelmed with fear and grief, indulged in piteous lamentations.

data.v: तथा भृशार्तां बहु चैव भाषिणीं; विललाप पूर्वं करुणं च भामिनीम् । जहार पापस्तरुणीं विवेष्टतीं; नृपात्मजामागतगात्रवेपथुम् ।।
data.es: Sinful Ravana carried away the beautiful princess trembling with great fear, struggling helplessly, crying pathetically and pleading in many mournful ways.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तथा likewise, भृशार्ताम् greatly terrified, विलापपूर्वम् weeping, करुणं च piteously, बहुचैव in many ways, भाषिणीम्  talking, करुणम् mournfully, विचेष्टतीम् struggling, नृपात्मजाम् princess, आगतगात्रवेपथुम्  whose  body started shivering, भामिनीम् to the beautiful lady, पापः sinner Ravana, जहार carried off.
data.md: And the wicked (Rävaņa) with a shaking frame carried away the daughter of the king extremely distressed, speaking much, and speaking piteously, uttering lamentations, and putting forth endeavours (to free herself.) saw

data.v: ह्रियमाणा तु वैदेही कंचिन्नाथमपश्यती । ददर्श गिरिशृङ्गस्थान्पञ्चवानरपुंगवान् ।।
data.es: While Sita was being kidnapped, she saw no one to protect her. Only five great monkeys stood on the top of a mountain.
data.anv: ह्रियमाणा taken away, वैदेही Vaidehi, नाथम् protector, कञ्चित् some one, अपश्यती not seeing, गिरिशृङ्गस्थान् standing on the peak of the mountain, पञ्च five, वानरपुङ्गवान् great monkeys, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Carried away (by Ravana), Vaidehi, not finding any defender, five principal monkeys stationed on the top of a hill.

data.v: तेषां मध्ये विशालाक्षी कौशेयं कनकप्रभम् । उत्तरीयं वरारोहा शुभान्याभरणानि च । मुमोच यदि रामाय शंसेयुरिति मैथिली ।।
data.es: Largeeyed, bright and beautiful Sita dropped her upper silk garment shining like gold and auspicious ornaments in their midst with a hope they may report this to Rama.
data.anv: विशालाक्षी large eyed, वरारोहा charming, भामिनी effulgent, कनकप्रभम् shining like gold, कौशेयम् silk, उत्तरीयम् upper cloth, शुभानि auspicious, आभरणानि च ornaments also, रामाय for Rama, यदि if at all, शंसेयुः they may tell, इति thus, तेषाम् them, मध्ये between, मुमोच dropped.
data.md: Thereat, that lady of expansive eyes and surpassing charms, in the hope that they might convey the intelligence to Rāma, flung off in their midst her gold-gleaming silken sheet, and elegant ornaments.

data.v: वस्त्रमुत्सृज्य तन्मध्ये विनिक्षिप्तं सभूषणम् । संभ्रमात्तु दशग्रीवस्तत्कर्म न च बुद्धिवान् ।।
data.es: In his excitement Ravana failed to notice when Sita dropped down that garment along with ornaments in their midst.
data.anv: सहभूषणम् along with ornaments, वस्त्रम् clothes, उत्सृज्य discarding, तन्मध्ये in their midst, निक्षिप्तम् thrown down, सः दशग्रीवः that tenheaded Ravana, सम्भ्रमात् due to excitement, तत्  that, कर्म action of Sita, न बुद्धवान् did not know.

data.v: पिङ्गाक्षास्तां विशालाक्षीं नेत्रैरनिमिषैरिव । विक्रोशन्तीं तदा सीतां ददृशुर्वानरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: The best among the tawneyeyed monkeys gazed, without blinking, at the largeeyed Sita lamenting.
data.anv: पिङ्गाक्षाः tawney eyed, वानरर्षभाः best among monkeys, विशालाक्षीम् largeeyed, तथा like that, विक्रोशन्तीम् lamenting, तां सीताम् that Sita, अनिमिषैरिव without blinking, नेत्रैः eyes, ददृशुः gazed at.
data.md: But the Ten headed one owing to hurry did not observe the throwing of the cloth along with the ornaments. Those foremost of monkeys having tawny eyes observes with winkless eyes the large-eyed Sītā as she was giving way to grief.

data.v: स च पम्पामतिक्रम्य लङ्कामभिमुखः पुरीम् । जगाम रुदतीं गृह्य मैथिलीं राक्षसेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Ravana crossed the lake Pampa and flew towards the city of Lanka carrying with him lamenting daughter of Videha.
data.anv: सः राक्षसेश्वरः that lord of the demons, पम्पाम् Pampa, अतिक्रम्य on crossing, लङ्कां पुरीम् to the city of Lanka, अभिमुखः towards, रुदतीम् crying, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, गृह्य taking, जगाम went.
data.md: The lord of Rākşasas, passing beyond Pampā, directed his course towards the city of Lankā, taking Mithilā's daughter along with him, indulging lamentations.

data.v: तां जहार सुसंहृष्टो रावणो मृत्युमात्मनः । उत्सङ्गेनैव भुजगीं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रां महाविषाम् ।।
data.es: Delighted Ravana, carried off Sita, the very embodiment of his death, like one carrying a highly poisonous sharpfanged female snake on his lap.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, सुसंहृष्टः delighted, आत्मनः his own, मृत्युम् death, ताम् her, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्राम् sharp fanged, महाविषाम् highly poisonous, भुजगीम् female snake, उत्सङ्गेनेव on his lap, जहार  carried.
data.md: Experiencing the height of delight, Rāvana ravished her, taking her on his lap like a sharp-toothed serpent of virulent poison.

data.v: वनानि सरितः शैलान्सरांसि च विहायसा । स क्षिप्रं समतीयाय शरश्चापादिव च्युतः ।।
data.es: Like an arrow released from the bow, Ravana went through the sky, at once crossing forests, rivers mountains and tanks.
data.anv: सः he, चापात् from the bow, च्युतः released, शरः इव like an arrow, क्षिप्रम् at once, वनानि forests, सरितः rivers, शैलान् mountains, सरांसि च tanks, विहायसा through the sky, समतीयाय crossed.
data.md: And speedily, like an arrow shot from a bow, he, coursing the welkin, left behind woods and streams and mountains and pieces of water.

data.v: तिमिनक्रनिकेतं तु वरुणालयमक्षयम् । सरितां शरणं गत्वा समतीयाय सागरम् ।।
data.es: Ravana soon crossed the refuge of rivers, the abode of Varuna, god of the sea, inexhaustible ocean, and the home for whales and crocodiles.
data.anv: तिमिनक्रनिकेतम् the abode of whales and crocodiles, अक्षयम् inexhaustible,सरितां शरणम् refuge of all rivers, वरुणालयम् abode Varuna, god of the sea, गत्वा having covered, सागरम् ocean, समतीयाय crossed.
data.md: Coming to the abode of Varuņa, that refuge of rivers, the exhaustless ocean—the home of whales and alligators, he crossed over it.

data.v: संभ्रमात्परिवृत्तोर्मी रुद्धमीनमहोरगः । वैदेह्यां ह्रियमाणायां बभूव वरुणालयः ।।
data.es: While Sita, princess of Videha was being carried away, the ocean, abode of Varuna got bewildered, waves rolled back, the movement of big serpents and fishes stopped.
data.anv: वैदेह्याम् to Sita, daughter of Videha, ह्रियमाणायाम्  was being carried away, वरुणालयः the abode of Varuna, the ocean, सम्भ्रमात् out of bewilderment, परिवृत्तोर्मिः waves turned back, रुद्धमीनमहोरगः movement of big serpents and fishes stopped, बभूव became.
data.md: In consequence of the carrying away of Vaidehi, Varuna's abode, from grief, had all its waves stilled and its fishes and mighty snakes inert.

data.v: अन्तरिक्षगता वाचः ससृजुश्चारणास्तदा । एतदन्तो दशग्रीव इति सिद्धास्तदाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: The charanas and siddhas moving in the sky said, O tenheaded Ravana this is your end .
data.anv: तदा then, अन्तरिक्षगताः flying in the sky, चारणाः bards, दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, एतदन्तः  इति this is the end, वाचः words, ससृजुः spoke, तदा then, सिद्धाः siddhas, अब्रुवन् uttered.
data.md: And the Cāranas uttered in the heavens these words, O Ten-headed one, this is your end. Thus did the Siddhas then say.

data.v: स तु सीतां विवेष्टन्तीमङ्केनादाय रावणः । प्रविवेश पुरीं लङ्कां रूपिणीं मृत्युमात्मनः ।।
data.es: Ravana entered the city of Lanka holding Sita who was tossing from side to side and who was the very embodiment of his death.
data.anv: सः रावणः that Ravana, आत्मनः his own, रूपिणीम् personified form, मृत्युम् death, विवेष्टन्तीम् struggling, सीताम् Sita, अङ्केन by his arm, आदाय holding her, लङ्कां पुरीम्  city of Lanka, प्रविवेश entered.
data.md: And taking Sītā on his lap, representing his own Death, who endeavoured (to liberate herself). Rāvana entered the city of Lankā.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य पुरीं लङ्कां सुविभक्तमहापथाम् । संरूढकक्ष्या बहुलं स्वमन्तःपुरमाविशत् ।।
data.es: Ravana went through the well laidout roads of the city of Lanka and through the well many guarded halls of the palace and entered the inner apartment.
data.anv: सः Ravana, सुविभक्तमहापथाम्  well laidout roads, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, अभिगम्य entering, संरूढकक्ष्याबहुलम् with many wellguarded halls, स्वम् his, अन्तःपुरम् inner apartment, आविशत् entered.
data.md: And entering the city of Lankā, vast, with all its highways well-arranged, and with people thronging its gates, he entered his own inner apartment.

data.v: तत्र तामसितापाङ्गीं शोकमोहपरायणाम् । निदधे रावणः सीतां मयो मायामिवासुरीम् ।।
data.es: Sita, with her dark eye lashes and lost in utter sorrow was kept in the harem by Ravana, like demon Maya kept Mayamayi.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, असितापाङ्गाम् a lady of dark eyelashes, शोकमोहपरायणाम् lady lost in sorrow, तां सीताम् that Sita, मयः demon Maya, मायामिव like Maya, तत्र there ( in the harem), नदधे kept.
data.md: Then Rāvana set Sītā there, having eyes with dark outer corners, exercised with grief and dole; as if Máyā had set his own Asura Illusion (in his own palace).

data.v: अब्रवीच्च दशग्रीवः पिशाचीर्घोरदर्शनाः । यथा नैनां पुमान्स्त्री वा सीतां पश्यत्यसंमतः ।।
data.es: Ravana ordered the female goblins of fearful appearance,'Let no outsider whether man or woman, see her, without my permission'.
data.anv: दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, घोरदर्शनाः  of fearful appearance, पिशाचीः female goblins, अब्रवीत् च said, असम्मतः without my permission, पुमान् man, स्त्री वा or a woman, इमाम् this lady, सीताम् Sita, यथा in a way, न पश्यति will not see.
data.md: Then the Ten-headed one spoke to some female friends of terrible visages, Let no man or woman behold Sītā without my permission.

data.v: मुक्तामणिसुवर्णानि वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च । यद्यदिच्छेत्तदेवास्या देयं मच्छन्दतो यथा ।।
data.es: Pearls, gems or gold, clothes or ornaments, whatever she desires, be made available to her without any hesitation.
data.anv: मुक्तामणिसुवर्णानि pearls, gems or gold, वस्त्राणि clothes, आभरणानि च and ornaments, यत् यत् whatever, इच्छेत् she desires, तदेव all that, अस्याः to her, मच्छन्दतो यथा  without hesitation, देयम् should be given.
data.md: And I command that, should she ask for pearls, or rubies, or gold, or apparel, or ornaments, the same should be rendered to her.

data.v: या च वक्ष्यति वैदेहीं वचनं किंचिदप्रियम् । अज्ञानाद्यदि वा ज्ञानान्न तस्या जीवितं प्रियम् ।।
data.es: Whoever utters any unpleasant words knowingly or unknowingly to Sita, princess of Videha is not worthy to survive (must be killed).
data.anv: या च whosoever, अज्ञानात् out of ignorance, ज्ञानात् knowingly, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, किञ्चित् even a little, अप्रियम् displeasing, वचनम् words, वक्ष्यति utters, तस्याः her, जीवितम् life, न not, प्रियम्  worthy,
data.md: She that, whether knowingly or unknowingly should say anything unpleasant to Vaidehī, would hold her life cheap.

data.v: तथोक्त्वा राक्षसीस्तास्तु राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान् । निष्क्रम्यान्तःपुरात्तस्मात्किं कृत्यमिति चिन्तयन् । ददर्शाष्टौ महावीर्यान्राक्षसान्पिशिताशनान् ।।
data.es: The courageous lord of the demons, having said so to the demonesses, came out of the inner apartment. While contemplating the future course of action, he saw eight powerful, carnivorous demons.
data.anv: प्रतापवान्  courageous, राक्षसेन्द्रः lord of demons (Ravana), राक्षसीः demoness, तथा likewise, उक्त्वा having said so, तस्मात् from that, अन्तःपुरात् from the inner apartments, निष्क्रम्य  coming out, किम् what, कृत्यम् can be done, चिन्तयन् while thinking, महावीर्यान् most powerful ones, पिशिताशनान् flesheaters, अष्टौ eight, राक्षसान् demons, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Heaving said this to the Rākşasis, the puissant lord of the Rākṣasas, went out of the inner apartment, and thought within himself as to what was to be done (next). And he saw eight flesheating Rākşasas of wondrous prowess.

data.v: स तान्दृष्ट्वा महावीर्यो वरदानेन मोहितः । उवाचैतानिदं वाक्यं प्रशस्य बलवीर्यतः ।।
data.es: The mighty Ravana, deluded by the boons, praised the strength and valour of the demons and said :
data.anv: तान्दृष्ट्वा seeing them, महावीर्यः mighty, वरदानेन by the boons, मोहितः  a deluded one, सः he, बलवीर्यतः about their strength, प्रशस्य after praising them, एतान् them, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, उवाच said.
data.md: And seeing them, the exceedingly powerful. (Ravana), blinded by the bestowal of the boon, after extolling their strength and heroism, addressed them.

data.v: नानाप्रहरणाः क्षिप्रमितो गच्छत सत्वराः । जनस्थानं हतस्थानं भूतपूर्वं खरालयम् ।।
data.es: Armed with different weapons, proceed at once to Janasthana where Khara lived and died.
data.anv: नानाप्रहरणाः a variety of weapons, सत्वराः very quickly, इतः from here, क्षिप्रम् at once, हतस्थानम्  where he was slain, खरालयम् the abode of Khara, भूतपूर्वम् the earlier (dwelling), जनस्थानम् Janasthana, गच्छत you may go.
data.md: Equipped with various weapons, do you speedily take yourself to Janasthāna-that field of carnage-which ere this contained the abode of Khara; and casting off fear at a distance, do you sojourn in vacant Janasthāna with all its Raksasas slain (by Rama).

data.v: तत्रोष्यतां जनस्थाने शून्ये निहतराक्षसे । पौरुषं बलमाश्रित्य त्रासमुत्सृज्य दूरतः ।।
data.es: Go and there in the desolate Janasthana where all demons had been killed, leaving all your apprehensions and relying on your strength and vigour.
data.anv: पौरुषम् prowess, बलम् vigour, आश्रित्य relying on, त्रासम् fear, दूरतः leaving, उत्सृज्य given up, निहतराक्षसे where all demons were killed, शून्ये desolate, तत्र there, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, उष्यताम् dwell there.
data.md: Equipped with various weapons, do you speedily take yourself to Janasthāna-that field of carnage-which ere this contained the abode of Khara; and casting off fear at a distance, do you sojourn in vacant Janasthāna with all its Raksasas slain (by Rama).

data.v: बलं हि सुमहद्यन्मे जनस्थाने निवेशितम् । सदूषणखरं युद्धे हतं तद्रामसायकैः ।।
data.es: I had stationed a great army at Janasthana, who were all killed along with Khara and Dusana by Rama's arrows.
data.anv: मे mine, सुमहत् very great, यत् since, बलम् army, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, निवेशितम् had stationed, सदूषणखरम् with Dusana and Khara, रामेण by Rama, सायकैः arrows, हतम् killed.
data.md: A great many troops endued with exceeding prowess, who had been posted in Janasthāna, have, along with Düşana and Khara, been slain by the shafts of Rāma.

data.v: ततः क्रोधो ममापूर्वो धैर्यस्योपरि वर्धते । वैरं च सुमहज्जातं रामं प्रति सुदारुणम् ।।
data.es: My anger engineered by my intolerance has crossed the limits of my patience. It has created in me a terrific enmity against Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, मम my, अमर्षात् due to that intolerance, क्रोधः wrath, धैर्यस्य one's patience, उपरि over and above, वर्तते is arising, रामं प्रति towards Rama, सुमहत् very great, सुदारुणम् terrific, वैरं च enmity, जातम् is created.
data.md: Hence unprecedented is my wrath, towering above my patience; and great and fierce also is the hostility I have conceived against Rāma.

data.v: निर्यातयितुमिच्छामि तच्च वैरमहं रिपोः । न हि लप्स्याम्यहं निद्रामहत्वा संयुगे रिपुम् ।।
data.es: I want to take revenge on my foe. I shall not sleep until I kill him in a combat.
data.anv: अहम् I am, रिपोः enemy, तत् that, निर्यातयितुम् avenge, इच्छामि I am desirous, संयुगे in combat, रिपुम् enemy, अहत्वा without slaying, अहम् I, निद्राम् sleep, न लप्स्यामि हि I am not getting.
data.md: I wish to avenge myself on my mighty enemy. Sleep find I none without slaying my foe in fight. Slaying that slayer of Khara and Dūşaņa, Rāma, I shall attain delight like to that attained by a pauper on gaining riches.

data.v: तं त्विदानीमहं हत्वा खरदूषणघातिनम् । रामं शर्मोपलप्स्यामि धनं लब्ध्वेव निर्धनः ।।
data.es: I will be happy only after killing the destroyer of Khara and Dusana, just as a poor man feels happy only on acquiring wealth.
data.anv: अहम् I am, इदानीम् now, खरदूषणघातिनम् the killer of Khara and Dusana, तम् him, रामम् Rama, हत्वा after slaying, निर्धनः one without wealth, धनम् wealth, लब्ध्वा having acquired, इव like that, शर्म pleasure, उपलप्स्यामि I will have.
data.md: I wish to avenge myself on my mighty enemy. Sleep find I none without slaying my foe in fight. Slaying that slayer of Khara and Dūşaņa, Rāma, I shall attain delight like to that attained by a pauper on gaining riches.

data.v: जनस्थाने वसद्भिस्तु भवद्भी राममाश्रिता । प्रवृत्तिरुपनेतव्या किं करोतीति तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: While dwelling at Janasthana, all of you should collect exact information about the activities of Rama.
data.anv: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, वसद्भि: while dwelling, भवद्भि: by you all, किं what, करोति इति he does, रामम् Rama, आश्रिता pertaining to, प्रवृत्ति: activities, तत्त्वतः exactly, उपनेतव्या get the information.
data.md: Staying in Janasthāna, you shall gather true information touching Rāma as to what he is about. Repair all you rangers of the night carefully, and strive yourselves always for slaying Rāma.

data.v: अप्रमादाच्च गन्तव्यं सर्वैरेव निशाचरैः । कर्तव्यश्च सदा यत्नो राघवस्य वधं प्रति ।।
data.es: All of you, O nightrangers, should be on the alert there and it should be always your duty to try to kill Rama.
data.anv: निशाचरैः by nightrangers, सर्वैरपि by all of them, अप्रमादात् alertly, गन्तव्यम् go there, राघवस्य Rama's, वधं प्रति to slay Rama, सदा always, यत्नः effort, कर्तव्यश्च should be done.
data.md: Staying in Janasthāna, you shall gather true information touching Rāma as to what he is about. Repair all you rangers of the night carefully, and strive yourselves always for slaying Rāma.

data.v: युष्माकं हि बलज्ञोऽहं बहुशो रणमूर्धनि । अतश्चास्मिञ्जनस्थाने मया यूयं नियोजिताः ।।
data.es: I have seen your strength on many war fronts. That is why you have been assigned this duty at Janasthana.
data.anv: अहम् I, रणमूर्धनि on war front, बहुशः many times, युष्माकम् your, बलज्ञः knower of strength, अतश्च therefore, यूयम् you, अस्मिन् in this, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, मया by me, नियोजिताः are  engaged.
data.md: I have been well acquainted with your strength in many a field, and it is for this that I set you in Janasthāna.

data.v: ततः प्रियं वाक्यमुपेत्य राक्षसा; महार्थमष्टावभिवाद्य रावणम् । विहाय लङ्कां सहिताः प्रतस्थिरे; यतो जनस्थानमलक्ष्यदर्शनाः ।।
data.es: The eight demons were glad to hear the pleasing and meaningful words of Ravana. They offered him salutations and left Lanka in the direction of Janasthana without being seen by any one.
data.anv: ततः then, अष्टौ eight, राक्षसाः demons, प्रियम् dear, महार्थम्  words of profound meaningl, वाक्यम् statement, उपेत्य after receiving, रावणम् Ravana, अभिवाद्य offering salutations, लङ्काम् Lanka, विहाय  leaving, सहिताः together, अलक्ष्यदर्शनाः without being seen by any one, जनस्थानम् to Janasthana, यतः in that direction, प्रतस्थिरे left.
data.md: Hearing these agreeable and weighty words of Ravana, those Raksasas, bowing down to Rāvana, left Lankā, and in a body invisible proceeded in the direction of Janasthāna.

data.v: ततस्तु सीतामुपलभ्य रावणः; सुसंप्रहृष्टः परिगृह्य मैथिलीम् । प्रसज्य रामेण च वैरमुत्तमं; बभूव मोहान्मुदितः स राक्षसः ।।
data.es: Then the demon Ravana felt greatly happy for getting Sita, princess of Mithila, without knowing in his delusion that he had created the bitterest enmity with Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वामलीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, राक्षसः the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, सीताम् Sita, उपलभ्य seeing, मैथिलीम् Maithili, परिगृह्य getting, सुसम्प्रहृष्टः feeling extremely happy, रामेण at Rama, उत्तमम्   highest, वैरम् enmity, प्रसज्य incited, मोहात् in delusion, मुदितः rejoiced, बभूव became.
data.md: Having obtained Mithilā's daughter, Rāvaņa experienced great joy in establishing her (in his own house); and having created high hostility with Rāma, Rāvana through blindness rejoiced greatly.

data.v: संदिश्य राक्षसान्घोरान्रावणोऽष्टौ महाबलान् । आत्मानं बुद्धिवैक्लव्यात्कृतकृत्यममन्यत ।।
data.es: After ordering the eight most fierce and powerful demons, Ravana had a sense of accomplishment within himself because of his perverse intellect.
data.anv: राणवः Ravana, महाबलान् very powerful, धोरान् fierce, अष्टौ eight, राक्षसान् demons, सन्दिश्य ordered, बुद्धिवैक्लब्यात् out of perversion, आत्मानम् himself, कृतकृत्यम् an accomplished one, अमन्यत felt.
data.md: Having commissioned those eight terrible and mighty Rākşasas, Rāvana, in consequence of perversion of sense, considered himself as crowned with success.

data.v: स चिन्तयानो वैदेहीं कामबाणसमर्पितः । प्रविवेश गृहं रम्यं सीतां द्रष्टुमभित्वरन् ।।
data.es: Thinking about Vaidehi and hit by the arrows of Cupid (the god of love). Ravana hastened to see Sita and entered the beautiful home.
data.anv: सः he (Ravana), वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, चिन्तयानः  thinking about, कामबाणैः समर्पितः succumbed to the arrows of Cupid (the god of love), सीताम् Sita, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभित्वरन् hastened, रम्यम् beautiful, गृहम् home, प्रविवेश entered again.
data.md: And brooding over Vaidehi, he, sore pierced by the shafts of Kāma, hastily entered his charming mansion, with the intention of secing Sitā.

data.v: स प्रविश्य तु तद्वेश्म रावणो राक्षसाधिपः । अपश्यद्राक्षसीमध्ये सीतां शोकपरायणम् ।।
data.es: Ravana, lord of the demons, entered his residence and saw Sita full of grief in the midst of the demonesses.
data.anv: राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, तत् that, वेश्म residence, प्रविश्य entered, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of demonesses, शोकपरायणाम् full of grief, सीताम् Sita, अपश्यत् saw.
data.md: And entering that apartment, Rāvana-lord of Rākşasas-saw the distressed Sītā in the midst of the Raksasas, with a tearful countenance, oppressed with a load of grief, like to a bark sinking in the ocean through the violence of the winds; like to a doe separated from the herd of deer, and surrounded by dogs.

data.v: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीं दीनां शोकभारावपीडिताम् । वायुवेगैरिवाक्रान्तां मज्जन्तीं नावमर्णवे ।।
data.md: And entering that apartment, Rāvana-lord of Rākşasas-saw the distressed Sītā in the midst of the Raksasas, with a tearful countenance, oppressed with a load of grief, like to a bark sinking in the ocean through the violence of the winds; like to a doe separated from the herd of deer, and surrounded by dogs.

data.v: मृगयूथपरिभ्रष्टां मृगीं श्वभिरिवावृताम् । अधोमुखमुखीं दीनामभ्येत्य च निशाचरः ।।
तां तु शोकवशां दीनामवशां राक्षसाधिपः । स बलाद्दर्शयामास गृहं देवगृहोपमम् ।।
हर्म्यप्रासादसंबधं स्त्रीसहस्रनिषेवितम् । नानापक्षिगणैर्जुष्टं नानारत्नसमन्वितम् ।।
data.es: His home was a complex of palaces and mansions served by thousands of women. It was an abode of different flocks of birds. It had captivating pillars studded with gold, crystals, silver, diamonds and vaiduryas. It resounded with wonderful sounds of drums. Its golden entrances were glittering.
data.anv: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधम् complex of palaces, स्त्रीसहस्रनिषेवितम् served by thousands of women, नानापक्षिगणैः by different flocks of birds, जुष्टम् attended, नानारत्नसमन्वितम्  studded with a variety of gems, दान्तकैः with ivory, तापनीयैः च and golden, स्फाटिकैः crystals, राजतैरपि silver, वज्रवैडूर्यचित्रैः diamonds and vaiduryas, दृष्टिमनोहरैः captivating, स्तम्भैः with pillars, दिव्यदुन्दुभिनिर्ह्रादम् resounding with wonderful drums, तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणम् having glittering golden entrance.

data.v: काञ्चनैस्तापनीयैश्च स्फाटिकै राजतैस्तथा । वज्रवैदूर्यचित्रैश्च स्तम्भैर्दृष्टिमनोहरैः ।।
दिव्यदुन्दुभिनिर्ह्रादं तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणम् । सोपानं काञ्चनं चित्रमारुरोह तया सह ।।
data.md: Rāvana in company with Şītā ascended the beautiful golden stairs, resounding with the sounds of kettle-drums and embellished with ornaments of burnished gold.

data.v: दान्तका राजताश्चैव गवाक्षाः प्रियदर्शनाः । हेमजालावृताश्चासंस्तत्र प्रासादपङ्क्तयः ।।
data.es: He ascended the wonderful golden staircase taking Sita along with him.Beautiful looked the rows of mansions with silver and ivory windows and golden trellis.
data.anv: काञ्चनम् gold, चित्रम् wonderful, सोपानम् staircase, तया सह along with her, आरुरोह he climbed, तत्र there, दान्तकाः ivory, राजताश्च silver, प्रियदर्शनाः beautiful, गवाक्षाः windows, हेमजालावृताः covered by golden trellis, प्रासादपङ्त्कयः rows of mansions, आसन् there were.
data.md: And those loftily edifices had excellent windows made of vory and silver, and covered with golden nets.

data.v: सुधामणिविचित्राणि भूमिभागानि सर्वशः । दशग्रीवः स्वभवने प्रादर्शयत मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana showed Sita, the princess from Mithila the floors with wonderful crystals.
data.anv: दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, स्वभवने in his own mansion, सर्वशः all over, सुधामणिविचित्राणि with wonderful crystals, भूमिभागानि  the floors, मैथिलीम् to Sita, the princess from Mithila, प्रादर्शयत showed.
data.md: The ground all over was decorated with ambrosia and gems. The Ten-headed one in his own mansion showed to Maithilī large tanks and pools covered with various kinds of flowers. (All this) Rāvaņa showed to Sítā overmastered by sorrow.

data.v: दीर्घिकाः पुष्करिण्यश्च नानापुष्पसमावृताः । रावणो दर्शयामास सीतां शोकपरायणाम् ।।
data.es: Ravana showed Sita who was overwhelmed with sorrow, stepwells surrrounded by various trees and tanks.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, दीर्घिकाः stepwells, नानावृक्षसमन्विताः full of different kinds of trees, पुष्करिण्यश्च lotus tanks, शोकपरायणाम् in deep sorrow, सीताम् Sita, दर्शयामास showed.
data.md: The ground all over was decorated with ambrosia and gems. The Ten-headed one in his own mansion showed to Maithilī large tanks and pools covered with various kinds of flowers. (All this) Rāvaņa showed to Sítā overmastered by sorrow.

data.v: दर्शयित्वा तु वैदेहीं कृत्स्नं तद्भवनोत्तमम् । उवाच वाक्यं पापात्मा रावणो जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: The sinful Ravana showed Sita, princess of Videha, the best of all his mansions in order to allure her, saying:
data.anv: पापात्मा sinner, कृत्स्नम् entirely, तत् that, भवनोत्तमम् best of mansions, वैदेह्याः to Vaidehi, दर्शयित्वा on showing, सीताम् Sita, इच्छया desiring to, लोभितुम् to allure, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.
data.md: And after having showed to Vaidehi the whole of that good lie of mansions, that wicked one, with the intention of tempting Sītā, spoke to her.

data.v: दशराक्षसकोट्यश्च द्वाविंशतिरथापराः । वर्जयित्वा जरा वृद्धान्बालांश्च रजनीचरान् ।।
data.es: O Sita, leaving aside children and the aged, I am the lord of crores of nightrangers in addition to ten crore demons and twentytwo crore terrorists.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, जरावृद्धान् the aged, बालांश्च children, रजनीचरान् night rangers, वर्जयित्वा apart from, दश ten, राक्षसकोट्यश्च crores of demons, अथ and, अपराः over that, द्वाविंशतिः twentytwo crore, भीमकर्मणाम् terrorists, तेषाम् them, सर्वेषाम् for all, अहम् I am, प्रभुः the king.
data.md: O Sītā, leaving out old men and boys, I am the lord of thirty two crore of night-rangers of terrible deeds. And a thousand come forward whenever required for any service.

data.v: तेषां प्रभुरहं सीते सर्वेषां भीमकर्मणाम् । सहस्रमेकमेकस्य मम कार्यपुरःसरम् ।।
data.md: O Sītā, leaving out old men and boys, I am the lord of thirty two crore of night-rangers of terrible deeds. And a thousand come forward whenever required for any service.

data.v: यदिदं राज्यतन्त्रं मे त्वयि सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम् । जीवितं च विशालाक्षि त्वं मे प्राणैर्गरीयसी ।।
data.es: For me alone there are a thousand attendants.The administration of the kingdom and all my subjects will be under your control. O largeeyed Sita you are dearer to me than my life.
data.anv: एकस्य for me alone, मम for me, एकम् one, सहस्रम् thousand, कार्यपुरस्सरम् attending, यत् since, इदम् this, राज्यतन्त्रम् the administration of the kingdom, सर्वम् all, जीवितं च life also, त्वयि you, प्रतिष्ठितम् is resting, विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, त्वम् you, मे my, प्राणैः more than life, गरीयसी dearer.
data.md: If such is my sovereignty, all this is established in you, O large-eyed lady, as well as my life. You are dearer to me than life.

data.v: बहूनां स्त्रीसहस्राणां मम योऽसौ परिग्रहः । तासां त्वमीश्वरी सीते मम भार्या भव प्रिये ।।
data.es: O Sita dear be my chief queen among the many thousands of women I have married.
data.anv: सीते Sita, बहूनाम् of many, स्त्री सहस्राणाम् thousands of women, यः such, असौ this, परिग्रहः married to me, तासाम् to all of them, त्वम् you, ईश्वरी chief, भव be, प्रिये O dear, मम my, भार्या wife, भव be.
data.md: O Sītā, be you the mistress of those numerous excellent women who are my wives. Dear, be you my wife.

data.v: साधु किं तेऽन्यया बुद्ध्या रोचयस्व वचो मम । भजस्व माभितप्तस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Do not think otherwise. Be good and accept my request. I am consumed by thoughts of you. You should be gracious to me.
data.anv: ते to you, अन्यया by another, बुद्ध्या by thought, किम् what, साधु be good, मम वचः my words, रोचयस्व you may accept, अभितप्तस्य consumed by thoughts of you, मम me, प्रसादम् grace, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि should.
data.md: This is for your good. Why should you act otherwise? Do you relish my speech. Do you bend your mind towards me. It behoves you to favour me, who am burning in the heat of desire).

data.v: परिक्षिप्ता समुद्रेण लङ्केयं शतयोजना । नेयं धर्षयितुं शक्या सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः ।।
data.es: O Maricha I have made up my mind that way. Even demons or deities including Indra cannot alter this decision of mine.
data.anv: शतयोजना extinding to a hundred yojanas, इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, समुद्रेण by the sea, परिक्षिप्ता surrounded, सेन्द्रैः by deities including Indra, सुरासुरै रपि even sods and demons, इयम् this, धर्षयितुम् to assault, न शक्या not possible.
data.md: This Larkă measuring an hundred Yojanas girt round by the ocean, is incapable of being harassed by the celestials themselves headed by Indra.

data.v: न देवेषु न यक्षेषु न गन्धर्वेषु नर्षिषु । अहं पश्यामि लोकेषु यो मे वीर्यसमो भवेत् ।।
data.es: I do not see any one equal to me in valour among gods, or yakshas or gandharvas or birds.
data.anv: लोकेषु in the world, यः whoever, मे to me, वीर्यसमः equal in valour, भवेत् may be, अहम् I, देवेषु among gods, न पश्यामि I do not not see, यक्षेषु among yakshas, न not, गन्धर्वेषु in gandharvas, न not, पक्षिषु in birds, न not.
data.md: Neither among the celestials nor Yakşãs nor Gandharvas nor Serpents, find I any one that can match me in prowess.

data.v: राज्यभ्रष्टेन दीनेन तापसेन गतायुषा । किं करिष्यसि रामेण मानुषेणाल्पतेजसा ।।
data.es: Of what use is Rama who has lost his kingdom, who is depressed and leads an ascetic life and who is a shortlived, lacklustre human being.
data.anv: राज्यभ्रष्टेन who lost his kingdom, दीनेन by a dejected person, तापसेन an ascetic, गतायुषा with a short life one, मानुषेण human being, अल्पतेजसा with one who lacks lustre, रामेण Rama, किं करिष्यसि what is the use for you ,
data.md: What will you do with Rāma a human being of short life, poor, of small prowess, practising mendicancy?

data.v: भजस्व सीते मामेव भर्ताहं सदृशस्तव । यौवनं ह्यध्रुवं भीरु रमस्वेह मया सह ।।
data.es: O Sita take refuge only in me. I am a befitting husband to you. O timid one youth is impermanent. Enjoy (your life) with me while it lasts.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, मामेव me alone, भजस्व accept, अहम् I am, तव your, सदृशः befitting, भर्ता husband, भीरु timid one, यौवनम् youth, अध्रुवं हि is not permanent, इह here, मया सह with me, रमस्व may enjoy.
data.md: O Sītā, bend your mind to me. I am a fit husband for you. O timed one, youth is uncertain. Sport with me here.

data.v: दर्शने मा कृथा बुद्धिं राघवस्य वरानने । कास्य शक्तिरिहागन्तुमपि सीते मनोरथैः ।।
data.es: O lovely Sita, give up the thought of seeing Rama. Where does he possess the power to reach this place even on the mental plane ?
data.anv: वरानने O lovely Sita, राघवस्य Rama's, दर्शने in seeing, बुद्धिं thought, मा do not, कृथा: entertain, सीते O Sita, अस्य his, मनोरथैरपि with his mind also, इह here, आगन्तुम् to come, शक्तिः power, का where is it?
data.md: And, O you of a handsome countenance, do not wish for the sight of Rāghava. O Sītā, what power has he to come hither even in thought?

data.v: न शक्यो वायुराकाशे पाशैर्बद्धं महाजवः । दीप्यमानस्य वाप्यग्नेर्ग्रहीतुं विमलां शिखाम् ।।
data.es: It is not possible to bind the wind blowing at high speed in the sky. Similarly it is not possible to catch the brilliant glow of flaming fire.
data.anv: महाजवः of high speed, वायुः wind, आकाशे in the sky, पाशैः by rope, बध्धुम् to bind, न शक्यः not possible, दीप्यमानस्य  of burning flame, आग्नेः fire, विमलाम् brilliant , शिखाम् flame, गृहीतुम् to catch.
data.md: None can fetter the exceedingly fleet wind in the sky, or hold the bright flame of a burning fire.

data.v: त्रयाणामपि लोकानां न तं पश्यामि शोभने । विक्रमेण नयेद्यस्त्वां मद्बाहुपरिपालिताम् ।।
data.es: O lovely lady, I do not see any one in these three worlds who can, by his valour, take you away from me guarded by my arms.
data.anv: शोभने O beautiful lady, त्रयाणाम् in the three, लोकानामपि worlds too, यः whoever, मद्बाहुपरिपालिताम् protected by my arms, त्वाम् you, विक्रमेण by valour, नयेत् can take away, तम् him, न पश्यामि not see.
data.md: O beauteous one, in these three worlds I find no one that can by his might carry you away, who are protected by my arms.

data.v: लङ्कायां सुमहद्राज्यमिदं त्वमनुपालय । अभिषेकोदकक्लिन्ना तुष्टा च रमयस्व माम् ।।
data.es: Rule this vast kingdom of Lanka. People like me, even gods and all beings, mobile and immobile, will be at your beck and call.
data.anv: त्वम् you, लङ्कायां in Lanka's, सुमहत् vast, इदम् this, राज्यम् kingdom, अनुपालय you may rule, मद्विधाः people like me, देवाश्चापि even gods, चराचराः all mobile and immobile beings, त्वत्प्रेष्याः will be at beck and call.

data.v: दुष्कृतं यत्पुरा कर्म वनवासेन तद्गतम् । यश्च ते सुकृतो धर्मस्तस्येह फलमाप्नुहि ।।
data.es: Drenched with the waters of consecration, entertain me. The effect of the bad deeds done in the past are over with your dwelling in the forest. Now enjoy the fruits of your good and righteous deeds here with me.
data.anv: अभिषेकोदकक्लिन्ना drenched with waters of consecration, तुष्टा च and satisfied , माम् me, रमयस्व enjoy, पुरा previous birth, यत् whatever, दुष्कृतम् evil deeds, कर्म तत् that, वनवासेन by dwelling in the forest, गतम् gone, ते your, यः whatever, सुकृतः  good deeds, धर्मः righteousness, तस्य of that, फलम् fruit, इह here, आप्नुहि enjoy.
data.md: Laving your limbs with water, do you gratify me. The evil that you had done, has been expiated by your life in the forest: now do you reap the fruit of your good deeds.

data.v: इह सर्वाणि माल्यानि दिव्यगन्धानि मैथिलि । भूषणानि च मुख्यानि तानि सेव मया सह ।।
data.es: O princess from Mithila, put on all garlands of wonderful fragrance and finest of jewels here with me.
data.anv: मैथिलि Maithili, इह here, दिव्यगन्धानि of divine fragrance, सर्वाणि all, माल्यानि garlands, मुख्यानि finest, भूषणानि च jewels, मया सह with me, सेवस्व you put on.
data.md: Here are garlands furnished with divine fragrance, and, O Maithili, superb ornaments. Enjoy you all those along with me.

data.v: पुष्पकं नाम सुश्रोणि भ्रातुर्वैश्रवणस्य मे । विमानं रमणीयं च तद्विमानं मनोजवम् ।।
data.es: O finehipped lady, I won by my strength from my brother Vaisravana (Kubera) an aerial chariot called Pushpaka shining with the radiance of the Sun.
data.anv: सुश्रोणि O charming lady, मे my, भ्रातुः brother, वैश्रवणस्य Vaisravana's (Kubera's), पुष्पकं नाम called Pushpaka, सूर्यसङ्काशम् radiant like the Sun, विमानम् aerial chariot, तरसा with strength, निर्जितम् is won over.
data.md: O you of shapely hips, the car called Pușpaka, resembling the sun, which (formerly) belonged to my brother Vaiśravaņa, was through my prowess won by me in fight. And vast and beautiful is that car furnished with the speed of the mind. Do you, O Sītā, at your pleasure sport on it along with me.

data.v: तत्र सीते मया सार्धं विहरस्व यथासुखम् । वदनं पद्मसंकाशं विमलं चारुदर्शनम् ।।
शोकार्तं तु वरारोहे न भ्राजति वरानने । अलं व्रीडेन वैदेहि धर्मलोप कृतेन ते ।।
आर्षोऽयं दैवनिष्यन्दो यस्त्वामभिगमिष्यति । एतौ पादौ मया स्निग्धौ शिरोभिः परिपीडितौ ।।
प्रसादं कुरु मे क्षिप्रं वश्यो दासोऽहमस्मि ते । नेमाः शून्या मया वाचः शुष्यमाणेन भाषिताः ।।
न चापि रावणः कांचिन्मूर्ध्ना स्त्रीं प्रणमेत ह । एवमुक्त्वा दशग्रीवो मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.md: Let not these words of mine spoken by me under the withering influence of love prove fruitless. Rāvana has never bowed his head to any female. Having said this, the Ten-headed one, come under the subjection of the Destroyer, looked upon Maithili, Janaka's daughter (as his own) saying, She is mine.

data.v: कृतान्तवशमापन्नो ममेयमिति मन्यते ।।
data.es: Having said this to the daughter of Janaka, the tenheaded Ravana who had fallen under the control of Yama, lord of death, misconceived that she had become his own.इतयार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, जनकात्मजाम् to the daughter of Janaka, मैथिलीम् Maithili, एवम् in that manner, उक्त्वा having said, कृतान्तवशम् under the control of Yama, आपन्नः being distressed, इयम् she is, मम mine, इति like this, मन्यते thinks.

data.v: सा तथोक्ता तु वैदेही निर्भया शोककर्षिता । तृणमन्तरतः कृत्वा रावणं प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Ravana, Sita, immersed in deep sorrow and unafraid of him, placed a blade of grass between her and him (intending not to speak to him straight) and replied:
data.anv: तथा thus, उक्ता having addressed, शोककर्शिता sunk in deep sorrow, सा वैदेही that Sita, princess from Videha, निर्भया unafraid , तृणम्  blade of grass, अन्तरतः between him and her, कृत्वा placed, रावणम् Ravana, प्रत्यभाषत replied.
data.md: Having been thus addressed, Vaidehī unaffected by fear, although exercised with grief, placing a blade of grass between herself and Rāvana, answered him.

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम धर्मसेतुरिवाचलः । सत्यसन्धः परिज्ञातो यस्य पुत्रः स राघवः ।।
data.es: Rama is a son of the renowned king Dasaratha, who was a firm ambankment (protector) of righteousness and was true to his promise.
data.anv: दशरथो नाम named Dasaratha, राजा king, अचलः steadfast, धर्मसेतुरिव as an embankment (protector) of righteousness, सत्यसन्धः true to his promise, परिज्ञातः renowned, सः राघवः that Rama, यस्य whose, पुत्रः son.

data.v: रामो नाम स धर्मात्मा त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः । दीर्घबाहुर्विशालाक्षो दैवतं स पतिर्मम ।।
data.es: The longarmed, largeeyed Rama is famous in all the three worlds. He is my husband, a righteous soul and a god to all.
data.anv: त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु in the worlds, विश्रुतः highly renowned, दीर्घबाहुः longarmed, विशालाक्षः largeeyed, रामो नाम named Rama, सः he, धर्मात्मा righteous soul, मम my, पतिः husband, दैवतम् god to all.
data.md: There was a king named Dasaratha, the bridge of righteousness, like to a mountain, ever bearing regard towards the truth, and renowned among men, whose son is Rāghava. He is named Rāma, and is righteous-souled and celebrated over the three worlds. he is long-armed, of expansive eyes, like to a celestial—he is my husband.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातः सिंहस्कन्धो महाद्युतिः । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा यस्ते प्राणां हरिष्यति ।।
data.es: The brilliant Rama of the Ikshvaku dynasty with the lion's shoulders will come with his brother Lakshmana and take away your life.
data.anv: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvakus, कुले in the dynasty, जातः born, सिंहस्कन्धः shoulders of a lion, महाद्युतिः  effulgent, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, यः who, ते your, प्राणान् life, हरिष्यति will take away.
data.md: Born in the race of the Ikşvākus, the has the shoulders of a lion and is possessed of exceeding effulgence-the same that along with his brother, Laksmana, shall take your life. If you had wronged me forcibly in his presence, you would have slain in battle in Janasthāna even as Khara.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं यद्यहं तस्य त्वया स्यां धर्षिता बलात् । शयिता त्वं हतः संख्ये जनस्थाने यथा खरः ।।
data.es: Had you abducted me forcibly in his presence, you would have been lying down dead just as Khara in Janasthana.
data.anv: अहम् I, त्वया by your, तस्य his, प्रत्यक्षम् (in his) presence, बलात् with force, धर्षिता attacked, स्यां यदि if you were to be, त्वम् you, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, खरः Khara, यथा just as, हतः killed, शयिता lying down.
data.md: Born in the race of the Ikşvākus, the has the shoulders of a lion and is possessed of exceeding effulgence-the same that along with his brother, Laksmana, shall take your life. If you had wronged me forcibly in his presence, you would have slain in battle in Janasthāna even as Khara.

data.v: य एते राक्षसाः प्रोक्ता घोररूपा महाबलाः । राघवे निर्विषाः सर्वे सुपर्णे पन्नगा यथा ।।
data.es: Those dreadful, mighty demons you have described are ineffective in his presence just like the serpents who with their venom are ineffective in the presence of Suparna (Garuda).
data.anv: घोररूपाः of dreadful forms, महाबलाः very strong , ये those, एते such of, राक्षसाः demons, प्रोक्ताः has been said, सर्वे all, सुपर्णे Suparna, पन्नगाः serpents, यथा like, राघवे with regard to Rama, निर्विषाः are devoid of poison.
data.md: All the mighty Rākşasas of grim visages, whom you have extolled (before me), shall be deprived of their venom before Rāma, as serpents are before Suparna,

data.v: तस्य ज्याविप्रमुक्तास्ते शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः । शरीरं विधमिष्यन्ति गङ्गाकूलमिवोर्मयः ।।
data.es: Now when I unleash the golden arrows, they will pierce through your body and come out like serpents emerging from the anthill.
data.anv: अद्य now, मया by me, मुक्ताः unleashed, काञ्चनभूषणाः adorned with gold ornaments, शराः arrows, पन्नगाः like serpent, वल्मीकमिव like the anthill, त्वा you, विदार्य after piercing the body, अतिपतिष्यतनि will come out.
data.md: The shafts decorated with gold shot by the bow-string of Rāghava, shall pierce their bodies, as the waves of the Ganga (beat against) her banks.

data.v: असुरैर्वा सुरैर्वा त्वं यद्यवधोऽसि रावण । उत्पाद्य सुमहद्वैरं जीवंस्तस्य न मोक्ष्यसे ।।
data.es: O Ravana, even if you stand invulnerable to gods and demons, you will not come out alive in the combat with Rama with whom you have earned great enmity.
data.anv: रावण O Ravana, त्वम् you, असुरैर्वा by demons, सुरैर्वा or by gods, अवध्यः are not to be killed, असि यदि even if, सुमहत् great, वैरम् enmity, उत्पाद्य after creating, जीवन् with life, तस्य his, न मोक्ष्यसे you will not be released.
data.md: Although, O Rāvana, you may be incapable of being slain either by the gods or the Asuras, yet having roused the high hostility of Rāghava, you will not be able to liberate your life.

data.v: स ते जीवितशेषस्य राघवोऽन्तकरो बली । पशोर्यूपगतस्येव जीवितं तव दुर्लभम् ।।
data.es: Powerful Rama will put an end to whatever little life you are left with. Just as a beast tied to a sacrificial post, you will not survive.
data.anv: बली powerful, सः राघवः  Rama, ते your, जीवितशेषस्य of the little life left, अन्तकरः destroyer of life, यूपगतस्य  tied to the sacrificial post, पशोरिव like a beast ready for sacrifice, तव your, जीवितम् life, दुर्लभम् difficult to survive.
data.md: The strong Rāghava will compass the end of what remains of your life. Like the life of a beast tied to the sacrificial stake, your own is incapable of being reclaimed.

data.v: यदि पश्येत्स रामस्त्वां रोषदीप्तेन चक्षुषा । रक्षस्त्वमद्य निर्दग्धो गच्छेः सद्यः पराभवम् ।।
data.es: O demon, you will be completely consumed if Rama looks at you with eyes burning in anger.
data.anv: रक्षः O demon, सः रामः that Rama, रोषदीप्तेन burning with anger, चक्षुषा with eyes, त्वाम् you, पश्येत् if he sees, अद्य now, सद्यः instantly, त्वम् you, निर्धग्धः totally burnt, पराभवम् गच्छेः you will be destroyed.
data.md: Should Rāma look at you with eyes aglow with anger, you, O Raksasa, would be consumed even as Manmatha was by, Rudra.

data.v: यश्चन्द्रं नभसो भूमौ पातयेन्नाशयेत वा । सागरं शोषयेद्वापि स सीतां मोचयेदिह ।।
data.es: He who can bring down the Moon to the earth from the sky or even dash it down, he who can drain the sea dry will definitely release me from here.
data.anv: यः he who, चन्द्रम् Moon, नभसः from the sky, भूमौ on the earth, पातयेत् can bring down, वा or even, नाशयेत destroy, सागरम् sea, शोषयेद्वापि will make it dry, सः he, इह here, सीताम् Sita, मोचयेत् will liberate
data.md: He who is able to bring down the Moon or destroy him, and to drink up the ocean dry, will surely liberate Sītā from here.

data.v: गतायुस्त्वं गतश्रीको गतसत्त्वो गतेन्द्रियः । लङ्का वैधव्यसंयुक्ता त्वत्कृतेन भविष्यति ।।
data.es: Your life is coming to an end. Your fortunes will wane, your strength will be sapped. Your senses will be dissipated. By your deeds Lanka will attain widowhood.
data.anv: त्वम् you, गतायुः life is gone, गतश्रीकः deprived of your fortune, गतसत्त्व your strength sapped, गतेन्द्रियः your senses dissipated, त्वत्कृतेन  by  your action, लङ्का Lanka, वैधव्यसंयुक्ता भविष्यति attain widowhood.
data.md: Your days are numbered, and auspiciousness has bidden you adieu. You are shorn of strength, and your senses have been dulled. And it is owing to you that Larkā shall be subject to widowhood.

data.v: न ते पापमिदं कर्म सुखोदर्कं भविष्यति । याहं नीता विना भावं पतिपार्श्वात्त्वया वनात् ।।
data.es: This evil deed(of abduction) will not yield happy results.You have brought me from my husband from the forest without any forethought.
data.anv: ते you, इदम् this, कर्म deed, शुखोदर्कम् will result in happiness, न भविष्यति will not be, या which, अहम् I, त्वया by you, वने in the forest, पतिपार्श्वात् from my husband, विनाभावम् without any feeling, नीता I am brought.
data.md: That you by force have for naught carried me away from the side of my husband-this sinful act can never conduce to your felicity.

data.v: स हि दैवतसंयुक्तो मम भर्ता महाद्युतिः । निर्भयो वीर्यमाश्रित्य शून्ये वसति दण्डके ।।
data.es: My effulgent, valiant husband armed with divine power resides fearlessly in the desolate Dandaka.
data.anv: महाद्युतिः effulgent, मम my, भर्ता husband, सः he, वीर्यम् valour, आश्रित्य resorting to, निर्भयः a fearless, दैवतसंयुक्तः supported by divine power, शून्ये in a desolate, दण्डके in Dandaka, वसति is dwelling.
data.md: That exceedingly effulgent lord of mine along with my husband's younger brother, summoning up their energy, is fearlessly dwelling in the vacant Dandaka.

data.v: स ते दर्पं बलं वीर्यमुत्सेकं च तथाविधम् । अपनेष्यति गात्रेभ्यः शरवर्षेण संयुगे ।।
data.es: He will remove your pride, your power, your valour and haughtiness from your limbs with a shower of arrows in the fight.
data.anv: सः he, संयुगे in combat, शरवर्षेण with showers of arrows, ते your, गात्रेभ्यः from limbs, दर्पम् pride, बलम् power, वीर्यम् heroism, तथाविधम् as such, उत्सेकं च haughtiness, अपनेष्यति will remove.
data.md: By means of an arrowy shower in conflict, he will take your prowess and strength, your hauteur and wickedness out of your person,

data.v: यदा विनाशो भूतानां दृश्यते कालचोदितः । तदा कार्ये प्रमाद्यन्ति नराः कालवशं गताः ।।
data.es: When destruction draws near, people being prompted by time start commiting blunders in their deeds.
data.anv: भूतानाम् for the living beings, यदा whenever, कालचोदितः prompted by time (death), विनाशः destruction, दृश्यते is seen, तदा then, नराः men, कालवशम् overcome by time, गताः become, कार्ये deeds, प्रमाद्यन्ति commit blunders.
data.md: When urged by the Destroyer, the destruction of creatures is perceptible, then, coming under the sway of the Destroyer, men become careless in their actions.

data.v: मां प्रधृष्य स ते कालः प्राप्तोऽयं रक्षसाधम । आत्मनो राक्षसानां च वधायान्तःपुरस्य च ।।
data.es: You vilest of demons, since you have assaulted me, the time of your death and destruction of all demons and of all women in the harem has drawn near.
data.anv: राक्षसाधम O vilest of demons, माम् me, प्रधृष्य having assaulted, आत्मनः your, राक्षसानां च of all  demons, अन्तःपुरस्य च and of women of the harem, वधाय for destruction, सः कालः that time, ते to you, प्राप्तः has come near.
data.md: Having outraged me, you, O worst of Rāks asas your time come; for compassing your own destruction as well as that of the Rākşasas and those dwelling in your inner apartment.

data.v: न शक्या यज्ञमध्यस्था वेदिः स्रुग्भाण्ड मण्डिता । द्विजातिमन्त्रसंपूता चण्डालेनावमर्दितुम् ।।
data.es: The sacrificial altar adorned with ladles and vessels and sanctified by the sacred mantras recited by brahmins cannot be defiled by a chandala (man of lowest caste).
data.anv: यज्ञमध्यस्था in the midst of the sacrificial ceremony, सुग्भाण्डमण्डिता decorated with ladles  and other vessels, द्विजातिमन्त्रपूता च sanctified by brahmins uttering sacred Vedic hymns, वेदी altar, चण्डालेन by a man of low caste, अवमर्दितुम् to violate, न शक्या is not possible.
data.md: A Candāla cannot tread the dais reared the midst of a sacrifice beauteous with ladies, and vessels, and sanctified by the twice-born ones.

data.v: इदं शरीरं निःसंज्ञं बन्ध वा घातयस्व वा । नेदं शरीरं रक्ष्यं मे जीवितं वापि राक्षस । न हि शक्ष्याम्युपक्रोशं पृथिव्यां दातुमात्मनः ।।
data.es: O demon this body has (now) no consciousness. You may bind it or bury it. I do not think that this body or even this life need to be protected. But at no cost can I make this an object of censure on earth (must not be branded an unchaste woman).
data.anv: राक्षस demon, निस्संज्ञम् unconscious, इदम् this, शरीरम् body, बन्ध वा bind it on, वा खातयस्व or bury, मे to me, इदम् this, शरीरम् body, जीवितं वा even life, रक्षयम् to protect, न not, तु but, पृथिव्याम् on earth, आत्मन: of myself, उपक्रोशम् ignominy, दातुम् to give, न शक्ष्यामि not possible.
data.md: Do you either bind or destroy this body deprived of sensation. This body will I not protect, nor yet this life, O Rāvana;

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेही क्रोद्धात्सुपरुषं वचः । रावणं मैथिली तत्र पुनर्नोवाच किंचन ।।
data.es: Having uttered these very harsh words out of anger, the daughter of Videha, the princess from Mithila spoke no more.
data.anv: वैदेही Sita (Vaidehi), मैथिली princess from Mithila, क्रोधात् in anger, रावणम् Ravana, एवम् in that way, सुपरुषम् very harsh, वचः words, उक्त्वा having uttered, तत्र there, पुनः again, किञ्चन not, नोवाच speak.

data.v: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा परुषं रोमहर्षणम् । प्रत्युवाच ततः सीतां भयसंदर्शनं वचः ।।
data.es: Having heard such harsh, horripilating words from Sita, Ravana replied in a way designed to create fear in her:
data.anv: सीतायाः Sita's such, परुषम् harsh, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः then, सीताम् Sita, भयसन्दर्शनम् creating fear, वचः words, प्रत्युवाच  replied.
data.md: Hearing Sita's words, harsh and calculated to make one's down stand on end, Rāvana answered her in words tending to excite one's apprehension,

data.v: शृणु मैथिलि मद्वाक्यं मासान्द्वादश भामिनि । कालेनानेन नाभ्येषि यदि मां चारुहासिनि । ततस्त्वां प्रातराशार्थं सूदाश्छेत्स्यन्ति लेशशः ।।
data.es: O comely princess from Mithila, O lady with a sweet smile listen to my words. If you do not accept my hand in the course of twelve months, the cooks will cut you off into small bits for the (my) breakfast.
data.anv: मैथिलि Princess from Mithila, भामिनि lovely one, मद्वाक्यम् my statement, शृणु listen, द्वादश twelve, मासान् months, चारुहासिनि a lady with sweet smile, अनेन otherwise, कालेन in course of time, माम् me, नाभ्येषि यदि if you do not accept my hand, ततः thereupon, सूदाः cooks, त्वाम् you, प्रातराशार्थे for breakfast, लेशशः in small bits, छेत्स्यन्ति will cut you.
data.md: Hear, O Maithili, my words. O damsel if, O you of sweet smiles, within this time you do not turn yourself to me, the cooks shall cut you off in pieces to serve my morning mcal.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा परुषं वाक्यं रावणः शत्रुरावणः । राक्षसीश्च ततः क्रुद्ध इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Enraged Ravana, who used to make enemies wail, turned to the demonesses and said these words.
data.anv: शत्रुरावणः who makes enemies wail, रावणः Ravana, इति these, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, उक्त्वा having said, ततः then, क्रुद्धः enraged, राक्षसीः demoness, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Having herself spoken thus, Ravana-challenger of foes-growing exceedingly wroth, addressed the Rākşasis in these words,

data.v: शीघ्रमेवं हि राक्षस्यो विकृता घोरदर्शनाः । दर्पमस्या विनेष्यन्तु मांसशोणितभोजनाः ।।
data.es: Addressing the flesheating, blooddrinking, loathsome and fearful demonesses Ravana said, Humble her pride at once.
data.anv: विकृताः loathsome, घोरदर्शनाः fearful, मांसशोणितभोजनाः flesheaters and bloodsulkers, राक्षस्यः demonesses, शीघ्रमेव at once, अस्याः her, दर्पम् pride, विनेष्यध्वम् humble.
data.md: You frightful Rākşasīs terrible to behold, subsisting on flesh and gore, do you at once crush her pride.

data.v: वचनादेव तास्तस्य विकृता घोरदर्शनाः । कृतप्राञ्जलयो भूत्वा मैथिलीं पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.es: No sooner had Ravana said it than the dreadful demonesses offered obeisance to him with folded hands and surrounded Sita.
data.anv: सुघोराः very dreadful one, ताः they, राक्षसीगणाः demonesses, तस्य his, वचनादेव soon after he said, कृत प्राञ्जलयः (offered obeisance) with folded hands, भूत्वा being, मैथिलीम् पर्यवारयन् surrounded Sita.
data.md: As soon as he had said this, those frightful and terrible Rākṣasīs with joined hands encircled Maithili.

data.v: स ताः प्रोवाच राजा तु रावणो घोरदर्शनः । प्रचाल्य चरणोत्कर्षैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: Stamping his feet and shaking the ground as if tearing the earth, Ravana said to those fiercelooking demonesses:
data.anv: घोरदर्शनः of terrific form, राजा king, सः रावणः that Ravana, चरणोत्कर्षैः stamping his feet, मेदिनीम् on the ground, प्रचाल्य after shaking, दारयन्निव as if tearing the ground, ताः to them, प्रोवाच said.
data.md: Then the grim-visaged king Ravana, as if riving the earth by his tread, proceeding a pace or two, said,

data.v: अशोकवनिकामध्ये मैथिली नीयतामिति । तत्रेयं रक्ष्यतां गूढमुष्माभिः परिवारिता ।।
data.es: Let this Sita be led into the Asoka grove. There sit round her and protect her in secret (her presence there should not be made public).
data.anv: इयं मैथिली this Maithili (sita), अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the middle of Asoka grove, नीयताम् take, तत्र there, इयम् she, युष्माभिः by you, परिवारिता surrounded by, गूढम् secretly, रक्ष्यताम् protect.
data.md: Do you take Maithilī to the wood of Asokas. There surrounding her, do you secretly guard her; and there (sometimes) by storming, and (at other) by means of soft speech, do you all strive to bring Mithila's daughter, like a wild female elephant, under your sway.

data.v: तत्रैनां तर्जनैर्घोरैः पुनः सान्त्वैश्च मैथिलीम् । आनयध्वं वशं सर्वा वन्यां गजवधूमिव ।।
data.es: There you all bring her under control through forcing and cajoling as one would do to tame a wild sheelephant.
data.anv: तत्र there, सर्वाः all, एनां मैथिलीम् this Sita, घोरैः terrrific, तर्जनैः threatening, पुनः again, सान्त्वश्च by gently coaxing, वन्याम् wild, गजवधूमिव like a female elephant, वशम् under control, आनयध्वम् being her.
data.md: Do you take Maithilī to the wood of Asokas. There surrounding her, do you secretly guard her; and there (sometimes) by storming, and (at other) by means of soft speech, do you all strive to bring Mithila's daughter, like a wild female elephant, under your sway.

data.v: इति प्रतिसमादिष्टा राक्षस्यो रावणेन ताः । अशोकवनिकां जग्मुर्मैथिलीं परिगृह्य ताम् ।।
data.es: Thus commanded, the fourteen demons along with Surpanakha rushed there like windblown clouds.
data.anv: इति this way, प्रतिसमादिष्टाः having been ordered, ते they, चतुर्दश fourteen, राक्षसाः demons, तया सार्धम् together with Surpanakha, वातेरिताः as if blown by wind, घनाः यथा like clouds, तत्र there, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Thus commanded by Rāvana, those Rākşasis taking Maithili along with them, went to the Asoka wood, abounding with trees granting every desire, and filled with various kinds of fruits and flowers, and frequented by fowls fraught with juices at all seasons.

data.es: Thus instructed by Ravana, the demonesses took Sita into the Asoka grove, which was full of perenmal fruits and flowers of different kinds, where trees yielded fruits of all seasons and birds were always cheerful.
data.anv: रावणेन Ravana, इति like that, प्रतिसमादिष्टाः instructed, ताः those, राक्षस्यः demonesses, मैथिलीम् to Sita, परिगृह्य  took, सर्वकालफलैः with fruits of all seasons, नानापुष्पफलैः with different kinds of flowers and fruits, वृक्षैः with trees, वृताम् surrounded, सर्वकालमदैः cheerful in all seaons, द्विजैः birds, समुपसेविताम् served by, अशोकवनिकाम् to the Asoka grove, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Thus commanded by Rāvana, those Rākşasis taking Maithili along with them, went to the Asoka wood, abounding with trees granting every desire, and filled with various kinds of fruits and flowers, and frequented by fowls fraught with juices at all seasons.

data.v: सा तु शोकपरीताङ्गी मैथिली जनकात्मजा । राक्षसी वशमापन्ना व्याघ्रीणां हरिणी यथा ।।
data.es: Sita, daughter of Janaka, engulfed in grief found herself like a doe under the control of tigresses.
data.anv: शोकपरीताङ्गी engulfed in grief, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, सा मैथिली that Sita, हरिणी doe, व्याघ्रीणां यथा as among tigresses, राक्षसीवशम् under the control of the demonesses, आपन्ना was placed.
data.md: And as a doe comes under the subjection of tigresses, Janaka's daughter, Maithili, her frame worked up with grief, came under the sway of the Raksasis.

data.v: न विन्दते तत्र तु शर्म मैथिली; विरूपनेत्राभिरतीव तर्जिता । पतिं स्मरन्ती दयितं च देवरं; विचेतनाभूद्भयशोकपीडिता ।।
data.es: Sita had no peace as she was threatened excessively by those women of deformed looks. Remembering her beloved husband who was also her god, and overtaken by fear and grief , she fell unconscious.इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षटपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: विरूपनेत्राभिः by women of deformed eyes, अतीव excessively, तर्जिता threatened, मैथिली Sita,  तत्र there, शर्म peace, न विन्दते not had, दयितम् beloved, पतिम् husband, देवतं च desired deity, स्मरन्ती while remembering, भयशोकपीडिता tortured by fear and grief, विचेतना lost conciousness, अभूत् became.
data.md: And greatly up-braided by the fierce eyes (of the Raksasis), Maithili did not know repose; and, afflicted with grief and fear, she, remembering her beloved lord along with Lakşmaņa swooned away.

data.v: राक्षसं मृगरूपेण चरन्तं कामरूपिणम् । निहत्य रामो मारीचं तूर्णं पथि न्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: Rama killed Maricha, the demon assuming the form of the deer as per his will and swiftly took the return path.
data.anv: रामः Rama, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, चरन्तम् moving, कामरूपिणम् assuming a form at will, राक्षसम् to the demon, मारीचम् Maricha, निहत्य slaying, तूर्णम् swiftly, पथि  on the path, न्यवर्तत returned.
data.md: Killing the Rākṣasa, Mārīca assuming shapes at will and ranging in the shape of a deer, Rāma vended speedily his way.

data.v: तस्य संत्वरमाणस्य द्रष्टुकामस्य मैथिलीम् । क्रूरस्वरोऽथ गोमायुर्विननादास्य पृष्ठतः ।।
data.es: While Rama was hasting to see Sita, he heard from behind the ghastly howl of a jackal.
data.anv: मैथिलीम् Maithili (Sita), द्रष्टुकामस्य desiring to see, तस्य his, सन्त्वरमाणस्य hastening, अथ at that time, क्रूरस्वनः ghastly sound, गोमायुः jackal, अस्य his, पृष्ठतः from behind, विननाद screamed.
data.md: And as he hurried himself, eager to behold Maithilī, jackals began to howl hideously at his back.

data.v: स तस्य स्वरमाज्ञाय दारुणं रोमहर्षणम् । चिन्तयामास गोमायोः स्वरेण परिशङ्कितः ।।
data.es: Rama knew it was the horrible, horripilating cry of a jackal which made him apprehensive . It made him think.
data.anv: सः he, तस्य गोमायोः the jackal's, दारुणम् dreadful, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, स्वरम् tone, आज्ञाय recognising, स्वरेण voice, परिशङ्कितः doubting it, चिन्तयामास started worrying.
data.md: Hearing their harsh cries, capable of making one's hair stand on end, Rāma struck with fear at the voices of the jackals, became filled with alarm.

data.v: अशुभं बत मन्येऽहं गोमायुर्वाश्यते यथा । स्वस्ति स्यादपि वैदेह्या राक्षसैर्भक्षणं विना ।।
data.es: 'The way the jackal is howling appears ominous. May Sita be safe without being eaten up by demons
data.anv: बत alas, गोमायुः jackal, यथा as, वाश्यते howling, अहम् I, अशुभम् inauspicious, मन्ये thinking, राक्षसैः by demons, भक्षणं विना without being eaten up, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, स्वस्ति wellbeing, स्यादपि may be.
data.md: Ah! I consider this as inauspicious—that these jackals are crying. Escaping being devoured by the Raksasas, may fair fortune befall Vaidehi!

data.v: मारीचेन तु विज्ञाय स्वरमालक्ष्य मामकम् । विक्रुष्टं मृगरूपेण लक्ष्मणः शृणुयाद्यदि ।।
data.es: 'If Lakshmana listens to Maricha imitating my voice in the form of a deer, he, sent by Sita will come for me at once, leaving her behind.
data.anv: मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, मारीचेन by Maricha, विज्ञाय having known, मामकम् my , स्वरम् voice, आलम्ब्य imitating, विक्रुष्टम् cried out, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शृणुयाद्यदि if he listens, सः सौमित्रिः that Saumitri, स्वरम् voice, श्रुत्वा after hearing, तां मैथिलीम् to Sita, हित्वा च leaving her, तया by her, इह here, प्रहितः sent, क्षिप्रम् at once, इह here, मत्सकाशम् for me, एष्यति he will come,
data.md: If Laksmana should have heard the cries which Mārica, knowing my voice, and fixing on the means of harming me, uttered in the form of a deer, Saumitrī, hearing that voice, leaving Mithila's daughter and commissioned by herself, must have come near me.

data.v: राक्षसैः सहितैर्नूनं सीताया ईप्सितो वधः । काञ्चनश्च मृगो भूत्वा व्यपनीयाश्रमात्तु माम् ।।
data.es: 'Hence the murder of Sita must have been jointly planned by the demons. Maricha who had assumed the form of a golden deer, took me away from the hermitage to a faroff place where, killed by my arrows, he turned a demon uttering the words, Alas, Lakshmana, I am killed.
data.anv: यत् that, मारीचः Maricha, काञ्चनः मृगः golden deer, भूत्वा having become, माम् me, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, व्यपनीय dragging away, दूरम् far off, नीत्वा after taking, शराहतः hit by my arrows, राक्षसः demon, अभूत् he became, हा लक्ष्मण Alas, Lakshmana, हतः अस्मि I am killed, इति these, वाक्यम् words, व्याजहार he said, सहितैः accompanying, राक्षसैः by demons, सीतायाः Sita's, वधः slaughter, ईप्सितः desired, नूनम् surely.
data.md: Surely, the Rākṣasas in a body are desirous of slaying Sitä. Becoming a golden deer, Mārica, having allured me far, transformed himself into a Rākşasa, as soon as he had been struck with my shafts; and exclaimed, 'Ah! Laksmana, slain am I.'

data.v: अपि स्वस्ति भवेद्द्वाभ्यां रहिताभ्यां मया वने । जनस्थाननिमित्तं हि कृतवैरोऽस्मि राक्षसैः । निमित्तानि च घोराणि दृश्यन्तेऽद्य बहूनि च ।।
data.es: 'On account of living in this dense forest in Janasthana I have earned enmity with the demons. Will Lakshmana and Sita be safe without my protection? I see many terrible portents.'

data.md: It is doubtless, we having left (Sītā, whether all is well with her. I having raised the hostility of the Räksasas for the sake of Janasthāna;

data.es: On hearing the jackal's howl, Rama began thinking how the demon in the form of a deer drew him away. Thus in the midst of apprehensions he reached Janasthana.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, गोमायुनिस्स्वनम् the jackal's howl, श्रुत्वा on hearing, इत्येवम् like this, चिन्तयन् worried, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, रक्षसा by the demon, आत्मनः his, अपनयनात् due to being drawn away, परिशङ्कितः  terrified, जनस्थानम् Janasthana, आजगाम came.
data.md: Rāghava went back to Janasthāna, alarmed in consequence of his having been drawn away by the Raksasa in the form of a dear.

data.v: तं दीनमानसं दीनमासेदुर्मृगपक्षिणः । सव्यं कृत्वा महात्मानं घोरांश्च ससृजुः स्वरान् ।।
data.es: Dejected at heart, the birds and animals piteously kept the great soul (Rama) to the left and produced a dreadful cacophony.
